reviews.text: The staff here was amazing, you didn't feel "waited on" you definitely felt they were invested in your happiness. The appetizers were delicious, the signature cocktails phenomenal, and the dinner was planned perfectly. I left full and happy.
Probably the best wine pairing I've ever had! The staff was so knowledgeable and welcoming. The momster and I had the loveliest of times celebrating our birthdays here together!

Philadelphia is lucky to have Vetri Cucina. Five years after my first visit (and over two decades after they first opened their doors), Vetri is still making the best food and providing the warmest, most complete dining experience in the city.

Every impression and feeling from my first visit has only improved. The most recent time I dined at Vetri, my dining partner and I were blown away by the tortellini in seafood brodo (impossibly delicate and yet so flavorful!) and the roasted goat, which was, in the words of my partner, "the single best bite I've ever had." Also, if it's on the menu, get the molten pistachio cake. It's incredible - possibly my favorite dessert ever.

Service is always impeccable and welcoming, from the moment the maître d' greets you to the friendly goodbyes as you walk out the door. A shoutout to Bobby - who described the goat dish so wonderfully, I think it made the dish taste even better - and Zeke, who were and have been memorably wonderful.

We spent over $300 on our meal for two, and it was worth that and more to see every bite bring an expression of wonderment and joy to my dining partner's face. Vetri encapsulates what a special dining experience should be - expertly executed cuisine without the pretention, and an overall experience that leaves diners feeling fuller - both in regards to food and happiness - than when they walked in the door.

The desserts were impeccable. I have a personal thing against lava cakes (they're not bad, but not worth the fuss in my book), but the molten pistachio cake really surprised me. And the palette cleanser? Absolutely crushed it. I did not expect such a unique combination of flavors in Philadelphia. 

Unfortunately, I did find each individual savory course a bit "one note," i.e. the amuse (although *intentionally* burnt) only tasted of char, the veal tartare was overpowered with brown butter, and both the pici as well as the branzino were too salty. I did not finish the branzino and my guest and I had to swap some of our dishes. 

HOWEVER, service was perfect and that's why Vetri gets 5 stars in my book.  What the food that night lacked was made up for by the rockstar FOH staff. My server kindly asked me multiple times if I would like something instead of the branzino when I didn't seem to enjoy it - it's on me for not speaking up! I didn't want to cause a fuss, but I don't think they would have minded/been mean about it. 

At the end of the day, Vetri may not be the first thing I recommend to someone in town, but the meal ended on a high note and I'd go back in the future.

A special restaurant for a special occasion.  Food is superb, the wine options and pairing are equally excellent.

The highlight for us, luckily for two visits over the past 10 years, was our server Bill.  Easily the best service we have ever experienced.

Not sure how we've gone so many years without trying Vetri but got the chance to visit recently and I was very pleasantly surprised how much we enjoyed our meal. I think I had been hesitant because some people had told me the portions were not enough but I have to tell you we were STUFFED. Between the complimentary appetizer and amuse bouche, I think the number of courses would have been enough. But we added a third pasta and the prosciutto board and it was way too much food for the two of us.

Everything was excellent. Highlights for me were the duck garganelli pasta, the fried pizza dough complimentary appetizer, and my duck breast entree. The other dishes were very good too but those were definitely my favorite. Not pictured are our desserts, the ricotta cheesecake and the chocolate mousse cake. 

I also want to highlight that the service was impeccable! My husband spilled his espresso and they covered it up and got him a new one. And I started not feeling too well during dinner and they kindly packaged all our leftovers so well. Can't wait to go back!

I really enjoy this place, the food, the atmosphere, the people everybody was accommodating and friendly. It's a place you will have to try for yourself I highly recommend it. I would definitely go back and try other menus.

Each dish was perfection.  The gnocchi was beyond amazing. The pistachio dessert was delightful. Also the wine pairing elevated our culinary experience to a whole new level. Bobby- we hit the lotto having you as both our sommelier and waiter! Enrique- thank you for being the most gracious host!

I wanted to love Vetri more than I did. We had the tasting menu, and there certainly were some highlights. We ordered the Stuzzichini with the prosciutto and coppa. This was very good, but I didn't care as much for the tigelle which came with it. These little pieces of fried bread had an unpleasant texture.

The Sweet Onion Crepe was the best thing I ate all evening. It had the purest distillation of amazing caramelized onion flavor that I have ever experience. I would order this again in a heartbeat. I also tried the Swordfish Braciole, which was delicious.

The Gnocchi was another highlight. The potato-less dumplings had the most beautiful texture, and the brown butter sauce lent the gnocchi a richness that was amazing. I was less pleased with the Spaghetti Alla Chitarra. Overall, I found that the sauce lacked flavor, and I would not reorder this pasta.

My husband and I split the Veal Milanese. While it was an excellent cut of veal and had some truly beautiful heirloom tomatoes, I felt this dish lacked flavor as well. 

Both desserts that we tried were outstanding. I loved the Black Forest Tiramisu, finding the additional of cherries to be absolutely delicious. I was even more surprised by the Molten Pistachio Cake. This was a delight, and I would order it again.

My husband and I went here a couple nights ago for an early anniversary dinner and it was one of the best meals of my life. Service was exquisite, the ambiance was charming, and the food was incredible.

Service: From the phone call to confirm our reservation to wishing us goodbye as we left the service could not have been better. Our servers made wonderful recommendations, topped off our wine often, and brought us extra goodies throughout the evening. Note: Service is not fast, it is intentionally relaxed and spaced out so you can enjoy yourself. I never felt like we had to wait too long for any course, but if you haven't been to a restaurant like this before the paving might seem unfamiliar. 

Ambiance: The restaurant is on two levels of a row house. It's definitely not a large space, but they've made the most of it.  I didn't feel crowded at our table as there is plenty of space between tables so everyone has some privacy. But tables were close enough so we could see people's food as it was being brought out to their tables, which we enjoyed. Lighting was low, but not too low, the bathroom was exceptionally clean, the dishes and glasses all beautiful and charming. 

Food: They offer a structured menu from which you choose one option among many for each course. Every single thing I ordered was amazing! From the savory caramelized onion crepe with truffle, to the locally foraged mushroom ragu pasta, to the veal Milanese, to the pistachio cake with strawberry ice cream, every dish was exquisite. I

Also: We sprang for the wine pairings with each course and were really glad we did. Supposedly we were supposed to get a half a glass per course but it was definitely more like a whole glass each time! The wines were perfectly chosen for each dish and our servers were happy to tell us all about them. 

My husband took me to the French Laundry for a milestone e birthday a few years ago when we lived in California, and I enjoyed Vetri Cucina more, and that's saying something. If I could give 6 stars, I would. So, if you are looking for the perfect restaurant to celebrate something significant, or to propose, this is definitely the spot!

I made a reservation on Tock, this restaurant's online booking portal, on June 12 th for July 16 th. They required a $50 credit card charge to hold the reservation which I provided on American Express. On the night of the reservation they said they had no reservation for me and turned me away. I had given up a reservation at Zahav to eat at this place and ended up eating bar food after driving 5 hours to Philly. This places online reservation portal obviously does not work so please check before you go and get stuck like we did.

Vetri Cucina is phenomenal. Hands down one of the best meals we have ever had. It's a beautiful restaurant  located in a town house in Philly and offers a $125 pp prix fix style menu. Note that the website now says $135 pp.

We had;

Foie gras pastrami - excellent 
Torched Hamachi - very good
Barbecued quail - excellent 
Grano Arso Tonnarelli - very good
Swiss Chard Gnocchi - excellent 
Veal Milanese for 2 - incredible (best veal Milanese I've ever had) 
Chocolate Polenta Soufflé - good

We were blown away with our experience at Vetri!

This is both a warning and a word of encouragement...it's going to be expensive! They have a $125 prefix plating option, but if you can swing it, you will see it is well worth it. 

Honestly, walking into the restaurant, I was king of surprised. I knew this was going to be a high-end/fine dining experience, but the you could pass right by the building if you aren't familiar with the city. It's like it intentionally wants to be a secret. And the decor inside is super homey, antique-ish, rich, and warm (not a ton of glitz and glam.) Yet, as soon as you sit down, you see how it is a fine-dining experience. They greet you with a complimentary cocktail, and the service is just fantastic! So friendly and professional, helpful, and provided a perfect balance of attention and letting you enjoy yourselves. 

The food was really good too! Can't complain there. The portions were small, but fair with the amount of plates you get. I left feeling comfortably full. 

They took note of it being our anniversary and added a nice touch to our dessert.

Everything from start to finish was just top notch! Would definitely recommend visiting.
This was truly an amazing experience.  The food was EXCELLENT and the service was fantastic. My favorite was the pistachio cake and the hamachi crudo. Highly recommend it to everyone!!

Lovely place to hold a special occasion dinner. You have a limited number of options for each course, which means they're all perfectly executed. Service is unmatched in the city. Staff is knowledgeable and willing to share what they know.

You're able to order extra items for a surcharge, which I recommend if you're unsure about what to choose.

We had high hopes for this place, but at $125 per person before tax + tip it was just... not that worth it, unless you have unlimited money to spend. I've had meals for half the price which impressed me much more than Vetri. Coming from out of town, Vetri was supposed to be the food highlight of our trip, but everyone in our party was let down.

The good:
- Atmosphere was nice, dimly lit and relaxing
- Service was friendly
- The appetizers and desserts were fantastic!

The meh:
- The rest of the food was decent but not excellent. I'm writing this review one month later, and besides the appetizers and desserts I can't remember the rest. Pretty unmemorable.
- If I hadn't eaten the complimentary bread, I would not have left full

Also, we found out afterwards that the cocktails they offer you in the beginning are complimentary, so make sure to get them. We didn't know and they didn't tell us so we didn't opt for them. The rest of the drinks (coffee, tea, additional alcohol, etc.) are not included.

To be totally honest, I'm probably not the target demographic for this restaurant since I rarely do high dining. If you have major cash to spend, maybe you'll find Vetri totally worth it for the price. But if this is a bit of a splurge and you're spending this much for a special occasion, I would reconsider.
We came in on a public holiday and we're served so quickly after a long day. The food was fresh and the place was clean. It was well priced and the servings were good.
The pasta dishes are superb but the wine and cocktails were not well matched both times we have come here. Our waitress made excellent recommendations though and no complaints about the service.

When I go to dinner I expect to buy dinner, but going to Vetri means paying for an experience! 

In past visits the offering was a chefs choice menu with several courses, usually including a pasta. On this recent visit diners could choose their selections. 

Fish, pasta, and offerings far outside of traditional fare. Exquisitely presented with various sauces or complimentary flavors that will take you on a culinary adventure found in very few places nationwide. 

A small venue of a hundreds year old row home allow a host of knowledge, passionate, professional servers with complete understanding of the dishes to fill in every detail of what you are eating. 

Get the wonderful wine pairing from the resident sommelier and let her take you through Italy and describe varieties you likely haven't tried. 

Fun. Just fun and palate expanding. An experience you'll cherish.

We celebrated our 50 th wedding anniversary at Vetri Cuccia, having the most amazing dinner one only can dream of. The entire staff was beyond excellent, as was each course. This wonderful restaurant has our highest recommendation.

It's been a long time since I've sat in a fine dining restaurant and I'm so glad my love chose this one. It was his birthday so we decided to visit this restaurant. He's been many times in the past and it was my very first time. The dining experience was very intimate and cozy we had a great view of the chefs table from our location. The service was phenomenal we were greeted and taken directly to our seating area. Then our server explained the menu and discussed a special that would replace the "second" portion. The cocktails were amazing and we didn't have to wait long after finishing a course to starting a new one. I'm looking forward to going again hopefully without it being a special occasion.

Without a doubt my favorite restaurant - I like it more than the few Michelin 3-star restaurants I've been lucky enough to eat at. Nothing about it - food, service, comfort - is less than amazing. Worth making a special trip for.

Did the tasting menu with wine pairings- so delicious and so much fun! Waitstaff was great, walked us through everything, answered all our questions, and taught us a lot about Italian food & wine! Perfect night out.

Overall: This was a bucket list dinner and well worth the wait. We had a great time at Vetri eating til we burst. You can tell that the chefs have incredible skill and training. Even the bread for the table is house made and the lightest fluffiest bread I have ever had. 

The sweet onion crepe was one of the best things I've eaten, ever. The broiled oysters were fabulous. The branzino was delicious and buttery. The chocolate polenta cake was literally the best chocolate cake I've ever eaten. 

The only thing I wouldn't do again is the spinach gnocchi. I believe I heard the waiter explain that they dont use ricotta or flour, it's basically just a spinach puree dumpling. While wonderfully done, I just don't personally love spinach this much that I can skip all the other things that go into a gnocchi. 

The last thing I wanted to say is that Vetri felt: cozy. It felt comfortable and approachable despite being high end dining. Not at all pretentious. 

While I can't say we'll be back any time super soon, it was an awesome experience and I'm grateful I finally got to try it!
Always amazing!!! The wine pairings are perfect. Service is out of this world. One of the best!!!

business.name: Alice Pizza

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': True, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}
attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}

business.categories: Pizza, Restaurants, Nightlife, Italian, Bars, Gelato, Food, Wine Bars

reviews.text:
Restaurant Week at Alice Pizza was truly a success. After checking out the RW menu online, and comparing it to a few others that I thought were worth checking out, friends and I decided that Alice Pizza was the spot for us. Two out of three of us had been for pizza and gelato before, but this was a first for the sit down, full menu dining experience. We called about a week in advance to make our reservation and were easily able to get the time we wanted.

We were seated immediately upon arrival and our vaccination cards were checked per the city mandate. We were offered regular and RW menus. As a participant in dry January, I only peeked at the drink menu to avoid temptation. I was pleased to see that the drink prices are pretty reasonable and there's a wide selection of cocktails, beer, and wine. I opted for a diet coke with lemon, another friend participating had a blood orange italian soda, and our non-dry January friend had an espresso martini.

The four course RW menu had 4 different choices for first course and the second course, so we all agreed upon our three preferences from each category and ordered accordingly. We each did our own thing for course 3, and then shared desserts for the fourth and final course.

To start, we had the Mozzarella Tasting, Salumi e Formagi Misti, and Burrata Con Tartufo. The servings were small, but just enough so that we could each have a bite of everything. For our second course, we had the Cacio e Pepe Gnocchi Fritti, Suppli al Telefono, and Sformato. Again, these dishes were on the smaller side, but perfect to share. The gnocchi was incredible, the ragu with the suppli was perfect, and the sformato was next level - definitely my favorite.

For my third course, I had the Carbonara pizza. This was the main event dish, the portion was so big I could hardly finish half. So crisp, well topped, minimal crust and just delicious. My mouth is watering while writing this review and thinking about that pizza. 

To wrap up the evening, we had the Sfogliatelle, Tortina Della Nonna, and Crema Catalana. Honestly, I think we were served a key lime pie instead of the Tortina Della Nonna because there was a lime garnish and no nut toppings but I am so glad because that little pie was my favorite dessert.

Start to finish, a delightful night. Our server Dom was personable, attentive, and made the evening thoroughly enjoyable. I can't wait to return to Alice for another sit down meal to try all of the other menu options. What is better than a successful Restaurant Week?!

I've been here a few times for lunch and dinner and I think this is a pretty good pizza restaurant. They are personal size pizza flavorful and they have a crunchy thick crust. The cool thing is after having a pizza you can grab a scoop or two of gelato. They also sell dry pasta that you can take home and cook yourself.

I love pizza( never been to Italy ) but New York, Chicago, Detroit,Californian.... I love them all specially New York very thin pizza. This place pizza is like between Detroit & New York pizza.  someone mention like Italian pizza here ! ok !! I will ask Italian friend later ... any way ... pizza taste good, not too oily even I ordered carbonara...taste  like carbonara but not oily... good chewy bite ... and meat ball... very fluffy, meat ball with light marinara sauce over the meat ball good combo! And we thought will order pasta but server mistakes  our order he bring calamari. But its ok ! I was thinking I gonna get them before order meatball! He said calamari with zucchini fritter so would be fine.... Turns out good Because I ordered pitcher of Italian beer we just need some beer food! any way server was super nice ( forgot to ask his name) everything is very nice...

Absolutely delicious for an authentic Italian pizza and I will definitely go back next time we are in the area!! The pizza here is bought by slice/weight just like in Italy, which is wonderful because you can choose so many different types

Alice Pizza is a pice of heaven to say the least!. With friends or a family member, to indulge with a simple plate of Pasta, to a Pizza with a number of desserts to complement the dinner, feast for the eyes!.!. From a movie or a theater, what a nice time to relax while relaxing with something to keep you tummy warm!.
Very good pizza and desserts. Close tot he theaters. Will need a reservation on theatre nights.
Have I ever reviewed Alice? Lol one of my favorite restaurants in town, whether to grab a slice of pizza, gelato, or to sit down to eat

Would give this 3.5/5 stars, but rounding up just because I had it twice for take-out but never in store, so perhaps I would've had a better experience with the food being more fresh! 

I ordered Alice Pizza on Too Good To Go, which is a food saving app which lets you pick up restaurant leftover un-ordered dishes at a discounted price. Therefore, I got a weird assortment of vegetable pizzas (broccoli, mushrooms, etc.) but honestly was pleasantly surprised after heating them up in the oven! There was quite a large quantity and they were quite generous about it. The crust was satisfying and the pizza shapes were all rectangular, which I thought was quite intruiging.

Wow! Simply fantastic pizza, certainly one of the better pizzas I've had. I went with 2 friends and we ordered 2 pizzas to share between the 3 of us, a Margherita and a Philly Special. The Margherita was as good as they get; the sauce was not too salty or sweet, the basil was fresh, and the cheese was tasty without being overly greasy. The Philly Special was terrific. I was very impressed by the pesto and how fresh and flavorful it was which is not easy to do. The crusts were excellent too, a perfect combination of crispy on the bottom and slightly chewy on the top without being either soggy or burnt.

Overall highly recommend going here with a group and sharing several pizzas, they are a bit large for one person to eat in one sitting although a piece would no doubt be fine for reheating. The service is solid and there's outdoor seating too for the COVID-conscious. They also have a huge selection of drinks and gelato which looked really good. We were all too full for gelato which wasn't a problem as it was so satisfying but I hope to come back here another time and try the gelato.

Came for the pizza. Stayed for the hospitality. This restaurant is not only outfitted to be an elegant bar-top, but an everyday place to have a drink, or enjoy one of their small appetizers. Antonella and Shane are the people to ask for to enhance your experience. Pizza to coffee, you won't regret stopping by.

4 stars for good flavor but 3 stars for being a bit overcooked, 4 stars for an okay salad 

An authentic square cutting Italian style pizza. This order unfortunately did take a bit longer than the projected wait time by about another 5 minutes and the pizza crust was unfortunately overcooked (burnt) on the bottom. I think we got the BBQ pork pizza - it had a nice flavor to it, I liked the red sauce, onion/tomato, but I think the cook of the pizza itself needed some work.

We also got the bresaola beef tenderloin/arugula salad combo - the beef was thinly sliced, had a very strong flavor, a bit tough to chew, but tasted quite hardy. 

Tips/Takeaways: 
-I think you'd be satisfied with any of their pizzas
-The bresaola was okay, nice for a try, but I'm not convinced I'd get it a second time

tl;dr premium ingredients and grab-and-go slices al taglio culminate into this solid pizza option in Center City

"Al taglio" translates directly to "by the cut," in reference to the large sheets, cut and served in rectangular slices. Originally developed in Rome, Alice Pizza has expanded worldwide and is now a heavy-hitter in the pizza al taglio game. A friend remarked that this spot was a regular spot in her culinary routine during her semester abroad in Rome, so it's about time that I tried the Center City outpost.

The decor is confusingly over-the-top and in slight disrepair. Funky wire lighting fixtures hang from the high ceilings, and the walls prominently display murals and paintings depicting scenes from Rome. The large space is dominated by a U-shaped center counter. A rainbow of gelato options highlights the front side, with a long row of assorted square pies along the left and a full-service bar on the right. Mismatched chairs are paired with Mod Podge-esque tables. Contemporary rock blends with the buzz from the kitchen.

My partner and I decided to split a few slices during our visit this past weekend. Ordering in-person was a breeze, and the slices were reheated within 5 minutes.

The crust itself was pleasantly light and crisp. Each slice had a generous helping of clearly premium toppings. I loved that sauce and toppings spread very nearly to the edges of the crust. Our favorites flavors were the Diavolo (spicy salami), Philly Special (pesto, arugula, and sundried tomatoes), and Salsiccia e Funghi (sausage and mushrooms). The only flavor that was a letdown for us was the Melenzane Picante (eggplant), which was lukewarm, slightly slimy, and overly oily, and one-dimensional.

Our eyes were definitely larger than our stomachs -- we ended up getting 6 rectangular slices (translating into 12 square-sized ones). I would recommend 2-3 rectangular slices per person for a solid meal. Nonetheless, the $30 (after tax and tip) for our meal was still a bit jarring for pizza. All being said, Alice offers some of Philly's best reheated slices, which can inherently be inconsistent.

Not quite the same pizza al taglio in Rome.  Although this location is a full blown restaurant/bar and not just a pizza joint like in Rome.  I had the funghi e salsiccia, margherita, diavola, and funghi.  All were very close to the flavors, but I can't help but notice this one is more cracker like than the ones in Rome.  I tried ordering the taglio from the bar, but the manager informed me that it was restaurant policy.  So I had to close out my tab and go on the other side of the place to get the taglio.  I suspect that if I was a regular patron, they would be allowed to order from the bar.
Great place, very good pizza and dessert. If you are at Phily City Center is a very good option to eat. Totally recommended.

I really needed pizza, and I really miss the walk-in by the slice pizza of Italy. But Alice has nailed it. Alice describes itself as having evolved from Roma pizzerias and I would agree. In Rome I was always amazed at the different topping varieties with lots of vegetables as opposed to the meat laden US renditions, and this is exactly how Alice has designed it's offerings. I actually wanted a full meal so ordered a personal pizza (Diablo's with added spinach) and the Fior Latte Mozzarella Caprese with added Prosciutto. Portions are very generous for the price and the pizza was glorious just like what I'd expect in Italy. I have not even had pizza like this in NYC or Boston (which I have always found weird because of the storied Italian influence in these cities). My review is only 3-stars for the following reasons - the Caprese "heirloom tomatoes" were not even close to meeting my expectations and they put too much sea salt on but not enough EVOO or oregano. Remember mozzarella is already a salty cheese so overdoing the added sea salt was just too much. Lastly, I ordered the added Prosciutto to the caprese and paid an up charge of $5.50 for it, but it wasn't added to the dish. VERY disappointing. Because I obtained this meal as take-away I didn't notice until I had arrived back at the hotel. For the charge, this is totally unsatisfactory. In hind-sight the added saltiness of the meat would have been completely overwhelming in light of my comment about the excessive sea salt. Finally, when I called in to order my food, the server didn't understand the menu and I had to educate her that, yes in fact they do have a caprese on the menu. How can someone working in a restaurant not know the menu? Really?
In summary, the pizza was awesome, the caprese was not worth it in the end. This would be an awesome spot for a walk-in and walk-away lunch - get your pizza, fold it in half and indulge as you walk down the streets of Philadelphia and for a minute believe you are in the streets of Roma.
The pizza was amazing! The ambiance is great and the ice cream to die for. Coming back. Thank you Dominique for taking care of our large party!
We had a slice of zucchini buratta pizza. It had a nice think crust; very Detroit style. The sauce and cheese balanced well. I'd definitely eat there again. Staff was helpful.
Not sure what I was thinking years ago, I love how you can grab a slice as big as you want. All of their toppings are so fresh and delicious. Light, crispy dough.

This is one of my favorite places in Philly. The staff is super cool, friendly and accommodating. They location is perfect. They have outside seating on the sidewalk, not on the street like Blume does.

Oh and the pizza. I've had nearly every pizza like 5 times over but the mushroom one is my favorite.

Then for desserts they have an amazing selection of gelatos and cakes!

As the only US outpost of a Roman chain, we had high expectations. The pizza was great- crispy crust, excellent sauces. The dessert case is stunning & both the strawberry marscapone confection & the chocolate mouse were delightful. The service was also very warm & helpful. Quick too. 
Recommend.

Went here for lunch with a friend/family. Decided to eat inside. Server was very nice and quick. We ordered Cacio e Pepe fried gnocchi,2 pizza (margarita and roasted pork). Gnocchi and Pizzas were very good.  for my taste (I tried to eat low sodium) the roasted pork was salted but it was delicious. There were square pizza, 4 moderate size slices. We also had gelato and pastry (I had a kinder gelato and apple tart). I didn't like neither. I had way better gelato with more flavor and the apple tart with almond cream was tasteless as well. I certainly will try this place again for the pizza. The only issue is parking around the area, a few parking garages but very expensive at the time we went. I was able to find parking on the street. (Sorry forgot to take pics of the food).

What a beautiful place! The restaurant and bar is both very clean and very pretty. The pizza was absolutely delicious and prepared quickly! The staff was very patient while I was overwhelmed with all of the options!

My husband and I are riding this experience at 5 stars for several reasons. First when I called to request a reservation, I was politely greeting and not kept on hold long. Then when we arrived we didn't wait more than 2min to be seated and we were able to choose which table we wanted to sit at that our waitress was serving. I got the Spicy Shrimp Fra Diavolo and it was delicious! There was a perfect ratio of spicy tomato sauce to fresh homemade fettuccine , and the flavors were rival to the best Italian food I've ever had. There was plenty of shrimp in the dish, not skimpy like other places. My husband had a pizza and they were very accommodating to his specific request as he can be a picky eater especially when it comes to pizza. I was so happy they did not take offense to his order. He enjoyed it very much. I also want to note that the place was very clean, even the bathroom, which surprised me because there were plenty of people in the restaurant and I would have thought it may be neglected since I didn't see a lot of staff, but it was nice. I would definitely return here next time we visit PA.

I've really only been here for the gelato, but I love it! It's a nice refreshing treat on a hot day that isn't as heavy as all the ice cream around town. I've had the Limone (lemon) a few times, and occasionally get something chocolatey (like Desire, which if I recall is a vanilla base with chocolate cherry or raspberry mix?) I'm never disappointed. Pre-pandemic they would give samples so you could try all of the flavors before you chose one for your purchase but I don't think they offer that anymore.

I always say I'll come back to try the pizza but who knows if I'll ever get around to it. The gelato is worth it on its own, though!

I wish I could give it a ZERO. I have ordered pizza and gelato from here in the past. Today I had a limited time for lunch and I ORDERED a pizza for pick-up because I wanted it to be fresh. The ones they have in the display sit out there for a while.

Anyway I picked up the pizza, didn't open it until I got home. In the first place it was barely warm, but I'll forgive that. When I opened it up it was BURNT. I thought it was just the corners but the entire crust was burnt underneath. I will NEVER order or buy anything from this restaurant again. I cannot believe that they would SELL this. It must have been a reject that they were going to throw out. Normally I would have returned it for a refund, but I would have been late for work had I done so. 

The gelato is good, but I'll never be back. I can go to the other restaurant on Chestnut and get gelato.

business.name: Di Bruno Bros.

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}

business.categories: Sandwiches, Cheese Shops, Meat Shops, Italian, Specialty Food, Restaurants, Food

reviews.text:
I frequent di Bruno bros since I live close by. The selection is incredible! I swear they have 100 different cheeses. The staff is very friendly and helpful. 

Things I love there:
Oat milk latte
Breakfast sandwiches (have interesting delicious cheeses in them) 
Selection of oils and vinegars
All the sweets (warning the cake is VERY dense.... Don't eat too much or you'll feel a sugar coma coming on)
All the cheeses
Prepared foods
Cheesy potatoes 
Creamed spinach 
The staff! 

Things that weren't as good as I thought they'd be (but not worth taking off stars):
The cake (see above - just a bit too sweet - yes even for cake)
Eggplant parmigiana - not bad but not as good as everything else 

I hope this helps! I'm so lucky to live close by.

I ordered in plenty of time for Christmas delivery.  A tracking number was given but the package never left DiBruno's.  I have tried to contact by phone several times, left voicemails as no one answered.  Never heard back. I signed an online contact form and haven't heard back.  I emailed and haven't heard back.  This is beyond poor customer service not to contact the customer.  I sent this package, $137 order,  to one of my clients. I am so thankful that I did not send it to all my clients as I contemplated doing.  What a disaster that would have been.  Very disappointed and at this point truly frustrated.

HORRIBLE customer service! I have ordered from here before and its clear to see they dont give a damn about their customers!! After you leave messages etc no return calls or emails! Funny how all during December they are out of alot of stuff but SHOCKER a couple of days after Christmas the stuff is back in stock. They have shown they are unreliable and unprofessional and do not care about their customers. Until they wake up I will order from a company who cares!

Come here if you love cheese. 

Pros:
- They were sticklers about wearing masks, an older lady walked in without a mask and was immediately asked to put one on. 
- They offered samplers of pretty much everything, they ask you to quickly slip the piece under your mask.
- Huge assortment of cheese and dried meats
- Friendly staff, listened to our preferences of what cheese we liked and recommended a few to try that were similar 

Cons:
- easy to spend money, we bought everything we tasted lol
- smaller space, can't imagine foot traffic during peak times and people trying out samplers right bumping into you. Overheard a lady said she wanted to step outside since she didn't feel safe during covid, which I completely get

Horrible customer service. They are quick to take your money, but not solve any problems. they billed me for items that i did not receive and no one will email me back from customer service. i do not know how they stay open.

Placed an order for a Christmas gift on Black Friday. Was asked to  choose delivery week at check out. Chose Christmas week. Was notified via generic email the night before it was to be shipped (5 days before Christmas) that "supply chain issues were affecting some of their orders but they were working day and night to satisfy customers."
Since then I've emailed and called several
times to ask when my order will be shipped as I am
traveling after the holidays. If the order ships while I'm gone the enclosed food will spoil before I return. I was trying to inform them  to postpone delivery until after I return.  I've received no response or acknowledgement. Christmas is tomorrow and my order is still "awaiting fulfillment". And other than the generic email that my order "may be delayed" I've received no correspondence from this company regarding the order I placed a month ago. This will be the last time I order from them.

I went to the 9th street store on the corner of Samson and was so happy. Always love their sandwiches and service but Wes went out of his way to get me some extra cranberry sauce when I asked it for it. It made my day! Thank you!

Now that this is in my neck of the woods, it's both a blessing and a curse. A blessing in that if I'm craving a nice block of goat cheese, I've got a place. A curse in that it takes everything in my power to not visit here every single day. It's a beacon of all things charcuterie and I'm hooked. It's a tiny Italian Market establishment, but stocked to the brim with aged cheeses, dried & cured meats, jars of sweet jams and spicy olives, vodka sauce & arrabiata, and a good variety of crackers and breads (if you get there early enough). All that's missing is wine, but just go half a block down to DiBrunos bottle shop and you're set. 

Word on the street is they host wine and cheese parties. You can rent out the place for the night and impress your friends and coworkers by nibbling on a chunk of Gouda and saying "yes, this is cheese." 

Pro tip: they sometimes leave unsold baguettes outside the door in a bag but sidewalk food is sus at best (although I was tempted.)
Horrible customer service - very difficult people to work with and refused to help make one adjustment to an incorrect address

Absolutely the best food I have eaten .   Mac and cheese to die for.  I didn't know DiBrunos was in the area so I ordered food online and it is delicious.
Will be ordering frequently .

Di Bruno has all types of cheeses and meats! We were overwhelmed by all they had but their staff were super helpful with questions and suggestions. We got a variety of things from a brie to goat cheeses and sampled a shmear which was very tasty. We picked up several sopressata and prosciutto and jams. We enjoyed everything we got and was not disappointed.

I stop by here impulsively while walking arround the area. Let me first say that this sort of shop isn't a place I would typically go. The products all look amazing but they are a little above my typical grocery budget. As a result even though the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, I was hesitant to engage too much. Ultimately I bought a few "orphan" cheeses and some bread. The bread was AMAZING and I can't recommend it highly enough. The cheese was fine by my selection didn't really go together that well. Had I been more willing to seek the help of the staff I'm sure I would have wound up with a more pleasing combination.

While shopping I stopped by a few of the other similar stores selling cheese/meat/dry good. This was by FAR the friendliest.

They have the type of products that you can honestly only find in Italy. Let me tell you I go grocery shopping in all the Italian grocery shops so I know it's hard to find the higher end in quality product from Italy. All tour stores have the usual San Daniel prosciutto and nothing else, but only Di Bruno has an actual selection. 10/10 definitely recommend. Grab some food from there to eat for a special date and you won't regret it.

Amazing 

Selection? 
Quality?     
Prices?       

The challenge is to choose and we selected some incredible cheeses to go with our meal

We bought some jar sauce as well and will be back for sure

Just want to say thank you~ My son LOVES his first eat like a cheesemonger monthly delivery. I VERY much appreciate you making it vegetarian as requested and will be posting this review. 

Thanks again from a repeat buyer!!!!!

Sitting out side along 9th street on a perfectly beautiful night with my wife. This is what life is about. Fine meats and cheeses under romantic lighting. 

If you were looking for a first date this would be the perfect place before November.

Laughable bad place for cheese.  

The first thing any person with the slightest bit of cheese knowledge knows will be the entire staff is clueless when it comes to cheese.  From storing it, to cutting it, to temperature control, etc.  Showing photos of the place to other store owners in different parts of the world their first reaction is total shock and they visible cringe seeing pics of unrefrigerated cheese.  These are people who grew up making cheese and working in cheese.

On the bright side, the staff is always incredibly friendly and many non cheese related products are stocked (though a touch pricey).

Does di Bruno Brothers have new management?  I've been shopping there for 15 years but have been surprised at how many things they've always carried are now missing.  The customer-friendly attitude I've always appreciated has also changed; when I asked about the shortages, I was told, essentially, "it's hard to keep a store stocked; if you think it's easy, try it yourself. ". At the very least, they should take down their sign saying "We welcome all feedback," as they clearly do not.
This place is amazing. Went to Phil I for a mini vacation and I'm we loved this place. Ppl were so helpful and knowledgeable. Grab the mole sausage. It's so fn a ma zn

Such a great atmosphere and selection of meats and cheese. We learned the history of the market and thr tradition that continues. We came to the market 2 times during out stay a must if your in the area.

There staff is helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and they make you feel like one of the family. 

Will stop in everytime we visit philly.

My friend booked the After Hours event at the original DBB location in the Italian Market for his wife's birthday last week, and i (luckily) was invited. I have to say, it was one of the coolest things I've done in the city. The staff people (Scotty & Jeffrey Davey or Davey Jeff? Can't remember which one! lol) were AMAZING! So helpful, nice, friendly, knowledgeable - just all around great! 

The food was obviously amazing too! Specially curated platters, pairings, and so much awesomeness! Loved every minute of it! Thank you!

Recently attended an After Hours event at the original DBB location in the Italian Market. It was an unbelievably incredible setup and the quality and knowledge of the products and sourcing is unparalleled. If I could eat here every day I would.
Coming down to the Italian market is like stepping back in time with appreciation for current good food. The staff couldn't be nicer and there are so many goodies in this small space.

I used this location of Di Bruno Brothers for a party I was having for my husband's 40th Birthday. I wanted 5 very specific cheese boards and accompanying condiments, bread, crackers and olives. I also wanted to pair the cheeses with cocktails for the party. I had the pleasure of working with Tommy Amorim, he was knowledgeable and helpful with every aspect of this process. He helped me choose a beautiful selection of cheeses with really great jams, mostardas, honey, marmalade's and additional accompaniments. They cheese boards ended up looking so great, tasted even better and they were a huge hit at the party. I cannot thank Tommy and Di Bruno brothers enough for everything they did to help us out, please don't hesitate to use them for you next even if party either!

Fabulous! 
Cheeses I had never heard of before nor tasted... wonderful meats. Staff is generous with the tastings and very knowledgeable.
Great experience even tho it did cost us over $100 by the time we got out of there!! lol

business.name: LaScala's

business.categories: Pizza, Restaurants, Italian, Salad

reviews.text:
We love lascala's at cooper River and had family visiting from out of town. They wanted to eat in Philly and I sadly recommended Lascalas at Passyunk expecting the same great food. 

Their pizza is a sad version of the excellent offerings at their NJ location. 

Servers were all nice and cordial.  Location is good. 

Food was not. 

The chicken parm pizza was very good. 
Garlic pizza was just a ton of garlic powder. No shaved roasted garlic like in NJ. 
Their marinara was not as good as NJ either. 

Skip this place. 
Maybe it's ok if you never had the better versions of their menu.

Visited LaScala's with my husband two weekends ago when we were visiting Philly for our anniversary. We both were in the mood for some itialian food and pizza so we decided to give this place a try. To our surprise, we visited on their re-opening night. We were told by the host that we would be seated outside since the owner was celebrating the grand opening with his guests inside. We weren't bothered since the weather was nice and they had patio heaters, it was a nice ambiance. We ordered a 5 cheese pizza and Philly Cheesesteak calzones however, only the pizza was good. The food overall  was underwhelming. My husband also ordered a Lofi sour, which was too sour to drink. He had originally asked for a mojito, but they only had the 5 drinks available on the menu. Service was just ok. Really wanted to like this place, but we wouldn't return.

Boy, am I full! I didn't even eat any of the Italian Wedding Soup I ordered as I was just stuffed.

My coworker and I came here after the new grand "reopening." LaScala's Fire has been open about a week and used to just be LaScala's. In these COVID-19 times, we were upset when they closed thinking it was for good. Thank God it wasn't!

LaScala's Fire has a very easy to use online ordering website and I used it without any difficulties to place a pick-up order. I love how with certain items they move into sub-menus for extra add-ons or take-aways. The price adjusts accordingly for the add-ons. After placing your order, they give you a time it should be ready and it was!

The Alicia's salad was nothing much in way of the salad itself. Greens, chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, but I added some calamari which upped the game, and the dressing they kept to the side. However, the gigantic sphere of a meatball with a huge amount of ricotta and red sauce was almost a meal in itself. Perfectly cooked with an almost crispy outer rim, juicy inside and so much flavor. Mixed with the ricotta was perfect. I was not the biggest fan of the red sauce, but everyone has their preferences. 

The fried calamari came back to work a little on the soggy side, and they were too salty for me. Next time I'll try at the restaurant itself and I bet they'll be better. Most of that came home for someone else in the family to enjoy.

Lastly, dessert was so decadent. The zeppoles were perfectly fried dough balls in powdered sugar with an outstanding cannoli cream over them. Then, to somehow make them even better, a raspberry dipping sauce. OMG. 

My coworker really liked her chicken Caesar salad that she added bacon to. Couldn't finish it but did chow down on the nice grilled chicken. Had to save room for the zeppoles! 

LaScala's Fire also looked awesome inside in gleaming white and has plenty of seating. The staff were using all COVID-19 precautions. We inquired about a luncheon and they said they are taking things day by day as the rules seem to change by the second in Philadelphia. However, they can accommodate.

The online ordering menu allows for a tip to be added, and you pay with credit. $67 for everything including tax and tip - 2 salads, soup, calamari, and zeppoles! I'll definitely be back to try the pizzas, paninis, Stromboli, calzone, some other starters, and their favorites. Really, one of everything, please, extra meatballs.

LaScala completely remodeled over the last few and reopened as LaScala Fire. The remodel is stunning! Larger bar , open kitchen . Gorgeous!  Luigi was our server and attentive and fun. The menu has changed some but the food was delicious . The portions were huge and enough to take home for a second meal . What are you waiting for ? Make your reservation today!!

Great food and great service! You walk in and see the beautiful bar to your left and the dining room to the right. I have not yet utilized the happy hour at the bar yet, but rest assured I will be back for that. My party and i split the eggplant appetizer and the ricotta board and it was gone in no time. I got the gnocchi last night with Alfredo sauce and it was delicious. I only wish I had saved room for desserts! I would definitely recommend for a more dressed up, yet casual, dining experience with a group of friends or an affordable date night.

The exterior of LaScala's right off the bat is quite inviting and intriguing. I was seated at a candle lit table next to the window in the back room, which featured quaint chandeliers and friendly prints around the room. The waiter was quick to greet us and I knew I wanted the fusilli with seafood before I arrived. The food came very fast (it was 5 pm so it wasn't that crowded yet). My food was extremely hot and steamy, which was impressive but somewhat intimidating. The food was delicious! I had never tried scallops before and they were lump and delicious. The shrimp still had the tails attached unfortunately, but they were satisfyingly easy to slide off. The pasta itself was fresh and the sauce was delicious. The only complaint I really have is how small the glasses are, which had my waiter refilling it every time I took a sip. We had a cannoli afterwards which was also very delicious. By the time it came the restaurant was very lively with a cheery and romantic atmosphere. This place is great for a date and I would 100% recommend!

Went on Valentine's and although it was (rightfully) busy, the food was out in less than 15 minutes. The salmon was incredible and so was the lava cake. When I had asked the host for better seats he did not hesitate. A relaxed environment with great food, definitely recommend!

Visited last night and was blown away. The staff was extremely nice and attentive, and had the food out in less than 15 minutes from when our order was taken. Amazing food and great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend to anyone who's visiting Center City.

Salmon was cooked to perfection overtop a hearty bed of spinach.  Chicken Marsala was delicious and serving sizes were fair.  Prices weren't steep.  Overall, it was a good experience with Sergio as my waiter.   I just wish that my table placement was different on valentine's today.  My table was all the way in the back corner and to be honest. I didn't feel like I was apart of the restaurant at all. Complementary parking above the restaurant was a winner.  Overall.  I would probably return sometime in the future.

LaScalas is a wonderful spot in a great location within walking distance from the liberty bell and independence hall. The interior has a somewhat swanky feel with large leather booths and dim lighting. When you enter you walk by giant dessert carts filled with mouthwatering treats.
The food did not disappoint! We highly recommend the brussel sprouts as an appetizer. They were cooked perfectly with pancetta and balsamic for a beautiful flavor and texture. The calamari was pretty good and the truffle Mac and cheese was also good, however the truffle flavor was not as strong as we hoped. 

The rigatoni a la vodka was pretty good, but nothing too special. However, the pizzas were incredible. If you dine here, DEFINITELY order a pizza. The crust is perfectly cooked and has a crunchy base. The buffalo chicken pizza and prosciutto pizza were both raved about at our table! They also had a great selection of wines that made everyone happy.
Definitely worth trying LaScalas!

The food use to be so good but I don't know what happened. I haven't been here in years and was so excited to return. First, I ordered a pitcher of sangria but the size that was given definitely was a carafe. The price I paid for the sangria wasn't worth it all. Plus, I ordered the rose sangria and it tasted nothing like rose. It seemed like I was given a white sangria. The mussels and sausage appetizers I ordered just weren't good. Something about the flavor was off. The entrees were mediocre, well at least the rigatoni vodka. I remember having it back then and it was amazing. The seafood pasta was just horrible. It tasted like I was eating the entire ocean. It really was a turn off. I've had seafood pasta before at other restaurants and it definitely didn't taste like that. The sauce tasted like nothing. No flavor at all. Finally, when my plates were cleared, dessert was not offered and immediately he informed us he would bring the check. I did stop him and asked him what desserts were offered. I got the chocolate cake and it was probably the best thing I had the entire night. Service was mediocre and food was definitely not great. Definitely won't be coming back!!

Convenient to go to after the theater. TOok us earlier than  our reservation. No problem. Surprise! Restaurant Week! Didn't know but everything I wanted was on the special menu. Chopped Sally's, baked eggplant, aranccinni. Enough to share. Seafood fusilli was amazing. I kept the tiramisu to myself and wanted to lick the plate. Took home leftovers. Will definitely go back. Maybe for pizza. ThE piece  I tried was outstanding. Especially the crust!

Such a shame with the lack of private event customer service, since their food is delicious. I called the third week of December in regards to holding a rehearsal dinner for February. The host who had answered the phone was great! She informed me the manager will respond within 2 business days with pricing but that the restaurant is completely available.  I had asked if they could just email me prices and expressed that I was very interested, as well as give who had referred me to them. I had also send an email request prior to my call with the same information. I waited for over a week, with regards and  understanding due to holiday parties it might take a few extra days. After 10 days, I had called back again and expressed to the host that I had been waiting for pricing and would like to have an idea before booking as we are in a time sensitive manner. The gentleman only took my name, not phone number, date I requested, or any other information and explained the manager is out of the office and will respond when he returns. It is now another week past and I have yet to get a response. As I work in the sales and event management business for over 10 years, I'm astonished with the last of follow through and customer service on potential business.  complete Mismanagement

Went there on New Year's Eve for an early dinner. Had a special menu for the day and it had nice selection. I had reservations and was seated immediately. Was seated by the window which my daughter and wife enjoyed. Server was rough in the beginning but he warmed up and turned out to be a Great server! The food was very good. My wife had the seafood Fra diaolvo and I had the short rib with risotto. They were both very good. This was our 2nd time at this location and it was very enjoyable.

Hubby had a cast, so we decided on a restaurant near our hotel. Usually restaurants near hotels especially near tourist attractions are just "ok". In addition we have had great Italian in South Philly, so our expectations were low. 

We are eating our words!! Hubby wants to return again this weekend. It was an amazing Italian meal.

We had the lemon cello martini over ice in a tall glass- so yummy.

The 3 meatballs appetizer was enough for 6 of us to share with the rolls- rolls served with softened butter in olive oil.

The beet salad was also enough for sharing small bites- very good and I highly recommend.

The veal parmigiana was simple and yummy!! The broccoli rabe was light and tasty with fresh, crisp vegetables and sausage.

The pappaderelle was delicious! The vegetables were perfect and meaty tasting.

The Creme Brûlée was good, but the lemon cake  was sensational!!

The wait staff was super friendly, took our picture and the regulars were friendly and chatty.

Great experience
Was pleasantly surprised..the food was very tasty and my waiter was very good!! Will tell friends to try it and am glad I know this is there!!

First time here - absolutely fantastic. Food was outstanding, sangria was delicious. First off the appetizers ... stuffed long hots and the ricotta board. Both were phenomenal and Ive never had ricotta and honey before and it was just such a delightful mixture and was amazing with the homemade bread. My fiancées entree was a great pasta in creamy red sauce with lump crab meat, shrimp and scallops. My entree was a perfectly cooked strip steak covered in a mozzarella cheese on a bed of mashed potatoes and broccoli rabe. Zero complaints on food. The service was also perfectly okay, not too on top of you and allowed you to enjoy the food. Setting is also very comfortable and open. They also offer free parking in a garage nearby with entree purchase which in Philly is huge. Will certainly be back to try more of the menu! Great first experience.

Still great!  We hit this place a few times a year.  Love it.  In 9 years I think we had 1 bad meal and apparently there was a chef issue that night.  The only other bad experience was an ignorant patron that was upset that our children were there at 8pm.  Get over it lady!  This is their city and they are extremely well behaved... in restaurants anyway.

The atmosphere is nice , service was very good  but the food had a lot to be desired.  Salad was wet, pizza was so dry I could not eat it. , pasta was on level of Olive Garden. My friend ordered ravioli and she was disappointed ( it was the special too)   There are so many great restaurants in Philly so I would not put this on my list !

Just ok....went here cause the place we wanted to was closed and it also had outdoor seating, which was nice. Menu is alittle pricey and everything was just ok. We got calamari for an app, which was the best is the meal. My husband for a pizza and I got the chicken francese. Both were bland and ive had way better. Service was fine and being outside was nice. Place was empty at 6pm in a Sunday.

We came here for dinner around 6:30 on a Saturday. The place was pretty empty. The interior is nice. There are a ton of canvas photos of random people everywhere. We asked the waiter who they were and he said it was family photos of the owner. Which is cool!  We each ordered a glass of wine. I had the peperadelle pasta and my husband had the bolognese. Our dishes were very sub par. They weren't bad, but they weren't good either. It felt like Olive Garden quality. Overall, we had an ok experience, but it was mediocre food.
We went there 8/19/19.  The service was good, but the food was bland.  They offered to make something else or give us some seasonings, we chose to add some seasonings.

Not the LaScala's it used to be. At one time, it was a go-to restaurant for me. The atmosphere, food, and service was great. Now, I'm giving 1 star for service, and 1 star for the apps. What's good... the service. Our waiter was Kenardi, and LaScala's is lucky to have him. He's the only reason the experience didn't end up being a disaster. He's very attentive and friendly. The food... The bread and oil dip is excellent. The appetizers we had was pretty good (White Pear Pizza, especially ) and Im glad because we sent back 2 entrees. Both were chicken pasta dishes. The chicken was literally boiled in water and thrown on top of noodles, it was absolutely flavorless, the sauce was just as bad... it was like eating cardboard topped with chalk. Both dishes were really terrible. I couldn't even dress it up. Use the seasoning rack, dammit! The atmosphere is confusing. They have candles lit on all the tables, but what mood is that setting when your customers under lights bright enough for a broadway show. Also, they don't pay attention to seating. The restaurant was pretty empty, so sitting adult parties next a table with 3 screaming kids wasn't very thoughtful. I think it's unfortunate the way LaScala's has changed. It's not hard to get it right, you just have to pay attention, and put the effort in. Prior to this visit, it has been a long time. I'm not gonna say I'll never go back, because I'm really hoping this was just a bad night, and I can still count on one of my old favorite restaurants. We'll see.
We went on Easter Sunday. We had drinks at the bar before dinner. The food was very good and the service was also attentive.

I was greeted by the manager at the door with, "What can I do for ya, Buddy?" When I told him I was there to eat, he seemed displeased with that.

The stuffed long-hots were great. The veal Marsala was good. The espresso was good too. My server was polite and efficient.

Over all, it was an unfortunate experience.

reviews.text: Pizza place on a college campus. They are used to doing high volume. Over the years, I've gotten the tomato pie and regular pizza. They make a party size one, which is a monster size. They also have take out beers and such. It's a nice addition for a pizza joint.

if you're black or if you're white n care about black people i'd avoid this place. a black woman in front of me in line was ignored and the person serving tried to literally go around her to serve me. also they kicked a black man out who was simply waiting for his order and chatting w another customer. the owner came over and told him to stop disrespecting folks and the people who he was talking to literally said he's not disrespecting them but the owner kicked him out anyhow

This is definitely the quickest pizza order. Great quality. Delivery is fast and they even sell fruit cups and other goodies inside. Please don't overlook them for the bad reviews. I've had an excellent experience. Very consistent.

Food safety seems to be a big problem for them. Ordered a Sicilian pizza only to have it delivered raw an hour later. Called back, and they said they'd send a new one, which showed up burnt on the edges, and raw in the middle, again. We tried to see if we could revive it in our own oven, but no luck. For $25, it was pretty disappointing. The other food we ordered was sub par, and we all ended up sick from it. Avoid at all costs.

I was trying to support a small business, but don't waste your time ordering pizza. I asked for vegetarian slice and a extra cheese slice. This is the foolery I received. I could've slapped Kraft cheese and peppers on my own pizza instead of paying for this to be delivered.

Really awful service at this restaurant. I have been coming here a while but had another bad experience. 

I ordered a burger last week around 10:30 pm. Cashier said it would be 5 minutes or so. After 10 minutes, I asked someone else and they said it would be 7-10 minutes. I did not receive my food until 11:15 and when I had gotten home the burger was dry and the bun was *burnt*. I guess those 40 minutes were just spent grilling a patty into a tough sponge. 

Don't come here unless you being drunk and eating bad food and/or wasting your money.
Garbage food and no regard for Covid. At least the service is horrible! This place is the pits.

Absolutely not following COV19 guidelines. Beware! I just left  this poorly managed establishment and one cashier and one guy making pizza had on mask. Only after several students came in did the manager/owner put on a mask. One guy in the back cooking had no mask on a girl sweeping the floor had no mask on. No one took control of the overcrowded waiting area as one guy came in with his T shirt pulled up. So student cause the employees to wear mask not regular folks?!?!

My go to place to pick up something quick and delicious (pizza and cheesesteaks) on my way home from work! Pepperoni pizza is always a hit with my family. My favorite is white w/ garlic, spinach and grilled chicken.
Food was  completely saturated in ranch from my "side salad" ... maybe package separately next tim

Just got off the phone with a "manager" who was incredibly rude about a delivery order I placed over 2 hours ago. The order never showed up, although we called 30 minutes ago and was told it was "on the way" The manager explained that there was a mistake in the restaurant and the Grubhub order was never rung in the system and that they will cancel the order. When I asked if I would be compensated for their mess up, and told him we were still hungry and waiting for our food, he told me there is nothing he can do and they don't give out free food. I told him they are losing a customer and he didn't seem to care! Will never order from them again.

This place has great pizza! If you're looking for something quick and cheap, then this is the place. Compared to the surrounding pizza joints, I prefer Allegros. They also have unique toppings that live up to my expectations. Although it gets super busy on the weekends, it is very clean inside. The times I've been there, there is staff constantly wiping down the tables.
I'm not sure if this is under new ownership but it's totally disorganized. I ordered ahead 30 minutes and they weren't ready 45 minutes later. I'll be finding a new local pizzeria

I probably won't be ordering from allegro again. I got it delivered through grub hub and they forgot my drink, the pizza was dry and cardboardy, the Mac and cheese is literally just penne and cheez wiz, and there was no mayo on my cheesesteak even tho I asked for it. The soup was ok though.

Only giving Allegro's 2stars for the simple fact they stopped delivering pass 49th street in Southwest which is corny cause they use to back in like up to '12. Guess because it's rougher down towards this end they loss their heart to come pass 49th street. When they started that they even use to put you on hold and ask in the background "do we deliver there"? Come back and say "No".

  It's cool though cause I drive anywhere If the food is worth it but them they fell off anyway over the years rushing and trying to appeal to the University of Penn students. So I mean it is what it is but quality wise over the most recent years, they still ain't that great either and I know cause I use to order pickup like I said they lost their touch.

I don't always find myself up in West Philly, but when I do I always end up at Allegro! They're open late night and even open at 11 AM with a full selection of regular and gourmet pizza. This place has a decent beer selection and a wide variety of pizzas. I am always happy when I walk out and I always know where to go next time I am in West Philly.

Avoid this place.  The pineapple on the hawaiian pizza had obviously gone bad, and the people working here are not very bright.  Messed up order and tried to blame on the customer.  Also doesn't look like a very organized or clean kitchen.

It's an average pizza place. I used to get food from here a lot when I worked night shift. Their hours are very convenient.since switching to day shift I haven't order from here as often due to other options. They sell more than just pizza. Their delivery tends to arrive in good timing. If I ever go back to night shift I could see myself ordering from here more.
I guess this is a pretty average pizza spot, they have what you'd expect and some other random things. decent selection of beer too
Pretty good food. We ordered delivery and got Mac and cheese, motz sticks, pizza, and a turkey panini. Everything was pretty good, and the kids really liked the Mac and cheese.

I gave them four stars because this establishment is very transparent in what you get: a college student centered, late night pizza. The cheese pizza was pretty good, a little undercooked, but again this place serves its purpose. Cheap and pretty good.

With three stars, it might seem like this will be a bad review, but I actually love and regularly order Allegro pizza - it's just important to have the right expectations going in. Allegro is good for "college pizza" - late night, not-much-else-is-open, dependable kind of pizza. I usually get a large cheese, and every single time have had to re-cook it in my oven at home because the dough is still soft. Once re-cooked, it's great! They're really generous with the cheese, and the crust is thin without being insubstantial. So if you want some solid late-night pizza, and don't mind the extra 10 min of recooking, Allegro is a good choice.

Allegro pizza!!! This is definitely the place to go if you want shitty pizza and shitty service. They have the worst pizza and service ever. Please save your money and go somewhere else. They are not worthy of my one star that I have to give on my review.

Oh Allegro. I've had it so many times that at this point, I can recognize the smell of it from anywhere. The pizza itself is so oily that you can use 1-2 napkins to wipe it off beforehand. It looks and tastes like it was designed for drunk college students to munch on after a long night. Don't come here if you don't have a good reason to.

Ordered delivery for two pizzas and a side of mozzarella sticks. One large 16 inch bbq pizza and one regular 14 inch veg pizza. Received a wrong sized pie. Called the restaurant immediately to see if they could correct the mistake. Gentleman by the name of Valentino claimed to be the manager for "5yrs without a problem"  cursed me out and hung up on me after I asked him for his name repeatedly and if he could correct the mistake. Contacted grubhub's customer care service and I was told by Grubhub the restaurant would not send the correct item and that at the moment they were not able to refund me at that I would be contacted by via email. My order was 59dollars. They took my money, got my order wrong, refused to correct their mistake, cursed at me, and hung up on me. I will be pursuing my refund. Allegro's you can expect to hear from in the immediate future.
