reviews.text: Great restaurant! Good food, great service, nice ambiance. Mark was our server and he was spot in! Definitely will come back

The best Italian food! I took my daughter to eat here while she was home from college for the holidays She is a very picky eater but she loved everything we ordered.  We started with rice balls, then had meatballs, and filet of halibut and salmon.  My mouth is watering as I write this review.  They are BYOB which is great.  I will definitely be returning when I am in the local area!

I visited Scannicchio's Sunday afternoon Nov.14 we were a party of 5, our waitress was  Nikai this was her first week, I must say she did a fantastic job, everything was as ordered, even though my sister wanted to create her own dish, which Nikai had no problem with , it came out just the way she wanted it, although Scannicchio's never disappoints in food or in service...this is a place we visit frequently & will continue to do so...
Nikai is certainly an asset, she is pleasant & personable. & 6

Yes 5 stars. Excellent from the house salad to the escarole and beans. We both had chicken dishes which were excellent as was the penne and gravy. More food than we could eat. Glad I messed up on my flight arrangements so we could try this place. Will go back.
Great little spot on Broad St! BYOB restaurant with huge potions and the food is always amazing. The chicken parm is massive. Vodka sauce has great flavor. Family run place with a great vibe.

The other half of the story from my L'Angelo's review - several years ago I was going out on a date and walked into this place several hours before closing. It was right in the middle of dinner hour, actually, and the dinning hall was pack. We were immediately told by the host that the kitchen was closed. It was then, looking around at the sea of White faces who all stopped eating to stare at us, that we realized why we had that awkward experience down the street - they didn't want to serve us because we were Black. It was weird to experience such ugly and open racism right on Broad Street, but here we are, part of a long lineage of Black folks getting denied dinners at restaurants throughout the decades. Hopefully my kids never have to endure something like that.

Absolutely delicious. Amazing service and great people. This place is byob which is a huge plus. Not to mention the food is amazing. Calamari amazing. Arranchini amazing. Tortellini Alfredo amazing. Penna vodka AMAZING !!  Don't waste your time going to any other Italian restaurant in this City. If you can get a reservation here BOOK IT!!!

We've been going to Scannichio's forever. My family celebrates every functions here. The food is fabulous. So is the service. I would definitely recommend Scannichio's over any Italian restaurant in the South Philadelphia area. There covid menu is great and very accommodating. I can't wait to dine in again.
Had another Wonderful dinner! Meatball appetizer was yummy! Gnocchi special with shrimp in pesto sauce was perfect!!! Can't wait to return

Wow I love this spot! In my opinion best Italian in Philly. Dined here this weekend and had such a perfect experience and unforgettable food! Service is efficient and welcoming. You can tell its a family ran place and that makes me feel at home! Come for the food...come back for the experience!

This place is a hidden gem. A must go even if you're in philly for the day. The pasta is fresh and the sauce is tasty. The fried meatballs were good. The clams casino were really nice.  Lobster ravioli was amazing.  Shrimp scampi and risotto was really tasty and light though not what I expected as I was hoping for a more garlicky fish but it was delicious.  You will not be disappointed. It's a local favorite and byob.

Excellent from the moment I made the reservation until I paid my bill.  Very accommodating and observing all the Covid rules for outside dining.  Service was very friendly and paced very well.  The food was excellent.  My special eggplant stack appetizer was delicious as was the fried meatballs and the scungilli  diavolo.  My special salmon with the lightest tomato sauce with crabmeat was cooked to perfection.  The restaurant is a byob.  The staff surprised us with dessert and a refreshing drink when we were done.  Great evening out.  Can't wait until we can return for in restaurant dining.

This was my family's first dining out experience after restrictions were lifted some what in Philadelphia and we could not have chose a better place! Our outside dining experience was excellent and the food was outstanding. The staff was very attentive and welcoming, they treated us like family. Large portions and great tasting food. The Gnocchi was excellent and I love there clams casino. This was our second time there and it definitely won't be our last. And also, big shot out to Lori our server who was as friendly as they come. Thank you Scannicchio's for a great time.
Authentic, consistently good, and some of the best food in south Philly! I love the artichokes and the veal parm is huge!

We ordered off the special quarantine family menu. We got chicken parm and meatballs. It came with a huge salad and bread. Everything was wrapped and sealed nicely so there were no leaks or messes when I got home. They quickly and safely handed off my food. The food itself was phenomenal!! Plenty of everything to satisfy us all.

One of my go-to's for classic Italian food done right!  Some of my favorite dishes include the calamari Sicilian, eggplant tower, grilled romaine salad, eggplant or chicken parm, penne vodka, pumpkin ravioli, sweet potato gnocchis.  Their crab cake is my favorite -- served over sautéed spinach and vodka sauce.  I'm getting hungry just naming the things I love at Scannichios.  Some of these are specials and some are staples, but you can always ask the staff for recommendations as well!  Save room for dessert (I suggest the italian iced cream sandwich with Nutella and hazelnut gelato.).  I saw a negative review from a girl with celiac and honestly that's wild, I have a good friend w celiac and she wouldn't even consider eating at a restaurant unless they could guarantee no cross contamination of gluten (nearly impossible for an Italian restaurant that has been running since before celiac was a thing).  Soooo I guess i would say I would not recommend for celiacs or for vegans.
My family & I have ate here on many different occasions, birthdays, family celebrations, etc. Great food + amazing customer service every time! Would definitely recommend!

Old school Philadelphia. One of the waiters (I'm assuming he was the manager or owner) was walking around in Eagles pajamas, this was at around 9pm on a Friday night. I was here for a special event, so we had a prix fix menu, and I didn't pay, so can't comment on the price. I will say that this restaurant could be used in a movie made by Martin Scorsese if he ever does one based in Philly. It has the small, cramped, old-school, Italian, family owed vibe. The atmosphere makes you feel like you are really in Little Italy in Philly.

I didn't find the food anything special. Everything tasted pretty deep fried, and didn't have that much flavor. The Chicken Parmesan was a nice size (again, tough to say if this is the regular portion size or what because it was a special event), but the flavor just tasted kinda whatever. The Penne ala Vodka just didn't have much taste; the sauce was watered down, and the pasta just was bland. Same goes with the multitude of appetizers we had, nothing really stood out in a positive way. The bread with the sauces and oils they had was pretty tasty.

While I had an absolute wonderful time at the event, the food just wasn't for me.

Food (C), Pricing (N/A), Atmosphere (B-), Service (B-)

Had my husband's 60th Birthday and it was Fantastico!  Mike and Sandy didn't miss a beat, and the food was crazy good!  Yes we are from California and we love to go there anytime we are in Philadelphia!!!

I absolutely loved my time here. Our waitress Kelly, was a joy with a wonderful personality. I'm amazed at how she keeps the daily specials stored in her brain! Everything was so flavorful, the atmosphere is very intimate. Perfect for date night or hanging with family. BYOB. Reservations are strongly encouraged considering the small place fills up rather quickly.

BYOB restaurant in South Philly. I liked my gnocchi al forno, but didn't love the stuffed artichoke we had. Food wasn't super quick to come out after we ordered, but they were pretty busy.

 I have to say the 3 star review is more related to our waiter than the food or rest of our experience. The women who were working told us we could put in appetizer orders right away (normal, right? Appetizers is how you start the meal, why not put those in first?). But the waiter (Mark?) was adamant that entres and appetizers had to be in at the same time. Ultimately that negatively affects the restaurant because we ordered less food... 

Overall, an OK experience. Not amazing, not terrible, just OK.

After many years of passing by, we finally tried this place! It was delicious and we will definitely go back.

The restaurant has an adorable ambience and the service was great.

Not many places in my neighborhood are open on Monday, so it was nice to be able to go.

We ordered the eggplant caprese appetizer, Caesar salad, veal chop special, and the veal piccata. Everything was fantastic! The Caesar salad was the only dish I wouldn't get again. It was still good, but I would try a different salad. 

The service was wonderful and we will definitely go back!

Words cannot describe how good this is. By far my favorite place in south Philly. They treat you like family and each every dish is thoughtfully prepared. 
Tell em the "other cousin Vinny" sent you!

It was fine.  Going to Elton John concert, close to that.  BYOB is a plus.   Friendly bustling place on a Friday night, average service and average food.  It was all good but never thought about "best ever" or great.

We had medium expectations and they were met.
One of the best Italian restaurants in Philly. Between the service and the menu, you can not go wrong

business.name: Nomad Roman Pizza

business.categories: Restaurants, Bars, Wine Bars, Italian, Pizza, Nightlife

reviews.text:
Been here a few times but it was my first time on a Tuesday which was great with the BOGO deal for pizzas. Favorite one is the truffle pizza. The spicy sausage is good meat option too. Fungi is on the special menu which is okay but I would just order an extra truffle. 

Good service.

Swung by here on a Saturday night and got a table for two with no wait. 

We were originally going to get an app and pizza but no apps called our names so got two pizzas. Managed to eat a pizza each. To be fair though, very very thin crust. The crust was nice and chewy though with crispy edges. Came out in less than 10 minutes. 

The quattro formaggi was great, with just the right amount of onion that gave a hint of sweetness. We also got the arugula which was great... nice freshness to the greens. 

The place was pretty packed by the later evening and tables so close that every time a waitress or waiter came through, had to hold onto our water glasses, so definitely not a fancy place. Cute though. Variety of pizzas, including a couple vegan options.

I've been coming to Nomads for a few years now and their pizza is consistently amazing  My favorite is the Trenton Tomato which consists of a white sauce, fresh basil, mozzarella and tomatoes, it's delic guys and gals, you won't be disappointed! 
However, their drink selection leaves a lot to be desired with limited craft beers, wines and cocktails to choice from. Overall it's a good experience because the pizza more than makes up for the alcohol selection. I'm mad about Nomads!

I went here with a group of about 15 coworkers on a weeknight.  My boss made a reservation and they were ready when we got there.  We did show up a couple of minutes late.  Nomad Roma was easy to find for a bunch of out of towners.  Our dinner was reserved for 5:30 PM, so we arrived during happy hour.  The happy hour menu was great for individuals and our group.  It looked like most people ordered a personal pizza, or there were a few people who split a specialty pie.  I ordered a marghertia personal pie and did not remain full for most of the evening.  The pizza had extremely thin crust, it was basically non-existent. I guess they are known for having thin crust, but thin was seriously an understatement.  The service was great and they allowed us to linger for a while when we finished eating.  I really was not a fan of the pizza otherwise I would have rated 4 stars instead of 3.

Had a reservation for a Sunday night at 5pm. We showed up 10 minutes early and we were immediately seated. The service was so quick - we had food on the table by 5:08. I checked the time because of how quickly it came! 

We ordered the arancini, a salad and a pizza. The salad was delicious. We loved the arancini. The pizza was plenty for two people to share.

I heard that Nomad does buy one get one pizzas on Tuesdays, so I got a group of four together and made a reservation for Tuesday night. We ordered four pizzas (for the price of two) and had leftovers! We tried the Margherita Di Bufala, Arugula Con Prosciutto, Spicy Sopressata, and Quattro Formaggi. All were delicious, but my favorites had to be the Quattro Formaggi and the Spicy Sopressata. I typically do not like spicy foods, however the honey paired with the spice was delicious.

This is a great spot and if you want to try it, I'd recommend going on a Tuesday and making a reservation. The restaurant filled up quickly! There is also bar seating available, so you could always give that a try!

If you are a fan of deliciously thin and crispy pizza crusts (as I am), this is the place for you. The sauce and toppings were super fresh and flavorful. The service was great; attentive, but not intrusive. As a bonus, the location is just a short walk from venues in the Avenue of the Arts area. Great for a pre-show or post-show meal.

Went here on a Saturday night with a bunch of friends. Surpringsly was not too crowded, and we didn't have to wait too long for a table of four. We decided to do family style and just share a bunch of starters/entrees. We ordered three items - Cacio de Pepe (which was on their specials), Margherita pizza and Spicy Sausage pizza. All three were really good and the perfect amount of food for four people. The spicy sausage pizza had a good kick to it as well. 

The ambiance of this place is really nice and our waiter was nice as well. We were able to try a couple wines before ordering the ones we wanted. If you're planning to drive in, plan some time for parking because it may be a little difficult to find parking, especially on the weekend. Overall, great restaurant with great food. Would recommend if you're looking for good pizza/pasta!

I recently went to Nomad Pizza for dinner and had a great experience. Pizza was great, service was great, and the restaurant had a nice vibe. All the ingredients for a memorable experience. I will definitely be back when I have a hankering for pizza in Philadelphia.

Quick review:
Yesss this place is a delish casual place to grab dinner with friends!

10/10 for the crispy thin crust pizza my friend and I devoured! We decided to try the arugula prosciutto pizza. ***Note, this place does medium size pizzas and considering they're thin crust, I think it'd be pretty easy to eat one by yourself heheh. However, my friend and I were in the mood to share a pizza and try an app! We didn't exactly want the same things and tried to do half and half which apparently is not something they attempt here! However if you want to remove a topping off one side or add another they seem flexible to it. I will definitely be back for this yummy pizza..

Now to the part I didn't love...

5/10 for the bistro salad! This app seemed action packed with fruit/avocado on butter lettuce with a ball of fried goat cheese.. all the elements were there but somehow it just was a little sad. Literally 4 pieces of butter lettuce spread across the plate with some toppings but somehow it comes to $10... skeptical. I'll be sticking to pizza in the future

My husband and I were staying near center city and decided to try Nomad's on a Saturday night. We didn't have a reservation, but thought we would just walk there and see if we could eat. The hostess gave us in our opinion the best seat in the house, a little table right next to the open window wall. She told us we needed to be done in 45 minutes because that's when the next reservation for that table began. We tend to eat fast, so that was no problem for us! This place is very small and cozy, with dim lighting. It's a nice date spot! Our waitress was great to begin with, but forgot about us after our food was brought out. We decided to order 2 pizzas and share them. My husband ordered the spicy sausage and had the caramelized onions omitted on his half. I ordered the spicy soppressata and he asked for the honey to be omitted on his half. I appreciate them allowing you to make small alterations, and not pulling the "chef created this to perfection" card. Each pizza was $17, which seems about right for the quality and charm of the place! Our pizza was brought out in under 10 minutes! A food runner brought the pizza, not our waitress and we were out of water and it was clear after 6-7 minutes she wasn't coming back anytime soon, so we had to ask another waitress for a water refill. She must have told our waitress because she cane back with water and apologized. After she apologized, we were fine, didn't hold a grudge. Our pizza was so delicious! The pepperoni was so crispy and paired perfectly with the honey! My husband's sausage pizza was also very good! I felt like it was missing acidic and textural elements though. It needed a little lemon or vinegar and something on top for a little crunch. But overall, very excellent! We finished in about 35 minutes and we're just waiting for our waitress to come back so we could ask for a box and the check. She finally came back after another 7 minutes. We were getting nervous because we didn't want to screw over the hostess who let us take the table. When she brought the bill we had our card out and ready for her to take. By the time she brought it back, we had gone over the 45 minutes. There aren't very many tables, this place is very small and they seemed to have a handful of waitress/waiters in addition to food runners, so we're not sure what caused our waitress to be aloof after we ordered. Anyway, food is very excellent! The place is super cute! I highly recommend this place!

The service was okay. The first server was awkward, broke a glass as we walked in. The other server who sat us was a bit standoff-ish. We ordered from the late night menu 10-11pm. Happy hour drinks consisted of red or white wine, selected beer or cocktails. We ordered the two wines however were not informed or asked what the wines were? But I guess that was ok since it was late. The table was wobbly thus the water vase on the table was close to tilting over during the duration of our meal. The pizza was good: taste-wise and cooked well. Not worth the $16, thank goodness we paid happy hour pricing. Giving a 4 because the pizza was good but overly priced / cold service

Ok. Check this out. They have a for real wood fired brick oven. The pizza comes out quickly. And perfect!  We had the spices sausage pizza. The layers of flavors are amazing. The crust?  Faggotitaboutit!  I loved it. 
Wait staff was good and knowledgeable but not smothering. I want to eat lunch here tomorrow!  
The red wine was good on the happy hour. 
So go if you want. But if you eat a bad meal somewhere else that is on you!

Nomad Roman is a true GEM. I kick myself every time I get pizza in Philly and it's not from here! I've probably been here ~10 times over the past 3 years and I continue to love it each time I visit.

Their best deals are their HH (regular hours AND late night on the weekends) as well as their 2-for-1 pizzas on Tuesdays (they include automatic tip on the non-discounted amount, fyi). They have standard options (e.g., Margarita) that are enhanced by their scrumptious thin crusts. I am a personal fan of their honey sopressata (hot and spicy with honey-y goodness). I could probably eat one of their personal HH-size pizzas by themselves given how thin the crusts are, but at $6/each, it's a steal anyways.

I've been here with small and large groups and the service is usually great! They take reservations, so a good option if you're looking for a team meal. 

Come here if you're craving thin-crust pizza, you're looking for a bomb HH deal, or you're in the neighborhood. You probably won't regret it!

Great happy hour prices and the service was good until we wanted to pay. $6 personal pies for HH and they were just meh. The margherita came out less than 5 minutes since we ordered and was obviously not made to order, at least not for our table. Luke warm and lacking flavor. 
The marinara pie was a little better. 

Very thin pies with not a lot a flavor. We won't be returning.

Went out to brunch and the wait was too long elsewhere, so me and my boyfriend decided to check out this cute pizza boutique! I usually get too excited about eating to catch pictures but this time I was able to capture it all.   The decor is handpainted by a local artist. The music and vibe is dope! We started with two apps, the fried seasonal veggies and the grilled Caesar! 10 toes up! It was boyfriend's first warm salad and he LOVED IT! He almost didn't let me try it! And the veggies,OH MY! WE HATE sweet potatoes but it's something about how they fried them and the aioli on the side just sealed the deal! We had like 4 cocktails. Two Tito's mules to start and then we jumped into the paper plane and the Margarita!!! Our server/bartender ZACH WAS spot on! Those drinks definitely made for an interesting afternoon on the town lol. I don't eat pork so I ordered their truffle pizza..my only complaint is that i would have liked for something tart or acidic to cut the richness of the all the cheeses on it. My boyfriend ordered the soppressata pizza and only left ONE slice. Everything was timely, hot and delicious!!!! We WILL be back!!! Might be a new little hangout

It seems like every restaurant in this neighborhood of Philly serves fancy pizza but we were very happy we ended up here. The restaurant is nice and not pretentious. Service was good and pizza was great. Prices were reasonable.

I LOVE this place! Eat here whenever I can. The staff is lovely, the food and drinks are great and the vibe is relaxing and the prices are good. I enjoyed every dish I have eaten here. Go alone or go with friends, you'll have a good time and you'll eat well.

Nomad pizza was a really nice little spot in south Philadelphia. Everyone working was nice, there was no wait and it wasn't too crowded. We ordered two pizzas and they were both delicious. We had the Truffle Pecorino and the Arugula pizzas. When we ordered drinks there was some confusion with what they still had on tap so two of the beers we ordered were not available. They were super nice about it and covered the cost of my beer. The vermouth drink my sister had was great, the mojito was not amazing, it tasted pre-made and with not much mint added. Other than that we had a great experience !

The tuesday special buy one get one free pizza is amazing!! The only negative is the pizzas are very thin crust (not very filling) so it's a bit pricey if you aren't going on Tuesday.

Also the blue cheese salad we got was awesome
Food was decent but waiter was extremely rude. As a former waitress I was shocked at how he spoke to people at my table. The owners should be much more careful in who they hire.

About 2 years ago, this restaurant was highly recommended and so I finally got a chance to dine here and I was not impressed. I absolutely love pizza and I love crust and the depth varies, but when you get pizza where the crust is non existent and so thin and crunchy it resembles a cracker, that's when I have problem. 
Perusing the menu, options like eggplant parmesan and truffle pecorino stand out and sound amazing until you get them and the toppings are so thick they just about fall through the crust, making for a sloppy mess. I love arancini balls, but the prosciutto should be inside the ball, not lying on top and I am also a huge fan of veggies, specifically cauliflower and mushrooms...they were lukewarm and I really do not have any words for this dish.
Now, if you are on a budget, they offer a handful of pizzas during their happy hour for $6 each and for the price, it is worth it.
This pizza was amazing If your looking for great thin crust pizza then this is absolutely the place to go

I went for the first time this weekend and it was delicious! A friend and I split a hurrays salad and the spicy sopressata pizza. Plenty of meat on there as well a nice crunchy, thin crust. The service was great. The waiter was attentive and our food came out pretty quickly.

Thin crust pizza was very good.  Sauce was excellent and the buffalo cheese was excellent as well.   The meatball appetizer was delicious.  They gave three small meatballs in sauce.  Would come back again.

Nomad is great for happy hour, especially with large groups. Came here the other day with a group of ~8 people, and they were able to take a reservation for us with no problem.
 They had a few pizzas on happy hour special special, all with thin and crispy crusts. I had the margarita, which was standard but flavorful. I also tried some of the tomato pie, which had a delicious tomato sauce. They had a variety of sausage-topped pizzas that seemed to be well-received by my friends. 
Docked one star because the prices have increased quite a bit for their happy hour specials (no longer $5 pizzas). But for the taste and convenience, Nomad is a great choice!

business.name: Little Nonna's

business.categories: Restaurants, Italian

reviews.text: These phenomenal Italian devours come all the way from Little Nonna's located in the center city area of Philadelphia. This small Italian restaurant is snuggled in between two businesses. They offer both indoor and outdoor dining.  They are very prompt with seating their guess who either has reservations or who doesn't have reservations. Once I got here I was seated properly by my server Connor. Connor was very knowledgeable of all the wines that were offered as well as the full menu. He introduced the special for the week which was the seven fishes special which was a three-course meal that introduced seven fish dishes. I was totally intrigued and I took him up on his offer. The feast is an annual 6 day long special menu (regular menu available as well). I ordered the red wine that was simply amazing. It was very smooth yet tight towards the end. The bathrooms are really clean, and they are well decorated with priceless pieces of art. The feast of the seven fishes consisted of the olive & smoke salmon crostone, the fried cod, the grilled octopus, the shrimp scampi with the baccala mash were all incredible. The code shrimp salad was simply amazing. While the grilled octopus was cooked to perfection. If you ever find yourself in Center City wanting some authentic Italian cuisine please check out little Nonnas and please tell them that SHIMMY sent you and ask for my good friend Connor!
Food was amazing, the Courtyard is where to sit for the perfect ambiance. Absolutely loved it!

Wasn't too happy with the chicken Al Mattone and the unnecessary food garnishing included in a separate container. Could've included a salad or some bread to make up for the overcooked chicken and Brussels sprouts.

Came here for Restaurant Week in fall 2021. The main pasta and desserts hit the spot. This Italian place is not one of those super super fancy restaurants but the more quaint, should I dare say more authentic Italian place. You should ask for one of their seatings in the patio inside the restaurant! Super romantic and great at night with the string lights overhead.

We didn't order spaghetti and meatballs but the table next to us ordered and it looked delicious (will probably order it the next time we go). 

The wild mushroom avacini was a ball of goodness, the warmth and the mushrooms all melted inside the fried outer was spectacular. Also got the rigatoni alla vodka.
Great tasting Italian food with a small menu of options to choose from. Staff is polite and helpful. Prices are reasonable.

I knew I was in for a treat when I saw the line outside. But lucky for us we didn't have to wait long until we got our table. Let me start off by saying the ambiance and atmosphere of this restaurant is homely and comfortable. It's perfect for a gathering with friends and family or a date with someone that you're getting to know. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs while my friend ordered the eggplant parmesan. Now as a meatball aficionado I will say that this was possibly one of the best meatballs and marinara sauce I've had in Philadelphia. My friend couldn't stop raving about the eggplant parmesan and both of us have promised ourselves that we will be returning on our next visit. At this price point I don't think that this restaurant can be beat by any of the surrounding Italian restaurants. Enjoy friends because we know we did.

I was looking forward to this place after seeing raving reviews but I was disappointed. The only good thing about this place was the ambiance. The waiter asked if we wanted garlic bread or regl bread with our meals so we assumed it came with it and wasn't an extra $5 since it wasn't mentioned. I had the chicken parmigiana which was pretty good but the sauce on the pasta was super sweet and disgusting.

Little Nonna's is one of the reasons why I think about Italian food whenever I visit Philadelphia. I visited Little Nonna's on a Friday evening after trekking through a rainstorm. I had reservations for 5:30 pm and got to sit in the covered back patio area. There were parts of the patio that weren't ultra rainproof, but most of it was. The space was very warm and cozy with lots of live plants decorating the space. Got the escarole and apple salad, wild mushroom arancini, and the Sunday gravy. Portion sizes were very generous, especially the Sunday gravy. The braided beef short rib in the Sunday gravy was so tender the meat basically fell apart without really having to chew it. The salad was refreshing and the apples added that extra sweetness and crunch amongst the leaves. Service was great, food was delicious. It's a shame that I can only eat so much for one meal. Looking forward to my next visit.

We got there an hour early and they were very gracious to accommodate us. Service was great. (6'5" server) Every dish was perfect: charcuterie board, meatballs, eggplant, Philly wedge, spags & mb, chicken parm, Sunday gravy, rigatoni vodka sauce!! Wine choices....perfect! Thank you, we'll be back!

Food and Service were both AMAZING! The garlic bread melts in your mouth. Spaghetti and meatballs an the chicken parmigiana were amazing! Order the cannolis, our daughter picked one up and gobbled it!!

Was visiting Philadelphia to celebrate a friend's birthday. We waited over two hours for a table and when they sat us outside (when the weather was in the 30°s), we asked for a covered table because I had stage lV cancer, a transplant  and was suffering from neuropathy. That I physically couldn't sit there ...they just told me 'sorry it didn't work out for you'. Both the waiter and the host had the same response. Even though they could have accommodated us at a different table they were so pretentious that they didn't care at all, to put it lightly.

This should be advertised as American-Italian restaurant, because our Italian counterparts would have a big problem with this place. Not authentic. The best part of my meal was my glass of wine that arrived AFTER my appetizer. My friend and I had Nonna's spaghetti and meatballs, and the chicken parm, both of which were SWIMMING in sauce. And not in a good way. There's no complimentary bread, so it's not like we were gonna sop up the acidic sauce either.

I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Not only was the ambiance great but the food and service was amazing. Their menu is limited however I can guarantee that they cook every mean they offer exceptionally well. If the weather is nice ask to be seated in the back patio you won't be disappointed. Make sure to order the garlic bread, I believe it's freshly made and seasoned so well. I ordered the Campanella Nero which is squid ink pasta with shrimp. The dish was seasoned perfectly, each ingredient was allowed to shine and I was left wanting more. My boyfriend ordered the Steak Tagliata, the steak was perfectly charred and the fingerling potatoes complimented the dish really well. Note this dish comes with mushrooms. Be sure to stop by if you're in the area. Also Philip was our waiter and was very attentive.

I just cried, tears down my face, because the tiramisu was so good. I have never had a good bring me to tears before. I got the tiramisu to go because I was so full from the giant portions! 

I got Nonni's Spaghetti & Meatballs and my fiance got the Sunday Gravy ... we were both blown away. First by how much food we got, but second how DELICIOUS it was. 

At first I was nervous the prices were a bit high, but rest assured it is worth every penny! We will definitely be back again!!! 

Helpful note: it's just as delicious the next day as left overs :)

If you're dining inside Little Nonna recently, you will find that it is an intimate dinning experience. The perfect romantic space for a date. The reflection of the lights against the clear dividing wall between tables look like stars. On my recent visit, I had a wonderful time. The pasta was delicious  along with the yummy garlic bread which includes freshly roasted garlic that you can squeeze on top of the bread. I also enjoyed a nice sangria with the meal. What makes the whole evening even better was my date. He was just perfect.

They were very accommodating about reservations which was nice! The courtyard area was cute. 

We knew what app we wanted even before fully pulling up the menu online. We were told we had to order appetizers and entrées at the same time, since the kitchen was too busy. It looked like about 30% of indoor/outdoor/courtyard tables were full...but maybe they had a lot of carry outs. Little frustrating though for entrees to come out literally 5 minutes after appetizers. Couldn't enjoy the apps without entrees getting cold, and all crammed into the tiny table. 

Not the biggest deal, obviously, but enough to be a turnoff. The food was good, but with so many options in Philly, things like that tend to really distinguish restaurants.

Short and simple: The food here is amazing! Feels like a small mom & pop restaurant you'd find in Italy! Came here for Restaurant week and we were able to try a few of their pastas, and they were all amazing! The meatballs for the appetizer were absolutely delicious. Their tiramisu was also so fluffy and soft. Honestly, A+ to their food. We came rather early and booked a table, so not much of a wait. Server was knowledgeable on what they have, and also had recommendations regarding wine! We were also able to sit in their back outdoor seating area, which was a pleasantly surprising cute space. Definitely worth coming back!

Rating: 9.0/10
Pros: All their pastas
Cons: Not much.
Delicious. I had the cheese stuffed meatballs and they were FANTASTIC.

One the of best Italian places I've been to in a while. Wife and I sat in the back covered courtyard and it was a nice romantic meal with excellent service.

We ordered a bunch of items so the waiter recommended bringing certain things out a different intervals to create several courses, which worked nicely.

Started with creamy Stracciatella with olives and fresh warm bread. We followed this up with a tangy escarole/apple salad. One order of salad was plenty for two. 

Next up was a fantastic course of wild mushroom arancini and broccoli rabe with white beans. The four crispy rice balls had a lot of flavor. And the rabe had a nice garlicky flavor with a kick from the red pepper flakes. 

For dinner, my wife went with a good portion of branzino. She said it was nice and fluffy with perfect seasoning. 

I went for Nonna's Sunday sauce dinner. Pasta of the day was orrechiette. It came with the side of short rib, garlic sausage and their famous meatball. Portion was enough to take half home. Sauce really did remind you of eating at your grandma's house as a kid. Nice flavor. All the meats were delicious with the meatball standing out. 

We also did the garlic bread on the side. Hot toasted bread with a side of roasted garlic head to spread. 

Overall, this placed wowed with its food and service. Looking to try a new place in center city? This is a good pick.
Great atmosphere! Highly recommend the Sangria. Portions were pretty large so easy to share with friends. Staff was very warm and welcoming

Had carry out from here over quarantine and like many other Italian neighborhood favorites, this place got the job done. 

I know a lot of people might think ordering spaghetti and meatballs out at dinner is a faux pas, but this place is an exception. The spaghetti and meatballs are a must-try. I believe it was about $15-16 bucks. 

Would love to go back and try again in person! Until then, B+ 4 stars!

My wife and I had a great dining experience here. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. The food was pleasant and surprising while still maintaining a rustic Italian oeuvre. 

Italian food is almost always unsurprising. The margin between the best and worst Italian food is relatively narrow. For a restaurant to deliver four bites of familiar foods with an unfamiliar twist was a pleasant deviation from the status quo. 

The meatballs for example were standard from the outside, but with smokey and cured undertones. The chicken parm was crispy enough to handle the burrata and the fennel salad added a pleasant note. Even the house made sausage had nuance that I didn't expect.

Parking is aplenty nearby. The courtyard:garden area was lovely and intimate. A+ dining experience.

We came into town for my son's last treatment at CHOP.  I made a reservation for 5pm in the courtyard to celebrate with my 7yo, 7 month old, and husband.  We got there at 4:50pm.  My son was hot and wanted water, my daughter really wanted to nurse.  I just popped into the restaurant to ask if we could change our reservation from the courtyard to a sidewalk booth.  There was a hefty brunette woman who said they didn't have my reservation (I have a copy of it in my email) and that they maybe could sit us, but to come back in ten minutes.  She was not very nice about it.  My husband waited w my daughter standing outside the booth and I went and got my son a bottle of water around the corner.  They got us the sidewalk booth and asked us if we needed a high chair.  We said yes.  They never brought us one.  They did say that we couldn't have outside beverages, so away went the water.  The food was good.  But, we really did feel unwelcome.  I kept a smile on for my son.  And really wanted to show the lady my reservation in my email, but didn't.  Meh.  Next.  Philly where's the love?  Not here.
all of the food i've ever gotten from here has been so good! but the best was the tiramisu, i'm obsessed with it

Amazing Italian cuisine! From the bread service to the antipasto to the dinner, I was in heaven from start to finish.

I had the Sunday gravy, which is a delcious combination of the house gravy with sausage, meatballs and meat, served with a healthy bowl of pasta. It was one of the most delicious dishes I have ever had in my young life.

Nonna's will definitely be a require stop whenever I am in town.

business.name: Mondo Dei Dolci

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': True, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': False}

business.categories: Food, Bakeries, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text: We went when it was getting busy so it took a while for food to come out. The crepes are buckwheat flour which is different but overall was just okay. However a lot of nice tasty desserts. We tried to use the yelp offer for 15% off our order but they did not honor the offer. Overall it's a cozy place to stop by for dessert and coffee, I'm giving it 4 stars but it's more like 3.5.

Enjoyed this cafe. The decor was pleasant and relaxing. We indulged in 2 different crepes and ice cream bowl for the little one.

First, the ice cream is generously portioned... 3 big scoops and very cheap.

The nutella & banana crepe was tasty. A standard dessert done well.

The poached apple crepe was good, but would try something different next time. I guess I had imagined it would be more like apple pie filling (soft with cinnamon sugar) than harder pieces of apple. Good thing though it wasn't too sweet.

I really liked the crepes themselves, hard to describe the layers and consistency, just know they're tasty!

The cafe has many interesting desserts, cheat days beware!! :)

I stopped in here because it was next to my dentist office and I noticed it seemed to have opened recently. The interior design is pretty opulent, with a big chandelier and grand piano in the corner. It's definitely not what you expect when walking into a cafe located in a Northeast Philly strip mall. 

The desserts all looked amazing. So I choose a few to try. I got the Tiramisu, a few French style macaroons, and a couple little cakes. Everything was impeccably decorated. The macaroons were good. The cakes were very good. I would definitely try some other cakes from this bakery. I would also like to stop in and try their espresso, as it looked like they had all the right equipment to make a good European style cappuccino. The prices were also not super expensive, as you would expect from the look of the desserts. The to go packaging was pretty unique and had that higher end appeal. 

The staff was a little stand-off-ish. It seemed like a place that was more comfortable to for its regulars. But, I wouldn't let that deter me from trying it out.

Really unexpected place for the location. Super cute interior. Staff are friendly but speak little English so just be aware. Menu is pretty extensive. Foods decent, pricing is fair. Parking lot can be a little tricky.

Don't let the exterior fool you. Mondo Dei Dolci brings a wonderfully elegant taste to the northeast. Every bite of the pastries we had ordered was very flavorful, not overly sweet. I highly suggest stopping by and getting a couple things! Will be back again to try the rest of the menu.

Mondo Dei Dolci is one of the very few pastry shops in NE Philly. Let me clarify "very few". Of course there are plenty of bakeries in NE Philly. But there aren't enough delicate pastries eatery, where I can buy and enjoy my cakes inside. 

Location wise, not bad. It sits on the bustling bustleton ave. along with few other retailers. It does have a parking lot but spaces are very limited due to being small. We can agree is still better than paid or meter parking. 

Mondo Dei Dolci's pastries changes daily. So if you ever favor a cake, call to ask before going as they might not have specific ones on the menu that day. So far, we try opera, red velvet, tiramisu, macarons, cookies and cream, bird milk soufle, carrot cake, triton etc.... Our favorite is Cookies and Cream. Of course it doesn't look pretty but it tastes really creamy. The rest meh, we didn't like the taste, like some taste funny. For example, whatever they put in the carrot cake, it alter it's flavor quite a bit. 

They also carry a dine in menu. We finally have time to sit in and enjoy this time. I find out they have meat and sweet breakfast items. Variety flavors of smoothies and milkshakes. Also hot tea and caffeinated drinks. We tried 4 milkshakes that day: Mango, Strawberry, Banana, and Blueberry. We all loved the Strawberry, Banana and Blueberry. Mango MS not my favorite.

My friend and I really wanted crepes and this place was the only place open late so we decided to go here. They advertise that they are open until 11 pm we arrived at 9:30 pm. Stood in line to tell the woman our orders she told us to have a seat. We waited for about half an hour waiting for her to come take our order then we decided to walk back up to her she said she was busy (there was one other table there with 6 people on it) it was about 10 pm at this time. We asked for two crepes and two coffees she she doesn't have time to do the crepes for us. The place closes at 11 and she said she had 3 other crepes in the que for her to do. 
We just left even though they close at 11 she stopped taking orders at 10. She didn't say she was sorry at all and gave my friend and I a really bad attitude problem. Even if the crepes are good I will never go back and try it because of the rude service we received.
Cutest little bakery in the Northeast! The carrot cake was scrumptious! Need to go back and try their crepes.

Not sure about this one Jack. The older lady behind the counter did not make us feel welcome,however the younger one was the exact opposite. The deserts tasted pretty good. Ditch the attitude lady you need other customers besides your own kind.

We wanted a sweet treat on a Sunday afternoon and stopped in at Mondo Dei Dolci. The place is gorgeous inside and very cozy. We did have to wait a bit just because the person behind the counter was helping a lot of people and was by herself. We tried 4 different pastries: an Oreo cake, a Red velvet, and I cannot remember the name of the other two. They were all excellent, though the Red Velvet was a bit dried out. We also got a hot chocolate because they weren't selling any cold coffees. We will definitely go back! Only giving 4 stars because we were told they do not accept the Yelp discount :(

Beautiful cozy place, relaxing atmosphere.
Great latte, delicious cakes. 
Perfect place to spend some time with friends and family.

I have no words describe this place but perfect ! Foods amazing, environment is cute and friendly and the prices arents as bad as I thought for a fancy cafe like this. Definitely recommend it. Cute for dates and stuff !!
I really enjoyed the breakfast blueberry cheesecake waffles and caramel latte. The service was great and the place had a cozy yet classy ambience. I highly recommend this cafe

Its over the top fancy with a giant chandelier and crazy chairs. Its on the high end of fancy for what I'm looking for in a coffee shop but I prefer that over some of the cafeteria coffee shops popping up.

Had the cheesecake which was very good. Huge selection of sweets in the display window. And our cappuccinos were excellent.

Great spot for a coffee and to chill out.
Love the place and my uploaded photos express my review ..went on Tuesday and definitely taking my besties to day to enjoy a delicious coffee

I enjoy sweets, but not ones that are too sugary. I'd rather have flavor over a large amount of sweetness. Sometimes that is hard to find. Mondo Dei Dolci has very beautiful pastries that fit that bill. 

There is a wide selection of pastries ranging from classic French ones to Eastern European ones that I have never seen before. Most are priced between $3-$4. I got three different ones to go. While they were all delicious, my favorite was the Colombian, a rich chocolate mousse with a little creme center with a layer of almond cake underneath, and then the whole thing was coated with a thin dark chocolate shell. My second favorite was a round pastry coated with hazelnuts with a Russian sounding name. The inside was a dense hazelnut cake. It was not very sweet at all. The Paris Brest was not a bad choice either with a thick layer of praline cream sandwiched between two light round pastry layers. 

The total for those three pastries was $10.55. They also packaged them up nicely in a large take out container so we got them home in mint condition. The eat in area is really nice looking though, so this is definitely a place where you can relax and enjoy some coffee or tea and a nice pastry. If this place was closer, I think I'd go here every week. Be sure to visit if you're in the area!
This place is so pretty and SUCH a gem! All the desserts are amazing and coffee is great! They have crepes, tiramisu, cakes, sandwiches, and much more. Definitely coming back here again asap

So after lunch my wife and I were craving something sweet and stumbled upon this little cafe off of Bustleton Avenue and we were quite pleased. The place is called Mondo Dei Dolci and I'm pretty sure it's Eastern European/Russian and it was very very good. The menu is simple with lots of choices of various sandwiches, crepes, cakes, breakfast, lattes, and etc. My wife and I ended up ordering a few cakes and the smoked salmon Benedict and an Americano coffee. The inside of the cafe is really nice and the service is great as well. The place is very children friendly and although it's not the biggest place it's big enough having a few tables and some couches with pillows making it very comfortable. The prices were also very good and just a very clean, friendly, and delicious place with good prices. I will definitely be back when I have that sweet craving for desserts without a doubt.
Out of this world crepes.  Best desserts ever. I Only went for dessert but will return to sample some of the other menu items.  Nice place to go.
The desserts are crazy good, the carrot cake is to die for and be chocolate cheesecake is delicious. It's not that expensive for how fancy it looks from the inside. Everything seems homemade as well

I came across this cafe when I was searching for crepes on yelp. After viewing some photos, I really wanted to give it a try. I did enjoy my lunch there on my first visit. I would say if you have a craving for dessert, here is a place to be. The cafe looks pretty clean and comfortable. Desserts weren't bad. Worth another visit!
What a cute little discovery. Cappuccino was amazing. We came for coffee and cake but they have a variety from sandwiches to sundae

Beautiful place, what appeared to be beautiful desserts, but I guess they need a "too dark to serve" sign as people behind us were served, seated, and helped while we stood there waiting for someone to at least offer up a menu without us having to ask. 

There are other bakeries in the area, no sweat off my back (or my wallet ).

Beautiful looking with what looked like beautiful desserts.  I wouldn't know though because I'm Black, and we didn't even get spoken to.  Instead of seating us, they sat the couple behind us and pretended we weren't there.

This place has great food and great coffee. Pastries are out of this world. The people are always nice and willing to help you select the proper treat. You can't go wrong with anything in this place. Everything is good.

business.name: Starbucks
business.categories: Food, Coffee & Tea

reviews.text: I created this account just to write this review, Becca is the unfriendliest person I've ever met. She should never have a job where she would have to interact with anyone. Talked down to staff and customers. Never will I go back if she is working here.

This was the first Starbucks I have ever been to. I had no clue on how to order, so my friend helped me. Needless to say I've probably have had it 2 more times and never by myself because I still don't know how to order. I've never been big on coffee and I wanted to try it for the experience. I got a cold drink (can't remover what it was exactly). It taste good, more expensive than DD. The girl taking more order was helpful. I never knew there was so many different ways a coffee can come. It would be nice if they made a menu for occasional coffee drinkers. I feel like their seasonal drinks are easier to order.

Very ticked off.... drove around for 30+ minutes to find parking only to walk into Starbucks, only a few patrons. Ordered the Mango Dragonfruit drink only to be told it couldn't be made. When asking if the upstairs was crowded, was then told the upstairs was closed for "game night"??????

WHAT THE HECK IS GAME NIGHT?

Not even the courtesy of a sign posted on the door to share this information with the public. This is poor customer service for an establishment like Starbucks.
No decaf, no sugar in the raw or syrup, trash cans over flowing at 11am.  Didnt call when order was ready.  Not impressed.
The a.m. staff is my favorite. Super friendly people and good to see them every morning

I'm not sure why Starbucks gets so much bad publicity and poor reviews!  Guessing it's the sheer size and magnitude of a corporation and haters gonna hate.

Well, if you weren't surprised I love Starbucks and I'm a huge fan of founder and CEO Howard Schultz and the work and ethics that go into his company.

Imo the coffee is very good, the service is usually very friendly and astute and the app is a game changer. 

Being able to order ahead at a million locations and have your tasty beverage awaiting your arrival and skip the long lines is amazing! 

Also, you earn rewards towards future tasty beverages yay.

Also, Starbucks offers heavy cream as an option for those of us on low carb diets and also all natural, low carb sweetener.

Stop the madness and rate fairly please.

Thanks for stopping by :)

This Starbucks is awesome. Great place to warm up in and grab a wonderful drink in the south Street strip. The bathroom was very clean just make sure you grab the bathroom code from the staff so that you can get in. There is a ton of seating upstairs so do not mistaken the downstairs as the only thing lace to sit or you will miss out on the birds eye view of south street. It is a great spot to sit down and work from a laptop or to read a book. It is not too loud and there is quite a few places where you can get some juice for your laptop or your phone. It really is affordable to grab a coffee or tea as with Gold membership you get free refills and if you are not a gold member you still get free refills on tea or coffee for only $.50. I have been impressed with all their holiday drink recipes and the food is always fresh and they have seasonal options.

Really? In 2017, are we really denying pregnant women access to public restrooms? And at a Starbucks no less?

My wife is 30 weeks pregnant and was seeking relief after a fair amount of eating, drinking, and walking along South Street.

She walked into the Starbucks at around 8:00pm and asked for a venti cup of ice water and the restroom key. The barista (a white male) told her restrooms were for paying customers only. She showed her belly and explained that being pregnant she really needed to use the restroom and he told her there was nothing he could do because it was store policy.

My wife walked out visibly shaken and told me what happened. I walked in with her and asked for clarification about the store policy. I've never known any other Starbucks to do this. I was told by the same barista that there was nothing they could do and they reiterated the store policy, saying it was a "Philly Starbucks policy".

I told them that was ridiculous and asked if corporate was aware. Another employee (a white female) stepped up and told me that the reason they have this policy in place is because it is a "safety issue". My wife and I looked at her perplexed, so she continued explaining, saying that they let people use the bathroom and they end up shooting heroin and there's been an uptick in crime.

This made me livid... I asked if she really thinks my pregnant wife is coming in their bathroom to shoot heroin and she just kept repeating it's a safety issue.

Fed up, I said that I would be calling corporate to complain. She laughed and said I could go ahead and call corporate because they are the ones who made the policy and give them direction. I asked her for her name and she said she was not required to give it to me. I asked the other two employees and they also refused to give me their name saying they are not required to do so.

Frustrated, I said, that I would take a venti Cafe mocha and the restroom key. I figured policy aside, my wife needed to use the bathroom so I'll just buy something. The female employee said that she is choosing to refuse me service and that I need to leave the store or she would call the police.

Shocked by her brash reactions and the fact that the other two staff seemed to think this entire exchange was funny, I said this whole thing was crazy and headed out the door. As I was walking out, the female employee cursed at me saying, "have a great f'ing day". I walked back in and asked what she said and she kept threatening to call the police if I didn't leave. I took out my phone and snapped a picture of them (see attached).

I called corporate to complain about the situation and they indicated they would follow up with me. 

All in all, I am incredibly disappointed in this particular location and the workers here. They were rude, condescending, and took every opportunity to insult and demean us. And given that the three employees and the few customers in the store at the time were all white and we are black, l can't help but conclude that race played a factor here.

We spend entirely too much money on a daily basis at Starbucks to warrant this kind of treatment. And given their location on South Street (which gets busy at times), I can understand a customers-only policy, but they should consider expanding that to pregnant women and also people who are regular Starbucks customers. They should also evaluate individual circumstances and make informed, solutions-oriented decisions. 

Very disappointed. I look forward to a more detailed response from management/corporate.

This Starbucks is decent, not the best or worst I've been too. It's mostly clean considering how much foot traffic there is. The baristas are nice. There's extra seating upstairs, only one bathroom, which considering how large the Starbucks is - it stinks. My coffee was okay, nothing spectacular. I asked for lite ice but they didn't really give me lite. Overall it's convenient if you're in the area.
I went in here to order a beverage but the line was so long and the employee was moving at snail speed so I walked out. Will not be returning.

This Starbucks was a quick pit-stop on the way out of Philadelphia to head back to DC. Not only is this a gorgeous location if you're considering going for the wifi and to do work, but the employees here are quick and friendly. We were very happy with our experience here, and I'd absolutely go back the next time I'm in Philadelphia. 

Also, parking was easy. Let's be honest, in any major city parking has to factor into the rating of an establishment. Well, way to go this Starbucks! You're great with that. Street parking nearby, and we were leaving on a Monday morning at like 10. So there should have been lots of people trying to park, or so I'd expected. BUT the parking gods were on our side!

All in all, a beautiful and accessible Starbucks location in a fun, vibrant part of the city.

So today during my lunch break around 12:40 I went and joined my friend to walk her to Starbucks and she was ordering her ice coffee and we went to the end and got the coffee, and she tasted it and it was very bitter and had no milk and wasn't sweet enough so she's getting sugar so the barista says do you want more sweetener " it already has 6 pumps" and she didn't hear him so he's tapping his fingers on the coffee machine and while he was doing that he was like "take the lid off " tap tap tap "take the lid off" tap tap tap very inpatient and mind you there was only one other person waiting for a drink and Starbucks is usually so friendly I was in shocked like if you don't like your job find another one
Horrible customer service from a girl with short bleach blonde hair and piercings in her face. It was hard to even to even wait for my drink.

I wasn't going to write a review but this has happened a couple of times already.  By and large, the baristas here are really nice.  They always have my order ready and they are just generally great people.  But there is one European dude who is not nice at all.  And when he is working, my online order doesn't get filled and he is really indignant about it. I mean, I don't expect technology to be 100%, but when I tell you I ordered online and you scream "NO!"  like I'm lying, that is offensive.  Especially since I order here damn near everyday.

I still give the place 4 stars because it's overall great.  I live down the street so I can't comment on the bathroom, that seems to be a major theme here.
This place is ridiculous. You have to ask for a key to the restroom. Like a gas station. They might as well tear it down and build an Exxon. The coffee was the same quality.

Pretty good Starbucks despite the sometimes questionable location. I never know with south st..you either find a gem or you come across crazies.

The staff here are very nice in the mornings, so I can't vouch for the later times.
They're friendly and professional and the wait is not bad compared to other Starbucks locations. They also make my drinks right.
Parking is a hit or miss but in the mornings it's no problem !
Cashier was unenthusiastic and dull. Slightly rude. But they had the Philadelphia mugs which was a huge plus considering we only came into that Starbucks for the mugs.

At The Starbucks on 4th and South streets, the BARISTAS are a great group of people. They have to deal with so many different types of people(some of whom are very rowdy) and the baristas are always nice. The company has spent so much wasted money on putting locks on the doors that require combinations. The money would have been better spent  for  the baristas' pay. No one is refused entry to the bathroom. That's humane. So, why the locks? There is one thing that I do not like is that this is the busiest STARBUCKS for bathroom needs(especially people who are not customers). Each other starbucks has TWO bathrooms. This one, one of the busiest, opens only ONE of the two that exist in the café. Opening the upstairs bathroom would facilitate the use by the real customers who have made purchases.

While I was waiting for my order, I had to listen to a debacle amongst guests who didn't like that the bathroom had a passcode, and you had to ask the barista for it.  Was strange.  I don't care about a passcode if it keeps it clean enough, and it lessens the chance of someone ODing in there, but that's just me sayin'.

Upstairs is cozy.  Grab a seat by the windows and people watch while you sip your coffrapamochacinolattea.

To some this review may seem like nitpicking but I stand by it. My go to drink is Americanos. I get them just about everywhere, typically iced. When you make an iced Americano it's important to put the ice in the cup first and then pour the piping hot expresso overtop. If you don't do this you have a hot liquid in a plastic cup made for cold liquids. When you put hot liquids into these types of plastics there is a high probability the plastic is going to release chemicals into the drink that will do God knows what to you. 


I've been to this starbucks twice, both times they made it adding ice after. Both times I didn't say anything because I don't want to sound like a D but to date I've wasted $6.50 because I'm not drinking that ish. Try to poison me once shame on you. Try to poison me twice, shame on me. I'm being over dramatic but for real doe, I'm not going back.

As a gold card holder, I LOVE Starbucks coffee! I live near this location, so I've waited to write this review to make sure that nearly every experience I've had sucked. Well, it has. This is the WORST Starbucks I have EVER been to! Their service is absolutely terrible, unable to handle one customer, let alone a line with (oh my gosh) 2-4 people in it.  They only ever have pike place brewing, and the one time I opted to wait for a pour over, it took what felt like forever and my car was ticketed. Today, they ran out of pike place, and instead of giving me an immediate refund so I could be on my way, the girl behind the counter was flirting with her co-workers and diddly farting around behind the counter. I had to ask for her attention for my lousy refund! Anyone, Bueller? I can safely say that after countless bad experiences I will not be returning to this Starbucks.  If you're reading this, you know that Starbucks is on top of their game normally, this is not what you would expect.  Even if you're just walking by on South street, be prepared to wait and for them to be out of what you want. They were out of caramel macchiato's and coffee today, how does that even happen?? Shame on you, Starbucks! This location SUCKS!

Great location! I came to this location when I was seeing a show across at the TLA. It is right across the street and I enjoyed getting a drink to warm up. It is just your typical starbucks, assuming that you know about Starbucks. They have a variety of lattes, coffees, teas, and pastries. They sell cute cups and other small merchandise items which can come in hand if you have a last minute gift to grab. Best of all about this location is their public bathroom. Another perk of being right across from the TLA. After a few hours in that line a bathroom is essential! Plus, when I was waiting in line for the bathroom (just one stall) I was able to chat with a few of the members of one of the band I was seeing that night! Great experience and I have the selfies to prove it. Again, this is just a normal starbucks in a great location. The staff spelled my name correctly on my cup too!

Went in around 330pm on a Sunday, the place was pretty dirty and they had hardly any pastries left. Perhaps they were just rushed but I doubt it since there were only two other guests inside. However The baristas were very friendly and my coffee taste just like all the other Starbucks I have been too. If it would have had food then I would be rating it a 4

3 stars because the service here is dismal at best. I've been to this location more than 10 times because 8th very close to my apartment but if I have the time I head west 6 blocks to the next closest location.  
No matter what you order or how many people are in front of you you will wait at least 5 minutes for a very simple drink (ie black coffee) and if it's busy I've waited up to 15 minutes. Normally I'd walk out but when I'm craving iced coffee magic the more hip local establishments fail miserably every time. 
The only saving grace to this location is the upstairs area, which is bright, with a good view of South St for people wqtching, and has a lot of seating and tables to read relax or do work.
Arguably the worst Starbucks I have ever visited. Unfriendly baristas, very slow service, and dirty throughout. Do not recommend.

business.name: NY Bagel Cafe & Deli

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}

business.categories: Restaurants, Food, Bagels, Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Sandwiches, Delis, American (New)

reviews.text:
The owners got the worst attitude ever . 
Unbelievably rude and very disrespectful . I go to a lot of locations of NY bagel cafe & Deli never seen anybody with a negative attitude like that lady . I am sure that she chases a lot of people from this location !
Definitely not a cafe. There's a fast food feel to the place but I got take out and the food wasn't bad at all. The smoothies are just mix and ice.

For $6 I got a bagel with barely any everything seasoning. I also got egg whites and bacon. For the amount I was paying I was hoping to get more than 2 slices of bacon. I also got a side of bacon for my roommate, and was charged $2 and given only 2 slices of bacon. $1 a slice. We will be going elsewhere from now on

Our family loves NY Bagels! My dad has been going here for years, and it makes our Sunday morning breakfast so much better. Their bagels truly taste like something you would fine in NY, and their homemade spreads are equally as good. So happy to have this within driving distance!

Came across the little place for a quick breakfast. Basically a variety of meals including bagels, burritos and smoothie. You order at a kiosk and it's sort of like the ones at Wawa's where you can add or modify your order. 
We ordered 2 bagel sandwiches: 
1. Egg whites, turkey bacon, jelly, cheese, onions, mushrooms
2. Avocado, tomato and cream cheese

Bagels were toasted and generously filled! Good way to start the morning. Price was decent too.

In my 40+ years of eating bagels all over the world, I can confidently say these are the worst ever.  Also, they have an electric ordering kiosk so you don't even get to order with a human being. Btw, this place is located on the 2nd floor of the building, up a rusty metal staircase.
Took 15 minutes to get a ham, egg & cheese this morning.  They must have been waiting for the chicken to drop the eggs.  I've gotten my food faster at a sit down restaurant.

Iced coffee was definitely regular coffee, poured over ice, thus very watered down. Bagels were definitely not like NY bagels, they were very tough, and brick-like. The cream cheese was almost liquid, likely because they didn't wait long enough for the bagel to cool down. Likely will not give this shop another chance.

Let's start with the parking lot.  Many people go down the wrong way of the one way street. Bad drivers and owners issue, not the cafe itself.  But being that it's inconvenient to get there, is a factor. 

When we get in, I can tell people are confused about the self ordering kiosks (they have 2). Once you try to use the kiosk, it is very confusing when you have to look at every single box to see what you want to order. From different types of bagels to ingredients to add, it may take you awhile to order. 

Then, being the first from the bunch to finish ordering, I was the last to receive my order (took 30 mins) for two sandwiches. Then she tried to be cheap and squish both huge sandwiches into a small brown bag. Like, really? They aren't sardines, you know?

Even tho the food was pretty decent, I could have gotten the same from anywhere else. Nothing special. Just bad service coming here.

After an hour's wait with being unable to reach them via phone, I received my extremely pungent and brown mango and pineapple smoothie. I nearly vomited whole dumping it because it was so foul. Then I opened up my bagel sandwich, with avocado and tomato, to find brown avocado and very mushy tomatoes. So whatever they were spending that hour doing, it clearly wasn't paying attention to the quality of their food. Grubhub has been trying now for almost 2 hours to get a hold of them for a refund, but they're refusing to answer the phone. I've ordered from them nearing a dozen times, and this experience has completely ruined all the rest. Late, rotten food, then ghosting on customers... I'll never order from them again.

Update: After two days, Grubhub finally got a hold of them but they're refusing to do anything. So I called myself and the manager was so unbelievably rude and started yelling at me, not letting me speak. I was told that my brown smoothie ended up that way because the driver took too long to get there. Sorry, but fruit doesn't brown quite that quickly. I've waited an hour for their food before and all that happened was the smoothie separated. This was brown... But instead of trying to help, I was yelled at. They had a chance to redeem themselves and passed on it.

I absolutely love this place! The owners, Cantik and Ian, are some of the nicest people we know. And their bagel breakfast sandwiches are delicious - I could literally eat one every day. There may have been a week in 2018 where my husband and I actually did eat there every day. Our go-to order is the 2 egg and cheese sandwich with sausage on an everything bagel. I love my eggs over-easy and Ian makes the yolky goodness perfectly every time. We might be moving away in the next few months and I honestly don't know how we're going to survive without NY Bagel (and Cantik and Ian) in our lives.

Prompt service. Reasonably priced. Good portion sizes. I got the whole wheat everything with scallion cream cheese. The ratio of bread to spread was nice. Food was flavorful. Also has decent coffee. Seems to be family owned and the staff was friendly.
Great breakfast/lunch spot. Very friendly staff. Prices are solid. The place is on the upper level, so look out for that. Milkshakes here are also quite tasty

I ordered an everything bagel with plain cream cheese. It was good, but I was hoping for more flavor than what was there. The real problem is finding this place. For those of you who also got lost like me, ignore the Apple maps directions because they are totally wrong. This place is on the second floor of the building next to the Starbucks drive thru. Hope that helps!

By far the best bagels I have had in Philadelphia! The location is a little hard to get to right on City Ave but what a gem. They have a whole variety of bagels, including the standard onion, everything and plain options as well as some more original ones like Sun Dried Tomato. I tend to get the Everything with Sausage, Egg and Cheese but I don't think you can go wrong with any option here. The prices are reasonable as well so you aren't spending an arm and a leg.
Good bagels. I enjoyed the lox and bagel on everything. The kids liked the pancakes and bacon. First time my wife ever said, "too much cream cheese." Better than not enough!
Great breakfast place! I go weekly the menu has a lot od options. The staff is always friendly. I would definitely recommend.

Well this place just lost their awesome review. We have been ordering through grub hub and our food was always right and here quickly. 

After receiving an email from this company letting us know that it's cheaper to order from them directly, I took that route. 

An hour after I ordered, I called to see where my food was. The owner answered and told me that they hadn't started my food yet. Oops. 

I told them if they didn't think it would be here within the next 30 minutes to cancel my order. They assured us it would be here shortly. 

My food arrived about 20 minutes later and we began to pass it out. I ordered three total bagels and a egg, chorizo  and cheese sandwich. One bagel was charred burnt and the sandwich was just regular sausage patties. 

My husband called back to let them know how disappointed we were for ordering food from their site instead of grub hub as they suggested. The owner told us that because they were busy inside, their website ordering was pushed back. 

He then explained that our food was incorrect and she told him he was lying. Why would a grown person call an establishment that they tend to frequent to lie about their service? She kept talking over my husband and telling him that we were incorrect for ordering our food the way it was ordered. Are you kidding me? She used the statement "I'm not saying you're lying, but your food was made correctly". That's literally saying we are lying. This drama is not worth it for bagels.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places for a nice bagel or breakfast sandwich ! The lunch sandwiches are very good too! The employees are always sweet. And you get a lot of food for a good price.

In short, the parts of my experience was better than the whole. I ordered the fishermen's special which isn't on the menu. It's supposed to come with avocado, which they were out of. Asked for lightly toasted bagel, it was burnt around the edges. It didn't taste like it had scallion spread on it and for $10.74, it seems overpriced for what I  received. The nova was okay as was the whitefish salad which I picked off because my bagel was burnt.  Back to REAL Jewish delis. Trying to diversify?

I'm from New Jersey, so I'm a big fan of pork roll. This is one of the best places I have found near my school in Philly that knows how to make a good pork roll, egg, & cheese! The owners are super friendly and so sweet. Fast service and great food! Amazing for a quick late breakfast on the weekend. Highly recommend!

Love coming here to get a fully stuffed bagel.....lox is fresh and cream cheese is full of flavor. Ordered an everything bagel with lox & scallion bacon cream cheese and an iced coffee. Everyone is nice that works here and It is truly the perfect Sunday brunch food!

The best bagel in town!
If you want to taste famous chewy boiled New york style not typical philly bagel
Here is the place.

Lots of cream cheese choices 

They do breakfast-lunch all day.
From pork roll,beef bacon,beef sausage,turkey sausages you name it.

It's not only bagel but cheesesteak,panini,smoothies 
Salad

3 failed attempts at delivery so I'm not sure how the service is going in person.  Last 2 times I ordered they messed up everything on my order.  This time they forgot an item.  I brought it to the delivery drivers attention and he said take it or leave it, he isn't dealing with adjusting the price.  Done with this place.

Bought a dozen bagels. ONE would have been too many.
Doughy, uneven baking..just lousy. The "everything" appeared to have oats
mixed in with the seeds. If you like east coast bagels, don't go near this place. They reminded me of "California" bagels...the kind that don't get boiled.
