reviews.text: This McDonald's and the other one nearby on City Ave are now regularly closing to people and only serving DoorDash and UberEats. Don't waste your time driving here just to be told that they won't serve you. You can read more about their new deal in this article: https://restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/mcdonalds-announces-new-deals-doordash-uber-eats

Honestly this is LITERALLY THEE WORST MCDONALDS IN HISTORY OF WORST MCDONALDS! At this point why is it open? WHY? I don't even know why I play myself when I go here. There is ALWAYS A PROBLEM like it ALWAYS! I live around the corner so when I say I know OH I KNOW! First off they're always closed. It's literally been a long time coming with this review. I live about 4 blocks away so when I say they need to SHUT IT DOWN LITERALLY SHUT IT DOWN! THE STAFF IS ALWAYS RUDE, SOMEBODY ALWAYS HAS AN ATTITUDE! What broke me today and brought me here after yearsssss, here are how my last THREE VISITS went 

1.) I pull up the manager is yelling stop we closed, I'm looking at her like she's joking I'm like huh what do you mean why are y'all closed? She goes "I have no staff, nobody showed up" Like I understand you can't work yourself but always coming to McDonald's between 9-10 and they're always closed is it because staff isn't showing up? 

2.) I pull up start ordering, the workers are literally laughing playing around where I had to repeat my order 4 TIMES! Like pay attention I understand they might be young but you have a job to do, might I add one you're getting paid for so do it! Management seemed to not care, my order was wronG AND COLD! Fries were so bad like they hadn't changed the oil bad after taste. 

3.) TONIGHT! Now I pulled up to order a snack Oreo McFlurry so this literally just happened and her name was Asia - I go to order we are out of Oreos (okay that's fine, I'll just add my own Oreos) can I just get the ice cream in a cup? She goes no I'm like huh well can I get a snack size m&m mcflurry with the m&ms on the side (which I have done multiple times by using the "ask me" tab WHICH BY THE WAY IS FUCKING ALLOWED ITS FUCKING MCDONALDS! she kept telling me she couldn't do it , her manager refused at this point I'm so frustrated I leave because WHY IS THERE ALWAYS A PROBLEM?????? WHY DOES EVERYTHING HAVE TO BE A PROBLEM HERE!! 

Literally throw the whole staff away, and get new management, and maybe a new owner because this shit is horrible! Might I add I've lived in the neighborhood 20+ years and it's been horrible consistently the last 5 years SHUT IT DOWN!

I would give this zero stars if possible. The employees have invented every excuse possible to not accept any orders every time I arrive, no matter what time of the day/night. For months. I've complained to corporate but the issue has never improved. It is ridiculous. There basically is no McDonald's at this location.

I was absolutely blown away by the customer service here. The manager was very kind and accommodating when she realized my food hadn't been delivered yet after a short wait. Very happy I chose this location.

Hands down the worst McDonalds I have ever been to. From closing 30 min early to randomly closing for 30 minutes in the middle of a lunch rush, this McDonalds is sure to waste your time. I have never seen a place on Yelp more deserving of a 1-Star rating. Avoid this location if possible.

this mcdonalds is literally horrible. for the past 2 weeks they have been "accepting cash only" but they have a sign that says come inside to use your debit card. when trying to go inside, the workers refused to unlock the door and were extremely rude through the window saying go through the drive through. clearly we tried that but we had debit and not cash. how are the machines working inside but not out? horrible mcdonalds horrible service:  don't waste your time

Horrible. Service is EXTREMELY slow. Employees are rude, and totally incompetent. That must be a prerequisite for getting a job here. I've never been there that the order was filled correctly. The ice cream machine is off line more than on, and for two weeks they haven't been able to take credit cards, only cash.   Do yourself a favor...STAY AWAY.

Update -

After 9 months of avoiding this Mcdonalds despite driving past it daily I decided to give it another try. Ordered breakfast on the mobile app, got there at 6:30 am (breakfast starts @4:30am), pulled up to the drive through monitor and ended up waiting....
after waiting 5 minutes and repeatedly asking if anyone was there, an employee answers rudely "the store is closed". 
AT 6:30 ON A MONDAY??? FOR A 24/7 MCDONALDS??? 
I could clearly see at least two employees through the drive through window. The employee refused to give me an explanation and said they couldn't process my mobile order since they were closed - in the most rude and infuriating encounter to date. 
I stand by my previous review - Please do not let this location's shining golden arches tempt you - you will only find disappointment, frustration, and lost faith in this entire establishment.  
My Mcdonalds cravings will forever be tainted by this dumpster fire of a fast food restaurant.
This is a perfect example as to why these workers do not deserve $15 hourly rate.  Corporate needs to shut this location down!  Horribly ran store!
Always missing items with every order. Bad attitude when confronted with their mistakes. The fries are usually stale. Avoid it if you can.
honestly this is probably the worst mcdonald's i've been to, awful service, never fail to mess up orders and forget orders. Would not recommend.
Slowest "Fast food" I have ever experienced anywhere! I mean you really have to work to be this slow. 45 min and counting to get our food. Go anywhere else, not worth it.

This McDonalds is one of the most incompetent fast food drive thru I have ever experienced. I have had multiple orders (mobile/drive thru/ in person) missing items or having wrong items. 

it is also one of the SLOWEST McDonalds I have ever experienced. I have spent 20 minutes in the drive thru REGULARLY. Just sitting waiting for them to get my order wrong.  then when i get my wrong order the food is the poorest quality fast food 

Why do i keep going back? answer : it is in a very convenient location right off City Ave. HOWEVER, at this point i have had so many infuriating experiences at this mcdonalds that I now travel 15 minutes out of my way to stop by a different mcdonalds to get my food without the annoyance. 

Recommend to everyone to not waste their time waiting to get food from this location until management is changed to be more efficient.
I don't know why I tried this place again.  For the second time, I was refused service.   This really is the worst McDonalds.   Not worth the stop.

Umm i waiting ina drive thru for about 25mins i paid for a hot chocolate then i gets to the window they say the machine down ! instead of saying that before i paid then my boyfriend says sprite with no ice they gives him
sprite with ice then we asked for our money back for the hot chocolate because they told us they had no cookies to replace it so then when we asked for our money back they say wait two mins for cookies we had to pull over wait about 5mins finally gets my cookies then our fries are all over the bag just fucking terrible

I live around the corner and have tried this place more times than I'd like to admit just due to proximity. I can't anymore. Not only will they 100% of the time not get your order right, but they got 2 24 hour drive thru signs, a lady sitting at the drive thru window not doing anything, yet I sit at the drive thru order spot for twenty minutes saying "hello" and they act like they can't hear. The service her just plain sucks and they can't
Get my money anymore.

Can I rate at a zero star?    Never got service to rate.   20 minute wait at the drive thru. It's 6 am on Sunday. I'm the only car in line. And you say hold on for a minute.  Turned into 20.  I wish I would've went to the Starbucks.
had to wait in the drive through for more than a half a hour (45 minutes) service was bad, could've been way better food wad lukewarm/cold would not recommend.

I want to start by saying I've NEVER taken the time to write a negative review before. But after being turned away by the drive thru for the 3 billionth time, I feel it's necessary. I typically hit the drive thru anywhere from 5-6:30 am. Time and time again I am told the system is updating and it will take 15-20 minutes, or today at 5:45 I was told they were transitioning and weren't quite ready yet. But the best is when they don't reply at all. I once actually (and foolishly) came back a 1/2 hour later once only to be told the system was updating. So it's pretty clear the people inside just have no interest in working. Wonder how interested the owner would be to know how much money he's given away to the Wawa on Rock Hill Rd. thanks to his employees ineptness. Because I've literally seen lines of cars turned away.

This place is THE WORST.The BS attitude they gave my aunt was immature as hell. I don't know what's wrong with these people. They accused my aunt for lying about finding a wood chip in my grandpas hamburger. WHO HAS THE TIME AND ENERGY TO WASTE GAS TO GO LIE ABOUT SOMETHING TO GET $5 BACK. Like come on, these people need a common sense class or something.

if i could rate this mcdonald's lower than 1 star, i would. this mcdonald's was the grossest place i've ever been to. not to mention, the employees were rude and fisty. so it was a nice sunday afternoon and my uncle was picking up some food for the family. when he got home, my grandpa took a bite into his burger and you best believe there was a whole ass wood chip in there. the size was 3/4 of a patty. i am very surprised he didn't chip a tooth lol!! so my mom drove herself back to mcdonald's to complain for my grandpa and they first went to the back to talk about her, they then got 4 employees to come out at yell at her and accuse her of lying. i promise you, the employees were one of the rudest group of employees i've ever met. first of all, WHO HAS THE TIME AND ENERGY TO WASTE GAS TO GO AND MAKE UP A LIE TO GET $5 BACK. anyway, long story short, don't go to this mcdonald's unless you're looking to get sick or choke on something :) have a good day!!!

I used to smirk when I would see 1 star ratings for McDonald's because...c'mon, it's McDonald's, what do you expect? But yes, this place is on a whole other level of bad! Tried to order from the drive thru at around 2 in the morning after a night out. There was clearly a McDonald's employee inside working, but she refused to answer after I repeatedly called out "hello" in the speaker, trying to place my order. After a while, multiple cars started piling up in the drive thru as we sat there confused on why this 24 hour McDonald's wasn't providing drive thru service. We drove around a couple times, calling out "hello" into the speaker for placing orders in case the worker hadn't heard us the first time. Eventually, an Uber drive who was in line for the drive thru banged on the order pick-up window until the worker opened the window. The Uber driver was there to pick up her orders and this worker did not care! Instead, she proceeded to yell really aggressively about how they were closed because they were switching from dinner to breakfast (at 2 in the morning? Yeah, ok). I tried to ask her why they're closed when it's a 24 hour McDonald's only to get more aggressive yelling as a response. Aborted mission and went home. Whoever ordered Uber Eats from McDonald's that night definitely didn't get their food. Super rude service.
Never fails smh not one time has an order from Uber eats been delivered and it's been correct

When it comes to services! This is one of the worse places I've ever been. From the management to the employees. They all need to retain and work on their attitude. 
From the minute you walk into the place you feel that vibe of their negativity, rudeness way they look at you. It feel like you're inconvenient their working clock time.. 

WORSE STORE EVER! 
NASTY ATTITUDE 
RUDENESS AND DISRESPECTFUL TO OLDER FELLOWS.

THEY SHOULD BLESSED THEY HAVE A JOB. 
UNAPPRECIATED RUDE PEOPLE.
They claim to be open 24/7 but denied my friend and i in the drive through. Claimed they were getting ready for breakfast. Very rude.

reviews.text: The atmosphere is a bit odd... it feels dirty and it wasn't great service or food. I was disappointed. I was hoping this would be better, but it was good. I won't be back.
Great food. Even better service. GM, Cory, went out of his way to make us feel welcome. Service is important to me! Especially as a tourist.

Never saw someone so disrespectful with a client. 
Rolling the eyes when I was ordering and so slow to take an order. 
The cashier was great but the person taking the order was terrible.

This Cosi, located at 325 Chestnut St, Phil, PA, was HORRIBLE.
Every single table top was dirty.  The floor was filthy--food pieces all over and tile hasn't been cleaned for weeks.  Bathroom "out of order" at our noontime visit (7/14/2018).  Trashcan overflowing onto floor.  Order wasn't completed until we asked a second time.  Food prep was sloppy and sandwiches poorly done.  We'd have left, except made the mistake of paying first.  AVOID this place.  
R & J T
The Tbm on a croissant was excellent and fresh. Not enough ice and staff not real friendly

this is an awesome place. They make fresh bread in a kilm and the employees are so nice. I went there and had a really tasty breakfast sandwich. I would definitely go back anytime, and I'm excited to try their other food!

This place is okay. I'm not impressed. The sandwich I had was the turkey and Brie. They put so much honey mustard on it and it became too much. Halfway through my sandwich I found a hair in it. That was freakin nasty. The cashier was nice when she rang up the food. I'm really grossed out and I don't want to come back here.

I don't know Philadelphia well, but when I am here on business this Cosi is a welcome sight. 

The staff is friendly and the food is the usual Cost fare. The restaurant is very clean. 

If you are a stranger in a strange land, Cosi will provide you with a decent meal.

OMG this place has gotten so bad.  They recently eliminated the in-house baked squagel and now they serve STALE bagels they purchase from a 3rd party.  I could barely chew what they served as a sesame bagel.   

Bad and getting worse.  Do not eat here!
This is one of the worst run Cosi's I've ever been to. The ordering process is a mess and it's slow - we waited 20 minutes for our order and then it was wrong. Avoid at all costs

Cosi is a great place in Old City, Philadelphia that specializes in soups, sandwiches, and salads while you wait.  You can customize each item and watch as they prepare it with fresh ingredients.  

I was fifth in line for a custom sandwich and had my food in hand five minutes later.  

This place is clean, food is of good quality, staff prepare each item quickly but with good care to make it right.   I would recommend this place if you don't have a ton of time and would like very good food on the go.   Note, there are plenty of tables if you have time to eat in.

So, when you are starving, it's raining out and don't want to deal with a formal sit-down dining experience, then this is it for you. My family and I were absolutely famished and did not want to spend a ton of money on mediocre food for lunch. We wanted a casual cafe, where you order at the counter and they bring you your food. This was exactly that. Definitely no frills here. We ordered soup, flat bread pizza and a sandwich. Since it was raining out and I was wet and cold from that mess, it felt great to slurp some hot soup. I wasn't thoroughly impressed with the flatbread, nor was I crazy about the sandwich. The staff was nice and our order came out in a timely manner. There was also some pretty cozy seating inside where we were able to relax our bones for awhile before we trekked back out in the cold, wet weather. So, if you are looking for casual eats that doesn't break the bank for a quick lunch, you'll be well fed here.

They didn't have the dressing listed for a salad on the menu. The guy making my salad was nice, but he doesn't know what balsamic vinaigrette is. He just drowned my salad in straight vinegar. The cashier was a speed talking mumbler, and honestly purely uncaring about friendliness. The chicken melt sandwich was Luke warm and simply mediocre. This place is all marketing imagery, no great quality here. The bread is bland. I'll spend $0 with them in the future.

This Cosi has, by far, the most disgusting bathrooms I have ever seen in my life. I've been to dive bars with cleaner bathrooms. It looked and smelled like they hadn't been cleaned in a month. If they can't keep their restrooms clean, I don't even want to see what the kitchens look like.

Here right now. Woman who served us clearly hates her job. I ordered Thai Chicken Curry, and it was disgusting. I stopped eating it right away. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. We stopped here because it was right infront of our parking garage.

I was there the other day and ordered one of the Margherita pizzas.  I work around the corner. The pizza was cold and soggy.  The bread was stale.  I was annoyed.  The salad was okay.  I would have brought it back if it were  not for the fact that I had to work.
The place was dirty and seating is beat up. Time for an remodel. Food was overpriced and not very hot. Now I know why so few people were in there on one of the busiest time of day.
Great spot for a quick bite. Staff was very friendly. Location was right in the heart of tourists sites.
Listen. It is a quick spot for a micro meal of eggs and a square bagel.  Paid $24 for a fam of four compared to $20 a meal at the nearby breakfast joints in the hotel.
The customer service at this place is awesome, I think it was a manager that helped us but she just made the experience for my boyfriend and I. I would definitely come back here.

We ate here for a quick breakfast on our way to play tourist - our hotel was on the next corner. We were not disappointed. I had the tbm squagel. FYI - tbm = tomato, basil, mozarella. Squagel = a square bagel. The breakfast sandwich was awesome! I would definitely have this again (and I might..tomorrow!). The staff was friendly, and the prices were good. My breakfast sandwich and a large green tea were just over $5. My only complaints:  1) Our table was wobbly, which isn't fun when you have hot beverages on the table, and 2) my tea was so hot, I had to wait until I was almost done eating my sandwich to drink it. The food was five stars!
i like most of their sandwiches and the pizzas.  the Mac n cheese is gross.  It tastes like it came from a bag.  Service is a bit slow here, but the space is nice.

Good food, quick service.  Great find.  Did the taste two offer.  $25 for 2 meals with plenty of food!!  Definitely will visit again when in the area. Walking distance from all the old city attractions.

Have been here twice and both times they didn't get my order right. After making my sandwich they immediately wrapped it without asking if I wanted to eat it here. I suppose he assumed since I was alone and younger looking that I can't eat somewhere by myself. When I got to the register I asked for a plate to eat it here and she was completely confused and said they don't have plates??? Guess I'll just eat it out of the tin foil then. I usually love cosi but this one is extremely disappointing.

I have been to many Cosis and it is a restaurant I really enjoy. I've really never had an issue before, but this Cosi was the exception.

I work right around the corner so I went there today for the first time for a quick bite. I entered the store and was greeted by a sign that said Salads to the right, Sandwiches to the left. I was confused because at every other Cosi I've been to you just order at the register and they bring the food to the table. I was also ordering a Taste two (half salad+half sandwich) so I wasn't sure which line to get in. I decided on the salad line because it seemed like the logical progression of the line to the register. 

I get to the front of the line and the guy asks me what I want. I told him I wanted the taste two with a Signature Salad and a Pork Belly Bahn Mi sandwich. Without looking at me he asks "White or wheat"? I had no idea he was talking to me and I could hardly hear because it was loud. When I didn't answer he yelled at me and was extremely rude. When I told him what I wanted he went over to the sandwich people and told them my sandwich order. He then told me to slide down to the other side and wait for my sandwich.

I noticed that everyone else in line got an order slip to bring up to the register. I got nothing, but I assumed the sandwich people would give me one when they were finished making other people's orders. I was standing there waiting while three more people ordered and received their sandwiches and eventually I thought there was no way it was taking them that long to make my order. After standing there for about 7 minutes I asked the lady if someone was making mine and she said the guy in the back was. Well I noticed he was making a full sized sandwich and I ordered a half size. I notified her of this, and she asked me if I ever got an order slip. I said no. She wrote one up for me and told me I could go pay at the register and they would bring me my sandwich. 

I figured they would just give me the whole sandwich that they had already made to make up for the fact that I had been waiting for so long (which they never really acknowledged even though I was waiting directly in front of the counter AND the manager walked past several times). They gave me a half sandwich anyway. What did they do? Cut the sandwich in half and throw out the rest? Make a whole new sandwich? They never even asked if my order was for there or to go. I wanted to eat in house but they wrapped everything up and didn't give me a tray.

When I finally sat down, I opened my salad and it was pretty lacking. Whenever I've eaten at cosi the salad is usually very sizable with the lettuce piled above the rim of the bowl. Since they had given me a lid (because they never asked if I was eating there or to go) there was hardly any lettuce, and what was there was absolutely DRENCHED in dressing. I'm talking, when I was finished eating, there was at least a centimeter of dressing remaining at the bottom of the bowl. They also gave me white bread when I had ordered wheat.

I gave it two stars because, besides the bread being wrong, my Sandwich was ok. I had never had that particular sandwich from Cosi before so I have nothing to compare it to, but for what its worth I liked it. I'll be fair.

This is the first Cosi I have been to for a few months, so I have no idea if Cosi just changed their ordering layout or if this particular location is one of the only ones that does it this way. It was completely unorganized and prone to error. I will not be returning to this Cosi location which is a shame, because it is the closest one to my work and I really do enjoy Cosi's food. Oh well, I'd rather enjoy the diverse cultural cuisine of Philadelphia anyway.

business.name: Volo Coffeehouse

business.categories: Sandwiches, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food

reviews.text: Not a bad place for cup or coffee or latte on a regular day. I would not go out of my way to visit this place but would not mind stopping by again if I am directly or close to this place.

I go to this coffeeshop every time I am in the Manayunk area of Philly. I love their smoked salmon panini. It is very filling and it has a good sauce and bread. The paring with the salad is well thought out. It's a quiet place to study and/or get some emails done. I will be returning here next time I am in the city!

Love this place! This is a staple in Manayunk. Great food, drinks, and awesome employees! The baristas are always so kind and helpful. This is a really great place to do work and the upstairs is pretty quiet as well! This is the best coffee shop in Manayunk!

Best avocado toast I've ever had, hands down. They do NOT skimp on the avocado here. You can have it topped with egg and cream cheese for a protein- rich breakfast, or have it heaped with arugula and other veggies for something lighter and wholesome. The paninis are really generous too!

They serve La Colombe coffee and it's always great. They serve their cappuccinos with lots of foam which I personally really like sometimes. When you can sit inside, it's a sunny, cheerful atmosphere. The staff is very friendly!

I've only gotten an iced tea from here but I really enjoyed it and honestly, I feel like you can judge a place pretty well on how good their plain black iced tea is! The one thing that i've felt the few times i've been here, and both times it was a random weekday and not crowded, was that it wasn't super welcoming. Like I felt very intimidated walking in there. Maybe it's because all of the staff are standing in a row when you walk in and just stare at you? I guess that's sorta the vibe at most coffee shops but still just wanted to note that if you get nervous ordering make sure you look at the menu and decide beforehand.
Love this place. Over the top great grilled cheese sandwich. Excellent cold beet salad. Friendly staff.

The coffee is...coffee (hard to mess that up) and the food is pretty good, the atmosphere is pretty cute as well but the service leaves much to be desired. The staff feels very pretentious and you can sense an air of superiority coming from them when it's obvious you're not used to ordering from a place that isn't Starbucks or Dunkin. On my first visit I ordered a macchiato and was told "You know it's not like a Starbucks macchiato right" which in all fairness is correct but it's the way the message is delivered that makes me uncomfortable. On my second visit I ordered a black coffee because I wasn't comfortable with the looks I was getting from the girl at the corner. As someone that works in the service industry I know what it's like to be busy and understaffed but making guests comfortable should always be a priority right? Even if they are confused about the menu.
Great coffee, good atmosphere, and good prices. A local hotspot!!

Stopped by Volo during our college touring trip through the area, and found Volo based upon very positive Yelp reviews.  It did not disappoint!  

Enjoyed their friendly service, professional and safe COVID protocols, excellent and strong coffee (loved their latte) and some fantastic breakfast sandwiches and pastries.  Enjoyed the experience and would recommend as a 4-star experience.

Don't get me wrong, the coffee here is good! I'm writing and update because I was in here grabbing avocado toast and a few hot beverages for me and friends. I had to throw my toast in the trash. The guys that make the food along with the who I think was the owner were talking while my food was being made not wearing masks and I literally saw spit fly out of one of their mouths. I know I should of asked for my money back, but it was packed and I really don't like making a scene. I don't have an issue with the no mask rules, but after seeing that, I think food workers should permanently wear masks along with the hair nets they wear. 
FYI The ladies making the coffee all had on masks! I did drink my coffee. Lol. It was good.

Great vibe if you are looking for a quite place to read, study, or work? free wifi but not whole lot of outlets! The coffee's half-decent; but hey, most of Americans drink coffee for caffeine, not the taste anyways so why bother? If you are asking if they are acidic, they are not unless you're nursing it.

Service is a little iffy and the woman wasn't being consistent with her mask, but the turkey bacon panini, cold brew coffee, and iced coffee we got were pretty good. 

The coffees here are La Colombe and they also sell La Colombe packs as well.

It was our second time here, and if we're back in the area, we will probably go back for coffee and to split a panini.
Amazing coffee shop right on Main Street. Great coffee and food and kind, speedy service.
Best breakfast sandwiches, excellent coffee, friendly staff - thanks for starting my mornings off right Volo :)

Volo Coffeehouse was super cool and extremely affordable. Very cute spot with great prices and good choices. Cheese Danish was fantastic. I might have a new favorite dish here now. The team are extremely attentive and nice and they're very good at giving recommendations. If you have not tried Volo Coffeehouse you need to at least once.

We are supporters of any La Colombe vendor. This s place seems very popular, apparent by the line down the whole block! They had a great selection of hot and cold coffees with a variety of nondairy milks. We were drawn to the breakfast paninis that were on perfectly crunchy sour dough bread. They also serve lunch which is a plus. Ordering was a little disorganized but we will definitely be coming back for the delicious food and drink - worth the wait.
Super yummy food and great service! I had the orange juice and a sandwich. The staff was really prompt and friendly.

High quality coffee & takes safety seriously during COVID!!

Was very happy with the service here! The line moved quickly, as did my order of coffee and yogurt. The staff takes the pandemic restrictions very seriously which made me feel safe. 

The iced cortado is the next iced coffee imo- perfect balance of coffee to milk and their oat milk gave it a really creamy flavor. Granola was a little sweet for me but it pairs well with the plain Greek yogurt. 

Definitely plan on coming back here for more of their delish coffee!!

SUCH DELICIOUS COFFEE.
Please update your hours- arrived @7 and you currently don't open until 730
Great coffee spot. I love their cappuccinos. They are very friendly and they are pretty quick!
I swear on my mothers grave they have the best avocado toast I have ever had in my entire life and that's no cap

I just had one of the best almond croissants  and caramel macchiatos ever! With so many coffeehouses closed during this Pandemic it was a blessing when I walked pass Volo Coffeehouse and it was open.  The service was fast even though many people waited in line adhering to social distancing guidelines. I got my food and found a near by bench sat and ate, I was in heaven...so delicious!!! I had to go back and tell my server how delicious  everything was and how pleased I was. I am a LOVER of food as well as excellent service!!! I've traveled the world and enjoyed many delightful treats...today's experience was noteworthy for sure!!! Needless to say I'll be back!!!

Volo has been and will always be one of my favorite coffee shops. The coffee has an unbeatable taste, and I like the fact that they have food options. This is where I first ordered a Cortado, and let me tell you, it's definitely worth ordering. Super tasty! They also have incredible customer service, and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I recently moved, (not far away, just not as close) and one of the biggest things that I miss about living in Manayunk, is not being able to wake up and walk down to Volo within 10 minutes. If you haven't paid this little shop a visit, make sure you get around to!

Saw the great reviews on yelp and decided to meet friends here on Sunday morning. The Volo avocado toast was incredible and The other people in my party raved about their food as well. Bathrooms were clean and service was with a smile. Will be back!
The best Manayunk neighborhood coffee shop! La Colombe is a philly staple, and love that they serve a philly brew. Their pastries are amazing, too.

business.name: Menagerie Coffee
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Food

reviews.text: Coffee was so, so good. The baristas were friendly. Lacking the 5 star rating only because it felt a little dismal with no seating area... grab and go cause of the damn pandemic.
Was in town for business and stayed nearby. Great drip coffee and breakfast sandwich. Much better than hotel fare.

I just had the most horrible sandwich I have had in the last decade. I asked for just one thing if the sandwiches were hot. I got a lightly toasted multigrain bread with watery babaganoush leaking from it. Imagine starving and still wanting to throw your food away. The sandwich menu here needs to be killed. It's a cutesy place with coffee and pastries, but sandwiches they make are like my 3 year old makes - Hey I put a bunch of things between bread!

I was scouring the city looking for a fresh cup of coffee and when I found the menagerie I was starkly disappointed not only was I rudely treated when I tried to enter the location momentarily adjusting my mask after jogging through the city but then on top of that there was another patron who walked in who is verbally assaulted for not wearing his mask by some guy in a red beanie the guy in the red beanie was so mean so rude honestly I don't understand why you hired him.. save your money and find someone who understands humanity.
Insanely overrated. A very average latte, pastries are nothing special (like some packaged Little Debbie quality). Visited before 10am so I expected fresher stuff.

The coldbrew was indeed smooth, and affordable compared to NY and LA prices. Paid ~3.50 for a 16 ounce! Only thing I'd change; I asked for water and they said they didn't give out cups of it, only bottles of water. In the 95 degree August heat, this is a bummer.

We stopped there for coffee. The service was great, the place was clean and the food was fresh and delicious! They have a great menu.
The food was tasty and the waiter was very warm and friendly.
This is a quaint little place with so much charm. The food was very good and generous portions were served. Seating is limited but worth the wait for a table.

I met an old friend to catch up with at Menagerie. It was the day that the mask mandates and updates around COVID changed yet again and so there were no tables or chairs to sit inside, but nbd. We ordered our large cold brews with a couple scones and walked over to the park nearby. 

By far the best cold brew coffee I've had outside of the ones I make myself at home! In fact, it was so good that I went back to get another one on my way back home! Staff are friendly and they were practicing all the safety protocols. I'd definitely venture out a bit for this coffee - yes, it's that good!

Great place in old city to catch up with friends or some work. 
The coffee was very good, and there's usually a fairly decent amount of selections for pastries and sandwiches. They're nothing special but it's always good to have something to snack on while doing work.
The wifi was fairly reliable and there were lots of space, including a big table at the back, although if it's on a busy weekend, you might have to share tables with others. The bathroom was clean and there're quite a few places with outlets in case you plan on staying there for a while. 
Only complaint is that some of the areas are a bit dark. i'm someone who likes lots of natural light and well-lit spaces when i work, but the dimmer environment definitely has a more homey cozy vibe to it, which others might like.

I really wanted to like this place more because it's cute and the service is friendly, but IMHO, Elixr coffee is too harsh and bitter and the couple of pastries I tried (coffee cake muffin and oatmeal raisin cookies) were just okay. I was here a couple of days in a row on a recent visit to Philly, trying to give it another shot, but stopped coming after the third day
Super nice people work here, The only want the customer to be satisfied. Great lattes and baked goods.

I was killing time waiting for my passport at the customs house nearby and went looking for coffee. This adorable little place made me so happy- they have DECAF cold brew! I can't have caffeine and it is so hard to find iced decaf (besides espresso) anywhere. AND they had oat milk. And it was delicious. They had some delicious looking scones and other treats too! Definitely check it out if you're in Old City!

Totally respecting their in-store customer limit (we love that they're prioritising safety so much), but the matcha and chai we got left us wishing we could spend all day in there! Both drinks were perfect, especially with the use of oat milk. Finding that as an option is always a treat and it really enhanced our drinks. The staff was really courteous and prompt as well, making this possibly our best cafe stop during our trip

We love third wave coffee and always seek out local coffeehouses wherever we go. Menagerie is such a great coffeehouse with a dark rustic feel coming from the brick and natural wood. The service was excellent with them not minding that we arrived ten minutes before closing. We were happy we made it as the espresso drinks were fantastic. Look forward to a return visit next time we are in the area.

Cute little spot serving Elixr coffee, which I've enjoyed at their cafe. So on a dog walk recently, we stopped in (well, I stopped in while my husband waited outside with the dogs). Coffee was good, and I was impressed to see that that they have a kitchen with staff making the sandwiches to order. My husband got a breakfast sandwich and I got a pastry. 

I get the feeling they might have more food options when things get back to "normal." I'll be interested to try those, though they already have some good stuff on offer.

I like that they are open earlier than other spots, so I can stop in when I walk dogs and before things get busy in the neighborhood.

Cute cafe that has adapted fully to COVID. There were no chairs when I went and plexiglass separating the customers from employees.  They work super fast, very friendly, and have still managed to make the place aesthetically pleasing.
Their coffee and croissant was delish! 
I wish COVID is gone so I can enjoy an idyllic morning enjoying the cafe to its fullest soon.

Menagerie is the latest on my list of amazing places I have gotten to try outside of my typical Rittenhouse bubble. While I wish I were more of a coffee connoisseur (alas, call it my character flaw), I can definitely tell if coffee is amazing or horrible. Luckily Menagerie's coffee is AMAZING. It is delicious and refreshing. I got the iced oat milk latte and my friend similarly agreed that she loved her cold brew (which is saying something, given how simple cold brew tends to be).

We grabbed iced drinks from here and roamed amidst the historical buildings. 11/10 would recommend!

Coffee was ok, not bad, not the best. Breakfast sandwich and donut was very good! Not awesome when your husband waits in line to keep the three person limit and then gets kicked out when a customer comes back in to correct a precious order. These are not cities mandates and customer service should always be a consideration.

Very great coffee and pastries. Loved the Covid-safety protocols in place, felt very safe ordering and inside. We got a latte and a chai, as well as a cute pastry and a slice of Irish soda bread. Both drinks were amazing, the Chai specifically was really good and clearly made in-house. The soda bread was fantastically thick, and they grill-toasted it and buttered it for us. They were also quite fast and very friendly. It's also right near market street so it's easy to get to. Would recommend it as a stop.
$6 for a matcha latte that had way too much milk and not enough matcha. I've had better at Starbucks
If you're finicky about finding top quality coffee then this is your place. Best beans, great coffee, and they also do great lattes.

Small coffee shop with a selection of pastries, with a small table for 2 outside the door, and handled COVID well - ordered a chocolate croissant, cappuccino, and matcha latte.

How they're managing COVID: They were very strict on only having 2 people inside the shop at one time, and everyone had to be in masks. Had a screen around the cashier as well, and would pass over drinks & pastries through the screen. 

Food: Thought the drinks were well prepared and croissant was very flaky/crisp. However the drinks were ~$5 each, which I thought were a bit on the higher end, given the size of the drinks. 

Overall: 4/5 - I do think the prices are a bit higher than your average latte, but they were well made and had tasty pastries! Great job managing COVID too.
I'm always looking for great espresso when I'm in a new city. This did not disappoint and the customer service was excellent.
Tasty brews, fast, but cheerful and friendly service, yummy breakfasts- my go-to spot in old city for daily coffee

I stopped in this weekend and ordered a hot cider and vanilla donut. Everything was very tasty and fresh, service was quick and friendly despite walking in minutes after they opened on a Sunday Morning. I will definitely be back!

business.name: Beiler's Donuts
business.categories: Food, Donuts, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

reviews.text: I had an order from here twice. The first time I was being a little fat and got 12. I like to order things in sets of twos (OCD much)? No, but I have a sister and daughter so they can try one and I try the other. We're they good? Hell yea! The second time my friend dropped me off 4 donuts because what are friends for? ! I don't know I think this might be my new spot even though I'm a certified Krispy Kreme girl.

Good donuts! Many flavors to choose and all have their own distinct taste. I prefer the glazed cake donuts. They have a soft cake like consistency and are basically old fashion donuts with glaze on top. They are very dense. The Blueberry Fritters and Lemon Creme are a must try. So delicious, full of blueberries and lemon flavors. Donuts are also very affordable at $15.25 for a dozen and $8.00 for a half dozen.
Fresh and delicious, although you have a plethora of options, pick up a filled donut (preferably a citrus flavor)

Did you even go to Philly if you didn't stop at Beilers for the doughnuts. They have endless number of options to pick from that it can be overwhelming sometimes. Personal favorite are the White chocolate MnM and Fruity Pebble doughnuts. If you have a favorite, definitely recommend getting the big birthday doughnut but you have to order in advance.

I went to the Beiler's Donuts in Reading Terminal and got a dozen donuts. They have a huge variety of doughnuts, and I had the Blueberry Fritter, Caramel Apple, and the French Crueller. They were pretty standard doughnuts that were sweet, with nothing negative to say about them, so my impression is that they are very popular for the variety of doughnuts they offer.
Best donuts in Phildelphia. Always stop at Beiler's when we are in town. The fritters are my favorite but everything is good.

On Saturday, 9/25 we stopped by to pick up a large chocolate cream pie to take up to college to celebrate our daughter's 20th bday.  This pie is her favorite so we made sure to take extra care to make sure it was cold and intact despite our 4 hour ride.  Unfortunately when we went to take a bite, after singing happy birthday, the cream was curdled and the pie rancid.  We were shocked & so disgusted each of us 5 had to spit it out!  Luckily my daughter has a sense of humor bec this mom felt terrible about it.  So disappointing!
Quick & efficient with getting people in & out. Aesthetically delicious. The perfect sweet tooth craving fix.
So good, I forgot to take picture up until I only had a bite left. Staff was extremely friendly and the line was long but it moved quickly. Once again, one of the best donuts I ever had
Some of the best quality and most creative donuts you'll ever have. Nice shop in the University City area with some limited indoor seating. A must visit when in Philly.

I had read and heard so much about Beiler's Donuts, that I had to stop in when I was in the area.  I came in expecting long lines, but I was fortunate enough to be the only one in the shop on a Friday mid-morning.

I ordered a half dozen donuts to take to a friend over at Presbyterian Hospital.  Her family unanimously claimed them to be the "best donuts in Philly."  That might have been influenced by the fact that I told them Beiler's is credited to be the "best donuts in Philly" when I gifted them the box.  

After my visit to the hospital, I picked up a Chocolate Iced for myself and a Sea-salt Caramel for my husband.  I have to admit, the donuts are pretty darn good. 

Donut Pricing: $1.50 each, $8 Half Dozen, $15.25 Dozen
Best Donuts I have ever had - especially the Blueberry Fritter. They have so many delicious options. And the staff is super friendly.

I ordered the peanut butter s'mores donut. It had a white marshmallow filling, topped with chocolate, crushed graham crackers, and a s'more. The peanut butter flavor was minimal, almost nonexistent. The donut was soft and fresh, but not melt in your mouth. I would probably try something else if I go back, but this is a perfect donut for you if you love marshmallows. 

The service was fast and friendly. The line takes quite a while to move due to people trying to decide which donuts they will be ordering.

Better than the original location (if that's possible) - I came here on Friday afternoon right when they were closing, having called in to ask them to save a few of the original donuts for me.  Not only did they honor the request, but the staff was polite and highly professional as well.  They were friendly and knowledgeable about the offerings, and got me trying a new donut as well, something I had not done previously. 

The premises were clean and well-maintained, and unlike the original location, there's designated seating that's well-maintained too. 

They also have coffee!

Great customer service - they drew a smiley face on my box too!!  Will be back!

Always a delicious treat and better than other places with a reputation for fancy donuts (looking at you federal) but much better than the others and significantly cheaper. Example, average donuts last weekend from federal was $27, these amazing donuts from Beilers, $15

Don't sleep on their classics either like cream filled, glazed, and apple filled. All amazing

Good for people who: want a variety of tasty doughnuts to binge eat when you're stressed from school 
Bad for people who: are worried about their sugar intake 

As far as doughnuts go, Beiler's is pretty good. They have a ton of good flavors and it seems like theres always a new flavor that you haven't gotten around to trying yet. The staff were really nice when I went to go pick up my nuts. I got half a dozen for my friends and I to share and we had a lot of fun trying to cut open the nuts as if they were egg yolks on top of toast or something (as you can see from the videos it's definitely not as dramatic as cutting into a yolk). My favorite is the fruity pebbles chocolate doughnut. While I'm still a federal donuts girl at heart, I'm down for Beiler's anytime.

I was too close not to stop! Beiler's is a staple in Philly and a must try if your near by. I grabbed a half dozen before heading out of the city. They were totally worth the 20 minute detour and the $12 parking. The strawberry shortcake was my favorite

wanted to try federal donuts but they were closed due to covid hours so we ended up stopping in beiler's donuts.

* the staff: kind, helpful, patient

* dining area: jan. 2020 there wasn't any indoor dining so we just picked up some donuts to take home

* what i ordered:
- a dozen donuts (can't remember which ones we got exactly) - these donuts were thick and airy, not dry or hard at all! we were so happy that this impulsive stop for donuts was so delicious.

summary: 10/10 highly recommend. i guarantee you will find something here that you'll like. make sure to get there early so that they don't sell out of the flavors you want!

Melt-in-your-mouth donuts! The line of people waiting to buy the donuts says it all. These donuts are awesome!

Loaded with all the goodness....butter cream sugar, so don't count calories when you are here! Because you will not know how many of them you inhaled in 2 mins!

We tried apply fritter, mocha, pumpkin spice, apply cider, oreo cream, red velvet and maple glaze. My fav (because I am  not a fan of cream filled donuts) was apple cider. Mocha was equally yummy.

If in this Philly area, Reading Terminal Market is a must try. And don't leave the market before you treat yourself with a donut from here!

I have had Beiler's for the last 5 years and is one of my top donut shops. The best part is the texture of the donuts - it's chewy but airy and not cakey/dense. And the flavors are delicious and decadent. And for the price point it is amazing for about 1 dollar a donut it's better quality and price then the NYC Donuts I have tried. 

Favorites: my friends love the apple/blueberry fritters, I like the salted caramel, maple cream, and strawberry cake

I ordered a dozen doughnuts for delivery about 10 minutes before they closed up for the day. Unfortunately you all had run out of a few of the donuts I asked for. Instead you sent an assortment of 2 dozen doughnuts! Very much appreciated, and we still got our favorite doughnuts in the assortment. Everything was delicious.
There are some many varieties donuts!  And I do like many of them!  Chocolate moose, nutella, pumpkin spice (seasonal), triple chocolate, and so on!  Worth to try and very good service!

Heard these were some of the best donuts in the city so had to check them out. They offer of variety and specialty donuts. They are the best, no doubt. You'll find glazed donuts and the usual favorites. Then you'll find the non-usual type of donuts, like M&M donuts, Fruity Pebbles donuts and so much more. Fresh batches made daily and often. You'll smell them once you enter Reading Terminal. Get yourself some sugary sweet treats!

$12.99 for a dozen high quality donuts?? Yes please!

Donuts are thick and fluffy--the perfect texture. It gives a good bite but also melts in your mouth. They have a variety of different donuts, from the classics like glazed and chocolate sprinkled to the seasonal ones like peppermint bark to my favorites like the apple fritters. There are so many choices that it can make anyone have a favorite to choose from. I loved the fall flavors, like pumpkin pie and harvest apple. However, the caramel apple was the best. The filling was like apple pie filling, so it was so moist. I am also a fan of the Nutella and Oreo, however, the filling is the white cream. I wish there was Nutella filling or a cookies and cream filling. The PB and J donut is also really good. I like the contrast between the PB creme and the fresh jam. I wasn't the biggest fan of the cereal donuts, however. The cereal, like fruity pebbles and lucky charms, would not retain the crunch on the donut. The lemon donut was also decent, but too sour for my liking. Overall, it's definitely a good place to get some fancy donuts for a good price!

This review is going to be short and sweet because it's all about donuts and basically everyone knows that Beiler's has some of the best around. Personally, I like to keep it simple with my sweets. So I'm partial to the chocolate-frosted, cream-filled donuts or basic glazed/frosted. If you do like different flavors and toppings, there's definitely plenty of those to choose from as well. 

The donuts are perfectly sized so you can enjoy one for breakfast without feeling like you blasted through half a day's calories. An excellent treat for these trying times!

business.name: Rione

business.categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Pizza, Restaurants, Italian

reviews.text: Very, very good 'za by the slice, Roman style which is thin and airy. I prefer the white slices to the red sauce based ones, but everything is good. Hard to walk by and not get a slice.
After reading all the great reviews, decided to try the Prosciutto and Mozzarella sandwich for $9.50. See photo.

This pizza is actually amazing. I never had Roman inspired pizza but this is so unique in flavor offerings and always cooked at the perfect temperature level.  Crispy, delicious, and quick. My favorite.

First time trying Roman style pizza. The crust is so airy and light it reminds me of a focaccia! I love the texture it's so easy to digest and I don't feel stuffed after eating about 2 slices. I'm usually a fan of flat bread pizza and dislike the thick chicago style deep dish. Depends on what kind of pizza dough you like you'll have different opinion on this pizza place. But if you like focaccia bread, this is your place! 

We tried the ham & mushroom pizza slice, truffle pizza slice, and the carbonara slice. They were all really good but the topping is very lacking. I was hoping there would be more toppings on the Pizza but that's my strange personal preference. I've yet to really find a pizza place that's impressed me with their quantity of toppings. The bread and flavors were all good though - but nothing spectacular. 

My boyfriend told me they usually will sprinkle some oregano/spice and then add some fresh basil after they toast your pizza. They didn't do that for me...  *Ask about that when you go, I'm sure it'll add good flavor to the pizza.
The pizza was just fantastic!!!  The crust.  The sauce.  The toppings.  Everything was delicious.  It was like a melody in my mouth.
Love it! The dough is incredible. Looks like they're now back in operation after a covid hiatus.

They offer a variety of different pizzas, each with their own superb flavor profile.

I recommend the mushroom truffle pizza, spinach artichoke pizza, and the vodka sauce pizza.
Great variety of pizza and their salads are nice and fresh.  Service is always friendly and their delivery service is timely.  Try them!

This pizza spot has some really unique flavors and I'm all for it! Love that they sell by the slice so you can try multiple flavors. We tried the spinach artichoke, a mushroom one and one with prosciutto and egg cream - all were yummy. The shop appears to be following covid protocols well and the guy behind the counter was properly wearing his mask which I appreciated.
Grazie to exist! Best Roman pizza in town. Simple and the way they do it in Rome. So happy I tried it.

Excellent pizza option. I have never had "Roman style" pizza before. The crust is relatively thin yet airy and crispy. The topping choices are delicious! I had the trufolata, parmigiana, and ricotta vodka slices. The trufolata was the winner with the ricotta vodka a close second. The ricotta tasted so fresh and light. Everything was perfectly seasoned and not greasy at all. Overall, a great pizza option!

I love roman style pizza, and there's certainly fills the void for philly. tastes like naturally fermented dough, with a fluffy but toothsome interior and crisp exterior. cant go wrong with any of the toppings, but i love the truffle and the carbonara. one of the better spots for pizza in the area.

I think it's one of the best pizza shops around. I work a block away and I always make an effort to go there at least once every two weeks. Pizza us great and the staff is always friendly and outgoing. The owner is American but he was raised in Rome. Very clean atmosphere.
I love Roman style pizza and was excited to find this place near my apartment. The spinach artichoke is my favorite so far.

Some of the best dough in the business! The Al Taglio style is light and airy. I tried an assortment of slices - Spicy Soppressata, Mushroom and Truffle Cream, Carbonara, Margherita, Spinach and Artichoke, Potato. I wasn't a huge fan of the tomato sauce (Soppressata and Margherita), but the others were outstanding, my favorite was the Carbonara. The tiramisu and mini Cannoli's were also delicious.
Its simple...Just really high quality pizza... bought multiple cuts and we all ended up fighting over our favorites...

Decent interpretation of Al Taglio. Definitely on the pricey side for slices. Given nobody else does Al Taglio, it's fair to consider it the only game in town. Not a place I'd rush back to and not a place I'd refuse. They do seem to invest a lot of care into their product and the ferments look good on Instagram - perhaps I just had an okay experience.
Very good. Can't wait to go back. The dough is phenomenal and the ingredients are too quality. Impressed..

Wow, Rione was mind-blowing. The price was super reasonable - I couldn't believe it! Every single thing was fresh and tasted amazing. Service is quite helpful and pleasant. You all should check out this beautiful place.

Recently moved to the center city area and decided to take a stroll around. It sounds like this place just moved a few doors down to the former Poi Dog location. Lots of pizza options in small slices. I was very overwhelmed and ordered a few slices to go. Pizza is crunchy and crispy, but not hard. Will come back to try the other flavors. Wish they had a menu posted as they have some appetizers and salads also available.

THE BEST OF EVERYTHING!
Wanted to add a photo but was overwhelmed by the aroma.

Tried a little bit of everything.
Telefono Classico 
Cannoli 
Carciofi e Spinaci 
Cotto e Funghi 
Parmigiana 
The flavor aroma and portions deliciously perfect!

My boyfriend raves about how good Rione is and sadly I was never able to try, especially due to COVID. But Rione has finally opened their doors and I was finally able to try these Roman style pizzas. 

We got the Suppli which was divine! The cheese was stringy and absolutely delicious. 

Pizza: Diavolo, Carbonara, and Patate. All three pizzas were unique and flavorful. They were dense and rich in flavor with each and every bite. The Diavolo was by far my favorite with bold flavors with an added kick. The carbonara was rich and taste reminded me of carbonara pasta. The Patate was light and different (in a good way) with super thinly sliced potatoes to give an extra crunch. The pizza was airy but dense, I definitely couldn't finish everything. 

The prosciutto sandwich was one my boyfriend hasn't tried and I'm glad we did! The sandwich was both salty and sweet from the prosciutto and the mozzarella cheese. The arugula made the sandwich feel and taste refreshing. 

Everyone, go and try Rione and support this amazing one of a kind pizza joint!

Amongst the best pizza places that I've visited. Juliana's in Brooklyn, Regina's in Boston, Little Star in San Francisco....Rione is right up there with all of them. The Roman style is different than the aforementioned pizzas, but that's part of what makes Rione so special. The focus on fresh ingredients and quality is apparent. Easily my favorite pizza in Philadelphia.

I am huge fan of Rione, equally for their outstanding food and their thoughtful and personal service. We had a private event at Rione and making arrangements was borderline enjoyable given how simple and stress free it was. Everything went off without a hitch, we played our own music and had a blast. As for the food, what can I say other than everyone we bring here says they truly feel like they are back in Rome. Their lemon vinaigrette will transform the heartiest carnivores into salad lovers.

Rione is seriously delicious!  The crust is probably my favorite i've had for pizza.  I will say the salads are SUPER underrated.  This arugula salad is so simple and done so right.  The parm is sharp, the pine nuts are always good and the dressing is the perfect amount of sweetness.  I am obsessed

business.name: Red Hook Coffee & Tea

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
