business.categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Sandwiches, Caterers, Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Cafes, Event Planning & Services, Burgers, American (New), Vegetarian, Food

reviews.text:
We walked into the cafe in the direction of the counter and as we stood there, there were two people behind the counter - young man and older woman. Neither really spoke to us for few minutes as we awkwardly stood in pretty tight enclosed space. At some point the woman standing there writing in her notepad looked up and asked if we were being helped which we obviously weren't as she and the other guy that could've spoken to us. She asked for our vaccine cards before anything (which isn't a problem until a bit later) and then told us there were counter seats in the back or we can just wait for one of the tables to be cleaned and we can sit there. We opted to wait and we're seated shortly after. While we waited for someone to take our order, about two more crowds walked in and were politely greeted immediately and told them someone would be with them in one minute. Right after, another group walked in and after being greeted, they were advised to have a seat and would be asked to show their cards when someone came to the table.

My partner and I immediately noticed a large difference in customer care between us and the groups following us; I'm not one to say this often but it definitely felt like it was because we're are people of color.
We decided not to eat there and didn't even bother to try their food based on their service. I'm a big fan of small cafe's but this was disrespectful for my own taste - Philly has much better places!
Luna Cafe is decent. It was one of very few options near the hotel. Service was quick, which was appreciated.

We were in town for the weekend and looking for a place for brunch. We were lucky enough to get a seat. The service was friendly and attentive. But the food, WOW amazing. I had the biscuits and gravy with fried chicken and my husband had the everything bagel sandwich and we shared each.  We were blown away by how delicious and well prepared everything was. The coffee is La Colombe so you know it was incredibly good.  Can't wait to go back.  I also love that they include a gratuity so their staff is a being paid a better wage.

Came here with a friend for a late breakfast while I was visiting Philly. The food was delicious with plenty of options for vegetarians and vegans. 

The staff were nothing short of amazing and very attentive. It felt very safe, especially during Covid. 

There are outdoor tables and chairs and plenty of inside seating. If you are seating towards the front door, it can be a little chilly if you are seated there. So bring a light jacket :)

The food was pretty average so I am baffled by all of the good reviews. I got the Nutella stuffed pancakes and they took this as the literal meaning, not in a good way. When I've had this dish before at other places, it was more than just slapping on Nutella on the pancake. To piggyback off of the previous review, there is an automatic 20% gratuity charge added in. This is usually added in for 6 parties or more, which we were not. The service was slow and when I tried to flag down an employee for water, their automatic response was, "I'm not your server". Go somewhere else and don't waste your time here.
Great food and atmosphere.  Within walking distance of Independence Hall so stopped there before our scheduled tour.

I had a chai latte with a shot of espresso from here once and it tasted like hot water with coffee grinds. No chai at all. I tried to politely talk to the women who made it (shoulder length dark brown hair) but she just got super defensive and told me the espresso can be overpowering...? I was so thrown off by her response and lack of customer service I left and threw out the latte. I haven't tried the food here yet but I probably won't seeing as I wasted $7.

We are visiting Philly for a few days to catch a baseball game and sightseeing.  Looking for Vegan options for me I found Luna Cafe.  I had the avocado toast with tomatoes which was very good and fresh. I also had the plain potatoes.  My husband had bacon and scrambled eggs.  We had a tour planned for later in the morning so we arrived a few mintes before they opened.  They saw we were there and took our drink order.  Our waitress Maddie was wonderful.

I would not recommend.  For starters, the food took an inordinate amount of time to come - a fact to which our server was totally indifferent.  She never once asked if everything was ok or if we needed anything.  Then the check came and there was a 20% gratuity automatically added - I would not have given our server 20% for substandard service (maybe the automatically included tip reduces incentive to be on top of things).  As another reviewer commented, there is absolutely no notice of this on their menu (at least not on the menu that you pull up on your phone currently due to Covid).  To me, that is something a restaurant should give patrons full notice of on their menu.  What we ordered was good but I would suggest Red Owl Tavern which has far better service and is only a few blocks away.

The food was decent but they automatically and without notice add a 20% tip to every order. We were planning to tip but did not appreciate being forced to do so. When compulsory like this, it's no longer a tip. It's just an added tax. This 'policy' is not on the menu, it's not on the website, it's not written on the walls, and the server didn't tell us until after they'd charged our card.

Stopped into this small cafe twice over a weekend Philadelphia trip. The options were plentiful and the quality of the food was good. My only complain was that no one came by to ask if I wanted more coffee in the morning. Otherwise, a solid breakfast spot.

We are tourists visiting Philly for the weekend and found this quaint cafe close to our hotel. The place was packed and they had many tables outside as well. The menu has a lot of variety and we ended up choosing the breakfast tacos and chocolate chip pancakes. Both were delicious! We also both got a yummy iced latte since it was so hot outside. The only complaint was that our table was right by the door and the servers and patrons had to keep walking past our table which was slightly annoying but I understand the restaurant itself is very small. Luna Cafe is wonderful and we would come again if we are ever in Philly again.

Thoroughly enjoyed my meal, I had the chicken and waffles, my partner had the breakfast tacos, and father-in-law had the Philly breakfast sandwich. Service was pleasant. 20% gratuity made paying easier and honestly the food was delicious. My picture won't do justice being that that I took it after I took one of the two double stack pancakes out for my son. The pancake tasted like it was made like French toast. Very moist and soft. The gravy is a sausage which was normal but the crisp and breading of the chicken it what really knocked it out of the park.
Best chicken and pancakes anywhere!!! Friendly staff and great atmosphere. We love Luna Cafe!

Two days back to back and they still didn't disappoint! They were very busy and the wait for a table for one was about 15min, which isn't bad at all. This time I payed around and had my server make the choice for me, she was a little nervous but I was confident she couldn't mess it up. The hospitality was wonderful and everyone greeted me as they walked past. No one standing still and attending everyone consistently. 

The waitresses choices were spot on, she did cheat a little by giving a sampling of biscuits and gravy (So Happy she did this!). The Breakfast Taco's are exceptionally well done, the chef that runs the kitchen knows exactly what their doing. Pico de Gallo was refreshing and not overly spicy, eggs scrambled to perfection, and the sauce poured over the taco's made them perfection! 

Now for the biscuit and gravy sampling, never have I ever had a biscuit like this before! Flaky and perfectly rounded out with a light buttery flavor, the layering makes me think it was made with Filo dough. The sausage gravy richly flavored and had no grit from the sausage. Perfectly seasoned and not overly peppered or salted, most make their gravy greasy and under seasoned, this will not disappoint! 

Do Not Miss this spot to have breakfast or brunch! This will make your trip or day and will be back for more.

Stopped by my first cafe in Philly and have to say I'm In Love! The atmosphere is soothing and energetic at the same time. Very friendly staff and exceptionally clean. Nothing like very inviting staff to make the start to your experience a positive one. The iced vanilla late wasn't too sweet and perfect balance espresso, milk, and vanilla sweetener. 

Now, the Bagel Breakfast Sandwich! Very fresh Bagel, egg cooked perfectly, bacon crispy, and their Luna sauce.... what the actual f$@&, It makes the experience unique and adds explosive flavor. I have no idea what's in it, but it's a flavor I will come back for before leaving old Philly. 

If you're thinking about going here, stop thinking and just go! You will not be disappointed!!!!

What a cute place for breakfast! Great food! Awesome coffee and service with a smile.  The breakfast sandwiches are tasty, but I had the pancakes and boom: heaven!   Get there a tad early as they fill up fast with tourist and dwellers alike!

Used to be great. Ordered chicken salad online and got a text message it would be ready at 12:25. 

Showed up for pickup and they said, "We're out of chicken salad." Said, "We tried to call you." Totally lied. My phone did not show any attempt to call. 

Offered to make me something else   I said just give me a refund. I called 20 minutes later to see where my refund was. Said, "It takes days to show up." But amazingly a message appeared right afterward saying the amount would be refunded.  

 I was hungry and on a tight schedule and every place had long lines.

I'm hoping the owner sees this and does something about the service. They DO have great chicken salad and muffins...or at least they used to.

Had brunch with the family and the food was amazing! We were a party of 6 and were easily accommodated 4 at one table and two at the next which was great for the coziness of this restaurant during a Pandemic comeback. The pancakes were delicious and the oat milk hazelnut latte was sooo good.

My wife and I spent a get away weekend in  Philadelphia and wanted breakfast before we left.
Am I glad we found Luna Cafe! Breakfast was fantastic, the service was great. We initially decided to sit outside but it got a little chilly and asked if we could move inside. I've been to some places and you would think you were asking for the moon, not here it was no bother at all. The next time we visit we will definitely stop by again.
Omg I had the avocado toast with egg and it was delicious! This spot gets packed so prepare to wait. From looking at everyone else's plate, everything looks good! It's a must try.

Cutest place! We made a very last-minute reservation, hoping for the best and thankfully they had a spot for us! We had our own little secluded alcove all the way in the back of the restaurant - it felt very safe and we all felt comfortable considering we were dining indoors. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the food was delicious! I had yummy french toast and iced chai!

Byob brunch! The breakfast bowl is my favorite thing on their menu. I went here with two friends with three bottles of champagne. They have OJ so you can make mimosas and kept our bottles in ice. The staff is very friendly.
Love Luna. Go there almost every weekend for breakfast or brunch. Love their breakfast sandwich and their chicken salad! Best Mac and cheese!!

Exceptional, pleasant server, tasty home fries, quick service and very fair prices! This was my first time at Luna Cafe and I would absolutely return and recommend it to many others. We were able sit outside and feel very Covid-safe in a convenient location after they sat us right away without a reservation. Thanks to the gentleman who waited on us for a breakfast that left us SO pleasantly surprised!

business.name: Manakeesh Cafe Bakery & Grill

business.categories: Bakeries, Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Middle Eastern, Restaurants, Lebanese, Coffee & Tea, Halal

reviews.text:
Heard great things about Manakeesh and was honestly slightly disappointed. Ordered the chicken kabob platter and pistachio baklava. Overall though the portions were big and I'm willing to give it another try.

I wouldn't order the chicken kabob again, but the fries were great. I would try the chicken shawarma instead. 

Pistachio baklava was stale, although staleness could have just been because I went near closing, but that's no excuse.

URGH! This is a "revenge addendum"! I hate this place! If you have ANY need for simplicity or punctuality do NOT order from here! Food still amongst the most authentic and tasty Lebanese food in Philly, business practices still a nightmare! Could it be personal? Maybe they hate me? Order 50 minutes late and two orders delivered not one, delivery person (who didn't go to correct location to begin with) had the nerve to call an hour later and question me why we "opened the second order"!

I really wanted a chicken crepe from here, but the online menu said they "may can fulfill" the order depend on the moment. I didn't understand that so I just ordered the lamb manakeesh type flatbread. My wife ordered a potato and cauliflower wrap. 

The taste of my lamb mana was all there, but i was really surprised at how small it was compared to before. All good, I get that's becoming the norm at some places. I pretty much folded it into a wrap lol

My wife's wrap was HUGE and she really enjoyed the flavor. I asked for a bite, but she wasn't in the sharing mood because her wrap was so tasty. Maybe next time she will share. OR maybe I'll just order a wrap.

Great for a casual night, service can be a little hit-or-miss but the food hits the spot and the pita is so fluffy and pillowy. They give you so much hummus and the vibe outside is lively, inside is very low-key. I love the chicken platter.

Excellent flavors and decent portions, not cheap but you pay what you get for. I was a bit miffed with the staff who knew I was there to pick up my to go order, but failed to let me know when it was actually ready. When I pointed out that my order was waiting, they deferred responsibility. Also, they forgot the hummus on my daughter's wrap. But it was all quite delicious. Probably much better to get a simple order and check it on the premises.  A separate dessert counter with padded seating area and mood lighting is an inviting feature of this authentic cafe.

We got the chicken and beef manakeesh which are Lebanese flatbread pizza. The flavorings were very unique, I thought the chicken one was better. The beef one was strange because it was ground beef pieces instead of slices of beef. I wasn't a big fan of that. 

The left side of the store is a cafe where you order meals and the right side is a bakery with many baklava selections and other Lebanese desserts. They even had coffee, tea, and fruit juices. I didn't get to try anything from the bakery but will definitely be back to try more items.

If you're in Philly and craving Lebanese or Middle Eastern food, you absolutely have to head to Manakeesh. It beats most places I've tried in other cities. The menu offers a diverse selection and it took us a while to decide what to order. We ended up going with a Zatar Labneh and Chicken Tawouk Platter. The taste, quality and flavor of the meat, quantity of food, and richness was worth more than 5 stars. If I could leave more, I would. It also seems to be always packed and well frequented in the area. If you're ever in West Philly, you have to check it out.

Racist owners would not cater a wedding once they found out it was a gay couple. Wake up people. It's the age of inclusion not the age of racism and discrimination. So many options nearby for the same exact food. Buy from people who like their customers, not one who points to the middle eastern customers behind me to take their order in another language. I'm white so I don't get to order next? How fucking rude can you be.
Any of the fire grilled wraps or shawarma platters will change your life. This place helped me find god.

We were in Philly for a midday event after which craved a Lebanese lunch. We know the cuisine, especially my wife, who is from Beirut. Manakeesh was pretty close by so we ordered a few things over the phone to pick up as we drove there. 

The place is totally, authentically Lebanese. They were taking the bread for our order out of the oven as we arrived. The chicken shawarma is the best we've ever had in this country with real toum (garlic spread) and juicy meat. The baba ghanouj is smoky and a little chunky, like homemade, addictive and not at all bitter. The zaatar bread and beef lahm bajeen, amazing. 

We are going to go to Philly more often knowing Manakeesh is there to brighten the day and will try out other dishes without hesitation.

Manakeesh is so good! It's a must try if you're in the area. It is very authentic in flavor. I have so many recommendations. 

I love their cauliflower and batata. They also have a delicious hummus, and baba ghanouj. 

The balilah and the fool are great, flavorful entrees! 

They have a nice mint lemonade. I've also tried the cheese omelet and waffle during brunch hours. I had loved those as well. 

Five stars! Support a great local business!

I'm writing this review as I'm waiting for my sandwich for the past 40 minutes. If they would've told me it would take 40 minutes and more I wouldn't have ordered. I used my lunch break to get this food and now I don't have enough time to eat it. Probably not coming back. If you plan on eating here order on the phone or online an hour ahead because they rush those orders more than the actual customers order in store!
A nice welcoming atmosphere and great food especially their Lebanese style "Manakeesh" a taste of home faraway from home. I love the kafta too and the falafel sandwiches.

The chicken is some of the best i've had and overpowers an overall meh ordering experience.  The chicken came hot, well seasoned, over a bed of delectable rice.  It was served with some creme thing and a side salad of cucs, tomatoes and onions.  Overall damn good- better chicken than Yiro Yiro.

The lamb strips were also good- very great with tsaziki.

The lamb manakeesh that I got was absolutely not for me.  Too pickly, and was not as hot as the other dishes.  Also was not crispy which was sad.

Between the manakeesh and the 1.5hr wait for doordash to be able to even pick the food up, I maybe should have taken 2 stars.  But the chicken is really really worth it and made with love, and I did not want to distort this place and turn people away when they NEED to get the chicken here!

The flaming hot oven at Manakeesh Cafe & Bakery turns out the most tasty namesake Lebanese flatbreads with a choice of delicious toppings. The Lahm Bajeen (ground beef) and the Lamb Lahm Bajeen (ground lamb) were flatbreads topped with spiced ground meat mixed with tomato, green peppers, and onions, and this savory, juicy mixture paired with some refreshing pickle slices was the perfect complement to the crispy flatbread underneath. We also got an order of the Meza, a set of 6 different appetizers from the menu, which were each plated individually and made for quite the colorful spread! There was the creamy, lemony hummus; tabbouleh; stuffed grape leaves; four crispy falafels with tahini sauce; and my favorites, a refreshing fattoush salad made of lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, pita chips, and sumac; and a smokey baba ghanoush. There was just as much emphasis placed on the presentation of each dish as on the flavors, and each of the meza plates was meticulously garnished: a sprinkling of paprika and olive oil on the hummus, sumac on the baba ghanoush, and pickles/lettuce/tomatoes with the grape leaves. All the food was fresh and delicious, and the mezas were served with two flat, chewy pita breads on the side, which were perfect for wiping up the dips and eating with the salads!

This place is still my go-to Middle Eastern restaurant in Philly so far. Their service was not pleasant and I kind of noticed that their food quality is going downhill a little bit. But their pita/flatbread is still the best in Philly & I will still come here to just get their flatbread pizza (Manakeesh)! I recommend to try their chicken tawook (creamy & spicy) or Kafta (beef & lamb). We also ordered chicken shawarma platter, but it took much longer than the chicken tawook manakeesh, so I suggest you to get the manakeesh dish if you want something quick/to-go meal. We also added rice into our shawarma platter, but their rice was flavorless, so get the pita bread instead or rice. Their hummus was really creamy & rich, but it was too sour to me. I probably will try their other hummus-like dip "Muhammara" (roasted red pepper dip) with pita next time.

The last FIVE times I have ordered pickup from Manakeesh, which I would previously have given five stars, the food has not been ready until 30 minutes AFTER the pick up time. Really? Requiring customers to stand around waiting for 30 minutes for a scheduled take-out order? This last time, as earlier, there was no one else in the place, and the workers were moving in a very slack and slow manner. I've noticed that the owner doesn't seem to be around as much anymore. This is no way to treat your loyal customers, some of whom have gone to a lot of trouble to patronize you over the last year and a half. Please do something about this!

Terrible! terrible! 1 star only for the taste and no star for rude staffs who absolutely customers' time means nothing to them! I've been waiting 55 min today for 3 wraps! 55min and that includes reminding them about my existence twice! be aware! once you paid you are trapped and there is an endless tunnel of time for them to slowly process your order! 
Today was my second time being here. the first time 2 orders out of 3 were totally wrong!!! yet i decided to give it a 2nd chance and oops! again another shittstorm! if you go there just make sure you gonna be free all day long! terrrrible!!!
MashaAllah, great cafe and bakery. Very clean, service was great and food/coffee was perfect.

I came here last night for the first time and was blown away. Their everything was jaw dropping. I also had my first crème brûlée and it was mouth watering my amazing. I would come here again every night if I could. Thank you for a great experience

I've had delivery from this restaurant twice now while working late evening shifts. I've been consistently impressed by the food. I've tried the lamb kofta kebab, the chicken tawook kebab wrap, and one of the Manakeeshes. All of the dishes were flavorful and delicious. The food was hot and held up well in delivery. The baklava was pretty good too. 

This place is now my go to suggestion for when we order food at work, and I'm looking forward to eating here in person.

I've been coming to this place on and off for years now. I've seen it grow from a small one-room shop to a large beautifully decorated multi-sectional restaurant, smoothie bar, and dessert space. The food is always really good (the manakeesh, labs, veg platter, basbusa, Arabian sundae you name it!) and the staff is professional and helpful. I appreciate how the inside decor is so elegant but the atmosphere is down to earth and homey. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to treat themselves at a decent price. Thank you to the owners and staff for many great years of service!

I would recommend you order ahead of time if you plan on coming here so you do not have to wait in line. The cafe is currently open for both indoor and outdoor dining. Among the two of us, we shared a Baba Gannouj (great smokey flavor), Lahm Bajeen Manakeesh (loved the picked peppers), and a pita (it did not come with the baba gannouj). Overall, the food was very good.

I had heard good things about Manakeesh from friends so decided to check it out. 

Upon entering the restaurant, there is a large counter for customers to place and pay their order. Once paid you will get a number to place on your table. With this number system I'm not sure if it was for the staff to bring you your food or for you to pickup once your food is ready. I saw both scenarios happening when I was there. 

The menu:
-The menu is substantive and has many options for different dietary restrictions. 
-There are a few parts of the menu which are confusing since they seem similar with other menu items, however the person behind the counter was able to clarify easily for us. 
-We noticed this after, but there is a printed menu available at the counter, not only the one above the counter as we had thought.
-There is signage at the counter indicating that due to rising costs, all prices will be increased by 5% from what is stated. However checking in on Yelp yields a 5% off purchase coupon.

Food:
-The portions are huge and easily shared
-The pita is made to order and very delicious 
-Everyone in the group enjoyed their order.
-The bakery's menu looked delicious but sadly most items were out of stock. 

With all the positives listed above, you may be wondering why the three star review.  The bathroom was absolutely filthy and disgusting. I am hoping it's due to a fluke but it was bad enough to dock a star. Upon future visits If the situation improves I will update my review. 

Additionally the whole numbering system is frankly confusing. Some of us had our food brought to us. Others had to keep looking at the area where food that was ready to see if our order was there.  The restaurant was not busy so we were unsure what the deal was. This resulted in loss of a star since the last person in our group to get their food, where the rest of the group was already midway through theirs. This resulted in the loss of another star. 

Overall I would give Manakeesh another chance and also would love to try their bakery. I hope they take the feedback and address it. 

Things to know:
-It will be easier to look and order off printed menu versus one displayed above counter
-Indoor and outdoor seating available
-Pay attention to food that is ready to be served, your order may be stuck there if you are waiting for it to be brought to you 
-Guest WiFi available 
-Come prepared with hand sanitizer to wash your hands versus using the bathroom. And do your best to avoid having to use the restaurant restroom. You will thank me later. 
-Cutlery, napkins, and water are self served.  However the water cups are TINY (like 4 sips) so be prepared to refill often or (what I recommend) bring your own refillable water bottle/cup. 
-Street parking only
-There is a small section stocked with different items such as honey, Turkish delight, nuts, candy, etc. 
-Manakeesh has their own app for you to place delivery orders and get discounts from

Comfortable space, delicious food, great tea and snacks. Manakeesh is open and a great place to eat as well as study or work. Tables chairs as well as cushioned seating indoors and a covered outdoor space. The platters are very filling and there is a wide selection of sandwiches as well. The tea and pastries are a great desert or working snack. Ambience makes you fee you are in Beirut and the staff is very friendly. I've been coming for years and hope they stay open for many more.

business.name: Manhattan Bagel

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': True}

business.categories: Food, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Bagels

reviews.text:
New Yorker here. These ain't NY bagels. 

But, there was a woman working there who was as nice as could be. As nice as you could get. 

5 Stars for Customer Service
1 Star for the Bagels

Cream cheese looked decent.

This was probably the worst breakfast sandwich I've ever had. It felt like I wasn't eating a sandwich just stale bread. There was barely any steak or eggs on it. The bread was dry and the size was smaller than what I paid for.

First and last time at this place. Placed an online order, came in a few mins before it was ready and expected to wait a few mins, no problem. After I walked in, none of the 3 women there acknowledged me - it was actually kind of strange. I stood there for another few mins and then another woman, seemingly the manager, walks out and I tell her I'm here to pick up an order and what my name is. One of the women who saw me come in, responded to the manager saying "it's not done yet" - okay, I'll wait. I wait another 5 mins and see two people come in and order their sandwiches and get them all in the time I'm still waiting for my single sandwich that I ordered nearly 15 mins ago. Finally I walk up to a different woman and ask and she goes and hands me a bag that feels cold. Once I get to work, I head to the microwave to heat up this cold ass sandwich and see that they made my sandwich wrong too. Who thought ordering a breakfast sandwich was so hard? Yeeesh.
I ordered the Croissant Classic with eggs, avocado and Turkey bacon.  This is what came to me.  Literally not a croissant at all which was the whole name of the title of the item I ordered.   Unreal.

I just got a breakfast burrito at this place and it was the best breakfast burrito I've ever had!
Eggs were good with a lot of flavor. 
Thank you for an amazing breakfast.

What they deserve is zero star.I went last week and took one dozen bagel, apparently they mix old bagels with couple that are new.
Although I put the rest of the bagels in the refrigerator the next day it had already fungus on it. I've been to many countries and I never seen bagels like this, no taste, not enough sesame and very bad quality spread cheese.
A dozen cost $17 on top of that cheating just because they don't care about their customers with all their greediness and cheating.

I wasted $28 on food from here. 13 years of NYC bagels told me immediately.." this ain't it". The bagel had no substance to it. The fixings were skimpy at best. NYC bagel sandwiches have at least a inch of ingredients that make them a meal all by themselves. Are avocados scarce in Philly, because I got like 3 slices? The bagel was just bread and the crossaint wasn't any better. It wasn't flaky, buttery and had no volume. Sausage/cheese/ fried egg were cold as ice. I had to put it in the toaster oven.

Just moved to a new apartment and this place is right next door - wow!! One of the best bagel sandwiches in philly. Got a ham, egg, cheese on everything bagel and it was the perfect melty consistency and so delicious. The coffee was mediocre but the bagel sandwich was good enough I'll still give five stars. Definitely a new go-to spot!

I didn't discover this franchise until my early 20's and I'm so sorry that I didn't know about them sooner. They blow Dunkin breakfasts completely out of the water. You can taste the freshness of their bagels and breakfast sandwiches and I have never had a bad experience at this place. Their coffee is on point too

Stopped by while walking and grabbed a latte. For half the price of Starbucks, you can get a simple, tasty coffee. Their bagel sandwiches also look delicious although I did not order one during my visit!
My only negative comment is that the coffee making system seems a little inefficient. You order the bagels before the register so they're ready when you pay, but the coffee is made at the register while you pay. I felt a little bad holding up the line, when I wish the coffee could have been made quicker.

Decent Philly bagel place, but with NY prices. I'm a NY'er, who spent a weekend in Philadelphia. I went to grab some bagels and juices. I was immediately greeted by someone who took my order and assured me with paying. The place looked neat and the gentlemen was very friendly (aside from his Eagles hat, everything was perfect)

Two bagels, two juices and a muffin was about $15 bucks. I found that to be a tad on the expensive side, but the service and the product were good. I would return here in the future.

A simple place with simple bagels. But the employees are extremely friendly and genuinely care about getting your order correct. My go to place for when I want a bagel. 

For what it's worth, I'm from Central Jersey. No bagels compare to those from the homestead, but these are decent enough.
This breakfast food SLAPPPS. Manager was friendly and checked on everything! HIGHLY RECOMMEND MA DUDES!!
Very disappointed, bought this to take to an outdoor brunch with my friends and unwrapped to find a completely burnt bagel.

I think I've been to a few other Manhattan bagels in my time. I've never had much of an opinion on the chain. I love bagels though. 
I've been to this particular one quite a few times throughout the virus shut down. It is one of the few places that opens up normal time these days. 
So let me preface it by saying I really appreciate the workers and the fact that they are on the front lines and working. So these stars are for the workers and their service. 

Unfortunately though the things I've tried just suck. 
I've jumped around the menu a bit too. Doing bagel cream cheese or bagel sandwich combinations. I got egg white, avocado, bacon on an everything today. It tasted a little like plastic. 
The only other thing I can compare it to would be the Fisher Price cheese burgers that I played with as a kid. 
The coffee is pretty bad too. 

I'll keep going here. I pray they don't recognize me and spit in my food.

I frequently come here because service is always quick. The staff and manager here is a pain in the ass. Today, I came in to order a sausage and cheese on plain bagel and a cup of tea. The guy filled up the cup with hot water not even putting the tea bag like they were supposed to. He put the lid on the counter and I told him to get me another lid because its "flu" season and god knows if they wipe the counter. He started going off on me saying I complain everytime I come in and telling me to NOT come in anymore. Spoke with the manager and she sided with the guy. I WILL TAKE MY BUSINESS SOMEWHERE ELSE.

This location needs to work on their customer service. They cater to the regulars...one in particular in a fur coat..even when there is a long line. Someone should not be able to walk off the street, just stand by the register and order what they want. They should have to stand in the line like everyone else. It's a common occurrence there and I'm tired of it. Do better. Make everyone stand in line no matter how much they tip.

I was first introduced to Manhattan Bagel around thirty years ago. Even before Yelp was a thing I wanted to spread the word of these fresh as can be bagels at the age of seven. My family and I introduced the bagel to our family dog and she was probably the most enthusiastic participant I have seen devouring a Manhattan bagel since. 

I will continue to preach on about Manhattan Bagel and they really do introduce some quite interesting seasonal items - just look at the picture of there newest creation the Pretzel Pastrami Egg Sandwich I took below!

Whether you choose a toasted or fresh bagel, cream cheese or butter, breakfast meat or delectable fish, I think you will be happy with your experience with this bagel joint I know I was.

As always people SYOY!!

I think this place has some of the best bagels in CC. A bunch of funky varieties of bagels and some great cream cheese. I got the jalepeno cheddar bagel, which was really great. My coworker got the lox and thought it was awesome. The staff were super friendly and the prices are definitely fair

Yum. Wishing I had a manhattan bagel near me. I stopped in before heading to the Made in America Fest this past weekend and grabbed a snapple and two egg bagels with egg and cheese. Hit the spot. 

Liked the customer service and the quick in and out food line.

Love this place. I go almost 3 times a well. Colder is good and easy. The bagels and other sandwiches are delish. The staff is always friendly and kind. The owner is super cool and nice too. I love this place. It has some of the best prices for a quick but really yummy bite in Rittenhouse. I would highly recommend.

I'm easily impressed when it comes to most carb based things. However, when it comes to bagels I am nit picky. Does it taste good toasted? Untoasted? With toppings? Without toppings? Manhattan Bagel checks all those boxes. The only box not checked was the one on my wallet. These bagels cost a pretty penny, but are worth it for a weekend treat. I've had honey whole wheat with honey almond cream cheese and it was delightful. NOTE: they sometimes get the ratio of cream cheese to bagel wrong so be warned! But MAN I can't HATe Them ANd would go back for more BAGELs.

Omg these bagels are so good. I went here after a night of drinking honestly expecting to get any run of the mill bagel and was thoroughly surprised at how good these were. Not only did it get rid of my hangover but was so delicious as well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. 

I dont know what they do to these bagels but I need to figure it out because any bagel sandwich I've had since has left me very disappointed.

Really appreciated the help that the guy behind the counter offered in terms of Philadelphia establishments. He went out of his way to get me a fresh iced coffee and iced tea. Would love to come back to try the steak egg and cheese on a bagel.

Bad customer service. After being told my $100 could not be accepted, I kindly left to retrieve an alternate method of paying. Some time while i was gone, they made my order, trusting that i'd come back. When I got back & up to the register, I asked if my food was cold since I was gone for about 15 minutes or so. The cashier told me "basically, it's been sitting around for almost 30 minutes" and refused to make me fresh food, saying that it would hurt business. Not coming back.

business.name: Good Karma Cafe
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Food

reviews.text: Best coffee shop I've found since moving to Grad Hospital. Their coffee/banana/peanut butter smoothie is unbelievable and in addition to great coffee, their variety of iced teas are amazing. Can be a little slow, especially in the morning, so I would recommend ordering ahead!

I love Good Karma. The thing with all their shops in Philly; they are consistently great! The staff is always over and beyond amazing! The coconut iced coffees or lavenders coffees are my go to's. 

The cool as a cucumber starts my weekends right. Their seasonal drinks are great! When it is pumpkin season, you gotta get their pumpkin chai (iced). You'll thank me later.

Go give them a visit at any of their locations, you will enjoy it!

I stopped by Good Karma this morning for coffee and a small breakfast bite. The location is very easy to find from their signage and a large mural to the right of the storefront. They have a few seats outside and even some available inside (YAY!). 

There is a large menu above the counter with an assortment of coffees, teas, espresso drinks, and food items. I opted to try the Lavender Latte because I overheard someone in front of me order it and it sounded great. I am a huge fan of Oat Milk so I was excited to learn that they had that on the menu too! To eat, I tried the Power Bowl which consisted of scrambled eggs, turkey sausage & bacon, spinach, cheddar cheese, and everything seasoning. I ordered it to go and by the time I got home the cheese was melty and delicious. The portion was on the smaller size, but it was exactly what I was looking for this morning!

The staff was very friendly, the space was very clean, and I loved to see that it is pet friendly inside! Knowing that I could come by with one of my pups and spend a few hours working is very enticing.

Due to COVID my normal coffe shop work flow as been interrupted. Then the other day my wife visited GK and was on cloud 9 about this location. So we de Decided to pack our bags and take a bike ride and work from the shop. Everything she had to say lived up to the hype!

they had outdoor seating in the front but the real magic happened when they directed me to outdoor seating in the back. A cozy spot with an amazing environment. Pair that with great coffee and Chai tea, it was a great spot to get some stuff done on a nice day. 

Definitely Gonna keep coming back to support this place during these tough times.

We came here on a rainy Saturday to get some hot drink and a bite to eat. They have roadside seating and backyard seating. We ordered the hot chocolate and Buddha bagel. Their bagels are really nice. Hot chocolate actually came out warm so that was disappointing. Lemon poppy seed muffins were amazing. 

They also keep treats for your furry friends to chew on while you're enjoying your coffee. Good service!

Good cute cafe. Had Dominican mocha hot chocolate and Happy Buddha bagel with lemon popy muffin. Hot chocolate was not hot and a bit disappointing. I expected a bit more from it.  Buddha was OK. We had it with wheat bagel,  I think they recommend sesame bagel with it but were out of stock. But, honestly bagel was not bad it just missed the wow factor.. i think changing the bagel would do it. Muffin was delicious.  Saved the day. It was perfectly soft and moist. Highly recommend it.
Staff is polite and courteous. They all had masks on. Offered free dog treats for our pup. Restrooms were clean and available for customer use. They had hand sanitizers available for use.

Such a nice little place! We were looking for somewhere in the city that had a peaceful outdoor area. This one has a wonderful back area with about four tables and places to plug in electronics. We love the coffee as well! I'm a matcha fan, and I would recommend the Wildflower drink.

Love this neighborhood cafe for pastries, specialty brewed coffee or tea drinks, and bagel sandwiches. If you have time to truly savor the space check out their outdoor green oasis patio with tables/chairs. Great vibe, friendly service!

My local cafe features fair trade coffee , quick tasty bites including sandwiches & homemade soup , and outdoor seating in a private back area and a few streetside tables , good for dog lovers like myself.  A good place to meet friends or work remotely, with their free coffee refills.  Good Karma is lovely.
I've never had a bad cup of coffee or latte here! The staff is always pleasant, even at 6 AM, and the fact that they're dog-friendly makes it even better!

I started drinking coffee at the age of five. Had my first cappuccino by the age of eight. Ordered my first cappuccino at Good Karma Cafe yesterday and it was most delish. Above the mark scores in flavor, a bit too much froth and this may have been the cause of the temperature of the cappuncino not meeting my standards. That being said as far as cappacino's go I would fully recommend coming here for the cappuccino when your in the mood and have $5 you don't mind spending for a medium brew.

The Barista was also very helpful when I was inquiring about there seasonal drink the salted caramal mocha and she said if you don't love sugary drinks I would pass. Thank you for that as the days of having sixty plus carbs in a drink any nutrionist would slap you sideways if they heard you engaging in such behavior.

I will come back here for sure to try there food and will update review. 

Thank you Good Karma Cafe the experience I had here was well...quite Good.

Love this coffee shop- such a friendly and welcoming environment. I went for an iced latte on a Sunday morning with a friend. The coffee shop was a great place to chat and catch up. If you go, you are sure to have delicious coffee and 'good Karma'.

Ordered an iced coffee and asked for minimal ice. Received one that was full of ice. When I asked the associate (Cita, she also made the beverage) If I could have ice removed she gave her coworkers annoyed glances and rolled her eyes. It was unnecessary and off putting as she was the one who got the order wrong yet treated me terribly for speaking up in a polite way about it. Disappointing and telling of their customer service culture.

Love this coffee shop! It has such a warm and friendly atmosphere with great food and coffee. They have your typical coffee options (drip, espresso, lattes, etc) but also have fun, more unique drinks such a Lassi which is a latte with rose, vanilla, and cinnamon and I love it. Today I got the iced Espresso Shaker with oat milk and it was prefect for a hot summer day! 

They also have great food options, such as bagels, sandwiches, soups, salads, vegan cookies, and your standard selection of pastries. I got the "cool as a cucumber" bagel on an everything bagel and it was definitely very cool as a cucumber. Highly recommend. 

WiFi available. Dogs welcomed. Milk alternatives available. Outside seating in back and front. Free water with lemon.

My 3 stars are not at all given out of spite. I just feel that this is an average-level coffee shop in the Philly area. I've been here a few times and have never been blown away. Their coffee and drinks are good, but nothing remarkable. Their food and pastries are rather forgettable. 
I will absolutely continue to visit Good Karma when I'm walking by, and I will especially return to enjoy their truly delightful outdoor patio!
Don't write them off, but know that if you're in the hunt for stand-out coffee, Philly has more to offer.
Amazing hospitality today. Very welcoming and low key vibe. I love coffee with a smile and a convo. Keep that shit up folks.

I came here for cold brew but they only had a very strong ice coffee. I was surprised by the quality and the fact they had oat milk and compostable containers. The only downside is that they recommended Starbucks specials even though they worked at an independent lovely karma filled atmosphere!
Love this place!! The service to the food and many more fabulous things this team brings to the table. Thanks Good Karma for all you do!!!

Nice local coffee and breakfast cafe
Good coffee! Egg and Bagels sandwiches were very tasty! We will be back!

Excellent drinks!

This place has awesome seasonal drinks! My brother specifically came here to try out their springtime drinks. We both enjoyed their Masala Rose Chai with oat milk. The drink was super flavorful and rich. I will say they were a little expensive at almost $6 a drink but definitely worth it every once in a while. 

I'll definitely be back in the summertime!
Good coffee but the interior isn't that cozy, it's more just people at their laptops working.
Great find with delicious egg sandwiches (vegan options/gluten free options) that has fair trade coffee and is doggo friendly.

Go-to cafe for delicious soups and amazing service! Every interaction I've had has been positive so far at this cafe! 

Atmosphere: A few tables scattered around, probably can seat 15-20. Cozy and cute environment. I've seen days where people will simply come to work, other days where it's bubbling with conversation, other days a mix. Great for catching up with friends, dates, or just getting some work done on your own (with their free wifi)! 

Service: Highlight of coming to this cafe - the employees are very kind and friendly! I was super indecisive between soups, and was offered a free sample of one.
 
Food: Their soups will change, but I love their chicken + peanut soup. It was a bit on the oily side, but carried a lot of flavor. When I had a head cold, this really hit the spot! Coffee - they offer almond and soy milk at no additional cost (very rare for a coffee shop), and their special drinks are delicious! The latte I had was a bit diluted though, so I'll stick with their seasonal drinks in the future.

Recommended Must-Try: Sugar plum drink - not too sweet, but delicious blend of vanilla into your coffee! I also have yet to get a soup I haven't liked - quite affordable ($6.50 for 16oz) and flavorful. A tad on the oily side sometimes, but I'm still obsessed. 
 
Overall: 4.5/5 - I love coming to this cafe. It's so versatile and offers a wide range of delicious soups, salads, bagels, coffee, and pastry options. And very affordable! Overall, love the warm experience here (from the food and the service)!

Cozy place, great sandwich and salad combo which is similar to Panera Beard's but you actually walk away with an adequate amount of food instead of just being hungry and angry as is the case with Panera Beard's sandwich and salad "deal" lol. Nice place to open the laptop and get some stuff done!

Came here for a latte one afternoon. It was rainy out and the coffee warmed me right up! My girlfriend and I sat here talking, drinking, and watching the weather. Couldn't ask for a more perfect place. 
There were plenty of people working on laptops but we managed to find a spot. The employees were Courteous, the prices average, WiFi of course, good music and it was clean!

business.name: Mugshots Coffeehouse & Cafe

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': True, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}

business.categories: Vegetarian, Food, Coffee & Tea, Vegan, Sandwiches, Restaurants

reviews.text: Staff Ui nice but coffee is bland. They increased prices and they said it was due to switching coffee...it's worse now then before!  Nice place to hang out but bring your own coffee!

I absolutely love this new location! It appears to have more space (which isn't necessarily true in terms of square footage, an inside source told me) and it's much brighter. The eclectic group that makes up the staff is still pretty rad, not to mention friendly. The chef is fantastic, very creative, and they keep tasty vegan options on the menu (I'm a carnivorous creature, but I  can appreciate having options). Overall, two thumbs up.

On the recommendation of some friends, who told me they have some of the best smoothies in the city, I decided to stop in to see what the hype was all about. I walked in and was very greeted by a very nice lady at the counter who gave a few smoothie suggestions. I went with the Mango, and loved it! The only thing bad about it was the brain freeze I got from drinking it so fast. I'm not a vegan, but the desserts there are fabulous. I'm also big on environment. It was very clean, the staff was friendly, and was even greeted to some live entertainment (to my surprise, they have live music there too.)

My bottom line assessment is Mugshots is Starbucks on steroids!

Ok so this is specifically for the Girard store but should be noted for all the stores.  I call into the cafe to order a wrap.  They are out.  Then I try to order something else.  They are out.  They are out of all wraps- which makes up 1/2 their carry out menu!  What good is a carry out menu when you dont have ANYTHING on it???  Pretty screwed up.

The lack of a fifth star is only because of the space. I liked the character of the old space. I do think in time, this one will 'collect' that feeling. AND I do like that students don't find it as welcoming for hanging out with their computers. There's nothing more irritating than going to your local cafe to sit, relax and have a coffee or sandwich for a moment to find all the tables taken up with laptops...I do wish they would sit at the counters instead. The new spot doesn't attract this 'habit' as much as the old one...yay!

The food is above cafe standards and well worth a try. MANY vegetarian options. I highly recommend the veggie chili for everyone. It's great with extras like sour cream or cheese. But don't try it if you're spice shy, this one is good and spicy hot.  

The Mugshot green-organic philosophy is a joy to be a part of. The events, while not dramatically attended, are a nice treat...especially the beer-coffee pairings :-)

If you're looking for a Seattle-style 'coffee' shop, this may not be your spot...come to think of it...go to Starbucks. If you're looking for a place to have a bite with your coffee or tea, have a conversation with the staff, sit for a bit, this is your spot.

I was a big fan of the Manayunk location and was happy to find a Mugshots in my new neighborhood, as well. My go-to has always been the Bonnie & Clyde (chicken, spinach, pesto, and provolone served on ciabatta). It might be a simple sandwich, but all the ingredients work so well together.. plus I'm a firm believer that ciabatta bread makes just about every sandwich better. The peppermint iced tea is also worth trying if you like peppermint.. its flavorful and refreshing.

The new location is a win for Mugshots.  It's brighter, more modern and less confined.  The line moves more quickly and the food and coffee are still high quality.  I really like the bar and there is always room to sit and relax.  Whoever thought of the iced coffee growler is a genius!

We stopped in for iced chai tea lattes and got iced milk instead. We threw them out after a few sips and angrily headed to our local Starbucks for the real deal. It was most definitely a waste of $8.10 so we will not be returning. There is a Starbucks at 19th and Callowhill that will be worth the walk!

I really hate to give this place a bad review because I used to love it so much, but I have to. The coffee and the food is still good, but I really don't care for their new location, the price bump, and the crowd it attracts. Not to mention, it looks like they canned all of their staff from 21st and Fairmount when they moved. Normally I don't mind when a place moves, usually it's for the better, but not this time. The Mugshots at 21st had more heart and the staff looked like they enjoyed being there, when I went in here the other day everything that I liked about the previous location was gone. A coffee shop is supposed to be comfortable, this one just morphed into something ugly and corporate.

If you want disaffected trustafarians or hipsters to serve you overpriced coffee at their own leisurely pace, this is the place for you.

Coming off of living in Portland, Oregon for fifteen years, it's as if these jamokes were relocated to Philadelphia, since they couldn't hack it in the Pacific Northwest as a barista.  

Everything about this place needs to be changed from the pricing to the seating and most importantly; the staff.  I strongly suggest that the owner learn the distinction between running a hipster group home and a business.

I used to loooove Mugshots.  The old location was great.  The new one is horrible.  It is so loud.  Every conversation, every thought is interrupted by grinding or steaming.  The old place was charming, this one is cold and sterile and Starbucks.  The coffee and food are fine, but it is no longer a great place to hang out, study, read.  Just thinking about it gives me a headache!

I have to say that I really like the grilled cheese with the apple slices.  I'm not a fan of cafe food, but this is a solid sandwich.  I used to go out of my way to eat and work here, but I'm not going to make the trip from Northern Liberties just to get a sandwich I can make at home.  The staff still seems fine, the place is clean and well lit, but if the noise level of a place gives me a headache, I can't enjoy any of that.  

They need a few walls that can absorb some of that sound, and to put up something around the blender/steamer/grinder.

Loud! Loud! Loud!
I came here to get some grad work done, which seemed like like a common reason for many to go to a coffee shop, right? Anyway,  there weren't a lot of people there, yet still every five minutes the blender was blaring. BLAR-ING! Sorta hard to read technical writings with all of the noise.  I agree with a previous poster, the staff are a far cry from warm. To top it off, I got kicked out an hour early because it was slow, not cool for me.

I live in the neighborhood and supporting the local businesses has always been important to me.  However, I will tell anyone and everyone to skip Mugshots.  The only reason they get two stars from me as opposed to one is because I agree with their fair trade values when it comes to sourcing coffee.  

I've been to Mugshots about ten times and every time, without fail, the staff was rude and brusque.  It was almost as if they were put out that I was there.  No eye contact, no smile, no greeting, no thanks for stopping by.  The food and drink were insanely overpriced and took a lifetime to appear.  I appreciate that they make everything to order, but it doesn't take 15 minutes to make a latte or a BLT.  Ever.  Couple all of this with the fact that each time I visited, the quality of the food and drink steadily declined and you have a pretty decent picture of why I will never go back.  I will, however, be cheering for both Cafe L'Aube (at 16th and Wallace) and the new coffee shop that's coming to the old Mugshots location to succeed.

This is a solid O-K. Breakfast sandwiches are good the bacon is awesome, nice and thick. Don't over look the smoothies - good stuff. The thing that kills this place for me is the service and atmosphere, for whatever reason every employee looks annoyed they have the same people ring you up and make the smoothes and coffee. So if someone orders a smoothie and a coffee they are inline for 5+ min waiting for their drinks then have to pay. Then you go over to this little window to get your food but its right next to the ordering line so you are in peoples way, very unorganized. The place is very loud and there are tables and chairs everywhere so gets crowded, their old location use to be much better more like a neighborhood  coffee shop but not any more. 

Food is good but just get it to go and try to stay out of the way.

I used to look forward to coming in to Fairmount so I could go to Mug Shots with my sons.  We've done it for years and it marked some of the most enjoyable times we've shared.  We went to the new location yesterday and what a disappointment.  What happened to the character and warmth of the place?  Where's the eccentricity? Where are the comfy caste offs from grandmom's attic and the cozy nooks and crannies?  Where is the incredible menu filled with imaginative vegetarian and vegan sandwiches?  All we found was a sanitized, coffee chain ghost of its former self.  Good coffee is not enough to bring me back here.  It looks like every other mass produced coffee shop.   Its meager selection of premade sandwiches in plastic wrap is nothing but a sad eulogy for the greatness that once was Mug Shots.  Why did this have to happen???

It's not hard to pour a cup of coffee and make a bagel sandwich.  Yet mugshots always seems to have a problem doing so.  Cold eggs in a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich is baffling to me.  Why would eggs be cold unless they were frozen.  How hard is it to crack an egg on a grill and flip it over.  Paying $2.50 for bacon in a breakfast burrito which finally comes without bacon.  Thanks.  The only reason people go to mugshots is because there are no other coffee shops in the area.  I don't even like giving it 1 star.  You guys suck.

I have now stopped into Mugshots twice and can say that I would probably not go back.  Between the staff that seems uninterested whether or not I am there, the fact that the coffee (although quality coffee) is not made very well, and the "hipster" ambiance I would rather go elsewhere.  
I don't know what it is, but the staff really does not seem to care about the customers.  Most of the space seems like it could use some serious cleaning which is why I only got coffee.  The noise is fantastic and the lighting is intermittent at best.

Mugshots has moved to 19th and Fairmount. I really like the new location for some reasons and disappointed for others. The layout of the new place makes sense and there are more seats which was an issue at the previous location. The service seems faster and more efficient. I had the quiche and it was super tasty. A downside is the outside seating no longer overlooks Eastern State Penn, but Riteaid. There is less character since it is a new building and the noise level is higher.

If I could give this new site a zero, I would!  The place is brighter but the noise level is unbelievable!  All the loud talk echoing off the wood floors is bad enough. Add periodic banging from somewhere in the back and intermittent use of a very loud blender and I was finally driven out the door!!!
Too bad. No more cozy neighborhood coffee place.
Used to be a good place to enjoy a chai.

Oh, Mugshots, why? What was the point of moving two blocks away to a worse location that has none of the character of your old one? Not only is the new place dark, spartan and corporate-looking, you have almost none of the good menu items from before (vegan reuben, vlt, etc.) You've switched to pre-made sandwiches so additions and substitutions are a thing of the past.

You've always been pricey, but it was worth it when you still had good food and atmosphere. If it's not broken, don't fix it!

I'm so disappointed that Mugshots moved three blocks up Fairmount into their new location.  The building is so unbelievably nondescript, it's sad. The interior looks like cross between a bad Starbucks and a cheep cinderblock daycare.  Mugshots has lost all it's character and charm and traded it for faux granite countertops and Ikea pleather couches.  It's sad to see you go, Mugshots, you had such a wonderful way of snapping me out of my Sunday stupor.  I know you just moved and I should give you a chance to acclimate, but I just don't see how there's anything you could do to right this - you really got everything so wrong.  So long, and thanks for the memories.  *sigh*

I was super excited to see the new location for the first time. As soon as I walked in, I was so depressed by how different everything looked that I almost left. I'm glad I didn't though because the salads and baked treats are as good as ever. After I sat for a while, I had to admit that it's not that bad. The space is smaller and everything looks nice and new with a fresh coat of paint on the walls. But the old venue just had that great vibe of an old building that's been reinvented a couple of times. From the windows you used to see the stone walls of the Penitentiary; now you're looking at Rite Aid. It's still a fine coffee shop, but a huge part of what made it unique is gone.

I think I've tried like 75% of their baked goods and have yet to find one I didn't like.  Coffee is pretty good too.

The food is just OK. All the salads are fine. The Capone wrap and Scapegoat Sandwich are yummy. The curried chicken salad wrap is not.

Atmosphere is cool. It's a great place to come and study which is the main attraction for me, but I hear they're stingy with their internet.

I love it here.  They really shake up the shake, combining lots of different, but extremely yummy flavors.  Flavors of the day are written on a blackboard in chalk, making the ambiance fun and inviting.  The only downside is seating.  While there is plenty of standing room - and it's perfect for people on the go, with lots of street parking available - there are very few seats. 

The last time I went my date and I had trouble hearing our name called out - and ours mirrored the couple next to us.  So we rotated who got up when their name was called and finally got our correct meals.  The door we were sitting by we 'just for show', so my date and I spent hours telling people, "That door doesn't work."  I suppose we could have let them struggle a bit, but that's just not the way we thought.

Pros: Counter culture Coffee
Cons: Coffee is served in paper cups by default, staff attitude needs adjustment. 

As I was also picking up some beans, being something of a coffee aficionado, I asked the person working the register a few questions about the blends available for sale and the latest roast date and even though there was no one else in the shop at the time his general behavior was borderline rude. We ordered a couple of drinks and sat at a table. When the first order came out it was served in a paper cup. I inquired as to why would they serve me a cappuccino with a cardboard flavor when we clearly were trying to enjoy it right there. In response I was handed a cold cup sitting on the counter - no apology or offer of a replacement...

Overall the place is just average at best and not worth walking distance from the art museum. I would definitely recommend Elixr on 15th and Walnut instead - those guys know what they are doing.

business.name: Alex's Pizzeria

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}
