reviews.text: Stopped by this place to eat twice and twice I left before eating. First attempt to eat here was at 12noon on a Saturday. I was looking forward to eating pasta only to find out they don't serve pasta until 4pm. Mind you, this is not stated anywhere on the website. Second attempt to eat there was on a random Wednesday night and it was closed for a private party. Call it bad luck but this place is not worth the hassle. I shall not be back.

The food is great. So far we have had the pizza and tonight we chose to venture and get mussels. The mussels were great tasting! But... also it 
was 16 dollars and we had 10 mussels for that order. I don't mind spending the money but was very disappointed in what we got . Decent size but nothing over the top. I've had very big mussels at another restaurant in manayunk and we got about 20 to 25 in that order for about 14 dollars. We definitely we be going back but was hoping for more for the price.

We ordered for delivery and each of us had pasta dishes (polpette) and (carbonara). The bacon of the carbonara was served in HUGE pieces that were mostly fat and very tough to eat. Both dishes were fettuccine, the dishes would have been much better done with spaghetti. 

The focaccia bread that came with the meals was good but heavy on the black peppercorn spice. The spinach saltati was ok, but not worth the price. All in all, we were not very impressed with our meals.

Such a cute little find at the end of Manayunk / Roxborough. BYOB Italian restaurant with a cafe styled feel. The menu is small but I was able to find something I wanted instantly. The spinach pasta was delicious and the large size white pizza was perfect to split with 3-4 people. The blanco pizza was well seasoned and so cheesy. The service was fast and our server Sarah was so friendly. I'll definitely be back!

The food is incredible! The bread and pizzas are warm, perfectly seasoned, and soft and crisp in all the right ways. The owner is generous and makes everybody feel at home. Great quality for a much lower price than we'd expected, and they were really accommodating to our party of 18. Definitely give it a try either dine-in or takeout. It's a convenient location to pick up some awesome food on your way home. Love it!

Love love love A Tutti. Great atmosphere and great addition to Roxborough. Tomato Basil soup with focaccia is a must have. Love their crust! Very family friendly and the staff is so nice! BYOB but their coffees are delicious
Wanted to support a neighborhood spot.  Ordered for delivery.  Pizza was ice cold, very burned, and 30 minutes late.  3 strikes and you are out.  We will will not order from them again.
Hehe I love you guys. This pizza is pretty damn close to what I had when I studied abroad in Italy. Bang bang.

What a hidden gem!! Local BYOB!! Italiano to die for!! Food and service were awesome! Greeted immediately upon arrival, Sara was Very warm and prompt attentive service!! Food was incredible! The specialty bread is a must! The Chef (Paul) was checking in with each table to insure that food was delicious as ordered! Will definitely be back

Great service and super fresh food and amazing pizza. The menu is very affordable, three of us ate for under $50. They give you the best bread prior to the meal. Definitely a great place for dinner or if you just want to pick up a pizza.

A unique pizza experience off the beaten half that you definitely need to try. Thin crispy pizza with a fluffy doughy crust. The environment is a nice casual dinner setting with plenty of seating and TVs. BYOB.

Amazing deal Monday, Wednesday, Thursdays 5 to 7 pm- great pizzas for only 5$. Food is really good. BYOB as well makes it even more attractive. My girlfriend got the pasta and loved it. We have gone once a week since we discovered this place

My favorite, favorite pizza in the manayunk area. It's between this and Pizzeria Vetri for my top favorite philly pizza. You definitely need to give this place a try. The decor is cozy and service is fast and friendly. The location kind of stinks since it's on a busy road, but you can normally find close parking near Osborn street if Ridge is too crowded. This place is definitely worth the trip. Pro tip: stop in for pizza and then work it off with a walk to get ice cream at the top of Ridge Ave.

Love it here!! 
Great atmosphere and beyond delectable and delicious food!! 
Paulie is a gentleman and a hell of a chef!
Joe is kind and cooooooool!
Do yourself a favor and frequent this oasis!
It is a BYOB.

So this night started by ordering the vegan pizza with onions and peppers added from A Tutti from Uber Eats. I ordered this item as I have a dairy allergy and was excited to see a pizza that I didn't have to ask to be modified in order to be dairy free. Both on their menu and on Uber eats it explicitly states that this pizza does not contain cheese.

So I get my pizza in a timely manner from Uber Eats, and when I open the box, what do I see? A pizza with ONLY cheese, peppers, and onions. There was not even sauce on the pizza and it did not contain any of the other toppings that were stated on the menu... I also received the actual A Tutti receipt and it stated the correct order, so I am very unsure how such a big mixup happened.

I call the restaurant and they state that they will remake the pizza and have their delivery person deliver it to me as soon as possible. She stated that the driver will call me when he arrives at my apartment. So I wait for about 40 min and then TRY calling the restaurant back to ask what the ETA is. However, now their phone is not working. I had to call about 10 times for about 15 min before I can get through to the restaurant. When I finally get through, they state that they have been waiting for me to call back, because they were unable to get my address from Uber Eats. So I give it to them, and they state that it should be delivered soon.

Another 30 min go by and I have still not received my pizza or heard from the restaurant so I call back again, but of course it takes another 10 min of calling to get through. When I finally do they state that the driver is out making other deliveries, and if he was not back in 5 min that they would call the driver and then call me when the driver was on the way to my apartment. So after ANOTHER 30 min I try calling the restaurant, and "surprisingly" cannot  get through so I decide to get in my car and drive to the restaurant. As soon as I get there, I get a call from the delivery guy that he is at my apartment. I had not received a call from the restaurant stating he was on his way as promised.

I go into the restaurant hoping to speak with the manager. I told the woman that had been answering the phone that I was expecting a refund seeing as it took all-in-all almost 3 hours to get the correct order delivered from the time I ordered it on Uber Eats until the time I got the pizza. She told me that when the manager was not busy, he would call Uber Eats to get my refund, so we will see if that happens. Also, I was obviously frustrated and upset with this whole situation, and this woman at the counter was giving ME attitude. 

So now I am sitting here eating the pizza, and it is soggy, tasteless, and obviously very cold. Save yourself the hassle and go find better pizza somewhere else.

The pizzas and focaccia are amazing (so far all pasta has been too but these are our favorite) and the service is great. They were patient when we brought a tired 4 year old, even making a pizza specifically so that he'd eat it.

Delicious BYOB. Huge space, family friendly. Small but simple menu. Everything comes with this amazing bread. And the staff is anyways attentive and friendly. Couldn't ask for anything else from a quaint neighborhood joint.
First but not the last time I go there! BYO, outstanding food and service not to mention so reasonably priced. Loved everything!
The pizza is absolutely fantastic, also Paulie is the absolute sweetest - I was just passing through, but now I'm definitely coming back to try some of his Mom's famous meatballs!

Crust was undercooked. Ordered a half cheese, half prosciutto and mushroom. Got a half prosciutto half mushroom. Flimsy. Took about an 45 mins for takeout. Walked in and the place was empty. I'm not saying "oh there was no one there" and there was a table or two, there was the girl behind the counter. Period.

Also, it was pretty expensive for what I have l got. $19 all in after tax and tip. If it wasn't so close (2 blocks) I would have gone elsewhere, and in the future I'm sure I'll drive the extra few blocks for something better.

My daughter just had a first birthday party for her twins.  There were over 70 adults and 30 children.  The food just kept coming, and the staff were so attentive.  What made it so pleasant was how helpful the staff were in making sure every one was enjoying themselves. The owner mentioned that the meatballs were his mother's recipe, and they were exceptional.  In fact, everything about the experience was exceptional.  I just noticed some reviewers giving this restaurant one star.  I just find that difficult to accept.  This is truly a five star, especially for special events.

The pizza was delicious. Best pizza I've had in the area since I moved here a year ago. Plus you can't beat BYOB and a $5 happy hour personal pizza. The happy hour pizza can have up to 3 toppings and all the speciality pies are included. Personal pies are rather large in size. So we were all able to bring home leftovers. My group was very happy with our food and service. 

There must have been a kitchen mess up because we left with an additional free pizza. Something that worked out in our favor. 

The restaurant was a little hot....benefit of the doubt is that it's over 90 degrees out right now. My group was content with the temperature but we heard other tables complaining it was hot.

Update (13JUL2019). I had previously given A Tutti 3/5 based on a dinner service, and I recently attempted to give them another shot which revealed to me that I was mistaken in my 3-star judgment: let's bump that down to 1-star and dive into the lambasting, shall we?

The entire point of the hospitality service is just that: to provide guests with a good experience and to make them feel welcome. This was the total opposite of my most recent - and definitely last experience - at A Tutti. I want so badly to have a good pasta restaurant near my house, so I decided to give them another shot, and boy did I regret it! My friend and I ordered a salad on focaccia, and pasta and meatballs. Pretty standard fare for an Italian place, right?

My food - the pasta and meatballs - came out of the kitchen pretty quickly. Notably absent was a salad, which seemed odd since normally Caesar salads are pretty quick to prepare, right? We waited about 10 minutes in the absence of the aforementioned salad - and our waiter - so I decided to take things into my own hands and beckoned over who appeared to be the owner (I believe his name is Paul). Upon learning that we were missing a salad (read: on focaccia), he retreated to the kitchen to presumably fix this problem. 

A few minutes later, the salad, devoid of focaccia - Paul in tow - sauntered over to our table. Our waiter joined Paul in delivering this incorrect dish to us with a smug expression on his face, and remarked, "It's all Paul's fault!"

In response to our evident displeasure, Paul asked, "Was this supposed to be on focaccia?" To our great dismay - and I can't make this up - after we affirmed his query he responded with, "Oh well! I'll take it off the bill." (Said in reference to the additional charge of the focaccia NOT the whole salad.) What? He did not even offer to fix the dish that was wrongfully prepared. Just an "Oh well."

This was such a backwards experience, all in the pursuit of truly mediocre pasta. The cacio e pepe I received this time was as awful as ever, the salty punch of pecorino was nowhere to be found and instead was replaced by an acrid, plasticky pre-ground black pepper flavor. 

I will absolutely not be giving them a third chance, and I most definitely hope this review saves some other poor souls from sharing a similar experience. Go in grace, friends.

-- 

I have been dying to go to A Tutti for a while now because I'm very eager to find an Italian restaurant it's great pasta near me. Unfortunately, I was let down by the pasta at A Tutti, but everything else was pretty good and I like the energy of the place, so I do want to go back and try again.

Service: Our server Sarah was great. She was super friendly and gave us good advice throughout the meal.

Ambiance: I felt like I was in a little trattoria in Italy. Very authentic vibe with big band and swing music playing which further transported me out of Roxborough and into another time. We were immediately greeted warmly like family when we walked in, and I couldn't stop smiling after that. 

Food: Definitely some stuff that can be worked on, here. I will start with my sad pasta, cacio e pepe, which was bland, gummy (overcooked & stuck together), and truly unpleasant to eat. It had none of the sharpness I would expect from a dish which is supposed to primarily consist of Pecorino Romano, and I really couldn't even eat it. We also got the carbonara, which tasted good, but the egg was hugely scrambled (GIANT pieces of scrambled egg) and was a far cry from the luxurious, rich sauce you expect from this dish. I am not sure if we just got a bad night on the pasta front or if they need to tweak their recipes, but this was definitely a letdown.

We also got pizza, flatbread, tomato soup, and meatballs. All of this was awesome and tasted very authentic. The pizza was crispy - I love the dough - and had bright, tomatoey sauce with sweet, chewy cheese. The flatbread was made from the same dough and delivered crispy, herbal rosemary perfectly. The tomato soup was exquisite and was particularly tasty with the breads dipped into it! Finally, I was happy with the meatballs, which came out steaming and covered in tomato sauce.

Overall, there were some misses this night, but I liked the good food and the atmosphere so much that I definitely want to return. Thanks for the meal, A Tutti.

I can't believe that I have driven by this spot 1,000 times and it took me THIS long to discover it. Very happy I finally tried it out last night though! The restaurant is cute with modern decor and a relaxed atmosphere. It's BYOB so make sure you bring some wine. Our server, I believe his name was Dan, was attentive and a super cool guy. We were disappointed at first because the restaurant was out of a couple items that we wanted to order, such as the calamari and some of the ingredients that come in the Pasta alle Cipolle. However, when Dan brought out the focaccia all of our doubts about the restaurant faded. It was baked to perfection and we loved all of the rosemary and spices on it. Also, Dan and the cook told us that they can whip up a special pasta dish with the ingredients they did have in the kitchen. We really appreciated the accommodation and the pasta was great! The star of the show was the pizza. The crust was perfectly crisp and the sauce tasted amazing. This will be my new place to order pizza from in Manayunk and I can't wait to come back for another date night to try more of their pizzas!
This is a great place for Italian that won't break the bank. Authentic hand made pastas, pizzas, and flatbreads. Super fresh ingredients.  The focaccia is so flavorful. Also a BYOB which is great.

business.name: Thin & Crispy

reviews.text: I was craving pasta at an absurd hour and this spot popped up. Gave it a try and I was hooked. Every time I'm in the area, I always get the Penne ala vodka. Super simple dish but they got me hooked. One time they added meatballs and they were scrumptiously moist AND HUGE! The slices here are pretty solid too.
Amazing!!!!!' Will be ordering there from now on!! Delicious, fresh!!! I did not want to share this food!!!!

One of the best local pizza spots. They have amazing sause. And the free garlick note are outstanding.

The pizza is stkll good when you reheat in microwave or air fry
The owner threatens people and has been physically violent. I wouldn't eat his pizza because he is a crumb bum.
Giving it 3 stars so my review doesn't get buried, but the owner is total garbage racist POS

Been wanting to try this pizza spot in my hood and finally did. Close walking distance. I always see people in and out of here and now I know why! 

Oh yea, these slices did not disappoint! Had a pepperoni and cheese slice of pizza both last night and today (popped it in my air fryer and it tasted like yesterday!). I liked that the crust is thin and just right. Also, not too much sauce. Mmm! Delicious pizza!

Pizza after drinking just does something. Not sure if it's true that it soaks up the liquor but these slices did its job! Definitely going back!
Their margarita is delicious.  Their mozz sticks, tenders, etc all made in house.  Phenomenal food and service.  Highly recommend.

With one notable exception I feel like I live in a barren pizza wasteland, so I was happy to hear thin and crispy delivers to Port Richmond! And even happier that their pizza-specifically the Brooklyn style pizza-was delicious. 
We have tried Thin and Crispy twice. The first time we got a basic bitch pizza and wings. I wasn't at all impressed with the regular pizza. I felt the cheese was too salty and not enough sauce. It was ok just nothing to get excited about. The wings on the other hand are delicious. Definitely the best I've ever had from a pizza place. We went with the spicy honey bbq and they were perfect. 
Yesterday we got the Brooklyn style pizza, mozzarella fries, and more of those delicious wings. I really appreciate whenever the mozzarella is evenly distributed and not just thrown on top. They did a great job here with that. And the Brooklyn style pizza, omg. So good. It is like margarita pizza but on a square and sturdier crust. The sauce is delicious and the ingredients much better than the regular pizza. I highly recommend the Brooklyn pizza with a side of wings! Best call out food I've had in a while.

Seriously the only place to get pizza in Port Richmond/Fishtown. The homemade sauce, mozz sticks, and chicken fingers can't compare to any takeout joint in the area. Pizza never disappoints. This tiny corner pizza joint is incredible and it shows in what they're dishing out.
Thin and crispy is top notch. From the employees to the owner . Food is great.  Delivery is on time and food.is always hot .
By far best pizza spot in the area. Mozzarella sticks AMAZING & fingers showed their homemade touch. Definitely going to order again! Highly recommend

While the service on the phone left a little bit to be desired during Covid, the speedy delivery and the absolutely delicious pizzas made up for that. Make sure to try the mega french fry pie. It's like cheese fries on a pizza and it is as good as it sounds!

I don't get it. The crust was hard as a rock and burnt in places, the cheese was way too salty and everything slid off. Mozzarella sticks just tasted like frying oil and the marinara sauce was bland yet bitter. Salad ingredients didn't taste fresh. What are people loving about this place?
never in my life have i thrown away a whole pizza. so gross. customer service was nice but the food not so much. not worth the money!!

We used to order from these guys all the time, but in the past two months we have ordered the shrimp pesto pizza and both times the shrimp was spoiled. We will not be getting it again and probably won't order anything from these guys anymore. It's too bad.

I love their pizza! Not usually a fan of thin crust, but this one is great! Well seasoned and flavorful. Big fan of the homemade chicken tenders/mozzarella sticks, although the breading could be a little more seasoned/flavorful. Delivery was fast and maintained no-contact standards. Definitely my new go-to for takeout.

Fantastic White Spinach and Margherita pizzas. Taste and texture were spot on. I was a bit surprised by how thick the pizza was considering the name Thin & Crispy, but certainly not disappointed. I was expecting paper thin, but it was pretty standard thickness, but it still has a satisfying crispy bite. This is definitely on the go to list for philly pizza spots.

AMAZING! Their brooklyn pie is absolutely amazing. Perfect crisp, not too thick and not too thin of a crust, and the extra seasoning just make the pie. The sauce on the buffalo tenders is also full of flavor and tastes better than just the average buffalo sauce. Tiramisu is also pretty good. The order came with free garlic knots.
What a great place. Mozzarella sticks to die for. Wings are perfectly crisp and tasty. Sandwiches are full and delicious. This is our new go to for takeout!
Exceptional experience from start to finish. The Brooklyn pie is phenomenal. Highly recommend

Used to order here a bunch. Sadly they've lost their way by hiring terrible personnel. Counter person Jamie had the worst attitude over the phone. When asked to speak to a manager she handed me to someone who didn't speak English and clearly didn't run the place. Then she attempted to save face after realizing she had made a mistake but went off again after I no longer wanted to give them my business. Too many pizza places in Philly to give your money to people with poor service.

My favorite pizza place in Fishtown. They have take out only and the owner has been open for two years. Very authentic Italian style pizza. The Sicilian is truly thick and amazing with chunky tomato sauce, high quality cheese and great toppings like sausage and mushrooms. I have used the delivery service and it's only a small up charge and well worth it...and they are speedy. I usually pick it up myself and the owner always gives you a small bag of garlic dough knots for free. I use the Slice app and it is truly the best way. Prices are also very good...just check them out!

Ordered takeout. Asked for the special with no spinach. Came with spinach fully baked into the pie so I couldnt even pick it off.  Buffalo chicken cheese steak had close to zero buffalo sauce on it and the bread was a wet all the way through. After spending $40, I was left with a bowl of bland cubed chicken and some garlic knots for dinner.

Total hole in the wall but the pizza is fantastic. I've been living in Florida for the last four years and after having a more than a few pies here I feel like I've moved to heaven. I actually walk past one other pizza joint (pretty good spot) just to get to thin & crispy. True Neapolitan Pizza connoisseurs should walk the extra two blocks to get to thin & crispy. We can tell the difference.

I walked in to pick up an order and while my order wasn't finished, I enjoyed watching them make the other orders, as I was a little early anyway. The worker apologized a bunch for not being done yet, but once I got my order, I knew why this place had some good ratings! The sandwich I got was loaded with veal parm, and I was able to share it with two people with some satisfaction. The fries were large and covered in toppings. Watching him make the pizzas, I can tell that I want to order one from here at some point! Lovely local joint with some loyal fans!

business.name: Zavino

reviews.text: Visited for the first time during lunch. Surprisingly the rush must've been over, I'm used to seeing it packed and normally why I walk on by. However, I'm glad I stopped. The food was delicious. Love toppas portions, especially for lunch. The arugala salad was scrumptious (I added chicken) and the gnocchi was fabulous! Waitress could've been a little more attentive since it was slow when I visited, but all in all, great food & mood! I'll be back for 2nds and 3rds!

Very pricey for what you get. We ordered a Caesar Salad and the Casarecce and were expecting entree sized portions for the $45 we paid. Instead, we got what's equivalent to a Half Size salad and an APPETIZER size portion of pasta! Check out the pic - no exaggeration! My 8 year old daughter had the pasta and was still hungry! So if you want to get full here, you'd better be prepared to order a lot because portions are dinky!

Zavino has a great happy hour. It's 4:30 to 6:30. They have a drink of the day, beer, and wine on special for $5. They have good food specials. I tried the cheese flatbread and it was the size of their regular pizzas.  I love the ambiance inside. I took of one star because the  server was not very friendly and service is always important to me. This location is near work, so I plan on visiting for more happy hours in the future. You may run into a lot of college students, as it is on Drexel's campus.

Exactly what you'd expect from a pizza and wine bar - good food and inexpensive. Inside is clean and looks nice. Service is adequate and the pizza is good. Overall satisfied, although nothing extremely memorable about this place. Went here primarily due to proximity to my apartment on Drexel's campus. Would certainly go again if in the area, but there are much more compelling options in Center City if you're looking for italian food.

It's very hard to find a good pizza place in PA (sorry Philadelphia, I'm from upstate NY), but this was a great pizza find. Additionally, I now have eat Gluten-free and they make a delicious gluten-free crust and even shared the ingredients with me.  Zavino is my new go-to Philadelphia restaurant when I want Pizza.

Zavino has one of my favorite happy hours in the city. They have wines, beer, and a seasonal cocktail for around $5. You can get the full size margarita pizza for less than ten bucks. Their rosemary flatbread with ricotta is delicious and a huge serving. The bread comes out piping hot and the cheese is so fluffy and creamy. It's a fun dish to share. The arancini are always perfectly crispy outside and creamy and cheesy inside and finished with the right amount of sauce. Staff is very kind and you are allowed to order happy hour at regular tables. 

It's one of my favorite places to meet people after work. I don't see that changing anytime soon!

Had a nice last minute dinner here last night. Food was good and our server was very attentive. They offered still or sparkling water which was nice. We got the mushrooms & fava bean appetizer which was tasty. Entrees: We got the tonarelli w/ meatballs which was excellent. The pasta was cooked al dente and the veal/ricotta meatballs were tasty and moist. We also had the casarecce with pork ragu. This had a good flavor but I was disappointed in the pasta. It was a little over cooked. The big issue I had with this restaurant was that they sat us in a back corner and even though there was a dim overhead light above us it was incredibly dark. I'm not someone who usually has trouble seeing in restaurants but I was going to have to take out my flash light like my grandma if I hadn't found a good angle to read the menu using light from the open kitchen across from us! 
Overall I'd give this place 3 stars. The service was great. The food was pretty good. The lighting was for sh*t. Would I go back? Most likely. It's close to the hotel I'm staying at and it's open late. They also had some pizzas that looked pretty good.

I went to Zavino while I was visiting my sister in Philadelphia. We were craving italian and this was just a quick Uber away! It was a Saturday and we got there during brunch/lunch time. I was surprised it wasn't too crowded. I loved the ambiance and the decorations and there were even charging outlets and coat/bag hooks next to almost every table.

Upon seating, our server came over relatively quickly and we placed our orders. We shared the arancini as an appetizer and I got the tortellini special.

The food was delicious! However, I wish the service was a little faster and the serving sizes were a bit larger. It looked like a lot of people were ordering the pizza - they had a wood burning oven where you could watch them make the personal pies. If I went back, I would probably try that out. But overall, a solid experience!
The butternut squash pizza is incredible. Sadly it's only offered seasonally but I've never tried anything here I haven't liked!

The bar is located in University City nearby Drexel University. My friend and I need a place to wait for a friend. The bar has a wonderful outside tables, and there is a great view and space. We ordered two juices that's good, but the outside environment is great.

Yes yes yes yes yes yes. The whipped ricotta gives me life. It's light and slightly sweet and salty and creamy and so so so perfect. It's great for sharing and is definitely enough for 2-3 people. The pizza is so good too, but I def come for the ricotta. When people ask for food recommendations this is always one of the first things I say to people. 

The inside is kind of small, but once you get a seat it's great people watching and very cozy

Ate here for the first time a week or so ago and was kind of unimpressed with the food, but the the staff were wonderfully pleasant. The portions are kind of small for how much you pay. The pizzas are also extremely small for the price. The flavors are just ok, nothing spectacular. 

The main aspect I didn't like about the pizza was that it was slightly charred on the bottom crust from the stone, and the charcoal taste was getting in the way of the pizza's flavor. I also had a pasta, and it just wasn't to my taste. 

Not wonderful Italian food. Ok, but I think this place is a bit overrated.

One of my new favorite places for pizza! We had the margarita and the truffle (plus prosciutto)and it was delicious!! The calamari was also good - sauce had a nice little kick to it. The staff was super friendly. They have a great dining area outdoors as well. Highly recommended!

Great pizza. Even my picky eating daughter loved the pizza margarita. The truffle pizza is also excellent. We also had the Brussel sprouts for an appetizer. They were  delicious and enough to feed the entire table. No domestics but had really cold IPAs.

Love this place around the Drexel Campus. Good food, wine & beer and ofcourse great service. Been here more than 5 times already, will continue to visit and enjoy a good lunch or dinner. Thanks guys for keeping it fresh!!

This is an overall good Italian restaurant. However the menus are very small and don't offer a lot of the basic Italian foods like most restaurants do. The pasta section on the menu was fairly limited. I ordered the rigatoni and the rigatoni was a bit hard and not soft and fresh to chew. The Margarita pizza was very watery so it was hard to get a good taste. However the chicken skewers were very good and tasty. Overall not a terrible place, but not great either. The prices were reasonable.

Went here for a celebration dinner. Great drinks and seasonal menu items. Good food and service. Was my first time here. Desserts were also great. Good for a catch up date night with friends coworkers or spouses.

After multiple take out and dine-in orders, Zavino has earned a top spot in my book. The take out is always warm and fresh, even after walking back the 7 blocks to work. The outside seating area is so nice and in a great location; the $5 house wine helps too! My go-to orders are the flatbread with homemade ricotta and the spaghetti squash pasta. The ricotta is so good, it tastes like creamy, cheesy heaven in your mouth. 4/5 stars overall because the flatbread and pizzas are sometimes too well done and leave me tasting very burnt dough. Overall, Zavino is a must.

Great staff and food! Almost every time I've been there's been a slight wait, never too bad. Just wish they accepted reservations for parties fewer than five. 

The Margherita pizza is a must try! So is the ricotta small plate. I also really loved their brussel sprouts and eggplant parmesan. The arancini was good, just nothing special. The only thing I wasn't too crazy about that I've tried is the spaghetti squash dish. I prefer the noodles to be longer and the sauce a little less hearty, but that's just personal preference. 

Definitely my favorite place to eat in University City!

Okay, as a pretentious north jerseyite, I find it really hard to find good pizza in Philadelphia, but this is my go to pizza place. It's overpriced, I won't deny that so it's only a special place (especially for delivery). I've been told that people complain because the portions are small but I don't really mind that as much as others. Yes the calamari only has like 10 pieces on it; so not really worth the price. However def try the mushroom pizza it's super yummy, oh and they're bar is great!
The food here is delicious!  It's a casual atmosphere with upscale pizzas and other Italian food. They are extremely professional and want to make your visit great.

Came here for the happy hour. Would definitely recommend the rosemary flatbread with ricotta cheese. The seasoning was very well done, and the cheese was very soft and nice. Was a little bit salty, but still fine. The cocktail was a little bit watered down. The seasonal cocktail was citrusy with notes of cucumber and mint.

The vibe was upscale, and there were many groups for celebration. This actually made it hard for me to converse with the other person, however. The staff was very courteous and helpful.

Let me start off this review by saying that zavino in Center City is one of my favorite restaurants in Philly. I always tell people that it's my favorite pizza in Philadelphia.

I came here on a Friday night after a long shift of work. Experience started out when I asked to host if we could sit in and outdoor table for two when the restaurant was about half empty. He responded to say that if we wanted to sit outside it would be about 5 to 10 minutes for the table to be bussed (mind you there were 2 glasses on the table). We waited patiently for him to eventually decide it was time to seat us.

We ordered things that we have gotten many times in the center city location. Gnocchi, spaghetti squash, margarita pizza, and one new item to try: the cauliflower.  The spaghetti squash was the only thing that tasted even somewhat like the food we are used to in Center City, though definitely not as good or as hot. The pizza for $15 was undercooked and lacked flavor. The new Yogi was dry and instead of being in the sauce was in a ball with tomatoes at seemed barely talk. And the cauliflower was just not good. My wine was delish however. And the waitress was very friendly. Not worth an $80 bill. Unsure why the 2 locations are on such different wavelengths but definitely won't be back to this location

Party of 8 for dinner last night. Best part was the server,  Katie, who was incredibly upbeat. Pizzas were all good. I ordered beet salad with shrimp. It was a rather small salad for $12 and adding $5 for 2 shrimp seems ridiculous.

I've eaten here many times since this place opened and I always have a good experience. The food is top notch, the service is usually attentive and the place itself has a pleasing set up and esthetic. I love coming in the spring and summer and dining on their patio. It's busy enough (on Drexel's campus) for taking in the sights around while munching on really good pizza. I found myself here with my youngest, yesterday. She chose the sweet corn pizza and honestly, it was delicious. The corn was the star of the pizza, not buried in other ingredients. It popped with the compliment of chorizo and a cream sauce. We both commented about its deliciousness. We started with a ceasar salad that was slightly underdressed, but I would much rather have underdressed than overdressed, dripping in dressing. The greens were fresh and crunchy however and the salad complimented the pizza perfectly. This place also offers a good happy hour. (I've been to the Zavino in center city too and am never disappointed.) The only other thing I might need to mention is their meatballs. So good. You should try them .

reviews.text:
Yummy brunch spot smacked dab in the center of the city. Lots of good breakfast options, and a slamming bloody mary with old bay! 

Would definitely go back.

I LOVE VALANNI. I cannot even count how many times I have came here for happy hour, dinner and brunch. The drinks are the heart of this place as is the well polished décor. I love how cool, chic and fun this place is in the core of the gayborhood. The drinks always are filled with creativity and the perfect amount of liquor. I love pretty much all their appetizers, which I have had every single one pretty much. I do not like the preparation of the brussels sprouts and the mussels are always under seasoned. However the empanadas, filet kebabs and sliders are scrumptious. The lobster mac and cheese deserves its own review. OMG it is everything!!! To pay the price of an entrée for that small skillet is the epitome of quality over quantity. I just LOVE LOVE LOVE their pre-theater menu too. Its like having restaurant week all year long. They once had this seared scallop over crab mashed potatoes and asparagus and mushrooms and OMG it taste like a tailor made dish for moi... It is worth every penny and delicious in every bite. The oreo beignets are the only dessert that matters here. I have tried others and they just don't compare. I also want to give an honorable mention to the paella, it is worth the hype! I truly hope they open back for dine in soon, they are such a gem.

When I went I started with, the fried goat cheese which was delicious. I also ordered the lobster mac & cheese, and the fish. Everything came out very well and I would most certainly order it again. I love the gravy that came over top of the salmon.

Great cocktails wonderful service by Teddy but kitchen underperformed. Two of our party ordered the seafood paella and were first sent the meat paella. Two other times servers that were not ours tried to give us dishes that we did not order. Then my burger which happened to be delicious did not come in until 20 minutes after the other platters were served. Teddy was great but had to keep apologizing for the kitchen. We are not complainers and will definitely be back but the kitchen's failings didn't enhance the experience.

Valanni was ok. My gf and I had the calamari, octopus, Cuban sliders and the chicken empanadas. The Empanadas was the best thing we had. Everything else was below average. The booth we sat at was very uncomfortable. I did not really enjoy myself there.
Yummy! Very unique place. Great vibes and food. Paella is awesome. Serves 3 people - filling and delicious. Also amazing appetizers like lobster Mac and cheese!

Went to dinner with my husband Friday night.  Ordered off of pricefix menu.  Food  was ok.   Service not so good. Ordered  chicken but got salmon.  Told waitress and she wrote down chicken but put in salmon.  Husband got his food correctly, but had to wait for mine.  He finished his just as I started to eat mine.  Could've comped a drink since it was your error and I had to wait longer for the correct meal.  Waitress had a bit of a attitude with us after her error.  Also, we looked at their Happy Hour specials and when asked about them we were told that was only for people sitting at the bar(didn't see that written anywhere).  We were seated at a table during the time frame for Happy Hour.  Happy Hour is Happy Hour regardless were you sit!!!!   Won't be returning!!!

Came here for happy hour and it was very nice. The mojito was delicious but the apple gin and tonic I had was very hard to drink. Didn't taste like apple or gin or tonic - just anise?

We also ordered the truffle fries and the buffalo chicken croquettes which were both very good. Truffle fries were amazing!

Service was also quite slow and it took us like 15 minutes to get a food order in even though it was not crowded.

All in all, I would def come back here for happy hour since there are lots of drink options and it is a nice chill atmosphere. I would just order a different drink!

The inside of this building resembles a futuristic aquarium-style lair for a businessman. Everyone who works here looks hot and evil. Water glasses are tall, bad vibes are short. The paella is NOT meant for a single human being but I am literally 100 pounds and i did it so f*** all of you. We didn't get drinks but they looked nice from afar. We recommend getting the pita bread and using it as a vehicle to k-turn paella down into Highway Belly. We probably won't come back. but we would if we had disposable income. #Bloomberg2020

Would not recommend. Very overpriced for subpar food. The brussel sprouts were too sweet but the crunch was good. The lobster mac and cheese portion was too small but the cheese was well flavored. Perhaps more lobster in it would have been better. A friend had the salmon, which they said was not impressive. For dessert, I had the Oreo beignet with ice cream and a friend had the sherbet, which was mango apricot that day, I believe. Both deserts were amazing, and the sherbet was very refreshing!

TLDR: It was "meh" /ok. Food was average. Decor was underwhelming. Recommended for dinner with group + 1:1 + last minute option. 

I went to Valanni for dinner during Philly restaurant week with a group of close friends in Jan.  

Food - 2/5  I started with the Red Mussels, followed with the Lobster Mac & Cheese and ended with a sorbet.
- The red mussels were decent. I also had the chance to try my friend's mussels (he ordered the white mussels). After talking about it, we agreed the mussels were decent but nothing to really rave about .
- The lobster mac & cheese was delicious. The first couple of bites were great but as I worked through my meal, I began to notice the combo was saltier than I would have liked. 
- Sorbet - I wasn't particularly impressed by the sorbet. In fact, it was a bit too sweet/processed so I chose not to finish the whole thing (first bites are great - then too much sugar for my taste). For context - I have a BIG sweet tooth but get turned off if something is way too sweet #balance. 

Service - 3/5 - Our waiter was kind and attentive to our large group. 

Noise level - 5/10 - I consider the noise level here average for dinner at a non-small restaurant. 

Decor/Ambiance 2/5 - 
 - With it's white leather seats and bright purple lights, the decor gave me the impression of a lounge/club rather than a restaurant only place. In addition, restaurant branding is unclear. Wasn't in love with decor :-( 

Observed dress code: Mostly night time casual (i.e. nice sweaters + boots) 

Overall, I would give this place a 2 because I wasn't impressed. I don't see myself coming here again unless most other restaurants in Philly are booked. Would spend time exploring another place other than this one, tbh.
One of my favorite Gayborhood spots for a drink and yummy apps. The staff are all very friendly, good drink specials, and a great puppy-friendly patio in the warmer months.

Came in for restaurant week this past weekend and the place filled up very quickly! Their menu dedicated for restaurant week was surprisingly full of options as opposed to several others I've seen. I got the crispy brussels which were disappointing since it was mostly just loose, crunchy leaves as opposed to the full, meaty part of the brussel. The salmon was fantastic, they provide a thick filet that was truly great. The restaurant had several rooms so I would like to come back again and sit at the bar for a drink and a snack!

Slightly tacky decor and rushed feeling service but the food and happy hour specials are excellent.

Came here for restaurant week and was glad to see that they have their full menu available to select from.  The food was also excellent on just about every count.  I got the seafood cioppino and my companions got the lobster mac and burger, both were very good especially the burger.  Prior to sitting down I was also able to sit at the bar and had 2 glasses of pretty descent wine for $5 each happy hour special.  The one thing that I did not care for this place was the decor.  The dining area basically runs along the perimeter of the restaurant with a really gaudy looking purple neon light festooned bar in the middle.  

Again if it wasn't for that, the place would have been very classy and the food was above average so it would have gotten a 4 out of five for me, but the decor is so mismatched that it took away from my enjoyment of my meal.  They do have sections that are further away from the bar so if you can request that, by all means.  

Another minor annoyance was that they kept trying to clear plates that weren't completely finished.  It's a small nitpick but never the less, a little less hustle would have been appreciated.   Overall, the meal was great, but the ambiance and service was a bit lacking.

Stumbled upon Valanni as I walking by over the holiday season, was beautifully decorated so we went in for a quick dinner. Definitely a neighborhood gem, was surprised I never heard of it, albeit I am fairly new to the city of Phila. Décor inside and out was very festive. Drinks were really tasty and original and the menu (mostly tapas) were really good, nothing too original but the quality and taste were excellent. Crispy salmon was the best I've ever had ! My server (can't remember his name) was fantastic. Really nice time, definitely give this place a try.

This is my second time coming to Valanni, and my first happy hour experience. Suffice it to say, this is not a happy review. 

We start our evening at 6:30. Happy hour, according to the website, ends at 7:30. We get to the restaurant (empty, but 1 other table) and are seated, where we remain for nearly 10 minutes without word from our server. She arrives, only to inform us that only a select few of the beers on draft are happy hour--unlike the website, which says all draft beers. We place our food orders and she is not seen nor heard from for another 20 mins. The bartender brings us our drinks. My boyfriend's beer tastes like soap. The other table leaves. It is nearly 7. The menu on the table informs us that happy hour ends not at 7:30 as advertised, but at 7. Our server does not come back, and I go to the bar to put in two more drink orders because HH is now about to end. The mojito resembles a cream soda dum-dum lollipop--all sugar. We eagerly await our food!

Now, the only table in the bar, our food arrives at 7:10. If we wanted to order more food, we couldn't. I receive a plate of paella that, all things considered, is above expectations (smaller than a meal but very flavorful). My boyfriend receives two empanadas roughly the size of a chicken TENDER each. Is it customary for a happy hour to end before the server returns to the table to inform you, thereby giving you another opportunity to order food/drink? Apparently. If we had known the portions would be equivalent to a happy meal, we'd have placed three more orders in...and would have had the chance to, if the meal hadn't ended thirty minutes earlier than anticipated. All around, the service was abysmal. The food was good--not the kitchen's fault that the staff are ill equipped to handle two tables of two. Doll portioned, but flavorful. Drinks were lackluster. If you'd like to conduct a private meeting without interruption, this is the place for you. You will get two words from your server. If you want to have a low-key date night that's worth your while, look elsewhere.

We gathered here for a reunion and I would not recommend going back to this place.

I was extremely disappointed as they sell themselves as a restaurant and a bar. Being a bar in Philadelphia, I would expect their cocktails to be above average and I would expect the bartender to be able to make mocktails as well. The only mocktails this bar tender could make was a mojito with mint, sprite and a lime. 

The cocktails were below average in taste and tasted just like sugary mocktails.

The food was also average or below average in taste. We got the chicken empanadas, the Brussels sprouts, truffle fries, mussles, lobster Mac and cheese ( not pictured), veggie paella ( not pictured) and seafood paella ( not pictured).

Things we would order again: the lobster Mac and cheese and the truffle fries. The lobster Mac and cheese was rich but not heavy and extremely well seasoned. The truffle fries was not over powered with the truffle oil.

Both the paellas had no seasoning and tasted like bland tomatoes mixed with rice. The mussles had too much of the ocean taste for me to digest.

Excellent seafood Panni as the entre (perfect for 2 hungry adults or 3-4 on a diet)

Octopus appetizer was excellent as well.  Not spicy very flavorful

Oh dear. 

The real issue was how we were treated by the hostesses, who may have just been new and confused... We arrived to a virtually empty restaurant but were told they were completely booked up but we could try the bar. That happens, but I checked OpenTable and was able to make an immediate reservation...and literally all time slots were available online. Hm. Then when I showed the hostess this, she sat us in a back room, again saying there were too many reservations for us to be able to sit in the area where we could take advantage of happy hour (apparently only the bar and area behind/ to the right of the bar). When we said we'd just leave, she did seat us in the happy hour area after all. 

Neither side of the restaurant ever filled up. Literally, AT LEAST 4-5 tables immediately around us remained empty at all times, and that was only in the area we could see. What was that about?

Anyway for the actual food/ drinks...There were three cocktails available for happy hour and none were my cup of tea so didn't try any. We weren't told which select draft beers were included in happy hour pricing and didn't realize till we got the bill... assumed the bar tender would've told us that it wasn't all of them while she explained the other deals but oh well. Dining partners had multiple beers. 

Had several rounds of appetizers, and it was a great deal. Empanadas, croquettes were fine.  Servings were small so not made for sharing with a large group (ex two small empanadas). Brussels sprouts were good but it was a little odd that it only seemed like leaves so not very hearty. I'd pass on the mini paella. Fries were great... thin and delicious. Oreo beignet was good but literally just one, with ice cream. 

Our waiter was good. Clean place and nice looking interior!

Overall the food itself was average to slightly above but the initial treatment is going to keep us from recommending.

Had a pre-Hamilton meal here with my coworkers. Fabulous food in a quiet restaurant. The server had some great suggestions for small plates for our group, and the paella served last was the best in memory. In fact, every plate we had was unique and perfectly delightful. Very talented chef here. Great, romantic spot for a date night. Would recommend without hesitation.
We liked this place. We would come back. We were here for a rehersal dinner and had a number of apps and entrees that were very good. Nice ambiance. Attentive staff.

My experience here started off poor but one really good thing we ordered redeemed it. First, my boyfriend and I both ordered the cucumber basil margarita (I forget what it was called on the menu exactly). It was straight up bad. One square ice cube, TINY drink. I finished it in like 3 sips, seriously. It tasted more like a martini aka very strong with not much else in it besides the alcohol (I guess that's a good thing?) we ordered several small plates: the shrimp flatbread - small but decent. Cheesesteak sliders - very good, hard to mess that up. Chicken empanadas - fine, nothing special. Fiery potatoes - decent, but not spicy at all. Basically home fries with some meh chipotle aioli. The vegetable and hummus plate, surprisingly as it sounds, was the highlight of the meal. Came with tonssss of really perfectly grilled veggies and delicious hummus. I never would normally order a veggie plate but it was super good!

Best happy hour in town, love the square bar, so easy to talk to your entire group. Wasn't sure about the blue cheese stuffed olives in my martini, but Jazz the bartender sold me on them, OMG.  Two  up

Came here with a friend for an early dinner on a weeknight and made an OpenTable reservation. It wasn't too busy and there was a happy hour menu. We shared two things and found them to be quite filling!

* Mezze Board, $29 - The presentation was beautiful and I loved the proteins the most (shrimp, beef kabobs, lamb t-bone steak, and grilled loukaniko sausage). I love Mediterranean food and wasn't amazed by the spreads (hummus, baba ganoush, tzatziki) but as something to share on this board it was fine. Dolmades (grape leaves) were okay too and I didn't even touch the feta and olives because I was super full.
* Mini Paella, $10 - this was a happy hour item and you had the option to pick meat, seafood, or vegetable. We chose meat and it had chorizo and braised short rib hidden in the rice, it was so good! 

I'd come back to try their entrees since I was really happy with their meats. This restaurant is dark-lit for dinner so if you want good lighting for your pictures make sure you have someone else turn on the flashlight on their phone to help you out!

Did not even have a chance to eat brunch here.  Had a reservation for 11 and came in a few minutes early to get out of the rain.  Was told they are not open yet and to wait outside.  We asked, due to the rain, can we stay in the entrance inside.  With much hesitation and attitude the employee finally agreed.  The attitude was enough to make us cancel our reservation and go somewhere else.  Philly has too many good restaurants to stay and eat somewhere with this much attitude.

business.name: Zuzu's Kitchen

business.categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Salad, Sandwiches, Food Delivery Services, Food

reviews.text:
Came back and this time ordered the special zuzu's salad, Greek salad and zuzu's chicken sandwich. 

The zuzu's salad was so good and refreshing! Loved the artichokes and all of the toppings inside. I would highly recommend this. Greek salad was just okay I would skip out on this next time. Maybe if I added chicken it would have been better.

The chicken sandwich was SO flavorful and spicy! The sandwich is on a hoagie roll and is very big and filling. Great prices and great service again!

We used to live next door to this place and watched  it grow into a really good pizza shop.  Middle eastern influence with some great pizza, sandwiches, and wings. The guy who made the menu and started the shop sold it. Shortly after we  moved to a different part of the neighborhood and would order our favorites occasionally. This was our first time ordering in a couple of months. The large specialty pizzas cost 20 plus dollars , but don't taste or weigh like one. The attached picture was once one of their flagships, but weighs as much as an elios and was overcooked like a Saturday night forget me za. All in all. If I'm gonna pay 90$ for 2 pizzas and 30 wings, I'm gonna look somewhere else first. Wing prices might be high, and times are tough, but if you're making a light pie and are having a hard time, keep an eye on the oven.

I like Zuzu for what it is (see my prior review) - decent quality food at a fair price. 

However, today I ordered a cheese pizza with garlic spinach.  I assumed that meant fresh garlic. Instead, it was covered in garlic salt (not powder, salt). It was inedible. We had to toss it. Guess I'll boil some pasta?

Yesterday was the most extraordinarily terrible food experience I have had in a really long time and it makes me sad and I want my money back. Why should I order from here again? 

I hadn't had Zuzu's wings in so long and I decided to treat myself. I had just gotten off work, had the house to myself, a good series on Netflix and no where to be... 

I call Zuzu's : $15 (after tax) for 10 wings? Ok -- pricey. 

I pickup the wings, get home, open the box....

Of the 10 wings, 2 were chicken drumstick lollipops and had no actual meat on the ends; just bone and cartilage. 4 wings were so gross and overly plump that I questioned if they were properly cooked. I actually couldn't bring myself to eat them. The 4 wings I COULD eat (for $15) weren't good! They were edible, not GOOD. 

The CELERY was hands down the most enjoyable portion of the meal. WTF Zuzu's? 

Why should I order from here again?

If you are looking for an accurate pick up time or if you need a punctual scheduled pick up time, do not go to zuzu's. Had a scheduled pick up.   Was not ready and provided zero explanation.  Left waiting a half hour after it was "ready".  I understand it happens but at least an honest explanation and owning it.   Came off as their regular process.

The food is hit or miss, and the service could be better. Out of the 3 times I've been here, they never had the lamb that they said they had on the menu...they also never put my online order through the second time. Then, the third time, the wings were just shards of bone and the avocado on my panini were the smallest-most unripe slices I've ever eaten. Either way, I won't be back.

Ordered here for the first time last night and would rate the food a 7/10. My bf and I ordered a large Margherita pizza and tiramisu, which was from a different bakery. The price was on point and the service was great. Very friendly staff! The tomato sauce was rich and full of flavor. That was the best part about the pizza BUT it was not cooked long enough. Extremely floppy and needed to be in the oven for a few more minutes. You can tell from the pic that it could've used some additional time. It was still delicious and after putting the pizza back in my own oven for a few more minutes it was perfect...but I shouldn't have to do that. I read some reviews and seems like this place can be a bit inconsistent sometimes. I really did think the service was great and I would still happily come back to give this place another chance. Order pizza again and I would also love to try their Ethiopian food. The tiramisu I was not a fan of  and my bf agreed. It had a strong coffee flavor, which we liked but it just wasn't that great. I read reviews that their milkshakes are where it's at so maybe I will try that next time!

Mediocre at best. I've lived in Fairmount for approximately 3 years now and it's a hit or miss spot. Prices are fair so I will give 2 stars, but don't order and expect much. My last visit consisted of an order of hummus and two sandwiches to share with a friend. The hummus tasted store bought. It lacked substance, flavor and sadly salt. I had to doctor it up to salvage my 6.00 container. They offer pita with it - it's warm which is nice but it tastes store bought. The ratio of pita to hummus is disappointing. - would not recommend wasting your money.
I asked for an ingredient swap on one of my sandwiches and that was completely disregarded - despite me waiting around patiently for my order to be completed. I can live without this place in the future. Can't say I'd recommend the place, but if you're local and in need of food in a pinch, it will possibly do.

Probably the most hit or miss place you could order from. We've maybe ordered from here 25 times since moving in a year ago?

The Chicken Boom Boom Pizza (chicken strips, boom boom sauce, ranch, parsley) has been our go-to, and we've turned a couple friends onto it. It's maybe the best tasting pie you could have. Sometimes, though, it'll have no substance in the middle of the pie and a slice tastes like cardboard for the first couple bites. Today the pizza came without the sauce it's supposed to come with. Had to sauce it up myself. Sometimes it's cold by the time we pick it up (on the timeline they gave us).

We've had other things that are good: Buffalo chicken calzone, onion rings, milkshakes. Some stuff not so good: their bone-in chicken wings, some of their other pizzas (steak boom boom was pretty weird). 

Service is spotty. Couple times had to wait a while past their estimation to get our food. When we order milkshakes, they usually don't start them up till we get to the restaurant.

It's cheap, and usually it's pretty quick, and most of the time it tastes good. I don't want to stop ordering from there. But I'd say one out of three times though something goes wrong.

Y'all go here!! Even if it is just for the kindest service! The man working the counter was the sweetest, most polite employee I think I've ever encountered. 

Other then the service being fantastic the food was phenomenal as well. I wanted picky food as I was craving fries all day so of course I ordered them BUT let me tell you about the fried wontons I had ! I could probably eat them for every meal! GO HERE!!

Great local spot for takeout! We really loved the calzone...could feed a whole family it's so huge! The egg rolls were great and came with a cheesy dipping sauce. Chicken shawarma wrap was also so good, would not have thought pickles would add such a nice touch! Easy to call ahead and order, took about 25 minutes to prepare for pickup. Will definitely be back!

Not a sit down joint - they do have some counter service, but I always ordered takeout. They were always prompt on the delivery or the pick up time. Lots of menu options (HUGE - wide variety of sandwiches) and is reflective of mediterranean cuisine. Lots of spices & flavors, and great combos with meats & vegetables. Their speciality pizza is FIRE - comes with lamb, chickpeas and a spicy sauce. This is my favorite thing to get here. They have a wide variety of sandwiches  | lots of menu options | speciality pizza with lamb and chickpeas is amazing. Really affordable, and more than worth it if you are local to that area of Philadelphia.

The pizza is really good here, but should probably be three stars.  STAY AWAY FROM THE WINGS.  Have had a few different pizzas here and they are great quality.  Calzones are also really good.  Now the wings,  I've tried them multiple times here.  The first time it was dried and crunchy with no meat.  It's good to support local so I tried them again and they were good.  Third time even worse than the first completely inedible.

Fresh and consistent food!
This has been one of my favorite places to eat for the last 3 years. The Zuzu fries are my absolute favorite! We ordered their pizza for the first time last night and it was very good. They will be my go-to place for pizza now too. I've had almost everything on the menu now, and I have yet to receive something I didn't like. You really can't beat the prices either. Highly recommend this hidden gem!!

Zuzu's is the best and most affordable food in fairmount. When you're looking for a filling and delicious meal and the best bang for your buck, look no further than Zuzu's kitchen. The staff is friendly and will soon have your order memorized. They are humble and and hardworking and will always greet you with a smile. Zuzu's is simply zuzutastic!

Zuzu's has the convenience and affordability factors going for them but not necessarily fantastic quality. It took me a while to find something really delicious here but now that my I've found it will probably continue to order the same thing. Their steak boom boom pizza is amazing. They also have good Buffalo chicken pizza. Wraps are okay, mozzarella sticks are also just okay. They are super quick which is nice.

Excellent food. I have loved everything I've tried. I am partial to their lamb burgers, ZUZU burger which is a double mild spiced hamburger with a fried egg and an orange sauce. I've enjoyed other things there and have not been disappointed. Thank you!

My food is generally good from here. I loved the freshness of my salad however the Greek dressing i ordered with  my Greek salad was basically olive oil I would have ordered another dressing. Luckily I keep a back up dressing at my desk. I haven't had a bad item from this restaurant. I recommend it

I ordered food from their online website for pickup (lamb and beef gyro with Zuzu sauce) and went to the restaurant to pick up the food after about 30 minutes only to be told it wasn't made because the printer was broken. I told 'Dereket' (the employee) my order again in person and was told to wait 10 minutes for the food to be made which was fine to me since it would be fresher. After I got my order and went home which is about a 10 minute walk, I found out the sauce was missing. I needed the sauce since the gyro is dry without it so it was necessary to go back. Long story short, the service is terrible and the employees don't care about the customers time. Note to manager: train your employees to treat customers better and get the order right especially if they messed up and made the customer wait. However, the gyro was really good with zuzu sauce even though it was cold by the time I walked to get my sauce and come back.

TINY "wings" drowned in Buffalo sauce. There was no meat on the bone! Just bits of overcooked skin. 

The mozzarella was also burnt, overcooked, and hollow. No cheese inside the cheese sticks. Lol. My boyfriend and I loved Zuzus but they are getting sloppy and lazy with the orders. Truly disappointing.

The Zuzu Burger is honestly one of the best burgers in Philly. The other items on the menu have always satisfied.  Whether it is a quick pizza, sandwich, salad, or onion rings and fries - they tend to knock it out of the park.

On top of that, they have shown great respect for cleanliness and social distancing guidelines during the pandemic.

A true gem to have in the neighborhood - you won't be disappointed!

I don't know why this place has 4.5 stars. I ordered the beef tacos and 10 mild wings. As you can tell from my pics the food was just weak!! I know it's delivery food but there was barely any sauce on my wings and the tacos were nothing special. Also I provided specific instructions to the company on how to drop off my order and that was a complete disaster. The driver was lazy and acted clueless. Overall I'm not impressed with the food nor the delivery service so I will not be ordering from ZuZu again.

This place has been good to us.  Have ordered from them multiple times.  Have had the margherita pizza, the regular pizza, the Zuzu chicken sandwich  (at the recommendation of the guy that answered the phone bc they were sold out of the lamb gyro... this sandwich was delicious).  

It's not the best pizza or sandwich you're ever gonna have.  But it's quality, it's consistent, and for the cost, I'm not sure there's a better value in Philadelphia.  

5 stars.

I really love Zuzu's for their burgers which are some of the best in the city imo. The lamb burger and Zuzu's burger definitely carry it for me. However the sandwiches are disappointing. The Francisville flank sounded good but I was left with a small rubbery piece of beef with a horrible citrus taste that made it inedible. So much potential here.
Obsessed! The pizza is tremendous and so is the hummus platter. I live close by and they never disappoint

business.categories: Italian, Pizza, Restaurants, Nightlife, Beer Bar, American (Traditional), Bars

reviews.text: What a disappointment...This was our go to spot for years but hadnt been back for over a year...Ordered a pizza tonite which i would have a hard time giving any rating at all ....no flavor..paper thin tasteless crust... no cheese... sad...

This review is a conditional 3 stars. I've eaten at Angelino's many times before and always enjoyed the food. I've scored them higher in the past. Today however, the chicken parm dish was very unpleasant. The texture of the chicken was off and I couldn't eat it. The side salad was half of the size it used to be and some of the tomatoes were soggy. I'm hoping that today's experience is an outlier. I'm going to give them another shot and if the food is back to what it used to be I'll upgrade my score. Cmon chef!

This restaurant has some great reviews so I was excited to try it, but maybe I ordered on a busy day. I ordered the spinach and ricotta gnocchi, add chicken. It was very very salty, but at the same time, it lacked flavor. Didn't end up being able to eat it because it made me feel really nauseous. I really wanted to love it! Maybe adding the chicken made it too salty, who knows. It came with breadsticks, though, which were tasty!
How wonderful this place is! Everything is fresh and tasty. Old Bay fries were perfect!  The ricotta and prosciutto app was great! Definitely going again!

We got the vodka pizza and the Alfredo with broccoli the pasta came with a salad and breadsticks. Over all the whole meal was great really no complaints fair price great food and good service. New favorite spot

This is one of best pizza in the neighborhood and is a super popular spot. My first time having the pizza was years ago. I thought it was really good actually. The dough was soft, chewy and has nice sweet taste. The tomato sauce tasted fresh and delicious. Second time here, I had an amazing clam pasta dish with pancetta. Third time here, I had a good really avocado toast that had a nice spicy kick. Most recently, I had pizza taken out. The pizza didn't taste as good as the first time. I'm not sure if it's related to the change in ownership. Anyway, you should give Angelino a try. 

P.S. Expect a bit of wait here.
Great service. The food was quick and delicious. I could easily spend an hour hanging out there or just 20 mins for a quick lunch. Im excited to go back

Felt like spoiling myself tonight after a full 2 weeks without eating out due to my budgeting plan I have setup, sooo naturally pizza and wings were the way to go! I was not disappointed, I ordered ahead and the lady was so sweet and I asked what her favorite desert was in order to make my own decision. The walk to the restaurant was very cute and nice and they have amazing Covid precautions for pickup. 10/10 recommend if you want a yummy bite to eat!

We are from Miami, and came across this place, let me tell you the pizza was amazing, the vibe was too and the service was great. They were all super friendly! Best yet the pizza and spaghettis was fire, 10/10 would recommend anyone!

UM hello! I have never seen or heard of this place ever. BUT I stumbled upon them on GrubHub. Holy cow! So good. It's my new go-to take out spot in the neighborhood. The food is so delicious and fresh and you can tell they know what's up. Highly recommend the chicken cheesesteak, buffalo chicken cheesesteak, pizza, fries!!! Get it all! Seriously I've gotten it probably 3x already since I've found them!

We tried Angelino's for the first time and had a great experience. We placed our order over the phone and picked it up. By the time we got back to our place the food was still warm. The Cajun chicken pasta was seasoned well and had a great taste. It comes with a salad and breadsticks. We also had a veggie pizza. The crust was crunchy, thin and wasn't burnt. It had a generous amount of toppings. While the pizza was delicious I think it could have used a little more sauce (this wasn't a problem at all). We also had old bay fries and they were on point

We ordered Angelino's for the first time tonight, and it was delicious ! I loved the creamy Cajun chicken pasta and the shrimp and crab pasta. We also ordered the mozzarella sticks, and they were very good. So much flavor and great spices/ seasoning. I'm so glad we discovered this place!
Our order was ready for pickup really quickly but part of our order was wrong and their house special pizza was super salty.

Ordered on a Thursday night and our order arrived way ahead of the scheduled delivery time, everything hot and wonderful.  Would highly recommend the Spinach Salad (we added grilled shrimp that was really great - 6 large pieces of fresh jumbo shrimp)  and the Italian Tuna Salad.  We also ordered the Traditional pizza that was fantastic and still steaming hot when it arrived.  Angelino's has been a go-to pizza restaurant for us since they opened.  The "new" owners are great. Best pizza in the 'hood!

Come here all the time, food is always prepared the same way- with love. Never a disappointment from Angelino's. From their pasta to their desserts, you can tell these people love their restaurant and the people they serve. Thanks for being a staple in our neighborhood.

Literally the best place. I come here every time I'm in town. So like twice a month. Just come here. The Cajun chicken Alfredo will not disappoint. Also get the peanut butter dessert. Bomb. The people are nice. You can't go wrong.

DISGRACEFUL!
Hope owners see this!
Ordered ex cheese regular... no extra cheese, all crust... which we all know costs nothing, charged $20, tastes like terrible oil bread, crust is an overbearing fluffy mess - , wish I could obtain a refund plus delivery, all costs and taxes.  They should be sued for impersonating a pizza place.   

stay away,!  Terrible choice!

LOVE this neighborhood gem. The pizza & pasta dishes are delish- especially creamy things like Alfredo- which is what we order. 

Best cheesesteak Stromboli! 

Everything tastes homemade with quality ingredients. Our fave place!!

A review update that is long overdue! After a year of ordering Angelino's pizza, it has become my "go to" pizza spot. I have always been impressed with their crust - it's thin but not too thin and perfectly seasoned with garlic (yum). I have tried plain, Buffalo chicken, chicken pesto (so unique and delicious), sausage, pepperoni, etc.  Long story short this pizza is quality -

I have also ordered Italian food from here before - penne vodka and a seafood pasta dish. Also delicious. This fairmount/Brewerytown local spot is filled with amazing food and a great local business to support!
There are absolutely no options for gluten free. Well outside of the caprese appetizer. It makes no sense why there would be a steak/chicken section full of cheesesteaks. Very disappointed

We love Angelino's! This is a reliable, friendly, neighborhood establishment. My boyfriend and I order takeout from here multiple times a month, and we're never disappointed. There's been a noticeable uptick in business since the Barstool review, but the owners are doing their best to keep up with demand and quality (in a pandemic, no less). They aren't a fast food joint, so don't be disappointed if they sell out of pizza - that's how we discovered some other favorites.

We recommend the vodka pizza, chicken parm sandwich, bacon avocado burger, and gnocchi.

I wish I found this place sooner! I ordered a Mediterranean Pizza that had the perfect crisp. And finally...a crust with flavor!  The Mac-n-cheese balls were  on point!  Simply amazing! Nice job Angelino's, I'll be back soon!!

This is my new go to pizza spot.  You can't go wrong with there classic pie.  The sauce is good and the crust is nice and crisp.  Pizzas are always ready for pickup and delivery quickly.  The employees seem really nice.  The only downside is parking is a pain.  Overall a really solid place.

Angelino's is the gift that keeps on giving, and I love to give back to them by ordering from them! Their pizza is great, they season the crust to perfection, when your done with your slice, the flavor experience isn't over! In addition, delivery times are at least 10 minutes early. I wasn't expecting much from the wings but I was blown away by how moist and delicious they were, definitely in my top five of wings in the city. The appetizers and entrees are big portions that are both delicious and seem to go on forever. Check out Angelino's if you want to experience a restaurant who makes all their food with love

Angelino's pizza (esp the garlic crust) is a must have in Fairmount! We ordered via phone and walked to pick it up. They had it ready when we got there and the entire process was seamless. The price is reasonable for the pizza size. Overall, I would recommend!!

business.name: Basilico Wood Fired Pizza
