reviews.text: About darn time this dump closed ! Food was great until the New owner took over , fumbled & dumbed down the menu . Worst mistake ever! Went down hill after that , the cooks were great but showed sadness in the changes . Every single time we attempted to place an order they were out of something , ingredients, soda etc , smh . Clearly the owner didn't give a shit about his business  nor his employees.It's a shame such a great establishment went to waste

We normally make a large order on Fridays for our crew. We generally are extremely happy with the food, but the last 6 or 7 times we called (Roughly around open), noone answered the phone. It's a real let down when a business opens and can't even answer the phone to take orders or talk to customers.

Tried this place because I happened to be in the area and I like wood grilled pizza. This is the worst that I have ever had, the pizza was extremely salty, the crust was ver thin and flimsy. I ordered the wings as well, but they were undercooked and not seasoned very well. I was truly disappointed. If you like wood grilled pizza, do not go here.

I was pretty disappointed in the quality of this pizza for the price. It's $15 for a medium sized pizza. I was happy to pay that, as I thought it would be an unique pizza. Sadly, this wasn't the case. 

I first ordered the veggie pizza and they were out of mushrooms. The pizza only had onions, tomatoes, and mushrooms. They were nice enough to call and ask if I wanted a new topping or pizza. I choose to get a new pizza. The pizza I ordered, was a five cheese type of pizza. It was just okay. I'm sure the original veggie would have been better. 

Overall, I will give this place another try, as it's right next door to where I live. It is BYOB! Next time, I will go in and give this a try! It is worth checking out. I might have just had bad luck the first time around.

This was unfortunately an awful lunch. I ordered an eggplant parm that was pure mush. I asked for some broccoli rabe to try to salvage it. Waitress Dawn tried her best to accommodate, but the kitchen refused to make it better because I had "already started eating it." My friend got a soggy cheeseteak that through miscommunication ended up drenched in pizza sauce but he powered through it.

This was probably the worst meal and customer service I've ever had.  I paid $15 for 3 cherry tomatoes and a tiny bit of marinara sauce on spaghetti. See picture attached. I ordered two entrees and instead of calling me to tell me that one was not available, they waited to tell us until we picked up the order. However, they did call me at 8:20 to make sure I would come pick up the order before they closed at 9pm. This was extremely disappointing because the previous owners provided excellent customer service and product. I won't ever order here again.

Ordered a Spicy Meatball pizza.  This is what I received. Seemed to be a breakdown in communication from order taker to baker.  Cost me $3 (since plain puzza with meatball topping was $17 and Spicy Meatball was $20).  Mostly disappointed that it was not as ordered; however still a good pie.

This spot has changed owners (and names) many times over the year, but their pizza and truffle fries have stayed mostly consistent. The last places fries weren't too great but Basilico seems to have rectified it.  Pizza is always good.

The best part? They deliver now!  We made an order late at night when their driver had already been dispatched and they had another crew member bring us our pizzas even after. Great service! 

My only complaint is the slightly confusing sizing. Apparently the smaller size is prepared/cooked a different way than the other one and they don't do a great job of explaining the difference. Pizza tastes great regardless.

Had delivery from here last year and it was great. We were regulars at DeMeo's and that was fabulous.
Last night I picked up a chop- chop salad (always a fav) and it was a joke. It had lettuce (75%) a few tomatoes,bacon in place of pancetta and that was it!  It was missing 5 other ingredients. Super disappointing! Also ordered their rotolini. They used to be bite-sized snacks with pepperoni. Now it is a thinner Stromboli with cheese. Another Hugh disappointment. I can truthfully say it was my last visit. Now I understand why it was so empty. Still sorry to know our DeMeo's is gone for good. They spoiled us for a few years and have left us for good. Hopefully some changes will be made for the better here at this restaurant.

Extremely salty pizza. We had the buffalo chicken and it was just overall unappetizing to taste and to look at.  Tasted like it had been microwaved after it had been in the fridge for a few days. Much better options around the Roxborough Manayunk area.

Went there with my two children to eat in we sat down the waitress got our drinks then we sat there for 40 minutes she did not take our order by took orders of two other customers which came in after us. I got up and asked her why she said she thought they were there first I said how we have drinks so how is that she said you want me to take the order now I walked out with my children and went to another place to eat . Poor service the waitress on duty was horrible lost and does not know what she was doing.

There is a new owner-very nice people. The food is a little boring. The wings had no spice, the broccoli rabe had garlic, but it was sliced rather than crushed so the flavor had no punch. I could go on but it would all be the same. Not bad but no wow. Great service.

Had a great experience here! My husband and I went on 4/17/18 and we thought it was delicious. The free bread and the spread it comes with is totally addictive, the service was great, and most importantly the pizza was excellent! I love thin crust and this was the perfect consistency. Great sauce to cheese ratio, and tons of flavor. My husband doesn't like thin crust usually and he really liked it, so I feel like that says a lot!

Take my advice... DONT DO IT. Giving this place 1 star is a gift! I ordered a specialty coal fire pizza, calamari, and gnocchi. What got delivered looked like what ever the kitchen wanted to cook. They gave me a microwaved "cheese" pizza, coal fired? What a reach!! I then Opened up the calamari to soon find out the calamari has recently been replaced with badly breaded mozzarella sticks. Place is a dump... go ANYwhere else for food when in the area

Was visiting a friend in Manyunk since he doesn't live in the city anymore and we decided to order some pizza. We really couldn't have chosen a more terrible place! Not only did they mess up our order, but when we called to complain, I guess it was too close to closing time for this lazy staff to do anything about it, they told us that we just had to deal with it. Really disgusting excuse for customer service! Never ordering from here again!!!!

The food was an absolute disgrace. I ordered baked ziti and we were sent plain ziti with no cheese. I am not sure if they just don't understand what the food items on their list entails, their cooks dont u understand how to cook the food properly or they just think they can treat their customers like garbage and dont understand proper industry etiquette. You can not describe something as baked ziti then send plain pasta in sauce without the baked in cheese part. You are a sad excuse of a restaurant, you are a joke to the industry. 

NO ONE SHOULD EVER ORDER FROM HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET RIPPED OFF FOR INPROPER FOOD
Wonderful food!  The Chop Chop salad is my favorite....fresh and very filling!!  This is a wonderful little place tucked away in the Andorra shopping center!

Awesome and fast service. The food is amazing. I got a white pizza with pepperoni,  and the sweet chili wings. My mom got a pizza with sausage and meatball and the mac and cheese. This place far exceeded my expectations. Portions are huge, service is fast, food is AMAZING!! A hidden gem in the Andorra shopping center. Will definitely visit again!!

I dare any of you to go find TAKE OUT Neapolitan pizza (done correctly) at their price point. Literally I dare you. Your pizza is some of the best I've ever had. Ive been coming here for a little while but this review is well overdue. Please don't change a damn thing. Much love.

An update. Kind of boring. Meatballs good, not great.  Same with sauce. Bread not as good as it usually is. Turkey Hoagie had nice bread but turkey looked like lunch meat. But pasta fagioli  was very good.  I just miss the high end food DiMeos used to have.
Pricy, but they've got good deals throughout the week. This pizza is amazing. Perfect crust. Light and flavorful sauce. Definitely eat here

This place used to be 5 star unfortunately since they downgraded to a pizza place their quality control downgraded with it. 2nd time for takeout and they missed a prime ingredient in the chop chop salad avocado this time, last time avocado and pancetta. Along with no bread, that was asked for as a reminder. It seems like things shrink in size when it comes to take out with them. I basically paid $12 for lettuce, onion, grilled chicken, very little pancetta and no avocado. $29 for 16" over salted pizza and incomplete salad. 
When called to voice how  displeased i was.  The manager offered a merger 10% off the next order. She claims she couldn't do much more than that. Unless i drove the food back to her. Lmao! Is she for real? This manager needs to take a customer appreciation course. Sad thing i was a customer there since 2012. Totally a not run the way it used to be run. Darn shame this place used to be great! Until they sent their chefs to the mainline restaurant and hired cooks for this location. I'm no longer feeling the family love that this place originally had. It's totally lost all heart. Save your money and go to Maria's on Ridge Ave. They still appreciate their customers.

I used to love this place, but over the past year it's gone seriously down hill to the point where the sauce tastes like it's from a jar and the pasta is not aldente. We went last night and I got my favorite dish, and it was terrible. Then I read this article and it kind of sums things up http://www.philly.com/philly/news/crime/Pizzeria-DiMeo-owner-charged-IRS-fraud.html?mobi=true 

I'm so sad. We won't be going back.

Best pizza in roxborough! I thought when they re-did the store it was going to take away from the charm but boy was I wrong. The new additions of pizza are amazing. The tomato pie is out of this world! They still have their amazing entrees as well. Very happy with the new and improved PD Pizza!
Pizza is just as good as when this was DeMeos. Very good wood fired oven pizza.

business.name: Tower Style Pizza

reviews.text:
SLOP ONLY FIT FOR A PIG TO EAT!

I ordered for the first and LAST time tonight from this pig-slop dump through Slice. The delivery guy was perfect, so good news so far, right?

NOPE!

The cheesesteak sandwich was nothing like what I ordered because no one there has even half of a brain left to pay attention to simple order instructions. (More about that later.)

The only reason I ordered from this slop dump was because they also "allegedly" sold ice cream.

No ice cream left? Why don't you f*cking call me instead of sending me 2 cans of soda that I don't want.

And the Pièce de Résistance, the pig slop "steak sandwich!

Nothing like what I ordered, half a jar of Hell's Unreal Mayonnaise slathered all over the slop instead of on the side like I always order it and get it from any other place in town!

Although I was hungrier than Hell's Mayo, I couldn't even eat half of it.

If I had a pig around here, I would feed the rest to the pig. Fortunately, it's trash night on my block, so out it goes along with the rest of the week's trash and garbage!

And about the half brain-dead zombie who made my pig-slop "sandwich" and the so called "management" of this dump:

This place is not far from where I live and they sell beer to go there.

I think the cook and the owner drink the beer, p!ss back into the empty bottles, recap the bottles to look fresh from the brewery and the sell that slop, too!

Brain dead idiots at Tower, you must have drank way too much of your own p!ss tonight!

Bottom line- BEWARE of this pig slop dump!

MINUS 99 OINKS ON THE WALL!!!
Food is always late, cold and bland. Often missing items. And if you ever call, good luck! Rudest SOB on the phone everytime. Hoping they shut down soon.
I'm surprised that this place only has 2 stars. Solid pizza, well priced, quick service, and one of few late night options in the area.

I'm somewhat stunned by these reviews. I've lived in Philly for a number of years, have been to Angelo's and C+S, and while this place might not be a destination, it's pretty great for a neighborhood spot! The guy is nice and the dough is awesome. I like the tomato and ricotta slice.

Owner thought it was appropriate to aggressively scream at and threaten me at 9 pm when he was driving down a one way street the incorrect way, in response to zero hostility on my end and me reversing my car out of the alley so he could continue to drive the down the street the wrong way. I am young and a woman- I was scared and felt unsafe- he intended to scare me. We used to occasionally come here- on top of the rude and disrespectful owner, this is horrible pizza that clearly sits out for a very long time. Please do not support this business. Rione Pizza is down just one more block at 21st and Samsom, go there instead for better food and atmosphere.

Owner thought it was appropriate to scream at and threaten me at 9 pm when he was driving down a one way street the incorrect way. Also, we used to occasionally come here- on top of the clearly rude and disrespectful owner, this is horrible pizza that clearly sits out for a very long time.
Pizza was stiff and tasted like it was days old. No employee was taking covid precautions and I felt very unsafe in the store.  Would not recommend.
Super friendly service. Only accepts cash but allowed Venmo :) would recommend BBQ pizza. Especially when sauced ;) yum
Don't have anything new to say. Just wanted to remind everyone how disgusting this place is.

This place is a disgrace.  Rude service and fraudulent business practices, in my humble opinion.  Repeat offenders of no deliveries with no notice, refusal of refunds, etc.  I filed a complaint with grubhub and am submitting this review here in hopes others avoid getting ripped off/treated poorly by this company.

Terrible customer service! Pizza was ordered through the Slice app, and was quoted at taking about 40 minutes to arrive, which I understand is normal. After an hour and ten minutes slice reached out to the business and they said they were running behind. I then received a phone call from the delivery person yelling at me "yeah your pizzas in the lobby!!". As soon as I picked up the box I knew something was off. Everything I had ordered was cold, not warm or room temperature, cold! I informed slice and they reach out to the business asking for a refund. The manager refused to issue a refund for this. In my opinion this is terrible customer service, if you promise a product to a consumer, delivered as close to on time and hot then that's what should be the standard. If you did not deliver to standards then the right thing to do is to try and rectify it as best as possible; not yell at your customers and refuse a refund for ice cold food.

Good vibe place, tasty appetizers and pretty cool location. The inside is a little run down, but I enjoyed the chicken parm and the fries. Quality sandwich with good amount of sauce and chicken and cheese, and the man who got me my order seemed really jolly and pleasant.

This place definitely deserves more than 2 stars. I have only ever give in for slices but it was honestly great both times. The interior is not easy on the eyes and neither are the cold slices in the display. However, they are actually quite good after being heated up! It serves its purpose as a neighborhood quick standard slice spot for sure. I'll be back!

The worst place to ever go if you want to be treated like a human being. Wait is 2-4 hours even when there are no customers waiting. Management is very lazy and they barely even speak to you. It's the absolute worst avoid!

Honestly, think this place gets a bad wrap based on the reviews. Its your typical pizza spot - nothing spectacular, but nothing really awful either. Service is fine (I mean, what do you expect from a pizza spot?) and the food is pretty good. And their prices are the most reasonable in the area.

For what it's worth, it's one of the better slices in the area. Oh, and it's open stupid late - which is an anomaly in philly. 

To be fair, I haven't ordered delivery, only pickup. But would definitely recommend for a cheap, quick food that's exactly what you expect it to be.

This was the worst place I have  ever ordered from. Didn't follow the instructions on how to make the food. And the meat on the sandwich tasted awful. Wasted $14 dollars and will never order from them again.

Horrible service and terrible pizza.  We used to go there back in college and post-college because there was nothing else available, but after getting in arguments with the owner and staff several times we officially stopped going there.  They do not have any respect for their customers and the place is actually extremely flithy,  Never going there, event if I'm starving!!
Stopped in for a slice and a cheesesteak. I was scared by the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. The bread was great and fresh and lots of good fried onions.

Absolutely the worst food I have even eaten. My stomach would feel better if the box were filled with nothing but dog shit. Actually, even the dog would be embarrassed with this shit. The absolute lack of even attempting to make a pizza was astounding. I've had a Caesar salad that more resembled a pizza. I can't imagine anyone being so hungry as to actually enjoy this food. I would rather lick the Liberty Bell after a middle school field trip than take another bite of food from this place. Kibbles uses better quality ingredients.

Really enjoyed my cold pizza dough with splotches of pizza sauce. Oh, don't forget the toppings for my cheese steak pizza - AKA, cold meat and some cheese. And of course, i appreciated that I was given the opportunity to burn some calories going down 8 flights of stairs to get it, and then being told that my 20% tip wasn't enough. Hoping that I don't get food poisoning from this experience. To be continued.
The nastiest pizza I have ever had. Pizza is not fresh at all. Went their in the evening and just gave me old pizza. Got sick after eating the pizza.

Garbage. Ordered the signature tower special steak. I got half the ingratiates the steak came with. Called back to let them know the mistake and got greeted by the owner/manager/cook who is a complete jerk. Your delivery guy is rad and that's the only thing this whole restaurant has going for itself. Either own, manage or cook but even at that I'd say retire. Worst customer service I've had. Owner insisted I was a liar even after trying to calmly talk to him. Will never be back. Don't Or from here. Foods terrible but the customer service ruined it.

Terrible Customer Service. I ordered a pizza from this place at 1:00 AM on EatStreet because it was the only place open. At 1:40 AM I called to check on the order, only to be told that I had to come pickup a delivery order from the store. The person who answered the phone took about 15 minutes to tell me that, and refused to refund my order or deliver my food. Do not be fooled by their EatStreet rating. THUMBS DOWN!!! Basura.

Garbage. Ordered the signature tower special steak. I got half the ingratiates the steak came with. Called back to let them know the mistake and got greeted by the owner/manager/cook who is a complete jerk. Your delivery guy is rad and that's the only thing this whole restaurant has going for itself. Either own, manage or cook but even at that I'd say retire. Worst customer service I've had. Owner insisted I was a liar even after trying to calmly talk to him. Will never be back. Don't Order from here. Foods terrible but the customer service ruined it.

Pretty sure the name listed is Rittenhouse pizza. Regardless, pretty good pizza but more importantly one of the few places open late night. I saw some negative reviews but I got a fast pizza, the place looked clean, and not the world's best but pretty standard issue which

business.name: LaScala's Pronto

business.categories: Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

reviews.text: The food is ok, it's quick and in the vicinity of where I  work so this is just based on service, I ordered a chicken caesar salad and when I got back to work, put the dressing on it, the dressing was obviously bad, it was spoiled and tasted sour, so of course I called for a refund. A nice young lady offered to do it over the phone because who can just come right back? But the manager says that they can wait for me to bring it back if I want a refund, which means I'm holding onto a salad with spoiled dressing for 3 plus hours. I'm going to bring it back but when will restaurants learn not to inconvenience customers? It's not worth it, just do the refund and that's it.

Super disappointed. The white spots in the pic are the only SHREDS of motz cheese on this Margherita pizza. So, I basically paid for bread and sauce with a few sprigs of basil. 

If you're thinking, "maybe the cheese is UNDER the sauce," you aren't alone... But you're still wrong. :( 

The two starts are because the sauce is decent, and the dough is plain but not burned.

I've ordered a few times through Door Dash or Uber Eats. The orders have arrived quickly. I love the baked eggplant and keep reordering it. I put it over penne and easily get two-three portions. One day I will try something else.

The lemon cake was delicious. But the chocolate cake was too sweet for my taste, which is why I dropped my rating by one star. But, it should be 4 1/2 stars.
We had the food delivered and it was excellent and delivered very quickly! Portions are huge. Would definitely order from here again, and if we had time, visit in person.

COVID really hit these guys hard, and I don't know if they'll recover.  Complete staff turnover, cheapo ingredients usually result in another closed restaurant on Spring Garden.  Staff is hit-or-miss now, which I overlook much more easily if the pizza was better.

Nowadays, the pizza tastes more like something you'd get from the freezer at Aldi - a shadow of what they used to be.

Honestly, if you give this place a good review your taste is compromised, and possibly your brain. 

This place has a decent oven to get the job done - the dough doesn't look bad, but then they use ingredients you would taste in a pizza roll from family dollar. The cheese is the absolute lowest quality - has no taste, almost like wax. The tomato sauce is some mix of oil and something else red. Even seasoning the slices to death they are still absolutely bland.

City View is basically party pizza - but at least it tastes good. Brandywine is not gourmet pizza either, but it tastes good.  Even John's place, which has carnival type pizza has a bit of taste. This place is just disgusting grease in your throat. You'll want to spit it out the minute you put it in your mouth.

I have tried a couple sandwiches from here, and the same is true with them. Low, low quality, cutting corners. The cooks have no idea what they're doing, and the owner obviously doesn't care. The chicken cutlet sandwich I got was disgusting hard chunks with pukes of tasteless "cheese" and "sauce."

The facade of the building outside looks classy. I'm not sure what else I can do to lighten up the bashing, but after several chances, they just are consistently trash.

LaScala's Pronto you are totally terrific, I had a lovely experience here today. I've never had a bad experience with them, never tried something I didn't love. Their menu has every thing I love and I'm so excited to try it all. Very welcoming, attentive and experienced. Do not miss out, check out LaScala's Pronto asap.

The first time I reviewed from La Scala's Pronto was 7 years ago. It's become a household fav and staple since then.

Covid-era review update: they are still awesome.

Michelle P. Personal Update: I keep ordering the same things because they are awesome.

The Arugula Pizza is one of my favorite pies. Everything I've had there is serious quality. Great sandwiches, great Italian.

I'm so happy they've been in my life, especially in 2020. I've never actually been in their shop- delivery all the way.

Gave it a second go during covid. They are way overbooked- orders from every possible delivery app, walk ins, deliveries. It's a M E S S. Masks under nose. Phone girl takes mask down to talk. . Plan for your order to be incorrect. Never had Italian wedding soup with egg and chicken in it until today. And plan to wait!

Had no problems with deliver, but the pizza was not that good. I got the eggplant pizza. The eggplant was so bland and undercooked. The cheese was way too thick almost like a slab of cheese. The crust was nice and crunchy, but that was the only pro I had with the pizza. Not worth the price.

I had an Uber Eats credit and we were craving pizza, so decided to give LaScala's a try. I'd been to one of their other locations for a bridal shower before, and was really impressed with the food. 

Our experience overall was solid, though delivery took a lot longer than the quoted time. I called the restaurant at one point after our delivery window to check on the status. They told me it was on the way and, sure enough, the pizza arrived about ten minutes later.

We ordered a caesar salad, large classic pie, and small white spinach pie. This was more than enough food for two meals plus a couple extra slices. The pizza was best after a quick reheat in the oven; I especially enjoyed the white pizza.

We have ordered take out from them a few times. Order always comes early and is hot. Their pastas are delish, especially the tortellini and penne rigatoni. Caesar salad is very tasty. They give you free bread which is yum. Pizza is pretty great too!

I don't know why the place isn't more highly rated. I just grabbed a white slice with spinach and tomatoes on it and it was most delicious. I also grabbed a plain slice and a slice with sausage and pepperoni. I thought the sausage was tasty. The slices were bought around 11:35 and were fresh. I'd go back

I have been doing take out from LaScalas for years and they never disappoint. I absolutely love their salads, always amazing and large portioned. The pizzas are speciality pizzas and always delish. Appetizers always are a plus, I've had the risotto balls which are my favorite. Also, the prices are reasonable especially compared to a lot of places in the city.

My go to ordering out spot. I usually order every 2-3 weeks or so. The vodka rigatoni is my absolute favorite when I'm craving it and can't get my mom's rigatoni. Also, the dessert is to die for. Love their cannolis, tiramisu, and lemon cream cake. Pizza is solid! Really good place to order from when doing a group or party order since there's tons of options.

One of my favorite pizza places! Always delicious and on point. I love love love their sweet and spicy chicken pizza and most of their other pizzas. Their arancini balls and sweet n spicy wings are great as well. They also have slices ready to be heated up and taken to go. Highly recommend!

AWFUL DO NOT GO HERE. 
Terrible pizza - dough was cardboard and very obviously reheated. 
Gross BBQ wings - super dry and swimming in a thick gel-like sauce.

Terrible pizza - dough was cardboard and very obviously reheated. 
Awful wings - super dry and swimming in a thick gel-like sauce.

I ordered two chicken parm subs for delivery. The order came 25 minutes early and the delivery driver was very friendly. The food was delivered hot, and the overall meal was tasty. We especially enjoyed the toasted sub rolls. Would definitely order from here again when I'm craving a good sub!
I must say this place is amazing. Meat lovers pizza on point, everything fresh. Had yummy wings from here amongst other apps and everything is good every time.

Our health center orders from here often but this will be our last. Today we ordered $90 of food and both of the Mista salads had mushy, bad cucumbers. When I called to let them know the manager said, "I just went back to look at the cucumber and it was soaking in water too long. Sorry." 
Yes, sorry for you that we will no longer be giving you our business.

This review mostly reflects my experience with Pronto's pizza, so I'm still open to exploring their menu further and re-evaluating. Especially because I acknowledge that my selection when I ordered wasn't a particularly conventional pie and might not reflect how they handle more normal items. 

I surprised myself a bit when ordering and got the Sweet & Spicy Chicken Pizza. It wasn't awful or anything, but it wasn't spicy and I don't think I'd say it was particularly sweet, either! By far the most assertive flavor on the pizza was the Gorgonzola. I ordered the pizza hoping for a nice balance of the promised flavors and ingredients, but what I got was bites that were either a bit bland or a bit overwhelmed by the Gorgonzola. 

My girlfriend played things safer and got a White Spinach Pizza that was pretty good - better and less disappointing than my choice, but nothing overly memorably. We rounded out the order with fries, which were good, but, you know...fries. There are occasionally fries that wow me or appall me, but these fell squarely in the "standard restaturant fries" category. I don't say that as an insult or a knock, just that they didn't hold any real sway over how I feel towards the restaurant.

The pizza and cheesesteaks are very good.  We have been there twice recently.

I especially liked the salad.  It was very good. Extremely fresh.

I have been here several times and each visit I was left with the impression that it's nothing remarkable but does the job. The staff have never been overtly friendly, but the food was always pretty good. I was never moved to leave a negative review until my visit yesterday. The staff must have been still feeling rough from a late Saturday night out or something - they forgot my pizza slices in the oven and I had to remind them to take them out. Also, the man making pizzas behind the front counter was watching stuff on his phone for several minutes, holding the phone in his bare hands, then set the phone down and, without washing his hands, stuck his bare hand in a container of raw greens and placed them on a pizza. For me, this is unacceptable. I assumed it was food handling 101 to not do this considering the amount of bacteria a phone holds (they go to bathroom with us EW). This is a huge E. coli risk. Maybe this is how the reviewer who had food poisoning got sick...
Clean up the staff behavior and this could be a much better restaurant.

SALTY PIZZA! 
I ordered a plain pizza. Perfect texture, and thin crust but wayyyy too salty!
The sauce and the cheese were both over salted. In the words of my beloved mother, why do restaurants do that? I used to answer, it's because they want us to order more drinks... but why do that on a delivery?

Delivery was a 5/5 but the pizza was too salty for a second audition. Oh and the actual crust was salty too...Who does that???

business.name: Pizzeria Cappelli

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': None, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}

business.categories: Pizza, Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, Italian

reviews.text: THE BEST! I've been on an unexpected pizza kick the past few weeks and have been trying pizza all over the city... it wasn't until I found pizzeria Cappelli that I could say I found real Italian pizza. The crust is amazing, crispy on the bottom of the pizza but soft at the crust on top  ingredients taste super fresh and great quality. Also they sell individual slices which is my jam. Will be coming back again and again

Pizzeria Cappelli you are simply magnificent, I had an incredible experience here yesterday. What a cute place. The menu is really fantastic, a lot of excellent choices, I had to go with Meat Lovers Pizza, and it was amazing. The team was extremely courteous and service is wonderful. I 100 percent recommend Pizzeria Cappelli.
The Meat pizza was cold and the ingredients seemed like they were just thrown on after the fact.

I'm legitimately surprised by these reviews.  Ordered from Cappelli's on an inebriated whim after discovering every other place was closed early a la' COVID Ana this place was happy to take our order. 

We ended up getting a full pie with cheese only because they didn't have non pork pepperoni or sausage options (how is that legal in Philly). We went in with zero expectations and were blown away by the taste of the pizza.  The crust was the highlight of the pizza to me and the fresh melty cheese was a close second.  Sauce wasn't particularly standout but nothing to complain about either.  

Honestly I would give them 5 stars if they got some beef pepperoni or turkey pepperoni on the menu.  They should definitely fix that.

Only came a couple times, last few times the Counter guy was rude and lacks basic customer service skills! This will be the last time coming here, rather go home hungry then spend money with this type service! Oh and make sure you know what your paying for! Unless they got different prices for nighttime, i was over charged!

Horrible. If they allowed a zero I would do it. I ordered at 4:32 PM I got the pizza at 6:26 PM. I only received it after I called they said they were going to remake it but when I got it it was lukewarm so you could tell they just gave me the same Pizza. They didn't apologize but said they got confused and thought it was a pick up order.I probably would've been happy if they would have remade it but they just gave me the same pizza that was sitting there for two hours. Don't waste your money.

When I asked about "Special Cheesesteak", they didn't know! So I wondered if i should order food there  but  I just needed a quick take out before going to a concert so I ordered "Mushroom Cheesesteak" anyway. It seemed like they were making my cheesesteak out of recipe lol but surprise! Their cheesesteak was delicious. At least, better than By George on the next day. No frill but nice guys.

I had the best slice of bacon chicken ranch pizza from this gay pizza store! Yup, gay pizza store. As it's located in downtown Philly's gayborhood. There were a signs outside that got our attention so my wife and I went inside. Small little shop with 2 guys working behind the counter and they were pretty cool. The pizza was really good, I mean really good and I'm mad that I only had one slice at the time. I'm definitely going back when I'm in the area again.
The slices are a little bit pricey, but it's the best pizza I've had in Philly for sure! Maby the best I've had in the U.S. I'm from Brazil, so it's the kind of pizza we like the most!
Awful. Generous toppings but the pizza didn't spend nearly enough time in the oven. The pizza was severely undercooked. Is it just how pizza is done in Philadelphia?

This review is a warning to all non-sober customers, which, let's face it, has to be a good majority of the customers who come here to gratify the post-drinking munchies. While the food is not terrible (though also not good), you have to pay attention to what you're getting charged. I ordered 4 slices of pizza, cheese fries, and a bottle of water, and was charged $37.50. I only noticed how wrong this seemed the following day when I reviewed my credit card charges. The Square receipt rang me up for "Custom Amount," which is suspicious. Even assuming that I was getting some high quality fake cheese (hah), I was definitely stiffed a few bucks, which I do not appreciate. Stay away from this place and go get your drunk food from somewhere that will provide an itemized receipt!

Pizza Cappelli aka the homo hut pulled a premium after a long night of drinking out in the gayborhood. Either I was so wasted that anything taste good or the pizza was actually legit (we'll never know) but it's worth trying!

The best pizza in Philadelphia. The white pizza is just to die for. Mike Cappelli knows what he's doing. And they're incredibly friendly and welcoming. And of course they know how to make a mean slice of pizza. Cannot recommend more.

A group of us were staying recently at the Fairfield Inn and Suites at 251 S. 13th Street. We hadn't made dinner reservations in advance and found ourselves out of luck at all the sit-down restaurants within walking distance. So we decided to buy pizza at Pizzeria Cappelli, take it back to the hotel, and enjoy it there. (We pulled chairs together in the lobby, bought cocktails from the bar, and had a great visit!) This pizza was outstanding. About 10 different varieties were lined up on the counter, from which you could could choose slices, or order whole pies. Choices ranged from the more conventional pepperoni to the more unusual "philly cheese steak" or "mac and cheese." Each person in our group chose their favorite slices, and the guys behind the counter scooped them into a box. Most of us had the hand tossed thin Neapolitan style Supreme or the Pepperoni/Sausage. I had the White, which was baked to perfection with the delicate seasonings and parm flavors. The sizes were enormous! The guys at the counter were super friendly and helpful, describing all the varieties, and being patient with our large group. I would love to stop by again!

they have good pizza but its super annoying when their posted hours say 11am and by 1130 they still aren't open, this is an almost daily thing as well. if you guys aren't going to open when you are supposed to then change your posted hours.

It was my first time at this place. I was in the neighborhood after bar hopping in Gayborhood and was craving pizza. My friend recommended this place and there was a line out the door so I figure it must be a good place. I must be spoiled by my favorite pizza spot in St Pete and Clearwater, Florida because this place was a disappointment. I ordered the sweet chicken pizza based on the employee's recommendations. I was disappointed because I could hardly taste any tomato sauce or cheese. One slice costs $4.50 plus tax which isn't bad but I was disappointed that the pizza fell flat of my expectations of a hot, gooey cheese pizza fit for a night out after drinking.

After being a repeat customer for years, for the 3rd time in a row no cheese or peppers with delivery.  Additionally pizza was stone cold hard and cheese cooagulated.  The restaurant's response was (I am copy and pasting) "the address was a little too far and also they were pretty backed up with quite a few orders and that is why the food was late. Unfortunately they were not really able to offer any sort of discount for the food."

Horrible. Ordered from our hotel. Took almost "2" HOURS for our food to arrive!!! 1 hr 40 minutes to be exact. The pizza was cold (surprise) & so bad. Like bad doughy school carnival bad. The wings were fatty & tasteless. Ordered 2 orders & threw them away. The oil fryer was broken -? So they didn't have fries, onion rings or anything like that as an option. 
They deliver late night so it's tempting but ps so does Domino's & the people that ordered from there were eating way before we were !!

Product is excellent; Delivery service TERRIBLE. Ordered pizza and salad at 12:30am, out for delivery in 30-35 mins (awesome!) however delivery service took 40+ mins with my food to Residence Inn on Penn square (major hotel 3 blocks away). Four phone calls. The driver was lost/didn't know where to deliver...umm hotel front door-seriously?!!  Can you imagine my pizza after 40+ min ride? This must be fixed. I'm contacting management as poor delivery negatively impacts business.

The restaurant seems to advertise for late night pizza. We requested a Hawaiian pizza around 12:30, it did give a reasonable estimate of 45-55 minutes. We finally got a call a few minutes around 1:40am. We went down and got our pizza, when we returned and opened the box we found a white pizza with spinach, black olives, tomatoes, and cheese. Absolutely not what we ordered. I will not be ordering from the establishment.

Would not recommend this spot to anyone...Staying at the hotel around the corner from this spot. Waited an hour and half for the pizza to be delivered. First time they brought the wrong order. Second time, they brought a cold pizza and the wrap which wasn't wrapped at all. Never again........if I was hungry, Ive lost my appetite!!
Hard to find good pizza in Center City so I didn't expect much. THIS IS THE BEST PIZZA IN PHILADELPHIA!! So many options too. Highly recommend.

WORST pasta I've ever had. Ordered the penne vodka, the sauce was as liquid as water and tasted equally as plain. I was having a bad day and this tipped me to the point of actually crying. I had added chicken and the chicken was actually inedible. I also ordered the cheesy bread which tasted like straight chemicals one bite and I had to throw the entire thing out. This is the first yelp review I've ever left, that's how bad my experience was. DO NOT EAT HERE I should've known that any place open until 3 am would be trash but I was hungry. Still in genuine shock they thought this was okay to serve to people...

I was eating outside with my fam and was completely disappointed in the food, I remembered walking passed, so I got my happy ass up and left them to get me a slice. No going to lie I was pretty twisted but the cheesesteak slice was bomb, it wasn't hot/hot but warm. Idk what goes on in this city but y'all do not like your food hot...like can I get some steam, please. Anyway, it was 6 dollars which is rather steep IMO but I had pretty much spent 100 bucks on weak apps and drinks at that pretentious ass spot down the street so what was 6 dollars at that point.‍ I'll be back b/c I have more Moscow Mules to drink and drunken pizza mistakes to make. ‍

Idk what's with all the bad reviews? We ordered through Uber eats late as hell on a Monday night I believe around 12:30am-1. If you're having issues with their delivery time maybe try doing Uber eats because we got our pizza in less than 30 minutes and it was hot when we received it. 

Onto the pizza, I read the good reviews before ordering and saw that the buffalo chicken pizza was the best in a 75 mile radius. I am the pickiest buff chick pizza eater in the world because there is always way too much of one thing and not enough of the other. Not here. First of all, to do their pizza with ranch instead of blue cheese was already a way into my heart and then add the fact that it was equal parts buffalo, ranch, pizza, and cheese. It was to die for. My boyfriend and I got one pizza. I'm usually a 2 slice kinda gal - I ate 3 - and he ate the rest in one sitting even after me telling him to save a slice for me to eat in the AM. 

I'm craving this pizza already. I live 2.5 hours south so I can't have it but seriously if you live close, just moved to the area, or are just visiting like we were get this pizza!! It's worth every penny including the Uber eats delivery fee.

business.name: Santucci's Original Square Pizza

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {u'breakfast': False, u'brunch': None, u'lunch': True, u'dinner': True, u'latenight': False, u'dessert': False}

business.categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text:
In efforts to find a replacement for Angelo's, we found Santucci's through handy dandy Yelp! 

I drove up and assumed we could only order through phone for takeout. So we did. I got the marghertia pizza personal. 

I went to go inside and grab my food, and saw they were open! We asked if we could sit inside with our meal, but they rudely said no and that we had to order inside to be able to sit inside. Didn't know what difference it would've made considering it was empty. We ended up eating in the car. 

Onto the food- this is legit my favorite pizza! The crust was the perfect amount of crispness. The sauce was saucy. I prefer a little liquidity than tomato flavored. It was excellent. The proportions for bread, to sauce to cheese was on point. 

I came home with my leftovers and couldn't quite get the same level of crispy. 

Downgraded a star because of the rude staff.
Always the best and our go to.  Cheesesteaks are amazing and the pizza is on point every time.  Love this place.   Just go back to the old mozz sticks please.

WOW.   first of all, the people are over the top nice.  If I lived in Philly I would there everyday.

The Works pizza was fantastic.  The fries were the largest size I have ever seen.

I love this place and would get back every chance I could.
What happened? This place used to be THE pizza place. Incredibly sad to see this legacy going downhill. Absolutely no care for the customers, the atmosphere, or the product anymore.

Tried pizza from this joint! Thicker crust than NY pizza and extra saucy. We had The Works and the Buffalo Chicken. The Works had a new taste with every bite between the pepperoni and sausage. The onion and peppers cut diced gives a nice fresh crunch with the bite. The buffalo chicken smells like buffalo sauce but not as spicy and there is very little chicken on the pizza. For the price, I feel there should have been a little more. 

I enjoyed the taste and it hit the spot. Check out the pizza here for sure!

It's square.
It tastes like a good pizza.
It's a thinner crust that I assumed.

Nice 'hood too.

What a shame. TERRIBLE customer service all around. This is the third time I've waited for over 2.5 hours for a delivery after being told it would come within the hour. I've been a loyal patron for over 3 years - I think the pizza tastes good but the customer service is so horrible, I'm unfortunately not ordering from here again. There's only so much disrespect you can take and I'm appropriately fed up. It's now been almost 4 hours since I called to place my original order and I still don't have my pizza.  The woman who took my order has told me she's "too busy" to help me, that her manager would call me back (still waiting for that call after 1.5 hours), and that they'd expedite the re-delivery of my pizza since the delivery guy got lost 3 times. I called back to check on my order since it had been over an hour since I last spoke to her and she told me my order had been deleted so no pizza was coming?? She then proceeded to tell me, the customer, "I don't have time to argue with you" and promptly hung up on me. WOW. Zero apologies. Zero empathy tor their poor service. Zero acknowledgment or accountability of their mistake. I will never recommend this Santucci's to anyone. You're never going to make money with this type of attitude towards your customers. Do better.

This was the best pizza I've had in recent memory. I ordered a customized personal (9") square pizza with spinach, green peppers, onions, green peppers, tomatoes and olives. For a "personal" pizza, this thing was huge. I had no business eating the entire thing, but it was just too good not to. The crust was hefty enough to hold in place, the cheese, red sauce and toppings. It was lightly charred in spots which added a nice crunch to offset the veggies. The hidden mozzarella cheese was subtle compared to the sauce and toppings, but it offset the sweeter notes of the sauce. Speaking of which, this was one of the most flavorful sauces I've had on a pizza. It was tangy, rich and seasoned perfectly -- yet it didn't overpower the other ingredients. It was all so good. Unless you're feeling ravenous, I'd definitely recommend splitting the personal size with someone.

This family owned Italian spot is my weekly go to. They consistently make phenomenal dishes that leave your taste buds wanting more. The one time I had a large order and the young woman walked my food out to the car for me when I was capable of doing it. They go above and beyond - you can feel that they are genuinely glad to have you at their restaurant and provide you with a phenomenal cuisine experience. Thanks Santucci's!!!

Ordered on Grubhub from this trash ass establishment a small plain cheese pizza and some incompetent pizza maker made an era and put pepperoni on my pie and instead of correcting the era completely!!! Continued making it as is!!! I'm Muslim and don't eat pork at all!! The manager and the order girl showed no care at all and barely apologized for this major era!!! I'll never order here again and will never suggest it to anyone!! Racist ass trash establishment!! If I could give 0 stars I would!!!

Bought a margharita pizza and was so disappointed. Ripped pieces of sliced deli cheese, chunky large tomato slices and nearly any basil. The crust was good and I'd try it with a different pie but seriously felt so gypped over this pizza. Also, prices are higher than on the menu.

Meant to write this months ago when I ordered Sunday takeout from here whilst a little hungover and craving grease and cheese.

Got the buffalo chicken pizza and the short rib gravy cheese fries.  The pizza was far too expensive for the size and taste.  It played better as a white pizza with some hot sauce and chicken on it, but I wouldn't call it a buffalo chicken pizza.  The fries, however, were ON POINT.  As stick-to-your-ribs as it gets.  Heavy forkfuls of short rib braised all day like at Grandma's house, mounds of melty cheese curds, a generous slathering of brown gravy, and fries that gave out a little bit under the weight of all that good good (gravy cheese fries aren't supposed to be crispy!) 

If you're into that whole tomato pie business (i.e., ketchup on bread), have at it. Apparently they do it the best. For me, I'm sticking to those fries.

Placed my order at 11 am. Took 1 hour & 40 minutes (40 minutes later than I was told) to deliver my very small lunch order to a meeting at a doctors office that started specifically at 12 pm. Meeting was awkward as everyone was waiting for food and doctors and nurses were left with only five minutes to eat before they had to start clinic again :(
The service is horrible, delivery time can go over two hours, but the pizza is unique and pretty good.
One of the best pies in Philly.  If you're looking for something really fancy, this isn't the place.  But they nail the basics.

I got a large pizza with onions, green peppers, long hots, and extra cheese. The pizza was average there was really no flavor to the pizza. I wish the sauce would have been more tangy. I really couldn't taste the sauce it felt like it was just on there. When I called to order my pizza the person who answered the phone left me on hold for 20 mins and didn't even say please wait. So when I went in to pick up I thought they would be busy but they weren't. Other wise the pizza was alright.

Got take out from here after moving into the neighborhood, and honestly I'm shocked this place doesn't have a better rating!

Ordered online which was easy and got a text saying our pizza was ready. Not a massive selection of pizzas I suppose, and its  not really the fancy stuff you might get at many center city pizza joints, but its got what you need. We got a veggie pizza with shrooms, broccoli rabe, extra cheese and some other delicious things. The sauce goes ON the cheese which was weird to think about but this pizza was AMAZING. Honestly, the crust was probably the best part. Ever so slightly crispy on the bottom, fluffy, and great flavor. The sauce also had just a hint of sweetness which was great. We also got an apple and gorgonzola salad which was a surprisingly massive helping, and delicious too. A very nice mix of flavors and not heavy on anything in particular. The pickled onions were an especially nice surprise. 

Didn't take us long, but I think we found our neighborhood pizza joint. Check them out for sure! Just don't get delivery cuz it seems like thats most peoples problem with the place?
Very good square pizza and the blonde girl in the front it's beautiful and very sweet. Will def go back whenever I'm in Philly again.

It's a staple. Good basic food. I take umbrage with the onion rings lately. $9 for a 6 overcooked almost burnt rings ain't a good look. It's happened the last two times I ordered them. Not ordering them again. Also bring back the sunny side flat bread.

Disappointing. This place used to be my go to when I wanted to treat myself to a pricier pizza. I haven't been in about a year and it's drastically changed. I'm genuinely shocked at how the quality has declined. Also, i had a cheese pizza with spinach added, for the amount of spinach added for the extra cost I could've just bought a bag of spinach, sauteed it in garlic and olive oil, and added as much as i wanted to the pizza (they really skimped). Probably won't be returning as I don't think what they're currently selling is worth the price. I'll stick with randazzos.

I wanted to try their tomato pie and give them some business during all the covid craziness.  I ordered on grub hub and waited an hour and a half.  After the delivery time came and went I called the store and they said their store doesn't deliver to my address.   However the order wasn't cancelled and I got no notice.  The store didn't notify me in any way that the order was cancelled or wasn't being delivered.  The person didn't even say sorry on the phone.  I had to go through grub hub customer service to get it formally cancelled and refunded.   I ended up cooking at home.
Pizza is a sold 4 star. Very impressed with the red sauce . Wings are good but the mild ones need more flavor and they need to give more blue cheese

My personal favorite pizza in Philly. I've only ordered delivery from them so I can't speak to dining in. Note: they're cash only and no-nonsense, so don't expect big smiles and exchanging pleasantries. I'm from the Northeast so I'm used to it, but I've also never personally had a bad experience with service.

The only thing that isn't stellar is that the pizza sauce is inconsistent at times; sometimes the sauce is perfect and sometimes it's a little too salty depending on the day. But hey, that's how you know they make it fresh, right? Wings and fries are okay. The cheesesteak was surprisingly good considering they're a pizza place.

I can not believe the service here it might be the worst I have ever had the attitude I got from the waitress and then the " manager" was the worst thing I have ever experienced they were so ignorant and they had such a condescending and dry sense of humor which I the customer who was with his 2 little boys experienced so

Got Santucci's for the first time tonight after its been recommended multiple times to us and it did not disappoint! The pizza was very flavorful and toppings were seasoned well.  The ratio of sauce to crust was perfect as the crust was not soggy and had a nice crisp! The price matches the quality of pizza and really fills you up.  Ordered online due to COVID and the pizza was ready in less than 20 minutes.  It's our new pizza spot in Philly!

business.name: Picanha Brazilian Steakhouse

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}

business.categories: Buffets, Steakhouses, Barbeque, Brazilian, Restaurants

reviews.text:
So in love with the new design! 
And remodeling.
Unfortunately the meat wasn't as good as used to be .
New salad bar; is awesome!
The hot pans area are delightful with 4 variety of soups .

Let me tell you something Juicy about this place. This is a review about a restaurant so the most important thing for someone to review a  restaurant would be the overall experience from the food and drinks to the service that was provided. First of all, the food (Brazillian rodizio) are one of the best in Northeast Philly in fact I personally thinks it's the best in the northeast Philadelphia compared to Bronco steakhouse and taste of Brazil. All the waitresses and waiters are very professional so you wonder why I gave this place a one star review? Okay, so I m not a new customer at this restaurant in fact i ve been here numerous times but the last few times it really got me extremely disappointed. Beware of the cashier when you pay them. They will always expect you not wanting your change back no matter how much it is or even worst they will give you the excuse of we don't have any change and kept it for themselves. These incident happened over and over again with me and my family so if it was just one time then I can understand but numerous of times I don't think this was a mistake or coincident. If the owner knew about this and still let the employee do whatever they want then shame on this business establishment. If the owner doesn't know about this then that mean there's awfully a lot of silent partnership here.

SCAM: DO NOT COME HERE. 

I have been to this location over 20 times in the year before COVID began when it was a beautiful hole-in-the-wall restaurant with incredible food, service, and passion. The price was mid 20s.

It is a shell now. 

They charge 39.99 now, the waitresses don't come around (wasn't busy), the meat is TERRIBLE (over cooked), and all the side dishes are stale and left out. 

Worst part is that they just try to dumb burnt meat on you. Medium rare? Here's well done. Medium? Here's well done. Rare? Here's well done. 

SKIP this place. No longer worth. They had the audacity to scoff at us after we tipped only 15% (waitress NEVER came to the table after first sodas).

If you want the best bang for your buck, this is your place. It might not have as many cuts as Fogo or Chima but the cuts still tasted good. You also have the option to pay for food by the pound. The location is BYOB so we brought our bottle of wine.

This place is an all time favorite of mine. The staff are great and very accommodating, they make you want to give them your business. The food is fresh and extremely tasty. There's a lot of variety to choose from and you can't make a wrong decision. I always get my food to go because of my work schedule, but sitting down and with your family and friends will give you the best dining experience.

La mejor comida en mucho tiempo porque en NY es difícil encontrar una buena picanha en su punto, el chorizo rojo estuvo muy bueno, los sides     Muy bien preparados  como la lasagna de pollo, el arroz con camarón, las ensaladas los vegetales, el pan de yuca etc etc.

Volveremos nuevamente de seguro. El flan es muy rico, lo he probado en otros lugares sudamericanos en NY y tiene un toque especial, realmente nos gusto a toda mi familia y eso que tenemos gustos diversos. Los precios son muy buenos. LO RECOMIENDO.
Traditional Brazilian rodizio at 1/2 the price of Fogo de Chao. BYOB so plan on being there a while.

My husband and I visited this establishment because it was close to our home and the reviews were good. I must say, we weren't disappointed. The buffet looked as delicious as it was. My only issue with the buffet was that the food should be labeled. I had to ask other patrons,  who were also in line at the buffet, what was the names of the dishes. Also, it definitely is a cultural thing because I've never seen potato salad made with peas and carrots. Also, the raisin and carrot salad was garnished with those crunchy fried onions. Both items must be delicious because multiple patrons were enjoying them. 
The atmosphere was great and the dining area was very cozy and clean. The wait staff was very attentive and worked really hard. There were maybe four waiters/waitresses and they served the entire restaurant. 
I do wish that the drinks and dessert was included in the price.  I love the pay by the pound option. I will definitely use that the next time. I only had one plate of food and I was full. The food was absolutely delicious. I will definitely return and I definitely recommend this restaurant.

I like this place! I haven't eaten inside yet only takeout but man the food is flavorful! The price is okay. Love the pork sausage they offer and the sides they have especially the potato salad. This is our go to place when we don't want to cook anything Friday or Saturday nights. Just grab a plate, pack it up and head out. Staffs are friendly and helpful, place is clean and organized. Go try them out you won't regret it!

I have been to Pichana several times and have never been disappointed. The buffet has many options and the meats are always fresh & flavorful. The staff is super friendly and attentive to their customers. 

The only reason why I give Pichana 4 stars is because they do not always give you the degree of doneness that you ask for. 

If you love meat, I highly recommend this spot. The atmosphere is great -- spacious with a rustic feel. Their special hot sauce is also worth trying (if you can handle the heat.) You cannot beat the price point considering what you get.
Shady business dealing with weighing your food. They set up a new scale and did not account for the plate, virtually doubling everyone's bill. Watch out for this place. Will not be back.

The food here is delicious but sometimes you wont get the exact doneness you want for your steaks. They basically give you whatever they have at the moment. However its still delicious. My favorite are the sausage, chicken and the picanha. They also have a hot sauce that really compliment the chicken. 

4 stars because the only time you see the waiter is when they seat you down. Will have to wave the waiter over for extra water.

My aunt who is vegetarian, recommended this place! She lives in west philly and came all the way to the northeast to meet us for dinner. I have tried fogo, Chima and Nabrasa and I would highly recommend this place. Prices are very reasonable. I believe the all you can eat is $31.99 on the weekend per person. Or as others have said you can pay by pound which none of the other Brazilian steakhouses offer. Restaurant does seem to be newly remodeled and has a nice contemporary look but still stuffy or pretentious. Servers are very friendly but English is definitely not their forte. They tried though and it worked out. 

We opted for the per pound because I didn't want to roll myself out so they do not come to the tables with the meats when you choose that option. You instead are all self service including the salad bar and you go to the meat carving station and tell them which cuts you want. Salad bar was much smaller than other restaurants but had a nice variety of options and they tasted good! Meats were well seasoned, may be a little salty for some palates so if you want less salt def do ask for an inside piece and not the first cut. We tried a little of everything, the top sirloin was my favorite cut. 

And thank you fellow yelpers for the tip on bringing your own rum. I did and the restaurant did make a pitcher of capirinha with it  only thing it was a little too sweet would ask for less sweet next time. I only brought the rum, they supplied everything else to make the drink. 

4 people who left full, With coffee, tea and sodas (not included with your meal) and one dessert (flan, delicious!) was about $80. Not bad at all! Will definitely be back. 

Helpful tip for the restaurant, please label the sides at the salad bar. Most of the time I wasn't sure what I was eating exactly and asking the waitstaff to explain was hit or miss. Other than that great job!

Self serve which is different than fogo and it can be intimidating when you approach the steak section and the waiters ask "what do you want" when I wasn't sure what was offered. The food buffet is good with tons of options and the steak was great. I'd recommend going on a week day because it's like 25$ all you can eat. Small inside and I had a hard time finding parking but was definitely worth it.

Me and my family went here the food is amazing and fun when they come to table and ask you if u want this steak and they got a lot of different ones also the only thing is annoying you have to ask them if they can bring out the chicken or grilled fruit also we couldn't understand what the lady was explaining to us bc she was not speaking loud so we asked for a drink menu to see the different ones

Picanha has been making improvements over the the last few years. They went from basic little dicey restaurant to now this now cool nice looking restaurant with character. The prices are creeping up too! Hopefully they don't price themselves out of my household or we may not return. They have expanded theirs salad bar with more options. They have this practice of putting the containers/bowls on the counter in front of the bar which means people are able to talk and reach over the items and that is too much access for bodily fluids to fall in or spray the food. I do not select from those bowls. 

On the other hand, those meats: sirloin, filet mignon, short ribs, bacon wrapped chicken, garlic wrapped, Brazilian sausage and sometimes pork spareribs all grilled. The meats are so yummy! If you do not eat meats they have a few side items like grilled eggplant, Caesar salad, other salads, black beans, pink beans, white rice, sweet plantains, fried bananas, watermelon seasonally and more. 

For those who like a little stinky drink you may byob.

Back to standards and the guys cooking the meats are very open about how well cooked it is. I appreciate honesty and their pave dessert. I've gone back a few times since my last receive and after 3 visits they are climbing back up...again.

I used to love coming here. Over the last 8 years or more, this was one of my favorite places. Byob. Good service, options of by the pound or all you can eat. We go there so often, the mangers, cooks, and staff all were all friends with us. Maybe it was because we were the loud drunk ones, always going in there with handles of Jameson n parties of 10 or more.  But it all went downhill a few months ago, they changed the staff and the new cooks just didn't perform as well as the old ones. Came for a friend's bachelor party, Saturday night, we had 25 people and the restaurant was crowded. All the meats were burnt on the outside and too charred to eat. I know for sure the old cooks would've done a better job. I thought maybe it was just a busy night so I went back on a Wednesday with a friend. Wasn't too busy but still, all the steaks were burnt again. Sad to see how one of my favorite places went downhill so fast.

Came here with a large group of guys for part of a bachelor party. We thoroughly enjoyed it here. The service was excellent and the food was awesome. Don't let the surrounding area fool you. It's definitely worth going to overall the place was clean and had a great selection at the salad bar. What I did not like was dessert was not included with our meal it was extra and we weren't told that. When a few guys went up to select the desserts the guys behind the dessert bar were telling us what to take and pushing extra desserts on us. They did not tell us we were being charged for everything they were handing us.  Could have gotten 5 stars but the sketchy dessert bar practice ruined it.

Awesome. Awesome. Awesome.
Great food, atmosphere, and service on our first visit.

I will be back and I'm telling my friends.

Service was horrible. We had a birthday party of over 40 people there and we had to consistently ask for water. It took them an hour just to bring out on pitcher of water. Then I ask the waitress for a pitcher of soda she just rolled her eyes and left. Bearly any meat service was provided. When I expressed my concerns to the manager the were dismissed and she just started talking to someone else in the middle of me speaking. We will never come here again!

This is probably my favorite Brazilian steakhouse I've been. The meats are so fresh off the grill and Smokey delicious. The buffet style sides are a variety that is complimentary. You can pay one price for all you can eat about $30 or you can pay by the weight you eat and I typically eat 2 pounds that rounds up to about $20. Definitely try the sausage and the garlic steak! Those are my favorite! Don't make the mistake I made the first time I came! I filled up on the salad bar instead of the meat, such an American mistake haha! You go there for the meat so eat more meat !!

Service and Food was Awesome!! Fresh different and much appreciated!!! Excellent sides quick service and resonable price ... Usually Brazilian Steakhouses dont have good sides but this place was great and fresh ...

The salad bar is amazing, variety of different delicious salads the 2 stars is for the salads. We had the all you can eat for the price it was not worthed only 4 differents kind of meat, not tasty, no chimichuri to goes with the meat 31$ too expensive for nothing. I was on vacation and give this restaurant a try

This was the first "budget" rodizio I had ever experienced (more years ago than I care to admit) I got that there would be no bacon wrapped tenderloin like a Fogo, but there were a good assortment of meats offered, and it had a "diner-like" charm.  The meats being cooked over REAL wood fire (and the quality of ingredients being essentially the same as the fancy places made this a great bargain at the original price (around $15.) 

Subsequently, I had been splitting my rodizio visits among this place and its newer competitors. The place remodeled a while back, and looks much more upscale (though still not "fancy.")

Decor aside, the majority of us go to these places for a rodizio meat orgy. Last night (2/21/19) a half dozen of us visited and walked away less than thrilled.  The salad bar was well-stocked, with good stuff .. fresh veggies, salads and the usual Brazilian specialties.  However, just because the name is "Picanha" doesn't mean that's all we expect to eat.  We were proffered a "garlic steak" of undetermined cut first .. all well-done.  Subsequently, with the exception of one pass with well done alcatra (top sirloin) and a number of linguica (sausage) sausage and dry chicken thighs, 90% of the meat was Picanha.  Granted, some were tender and delicious, others just so-so, there was no skirt steak, no beef or pork rib, no lamb,no fraldinha or maminha... you get the idea.  The "baby" picanha were just small (and thus well-done) pieces of ...you guessed it .. picanha.

Service was friendly, and for the most part, meats kept coming.. for awhile... after an hour, we sort of experienced a long lull until we were presented with ... more picanha.

With the prices topping $30, the bargain doesn't seem so much a bargain compared to some of the "mid range" rodizios popping up in the suburbs.  Sad to see, because the potential is still there.  Maybe weekends they pull out more variety?  

Anyway, if you are an old fan and haven't returned in awhile, lower your expectations.  If you are fine with a feast of rump meat with a nice fat cap, you can get your money's worth.  If you are expecting the variety associated with a rodizio meal, you'll be disappointed.

business.name: Chima Steakhouse

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}
