business.categories: Brazilian, Food, Desserts, Restaurants, Barbeque, Chinese, American (New), Dim Sum, Steakhouses

reviews.text: One of the best Brazilian steak houses. Meats are grilled in perfect texture with right amount of salt. Severs are very well-attentive and knowledgeable regarding meats and wine. Specially thanks to Cameron for awesome service. One area if they can improve will be being less messy when they cut meats. Thanks for great dining experience.

The hostess seemed a bit rude, and did not answer my question. I also seen a mouse run across the lounge/waiting area. Even though I seen it, we still decided to stay and eat here. The food was good overall but the salad bar needs to have better selections. Our waiter was wonderful. I like Fogo de Chao better

The service is quite good and rapid very little wait time between going to the salad bar and having the various meats delivered to the table. Staff was exceptionally polite and attentive. Thank goodness Philadelphia is only a short distance away it definitely beats the traffic going into New York City. As a family or individually we will be back here again

I came  here with my family and was told we couldn't eat because my daughters were wearing "gym attire". The staff were unpolite, especially Tara. I called to make reservations and never was told about the dress code. They asked us to go home and change, but we refused to do so because we live 45 minutes away, they offered to us to speak to the manager, and they called security before calling the manager. They had a very intimidating guy standing next to us the whole time, and the manager, Edgar Da Silva, when he finally came was of no help. My young daughters didn't understand what was happening and why we were being treated like that.
We had to pay their Valets full price for being there 10 minutes (most of the time waiting for the manager)
Overall a very bad experience, not returning there.
We ended up going to Fogo de Chao, with no dress code, great ambience, and most importantly great food.

I like Chima, my first experience was good. But last night with friends we were seated at the very far back, so we would have to wait a long time to be served with meat. In the meantime, we get full while waiting. This is the only downside. The bathroom and on the way there is kind of slippery, and I am pregnant, so I was being very careful. Second bathroom lock is broken, I got someone ran into me while I was using it.

Today I just had the worst experience at Chima steakhouse restaurant From the management staff to the security who refused to let me in to my wife party that I was paying for do to the fact 
that they were done serving in 15 minutes  after I'd let them know that I would not be ordering  anything but I was here to celebrate my wife's birthday yesterday they refused to seat me .
 I will never visit this restaurant again poor managerial skills as well as customer service especially when I'm the one paying for the party with these very very expensive prices . P.s terrible Manger she would not even speak with us .

I went to Chima for my birthday with my girlfriend. I was very disappointed. The salad bar had nothing tasty, low quality. My girlfriend had salmon, for $45, it had no taste. A dinner makes salmon better. The meat was too salty and rare, not the best quality. The cheese bread, fried yucca, and mashed potatoes was inedible. We had cheesecake & apple pie that was too sweet & had no taste. We were very dissatisfied, and don't know how people
The meats were good!  The salad bar  weren't good at all.. rice was raw, beans were dry !! I personally won't go back.  The service sucks.  Waited so long for my drink.  Very disappointing

I wish I could give 0 stars for false advertising,  I booked a party for 10 because they was offering a $100 gift card for the host of the party and when I asked them about it they said it was for a party of 15 or more which they didn't not specify online and not to mention they wouldn't even let me book a party for more than 10 people so I'm pissed for wasting my time and money and for them not honoring what they advertised online but never again because the so called manager was very unhelpful!!!

I did not appreciate how Michelle mad myself and my party feel: she was dismissive and very nonchalant.y sister is not a red meat eater but it took 45min to bring her shrimp and salmon. The worst part was not being asked what beverage we would have liked to drink. To top the night we asked for spoons for the mashed potatoes and she advised that we use the serving spoon. SO INCONSIDERATE!!!! & COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL! I couldn't understand why she treated us this way and I don't want to blame race or say she's racist but she just was not welcoming or accommodating. She had a attitude from the start. We did speak to the manager after 35minutes who acted as if she understood but the damage was already done I didn't finish my food. I pushed my plate to the side and waited for the check. Michelle ruined my evening. It was a disappointment to be honest and she should do better. As a manager of a major hotel chain this shouldn't have happened and no accommodation was met. By the end of the night after we spoke to the manager Michelle never came over and apologized which was enough for me. 

I don't think I would return not even for a managers dinner. This was uncomfortable and a waste of $700 dollars.
The service is rude and indecent. The waiter asks for dresscode. It is really rude and inappropriate. We highly dis-recommend this one for its arrogance.

Solid steakhouse. Their meat particularly was very good and salad bar was also good. I went for my birthday with family and friends. We were treated very well by the staff from the moment I called and made a reservation. As a Brazilian, I didn't find there was anything too special about this Steakhouse, in a way I think I expected more. If you're a meat lover it is definitely worth it, if not then maybe consider some other place.
Very good food . Nice ambiance and service was excellent. We will be back soon. There was no wait and the food and drinks were great .

Tried this restaurant as part of center city restaurant week and was pleasantly surprised. They had reasonably price bottles of wine and we were seated on time. The salad bar offered as part of the meal was a nice touch but did not really enhance the meal to be honest. This place is all about the quality meats. The lamb was my favorite item on the basic menu, and all the steaks were juicy and flavorful. We opted to get dessert and the apple pie was solid, but beware it has a strange bitter aftertaste that some may not find appealing. Overall 4/5, service 5/5, food 4/5, ambiance 4/5.

Authentic Brazilian steakhouse with some cultural twists! The servers are so nice here and the food really is amazing! You feel like you're in a different world when you enter their restaurant. They serve a lot of fresh filet mignon and they cook it exactly how you like it and they will come back to you knowing your preference as well! The salad bar has a lot of nice, fresh choices as well like asparagus, apple salad, Cesar salad, fresh cheeses and meats, brown rice and jasmine rice, all kinds of sauces and beans. They also serve salmon with passion fruit sauce or pesto, grilled shrimps! The famous cheese with honey and grilled pineapple with cinnamon! We were celebrating my bfs completion of his phd program and the waiter came to surprise us with a nice cheesecake dessert which wasn't even on the menu! Delicious! Definitely a place worth a fancy meal experience, I wish I discovered this place sooner since I had always been a regular at fogo!

Chima is where we eat every year for my boyfriend's birthday.  I learned the hard way many years ago and woke up the next day with a meat hangover.  It made me not want to go back ever again.  But by the time his next birthday  rolled around I was ready to hit Chima up and eat a little more thoughtfully.  

First off, you can't eat just meat.  I, of course, thought the salad bar was a waste of my time the first time I dined here and only ate a tiny bit - but now I know you have to eat salad bar to not feel meat-sick the next day.  The meat itself is tremendous.  And they just keep bringing it.  I don't like to create food waste, so I had to keep turning my "stop/go" card over and over so I didn't get crazy amounts of meat on one plate.   But then when you know what tastes the best you can make sure they direct that guy over to you more often.  

Personally, I don't need chicken when I come to Chima.  I want red meat and maybe a tiny but of seafood.  I also love the grilled cinnamon pineapple.  They have different sauces on the salad bar but I didn't think any of the cuts of meat needed it.  

Lastly, this year they sent my boyfriend home with delish birthday cake.  I don't remember them doing that any other year but it's possible I didn't mention it on the reservation until this year.

So most people know this as a decent Brazilian steakhouse that is a great place to bring a date vs group of people vs family for a nice hefty meal to celebrate something... Or to come during Restaurant week, which the restaurant always participates in... More recently, I've discovered an amazing thing about this place, it's happy hour! It happens almost every day and their caipirinhas are great! Cheap and strong! Also with a decent happy hour food menu that won't burn your wallet. 

Rating: 8/10
Pros: Great happy hour, decent meats, Restaurant week! Also great location and staff
Cons: Brazilian steakhouse price

I was excited to finally try Chima during restaurant week and overall I had a great experience. I was wasn't blown away by all of the food but I still enjoyed it. The flank steak was my favorite. You definitely need to come on an empty stomach.

My favorite part was the atmosphere. The interior has a romantic vibe and I liked how all the tables were spaced apart just the right amount (although that's probably because of COVID). 

There's not much of a dress code. The patrons were wearing a variety of things from jeans to dresses to more causal outfits. The servers who came around with the means were all very friendly!

I like to see if the bathrooms match the quality of the restaurant and these bathrooms were not the cleanest. 

Overall, I enjoyed dining at Chima and would go back.

Well hello, Chima! How have you been? I haven't been to Chima's since my daughter was born which was 5 years ago, but me and my friends all had a rare baby-free night and did what any crazy parents would do: go eat peacefully! lol

I learned the hard way that eating breakfast, lunch or anything else in between is not a good idea before visiting Chima. The food just keeps coming and you'll need an empty stomach to fully enjoy it all. And I made sure this time to ask for smaller cuts of meat instead of YOLO'ing on the first few. 

MY least favorite of the AYCE meats was surprisingly the chicken. IT was cooked perfectly, but had zero seasoning. I had to grab some pesto from the salad bar to give it some life. My second fave were the grilled shrimp. The char and seasoning on them was just wonderful and I could have ate those all night. My favorite thing by far was the lamb. I have no idea what type of seasoning is used, but it's literally the greatest flavor on a meat I've taste in a long time. 

My wife ordered the creme brulee and actually let me have a bite. She must have liked me today!! The creme brulee had that sugary crust on top which bursted into the pudding so perfectly. I can't wait to come back to Chima in about 6 months, because I need about a few months to digest all the food I ate lol

5 stars for an amazing full course Complete Rodizio experience during restaurant week. They gave a $20 off coupon for future experiences, but it expires within 1 month of dining.

They also offered a discounted bottle of wine (red/white/rose)

Occasion: A group of three of us went on a Monday night for a friend's birthday, were seated promptly 

Ambience: Beautiful interior, mix of dark and bright, romantic

COVID19 precautions: gloves and hand sanitizer for their salad bar - it's not as extensive as Fogo, but also, you really don't need to eat much from the salad bar at an AYCE Brazilian steakhouse, do you?

Cuts of meat: 
-Definitely request food if you don't see what you want early on, they come out like lightning as soon as you place the order
-Favorites: Filet mignon, Lamb, Pineapple with cinnamon
-Salmon was also great with a pretty unique sauce (peach?)

Our bottle of red wine paired nicely

At the end of the night, they came out with a surprise little birthday cheese cake with bits of chocolate and a divine raspberry sauce. The cake was sweet and the sauce was perfectly paired. Perfect end to a perfect meal.

Tips/Takeaways:
-Beautiful interior, COVID19 conscious 
-Worth the full selection experience
-REQUEST WHAT YOU WANT and go for the more expensive cuts!
-Great for BDays and other special occasions - surprise bday cake was so nice!

Outstanding place to eat at anytime!!!!!!!  I took my wife there for her birthday and the food and atmosphere was great and professional. The food and salad bar were great!!!!!!!! I would highly recommend anytime!!!!

I come to Chima periodically for Happy Hour because of the bartender Anthony. I remember going there a few years ago and seeing that there were customers known as "regulars" and I aspired to be a regular somewhere. I've been there every few months, including during covid, and it's been a great experience. Everytime I go, he sees me from a mile away and greets me. He knows exactly what drink I get and always checks in. I love it there and would strongly recommend it. I've also gone for the Rodizio a few times and it is definitely worth it.

Me and my girlfriends came here for dinner and we had an amazing time. We love the atmosphere and the overall vibe. Our server was super friendly and attended to our needs with the best of her abilities. The different cuts of meat were delicious and we will definitely be back again!

Went for an anniversary dinner and everything was spectacular. From the attentive service to the well made tasty cocktails the restaurant blew us away. The selections of meats where brought around constantly sometimes at a overwhelming pace. There was a wide selection that catered to many different tastes. I ordered my meat medium rare and my girlfriend wanted hers well done, and almost every time the waiters were able to accommodate to our request. 5/5 would recommend and return again.
I live very close to Chima and omg you can smell it outside all the time. I ain't mad. This place is so good and never disappoints. The team that works there def know me and my boyfriend lol

business.name: Steve's Prince of Steaks

business.categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text: Usually love coming to Steve's but this particular one Denied me and my service dog with her vest and ID. Safe to say I won't be coming here anymore.

As much I wanted to like Steve's Prince of Steaks cheesesteak I really saw and tasted nothing that really wow me. 

It was just an ordinary cheesesteak that you can get anywhere in Philadephia. Don't get me wrong it was still decent cheesesteak, but my expectations when I'm in Philly is to have a really good cheesesteak.
Steve's is definitely my favorite CheeseSteak. I always order Whiz Steak W/F.O double meat side cherry peppers and hot sauce. With fries side of American. Every time im in Philly i get this sandwich.

This Steve's Prince of Steaks is on Comly Road, just off northbound Roosevelt Boulevard, Somerton, PA, in the far Northeast of the city. If possible, it is even smaller than my regular Steve's on Rt. 1 in Langhorne. There are two windows within. One for ordering your sandwich, for which they have posted a long list of rules to follow to get what you want, and the other only for fries and drinks. Like the rest, the burden is on you to know what you're doing, or face the consternation of the staff and your fellow steak lovers. Not an enviable place to be.

I ordered two "cheesesteaks wit provolone," meaning I wanted two sandwiches with fried onions and provolone cheese. I like the Wiz, too, but preferred the extra mellowness offered by the hard white variation. It set me back $25+. Not unexpected, but I'd be lying if I didn't do a double clutch before paying the dude taking my business. 

Normally, we would eat right along the walls at the Langhorne joint, but this shop was smaller and without short shelves and stools. We took them home to consume. These guys are fast and efficient, and it was fun to watch them work through the greasy glass window that separates kitchen from customers. It would have been a thoroughly enjoyable moment, but for Mr. Priss shouting not to take photos (after the last one). 

Oh, me. Oh, my! Have to protect those state secrets. 

At home, we added our own banana pepper rings to bring up the burn; the pickle bar being removed as a casualty of COVID. It was love at first bite. Great cross section of taste and texture as we incisored through the excellent torpedo roll, cheese and ribeye. My wife and I shared one sandwich, and left the other for her still growing son (6'3"). 

I have no dog in the fight between the chopped vs. solid slice approach to this Philly delicacy. I like them both ways, as long as the beef used is high quality. Steve's is among my faves, but with every pizza shop making their own version, we are really living in Cheesesteak Heaven around here. The worst one in the Philadelphia region is better than anything anywhere else.

I have had Steve's on many occasions ,steaks are good fries are good.Why is a three stars if you ask?I gave the cashier a $20 bill, the sandwich was $11 , I received $8 dollars change.Fortunately, my change, alerted him to the discrepancy and he gave me another dollar. I'm sorry to question someone's integrity but I almost feel as if it was intentional. The real issue I have is he didn't even apologize, he just opened the register and gave me the dollar and walked away.

They only except cash ,how you cannot give someone a five dollar bill and for ones is perplexing.Hopefully if this happens to anyone else they will mention it to management.
Food was great ....2 guys were nice but one (guy handling drinks/fries) was ignorant and extremely rude. shouldn't be working with public and should be fired (3/26/21)!
Location is a little seedy but they consistently make great steak sandwiches.  They don't chop the fresh ribeye and I prefer that anyway.   You won't be disappointed

This spot is well deserving of a 5 star rating in my opinion.  I travelled far for this steak based on a recommendation from a friend that lives in the area.  Holy moly.  Steak was delicious (I ordered with American cheese/no onion), service was fast and polite, and to make it just a little better, my order of fries were spot on too.  This is a must stop if you are traveling in the Philadelphia area.

During my visit to Philly, I had to try cheesesteaks! I was told this was the best one! Surely it did not disappoint. Due to covid and the snow, we were in a rush and I couldn't get a pic of my sandwich. I was able to eat it when I got back to Ny. I had to heat it up so not sure if I over cooked the steak or it was in general. But I really enjoyed the sautéed onions, sweet hot peppers and everything in between. I would def go back!

Terrible custom service along with a mediocre product, at best. One day me and my girlfriend ordered some food for pick-up. She was going to swing by on her way home from work. She has a respiratory disease which makes wearing a mask possibly catastrophic. She arrived, went into the waiting area, and proceeded to get reprimanded as if she was a 3rd grader without ever getting a chance to explain her situation. When she finally had the chance to speak, the guy in there told her he didn't "care what disease she had". She was taken back and completely embarrassed as there were other patrons in the waiting area. Being unsure what to do, she told him she'll step outside on the curb and wait. Ready for this? He refused to bring it outside to her. Not only is that ridiculously rude and insensitive, it's completely illegal to ask her to leave. As per Governor Tom Wolf's mandate, Section 3B. The best part of all this is their food is trash. I would highly advise against patronizing this business. Customer service abomination!

This spot was delicious. Can't complain at all. The portions were pretty great. The customer service was pretty good too. I had the spicy fries so the saltiness from the fries went perfectly with the cheesesteak.

I'm a loyal subject of the prince first off..... the quality of the meat is not what it used to... either they aren't taking care of it or it isn't the same. I'm not the only one that noticed it either someone who was in the store made the comment I had to agree with him... been a loyal customer for 10+ years. Sadly I don't feel the same
Loyalty from Steve's. At first I thought Was just the center city....  nah....  they say all good things must come to an end... Steves is coming to its end.

Still really good cheesesteaks. Stopped in to get two. I called my order ahead and it was ready when I went inside. The only reason it didn't get 5 is because they didn't enforce mask wearing or social distancing even though they posted a sign about masks being required. People standing there were ignorant and didn't take the pandemic seriously.

Warning, don't call them! Just did and was yelled at "We don't take orders on the phone anymore, you have to come in, stop calling, you've called four times" and hung up. I called two times prior because they didn't answer and figured they were busy.  I have a feeling he didn't want me to go in either. I hope their food is better than their customer service.  Very unpleasant experience.
So good! American extra wit! Delicious! Love the  bar of sides, pickles, banana peppers, relish, cherry peppers, etc. The rolls are so fresh!! Side of wiz is good to dip in!
American With review only. This steak is very expensive at $11 but it's good. Rolls are fresh meat tasty but could stand a tad salt and pepper.

Visit Philadelphia so I had to try the home town favorite Philly Cheesesteak!! After consulting with a few locals I found Steves's. I wasn't knocked of my feet but it was pretty good.  The steak was nicely cooked and tender, on a warm soft hoagie bun.
Not bad but for a place that claims they have the best philly cheese steak, I expected more. Good flavor but American deli has a way better cheese steak and fries. ‍.

My 2nd favorite cheesesteak spot in the city because: 
1) efficient service
2) great consistent taste

Today I got a cheesesteak with whiz and fried onions and a side of fries. It was adelicious, hot, and quickly made. What else is there to say? Steve's is good at what they do. 

I went at 12PM on a weekday and they still did a great job! The steak is left in whole pieces and seasoned just right. Most Philly cheesesteak shops chop them up but that's not always a good look. Steve's leaves all of the fixins on the side fir you to choose at your leisure. If you see this as a disadvantage think again because this option empowers you to choose any amount of pickles, sweets, hots, ketchup, etc you want.

You order fries at a separate window to maintain the shops efficient flow. This place is a win-win and I always know that I'm getting quality products when I go. I recommend any of the 2+ shops I go to. #HastyFoodiePic

I went to the Steve's on mid day weekend afternoon. I tried to order a hamburger because I am not a fan of cheese steaks and my husband is a fan of their steaks. The person / cook was rude and said they were too busy to make a burger.  
Do not offer other food options to customers if you are not going to make them.  If you are looking for good customer service quickly with a menu that they cook do not go to a cheesesteak/ burger place in the city.

Pretty awesome...very good cheesesteaks at very fair prices!  Steve's gets the job done. I stop there whenever I am in the zip code. I couldn't find anything to complain about, even if I wanted to. Friendly, helpful staff, etc.!

I wolf-down my cheesesteak off the hood of my truck...like a raccoon...so wave if you see me in the parking lot (lol)!  The portions will fill you up, but that's good, right?  (NO credit cards, I'm told, but that's never as issue for me anyway).

Anecdote: I took my daughter there once, and 5 weeks later it was her birthday & I asked her where she wanted to go for her B'Day Dinner.  I was thinking she'd say "Olive Garden" or some such.  Nope, she says "Take me to Steve's for another Cheesesteak."  True story!  :)

Omg terrible customer service i called in my order the man said he didn't have time to explain the sandwiches to me i said ok and i just ordered from the menu he told me it's very busy he can't promise it would be ready when i got there i said ok do u have a eta he did not i arrived 10 mins later place was empty and they haven't started my food below is a video of how empty the place was! I was visiting to take my daughter to sesame place and have never had an authentic cheese steak so i wanted the experience so maybe because they knew that they didn't feel the need to provide good customer service! I haven't eaten if yet but needless to say I'm upset about the terrible service oh and it's cash only in 2019 cash only and the man didn't tell me over the phone although i advised him I've never been here before.

Very delicious steaks but disappointing visit when you see cook grabbing raw meat from freezer and then picking up buns without changing gloves. Need to change gloves or have two chefs, one cooking meat one getting buns and cheese, like I see in other cheesesteak places

Holy Sweet Mother Of God! 

Bring your appetite and cash!


These sandwiches are by far the best 

Don't forget to order properly 

Double, with, wiz is the only way to go!
My entire family is sick ... cramps, diarrhea and nausea within a hour and half of eating here. Never going back here again

business.name: LongHorn Steakhouse

reviews.text: Always great food! Steaks cooked to perfection! Ashley G is one of the best servers I've had at any restaurant ever! Keep it up!

Always come here! You have to ask for Helene, best server in here. Helene and Vanessa are my favorites. They always know how to treat their guests right and make sure everyone is happy. WILL ALWAYS BE A REGULAR! Thank you for everything Helene! Always treat me like I'm family.

I went to longhorn for lunch,  but was told they couldn't accommodate the needs of me and my wife. My wife wears a niqab and I asked if we could have a table where her back could face the other customers, so she could comfortably raise her niqab and eat. 
Initially the woman who was the hostess said something about there being limited seating. I said I would wait for a spot.  The manager who was in ear shot behind the hostess said something to her.  And the manager told us that we would have a table in a few minutes. We were asked to wait outside even though we were the only people to be seated, and no one else was at the door. ( windy and a bit chilly outside)  After we went outside and waited a few minutes we were called to our table. The table was actually a booth with someone's table just about arm width distance between their seat and our table. I could reach out and touch their seat if I was standing next to my booth. With two other table seated right besides that one. I then said to the hostess that I asked for a table where my wife can sit so she can raise her niqab to eat. She told me we don't have any seat like that. Now mind you there was almost no one there. (12pm Saturday ) Approximately 6-8 tables. And there was a corner tables that was  only 2 seats behind  another couple.  I asked to speak with the manager.  She left me for several minutes and then came back alone.  She started saying something and I said I need to speak with the manager.  She left in a huff and after a moment the manager came back. I said to her that I requested a table where my wife's back was facing the rest of the people so she could comfortably raise her niqab and eat. She said, I didn't hear that, now mind you she was standing directly behind the hostess. She told me she had limited seating and couldn't accommodate us. I said is this how you treat people with religious needs. 
She told me she treats everyone equally. I said how can you say you treat everyone equally when you can't accommodate the needs of your religious  patrons. At this point we left and as I was leaving I turned and said to the manager that due to your lack of equality and sensitivity to the needs of others, that  we won't be back.  

I just want to note , I feel that our  needs aren't perceived as  a priority  we could have  been accommodated. There was definitely enough room and places that  the manager  could have put us.  She just didn't want to do it, as a personal comfort to herself and her staff. The manager came out with the word "equally", which to me means my religious needs are as important as anyone else's needs, which they obviously weren't. I don't even know how she could have the  word "equally" come out of her mouth. I was quite upset with the way this was handled, where as even if after all that, and she had changed her mind and was suddenly able to accommodate us I wouldn't have been able to stay there due to the awkward setting that the manager placed us in. To me and my wife, we just perceive this as, it was meant to be.  That we didn't spend our money to support this establishment. But we felt the need to have our voice heard. 
This place is not ready to accept our Muslim population.  
But seriously here, Is this how the Longhorn franchise plans on treating its Muslim population?

Covid makes dining out difficult. I stopped by to pick up dinner but it didn't feel the same as dining there under normal circumstances given the food presentation. I ordered the 8 oz sirloin which was tender but overcooked and loaded bake potato and rice. Comes with free generous portion of baked bread with butter. It was a great dinner for the price $18 including tip. 

TIP: you need to order and pay online in advance. When you arrive, you call their phone number so someone can come outside to give you your order. I made the mistake of walking inside to pick up my order and got reprimanded by the waitress. Oops

TIP: they tend to overcook your steak by at least 1 level so that keep that in mind when you order how you want your steak done.

A review has to be either pretty bad or exceptionally good for one to load a Yelp app and proceed to leave a review. I ordered curbside from Longhorn. $34 wasted. I ordered the wings. When I returned home from my 15-minute Drive to and 15 minutes from Longhorn I was extremely disappointed that my husband's fries were cold and old and the wings that I ordered seem to have been re-cooked. They had dry brown bones and were extremely tough. I phoned to speak with the manager and was told by the manager that the "wings are baked for 45 minutes and then fried to order." I told him I've recooked chicken at home and it's exactly like these...inedible. He offered to provide a new order to which I declined because again I live a 15-minute drive away and expressed to him that I would prefer a refund to which he replied  "No we don't do that  we would just replace it ." Neither the boneless wings nor the buffalo wings I ordered had blue cheese dip as described online when ordering. This was very disappointing. I should have just waited in the long Chick-fil-A line, at least the food would have been fresh, freshly prepared, and worth the money spent. Whats most insulting is the manager tried to make me believe this was normal and how they should be! My family and I were just there in the dining room on March 15th -my 51st birthday - for a birthday meal.  My nephew and sister both ordered the wings and they were nothing like the wooden wings I had today. They were edible, these were not. Save your money, go elsewhere...you've been forewarned. I certainly wish I had checked with Yelp first as I see there are many negative reviews for this location. Thank you Longhorn for a $34 lesson. Epic fail.
Ordered a burger it was raw and cold asked for it medium well...longhorn will rue the day the they messed my food up. The waitress also had 4 teeth....wasn't a fan of that.
Ordered a burger it was a raw and cold asked for it medium well...longhorn will rue the day the they messed my food up. The waitress also had 4 teeth....wasn't a fan of that.

my wife and I went to the whitehall, pa. location 9-11-2019 and had dinner.  The waiter was pleasant, and she ordered the prime rib, and I ordered Flos filet. Our salads were fine, and my wife's prime rib was fine.
My filet was so tenderized it felt like liquid mush instead of steak. Never had a filet that obviously was tenderized, to the point of melting in your mouth.  no texture or the natural grain of the steak. Filet cuts are naturally tender when grilled, and I will never get one at Long Horn again.
The sweet potato was good, and I just wanted to tell you, It was a very expensive waste of a steak.  I ate it, did not complain, but my experience was not good expecting a steak that was not tenderized. 
I will not order another one.

I starting with Wild West shrimp 
Prime rib steak medium well corn on the side 
The server name Monika she's very polite to our family even she's very busy. That's what we need person likes her. My 3 boys they all like the foods 
My wife and I also enjoyed too. Look at by the pictures.
Thank you Monika J.

Always come here SPECIFICALLY for Helene. No other server in there does it like her. She's amazing. Always has her game face on and never disappoints with service. Food is amazing, no complaints on that! Helene, I'll see you next week for my Flo's Filet! My favorite server!!

Today I ate at the Columbus Blvd location. It was around 2pm in the afternoon and not too busy. Our waiter was cordial. We waited sometime for our food, but were satisfied with its taste.

 I am writing this review not for the food but for an observation of the managers behavior. I am a person of color, and so was the manager. What disappointed me was the fact that he was certain to visit every table that sat non-Latino customers to check their experience. When he came to my table however (though cordial), he simply asks if he could take a plate sitting on the edge. He never asked about our experience. I guess our opinions meant nothing to him. 

Side note, I'm not a racially sensitive person in that I don't look for people to be racist or prejudice. If it happens ok but I'm not paranoid. It was clear where he wanted the approval. Smh! I probably won't return simply because when I eat out in restaurants, I go for the food as well as the experience. All currency is green. Every customer should be treated equal.

Service isn't bad but the kitchen sucks. I've been here twice within the past month and both times my steaks were over-cooked. A couple of weeks ago when I came I sent the steak back and they still served me another over-cooked steak. When I went yesterday(not by my choice) I didn't even bother sending it back because I knew it would be wrong again. I just won't be back. 
    And it's a shame because I was a frequent visitor but something needs to be done about that kitchen. This is s steak restaurant with chefs that don't know how to properly cook a steak.

I really love this place, the stakes are delicious and their side dishes are decent as well. The wait staff is very friendly and courteous and they're always happy to explain what's in the dishes on the menu. I have enjoyed every meal that I've eaten there and my boss always takes me there for administrative professional day.
Horrible kitchen. Overcooked steaks - you order "medium" - wait 40 min and receive "well-done". Do not recommend.

AWFUL service each and every time we have given them the chance. Just left there after sitting at the normal seat yourself bar tops. Only after asking would be be able to receive help (and them saying "sure") did the rude bartender curtly let us know that those weren't serviced during lunch. Managers galore, yet no one friendly nor did they care enough to serve us. We immediately exited and happily settled for Wendy's next door!

I did not like the waitress we had tonight at all. Her name was Amanda. She had my credit card for about a half hour. She should of brought it back right away. I finally told the hostess to go get my credit card and the check. The hostess brought back the credit card and the check. Amanda didn't bring it back and she never even apologized. She didn't even look at us. And she went to the next table. I will be back , but I do not want Amanda anymore.

I've given this place multiple "second chances" and I am not sure why I keep going back. This most recent visit though, will definitely be the last. Each time I have been there, the wait time for the meals to come out is unexplainably long. It's never been super crowded at the times I've went, so getting seated has been quick. But once our order was placed, it took about an hour for the food to come out. I understand they are short staffed, but perhaps mentioning this to the guests would be helpful instead of leaving them waiting and waiting. Makes no sense to have to sit and wait an hour for your order to come out in a half empty restaurant. Poor service.

I came in today around 10-ish, just to grab a quick dinner with my girlfriend. I ordered the Sirloin Steak and ask for medium rare. Around 30 mins after , the steak they gave me was good seasoned and all, however, it was too rare to my liking, way too red in the middle and I called the waitress over and told her the problem to see if they can maybe take the price down or any other options, the only option they offered was to cook me one. They took my plate with the steak that I didn't finished and just recooked it to well done. Ended up giving to my dog because it was too tough. I'll probably come one more time when it's a little more early because I know they were rushing just to go home after work, that way I would get a little more respect as a customer.. I would not recommend coming to late. I also forgot to mention they forgot to give utensils until the food arrived that I had to mentioned it because I thought she would know by the time it would arrived..

Great steaks! When you go to eat in, everything is fine. However, if you walk in for a take out order, you will be waiting about an hour or more. I had to sit at the bar for 25 minutes before the bartender ever looked at me. After she acknowledged my presence & took my order, she was nicer. I recommend calling your order in ahead of time if you plan to bring your meal home to eat. Otherwise the food is truly worth the wait!

So here I am having gone to Longhorn again just a different location. It was also lunch instead of dinner. It wasn't crowded so seating didn't take long and just two of my daughters and three grandchildren. We ordered wings and firecracker chicken wraps for apps... The wings weren't bad but were cooked a little long and the wraps were good they came with a lime avocado ranch sauce that none of us liked. My daughters ,one had baby back ribs, she likes them a lot they both thought that the ribs were quite tasty. There other had the NY strip with no complaints. I ordered the ribeye cooked medium, unfortunately it came over cooked and I had to send it back. It was no fun watching everyone else eat but I cannot eat over cooked steak. New steak was cooked to my liking. The steaks while tasty were not allowed to rest properly as there was a big pool of steak juices on the plates.
   I must mention that we had a spill at our table and when we informed the waiter he put four napkins on the table and went on about his business. I had to get up and clean it myself.  I think I'm over it!

My family and I come here a few times a year to celebrate anniversary, birthdays, promotions etc. I like this location because it doesn't get as crowded as the rest and the people are always friendly. They don't take long with the food which is a good thing.

If you're looking for a great steak dinner reasonably priced this is the place to be. Eben when crowded the eait is not bad. My waiter, Jared, was kind & friendly. He treated a sinngle dinner with respect & the petfecr combination of esit time & conversation. Highly recommend this rest2.

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!  My very first experience at Longhorn was horrible!!  Spend an hour in this restaurant for lunch.  Only received bread and lemonade within the first 15 minutes of placing order.  Never received our food!  The waitress would check on us and say food would be out soon.  Watched others around me come in after and get there meals from her! Since it was a lunch break, I had to leave. I will NOT be returning to this restaurant again! . Don't deserve one star from me!!

It has been around 7 years since I've been to Longhorn and I have had nothing but pleasant memories from my initial visit. I have no clue what has changed in those 7 years but the effects are visible. First of all the place looked fantastic but upon further inspection there was a thick layer of dust covering some of the booth I was seated at. The server was prompt with the menus and our drink and appetizer orders. That is when it went absolutely downhill. To put in perspective, when I arrived there were probably about 10 customers at the restaurant and just as many waiters working. It took a whopping 25 minutes to get two soups and stuffed mushrooms out. Now I am being generous calling my French onion a soup. It was cold and the cheese had at this point formed a hard shell on top of a giant mass of broth saturated bread- which was in place of the soup. Got three spoonfuls of broth out of it at best. Rest of the appetizer was no better. I was not giving up on the place as I still had an entree coming. I had hope that I was going to receive the medium rare  burger I ordered (now 35 minutes ago) and be at the least content. Nope, wrong again. I sat there for about half an hour after finishing my appetizer, waiting for my entree. I felt forgotten. The server did not once come by to update me on the status of my medium rare burger. Who knows, maybe the chef had to butcher a cow and grind the meat in the back of the the building; Sadly I just wanted a burger. Following some patient waiting, I kindly expressed the fact that no burger takes an hour to cook and that I would like to pay and leave. I would expect more from a fully staffed restaurant. Two stars at best.
Would not visit again.

Never come back this location again. The staff and waitresses's attitude are so rude. They forgot to put our name on waiting list and let some couple come after us in the table first. When we found out that after 30 minutes waiting, they didn't say any apology!!  I wish we would to go to Texas Roadhouse.

business.name: Marmont Steakhouse & Bar

reviews.text: Love love love this place! Perfect local Philly steak house that isn't glitzy and glamorous but amazing steaks and service! 10s across the board

I loved this!  Kind of an old speak easy type of feel with a great menu and fantastic food. Service wasn't that of a true up scale steak house but was still quite good. We had little things happen such as we never got bread and all tables around us did. We weren't really sure why. But apps, salad, steak and side with dessert and cocktails and wine for 2 for under 200 bucks, where does that happen in the city?  No where that I go. Will be back again!  Was great.

This place has potential. Started with the crab bisque, it would've tasted so good but they added WAY too much salt to it. I couldn't finish it that's how salty it was. Then for the main course I had the Bone in Pork Chop with apples and my boyfriend got the meatloaf. Food was decent would give it a 5/10 overall. But sadly my boyfriend and I both got sick shortly after.
We were impressed with our steaks...my husband ordered the cowboy cut, I had the petite filet mignon cooked to perfection.  We shared the asparagus and of course our dessert cheese cake was amazing.

I went here for restaurant week. The host sat us at our table and we waited 15-20 minutes before anyone came over to our table. I ordered the potato soup, Caesar salad and the 12 oz ribeye steak. The potato soup was room temperature and was very bland. The Caesar salad was basic but not bad. The best thing was the steak, which was cooked properly. The mashed potatoes were watery and flavorless.

My sister and I visited Marmont during Restaurant Week and it also happened to be my birthday. I look forward to Restaurant Week every year because there is always new places to try. Marmont was pretty decent and the service was great. The restaurant is in Old City so parking can be a hassle, but we live nearby so we walked to the restaurant. We had reservations and were seated right away, we were able to chose between indoor and outdoor because Covid is still lingering around. The steak I had was delicious, my sister was less enthusiastic about the lobster ravioli because she only got about 4 or 5 raviolis. The lobster bisque was good but a little salty. The raspberry champagne cocktail was delicious and refreshing. All in all I would probably come back.
I loved how crispy the salmon was but the flavor was so good! The sauce tasted similar to teriyaki.
If you like charred skin salmon doused with whatever bottled ginger sauce they paired with the salmon.... be my guest.... try it. I personally don't like charred salmon that taste like a grill.
Rude manager, good food & nice server. Make sure you like the food cus the manager doesn't take food off the bill if you don't like it.

Nasty taste like maybe lemon curd need a new chef. And I had the nerve to buy 2 and they look and taste the same.  $16 dollars for this crop. I thought maybe it was the hollandaise sauce that was supposed to be on my stuffed tilapia.  The lobster bisque soup. But I've had hollandaise sauce before. This was not it.

Unfortunately, it was my brother-in-law's 50th birthday in the middle of a pandemic. We decided though we should eat outside and have a great meal to celebrate. Marmont did an absolute excellent job hosting about 10 of us for my brother-in-law's birthday. The staff was excellent, the food delicious, the drinks icy cold. I was so impressed that they were able to pivot from being a intimate inside restaurant to a fun outside restaurant. If you're ever thinking about getting a great steak dinner, don't even think about it. Book a table at Marmont now.

This is our go-to restaurant. We have tried almost everything on their menu. Steaks are of highest quality and prepared per your desired doneness. Sides are also delicious. Chicken salad is out of this world.

my wife and i have ordered from marmont three times in the last month. we were more than satisfied with the quality and portions. the steaks were both cooked to perfection. and the portions were more than enough. i highly recommend marmont. and Zack whom i believe is the manager is great.

Sandra Sue
Yesterday at 1:35 PM
On April 4th the chef of Marmont Steakhouse went out of his way to have an absolutely delicious steak dinner brought to our daughter in Philadelphia on her birthday. My husband and I live in NY and were able to have her favorite meal created to perfection and transported to her front door. From a beautiful medium rare ribeye to crispy truffle fries accompanied by sautéed spinach in garlic, she dined in style during a world pandemic. Thank you, thank you, Marmont Steakhouse. You truly delivered in more ways than one

We went here for restaurant week. Yes there was a little wait because it was a great place and it was an amazing deal. The food was incredible.  My wife said it was her favorite steak ever.  Can't wait until we can get back after restaurants open again. Chris Vtrainers Personal Training.
I've been to some nicer Ruth Chris Steakhouses, but place was serviceable.  The quality of food was on par with other locations, wait staff very attentive, and you can't beat the happy hour deals.

Wasn't sure the place was open based on outward appearance. Stepped in through a curtain and found a small place. Service was friendly but S...l..o..w! We were sat by the door so our food got cold fast. My filet oscar was very good. My husband's lobster tail was chewy and steak was good but not great. French onion soup was way too much smoked gouda. We also had the pleasure of an extremely loud table nearby. I'd try elsewhere when in the area again.

I work in the area of the restaurant and never visited Marmont until recently!  After going to the theatre in the area we made reservations to go to Marmont for dinner!
 
This is a non-traditional steakhouse for sure, so I didn't feel confident going that route and didn't order steak...so I decided to try to mussels as an appetizer and pork chop for entree!  I admit both dishes were well prepared!

My Boo had the calamari and the stuffed tilapia-he enjoyed both as well!

I had a few cocktails and they were executed just the way I like them!  

I would return to sample other dishes!

came in today for restaurant week. It was really busy when me and my date got there and prob. waited 30 min or so to get our table but it was worth the wait! the food was amazing crab bisque was spot on and the steaks... THE STEAK!!!!! really friendly staff (thanks Kira!) had a wonderful time and just might come back before restaurant week ends! for the STEAK!!!!!!!!

Visited during Restaurant Week and we had a reservation for a party of 8. Disappointed in the nonchalant disposition and response of the manager when one in the party inquired how long the remaining wait would be when the party was not seated more than 20 min after the stated time. He stated that a reservation time indicated it could be up to at least an hour wait beyond the reservation time, and the party should expect that during Restaurant Week. He did offer for the group to wait at the bar, however there was no available space as it is a small bar/dining area. 

Hmmm...As we were hearing the response from the manager another couple leaving the restaurant stated loudly that those waiting should leave because the "...food sucks. the steaks were beyond fatty, and the manager did not handle their complaint well." That couple continued talking as everyone was now exiting the restaurant about how bad the experience was as another group of 4 left as well that waited for their reservation for almost an hour and both parties went down the street to Revolution House and were seated immediately. Just a very disappointing response.
Had a reservation for 730pm and showed up at 720. We were told told to take a seat at the bar till they cleared a table for us.  We waited until 8400m and still had not been seated.

I can not say enough good things about this place. The staff is friendly, the food is amazing, and the drinks are always delicious. It's the perfect hidden gem in Philadelphia. Skip the big name, over crowed, over priced steakhouses and come here. It's intimate and the chefs truly pour their all into the food and your experience.

I come here often for the food and drinks because they are always good and there's always some new special that's usually pretty good too. Only reason it got 4 instead of 5 stars for me is the service. The bartenders are always amazing but the wait staff?? Nowhere near as good. There are like 2 that were good and nicer, one has dark hair and glasses. But it seems there's always a new waiter that seems to know less about the menu than me lol. If it's just two of you I would sit at the bar. I wouldn't recommend a big crowd here until they get a little more organized service wise. 

Now to the food...the whiskey drinks are amazing to all my whiskey drinkers, the seafood is fresh and they have a few steak options because I always forget they're a steakhouse but I'm just not a big steak eater. My favorite dishes here are the crab bisque, baked brie, seafood Alfredo (special,) lobster ravioli (rest week special,) mussels, crab stuffed tilapia and the bread is fresh with amazing garlic butter. The only thing I tried and didn't like at all was the "gourmet cheesesteak" which had chunks of fatty steak inside a hoagie roll with Cooper cheese. The cheese was the best part lol because the chunks were so big I ended up using my fork and dipping them in ketchup! Lol Sorry but they need to shave that meat this is philly. Everything else is amazing though honestly.
Food was amazing. Took my mother for her birthday & now I have a new favorite steak place lol. Customer service was also excellent

Came here for restaurant week. There were 4 tables when we got there; it still took 15 minutes to get our drinks (a beer, wine, and two cocktails). We ordered the baked Brie, which didn't have anything listed under it on the menu. Turns out it had almonds in it. My friend had an allergic reaction to it. The server didn't know about the almonds in it and when my friend said "I won't die or anything" about the severity of her allergy he was like oh ok! My friend's husband had to leave to get her Benadryl during dinner. We had to ask for new silverware for her. The steak was tough. We got another round of drinks. It took another 15 minutes and one of them was wrong. We got the bill and nothing was taken off and we weren't offered anything for the food my friend couldn't eat. Immediately after paying (we still had full drinks) the manager came over and asked us if we could get up so he could have the table. He did buy us another round of drinks for that. Overall terrible service and something that could've been disastrous if my friends allergy had been worse.

business.name: Fiore's Steaks and Shakes
