business.categories: Food, Restaurants, Seafood, Specialty Food, Steakhouses, American (Traditional)

reviews.text: We had a great time here with my family. The restaurant is in a beautiful setting. It was a hopping place but not too loud. We enjoyed great steaks, wine and conversation. The surf and turf special was excellent as was the ribeye. The crab cakes were moist and flavorful. Dessert was also excellent. I am so glad we ate here!

Just can't beat this place. It has everything. If I could give more stars I would. Yes, it is expensive. It's the drinks that push the dinner over the top with price. If you are looking for the best experience for an event, dinner, or a celebration of any kind DelFrisco's is it. I have had an event party here and it was so well done. I have had private dining with a crowd of 25 and did not disappoint. I've been here for dinner. Was the best dinner of my life. I will say the more people you have, the longer you wait for dinner but it's worth it. It's perfection. Now if I could just more the location to out Philadelphia into the suburbs.... THAT would be the best!
Such a delicious dinner and beautiful atmosphere! The food was beyond amazing, staff beyond friendly, and drinks beyond tasty! Also would recommend the butter cake for dessert! 100\100!

Lolll, first of all, I wasn't sure if I should waste more time at this place by writing a review, after all, we had an amazing meal at the Finch a couple blocks away closer to home.   BUT, what is funny is that all the 1 star reviews are very lengthy stories.   Mine is the same lengthy and with the same "manager" Alice.


My parents came in first with our kids.  My husband and I walked in shortly.   Alice told us that my parents are not up to their dress code.  We were shocked. Mom was wearing cashmere "jogger" and host insisted they were sweatpants.  I told her it is my mom's birthday and can't she let it slide?  Nope.  Our car was valeted already.  Hubby took my parents home to change.  Me with two young children cannot be partially seated.  It was difficult.  

This Alice came over a few times, trying to be nice.   She told us we can wait in the high top area, but cannot be seated.  20 minutes later, she said she can "partially" seat us in the basement.  I said no.  The kids are not vaccinated and we made a reservation and the first floor had ample empty tables.  But No, cannot be seated.  Later hubby and parents returned and were told we only can get seated downstairs, because I was not nice to her. 


Grow up, please.  You sent a 60 year old birthday lady home to change because of your snobby dress code.  The definition of "business casual" is quite arbitrary. Sneakers, hoodies are allowed but cashmere joggers are not?   Or hoodies depending on who wears it,according to other reviews here?  You would not seat a mom with two young kids.  And when I told you - I don't want to talk to you.   You get offended?!   



It is New Year Eve.  So they figured they were in power and they wouldn't seat us,at all,not downstairs either.  When little people are in power, man, they go to town.  


Alice, if you really want a career in hospitality, grow some genuine heart and more importantly, improve your emotional quality.    Have a nice life.
One of the best Steak's I've had in my life was from here . Sheesh and the calamari was delicious, a little spicy though. Will visit again .

Came here tonight with a couple friends for an annual get together. I'll make it short. Server delivered the food and asked if I wanted to check the temperature of my steak which I couldn't even fathom what she meant. I was talking to my friends when she dropped the food off so I said 'I'm sure it's fine' trusting that the chef in a steakhouse knows how to cook a steak and also not knowing what 'checking the temperature of my steak' meant, cuz I don't bring a thermometer with me and shouldn't have to.. anyway.. Half my steak was medium rare, half was Chicago blue uncooked. Point it out to the server who offers to put it in a broiler but also chastises me for not checking the temp in the first place? I didn't want twice cooked food or butterflied steak. I don't want to have to slice my 16oz steak in half in front of the server upon their request to make sure their chef cooked it right. I want to cut the thing and eat it. I wanted a chef in a fancy restaurant to know what they were doing. It didn't happen. It's whatever. Server was nice but was also making light out of the predicament. When server came to take my bloody plate away she said 'do you have a dog to take this home to?' Which is a funny quip except it's basically acknowledging I paid $57 for 16oz of dog food. She was making the best of it.  The chef fucked up royal. I was offered nothing other than to cook the same steak again which is basically offering me leftovers that weren't good enough to eat in the first place. Kinda shocked. Kinda laughing. Kinda weirded out enough to write this. I had a good time with my friends. My friends dishes were good. It's a cool building. Trying to not totally drag this place but MY experience was ass. If you want to impress a date or have a good time this ain't the spot unless, you love twice cooked steak or places that can't say 'I'm wrong, let's make this right'. 

Tipped server over 20% because everyone should.

We went to Del Frisco's Saturday for a 7pm reservation. The building itself is absolutely stunning. Decorated beautifully for Christmas by the way. Downstairs there is a former bank vault where you can dine as well, which is a great touch. 

The previous few times we were here we had excellent service. Some of the best we have had. This time, not so much. The food and previous experiences save this from being two stars. To be honest, this experience was more two stars. Our waiter I believe tried to be attentive but I have to assume they were under staffed. Regardless, everything was very very slow. Drinks, taking orders, getting water refills, etc.. when we were served our food, the servers asked us to cut into our steaks to make sure they were cooked to our liking. Issue was, we had no utensils. They were cleared off and not replaced. To say I was disappointed in the service would be an understatement. For the price we pay for the food, I was hoping it would be better or to what it was a few years ago. 

Food was delicious though. The app was great - we got the calamari app. We also got a Caesar salad, and that was also very good. 

Main entrees we both got filet mignons, cooked well and both were good pieces of meat. We also got lobster mac n cheese and creamed spinach. We also got a complimentary desert from the waiter which was a nice touch. 

I hate to be critical when the food is very good. But for the cost, time the meal took which was about three hours (I love long meals but this was too long) and the service, I think it will be a while before I come back.

We arrived about an hour early to sit at the bar to have a drink. We were told we would be seated closer to our reservation and it was noted that we would be at the bar. We sat and ordered drinks when the hostess arrived to tell us we could be seated now. My wife went to the table while I waited for the drinks at the bar. When I arrived at the table with our drinks the bread was already placed on the table and was already cold. Our server was wonderful, very pleasant, professional,  and attentive. We started with oysters and calamari, both were excellent. The oysters tasted fresh and the accompanying sauces were delicious. We ordered steaks and sides. My strip med rare and my wifes filet medium. My strip was med well and the filet was rare. My wife decided she would keep hers and let it rest a few minutes. Our server offered to have a new one cooked for me but knowing my wife's food, and the sides, would be cold by the time a new steak arrived I declined. Unfortunately it was not as good at that temperature but it was good still. My suggestion would be to offer to have the drinks brought to our table so we could have been seated together. If a steak temp is incorrect have new sides brought with the newly cooked steaks. The manager did approach us, we assumed because the server mentioned the steak temp to him (the server confirmed our assumption), but he never mentioned this fact but I was almost halfway through my steak and wasn't about to mention it. It's always very disruptive to the dinning experience to have one guest with food, eating alone, while the other waits for the chef to correct their mistake, especialy at a high end, high priced, restaurant. We were there once before and it was an excellent experience, not so much this time.
Amazing food amazing atmosphere amazing service!! Loved everything about it!! Especially their bread with shaved sea salt.

Let me start by saying the food was delicious, always is. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I had the petite filet, creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin. My partner had a salad and cheesesteak egg rolls. And as you can see I started with a VIP immediately upon being sat because what we went through at the host stand was infuriating...

When we arrived my partner was wearing a hoodie. ALICE, who I also believe is a manager informed us that he wouldn't be allowed inside with his hoodie and needed to change. We left, went to a store close by to buy a shirt and then returned. When we went back to the host stand we saw someone walking out with a hoodie and asked Alice "how were they allowed in with a hoodie and we just had to leave and buy new clothes?" Her response was "I assure you they were not wearing a hoodie, we apply the dress code to everyone". Not only was that a dismissive comment but it was also WRONG because when we sat down we saw at least 5 more hoodies (im including photos of some). We pointed it out to another person working there who apologized to us and apologized for their inconsistency. Alice never apologized or said anything. Rude. 

It is not our issue that hoodies are not allowed in the restaurant. My issue is that my partner was asked to change when others weren't and I can guarantee it was because of how he looks. He has tattoos and a hoodie on him probably looks different than a hoodie on others. We felt judged and profiled and I wanted to take my time to write this because it happened, and it wasn't right. Mistakes are made, things get missed but Alice's arrogance made everything worse and made us feel invalidated. She is unapologetically rude. 

Our server was lovely, I didn't catch her name but Thank you for helping us salvage the evening somewhat.

It's a very beautiful restaurant but the experience was not good. The service was horrible and the food was very sub par. Especially given the pricing of the restaurant. It was a $600 evening for three people including tip. One child included. Drinks and food, were not delivered in a timely fashion and not even close. We were there for 2 1/2 hours. It was very surprising to us. The table was never cleared either. We will not be returning.

Giving one star only because site won't allow me to give less. I am an avid Yelp user and have never given a bad review on any establishment. I work in the city and am a frequent restaurant consumer. This place is the most overrated and over priced sub par steak house I have ever had the displeasure of dining at. Went to restaurant with a group of 6. On a Friday night before a show.. Not going to go on for long but here are some facts
- drinks inconsistent (2 old fashions  2 different colors and tastes)
- bread covered with mystery sauce and doughy (all6 agreed 
- cheesesteak appetizer served cold in center
- dry aged strip steak $75 tough and tasteless 
- chicken under cooked. 
- wife and her girlfriend ordered Damon and both were sick 1/2 way threw show
- 1st time in a so called high end restaurant where 4 out of 6 drinks were dry twice threw a $650 meal
Save your money and go to a legit restaurant
OUTSTANDING. wow could not have been better the ribeye was cooked perfect. Service was great. really fantastic. The sides were shareable. Drinks were awesome and a very nice wine selection
I've gone here 3 other times in the past year, food is always great. The waiter was a little off but I definitely wouldn't let that stop me from going back.

I came here last night for my birthday party, it was a party of 8. We had an 8:30 pm reservation.  It took about 30 mins to receive a drink. A few friends ordered an appetizer and the rest of the group was ready to order our entrees. We were told that we were not allowed to order our meals yet because the appetizers were being brought out. It took her another 30 mins to come to get our order, at this point we were already done with our drinks. Throughout the whole time dining there she never asked if we wanted to order more drinks. Once the food came out at 10:30 pm there was a mixed up and we told the servers this. One rudely stated "whatever" and continued to throw the food on the table. At the end of the night, I wanted to put candles on my cake and asked our waitress who we saw a total of 3 times, for candles. She tried to light the candles with a full table of DIRTY dishes. I asked her if she could clear the table for us and she started to. She came back and lit the candles and I told her we were not ready because the table was still DIRTY!!!!!! She tried to blow the candles out and caught herself saying "oh I forgot it was COVID". She now had an attitude that I was confused about because we asked nicely the FIRST time to clear ALL the dishes off. We stated we would let her know when we were ready and she never came back to light the candle. Not to mention it took them almost 2 and a half hours to get our FOOD. We spent over $800 to have a not-so-great service. This was our first and last time here.

This 3 star review is really based on the average of all my visits here... on a good day, it's amazing. On an off day, it's just... off.

This last time was the most frustrating. We had reservations, and the front desk kept saying the table was being bussed. For 1.5 HOURS. Seriously. Granted, we were a party of 7, but we even said go ahead and split us to 2 tables nearby. 90 minutes past our reservation time, no apology, nothing. If you can't manage seating, this is truly a problem.

Service is good if at times a bit awkward--I can't explain it. It's like wearing a great suit that is just like half a size off. 

Overall, the food is what you would expect from a steakhouse--the meat is consistent to temp ordered, the sides are ridiculously large and I'm sure 10000 calories each. The creamed corn is probably my favorite, the others are good as well.
The starter bread is not my favorite--sometimes overly dry, overly buttered/sweet/salt (maybe this is their attempt so you don't eat it?). 

The place is beautiful, if a bit loud. 
Pricey but on par with other steakhouses in the area.

Summary: a place for a consistent piece of steak and sides.

This is a review of the Butter Cake with Butter Pecan Ice Cream, Fresh Whipped Cream, and Caramel Sauce. It was honestly mediocre and not worth the calories or price. While I don't enjoy writing negative reviews, I think it's important to be honest. Especially where it concerns relatively high priced or calorie dense food. I had high hopes for this dessert, but it sadly fell short. The cake was luke warm, overly sweet, greasy, and generally bland. While the ice cream tasted like store bought Breyers. Even the caramel sauce was far below average. At a price of around $15 with tip included, that's not acceptable. Bottom line - skip dessert at Del Frisco's. Don't recommend.

I mean we all enjoy Del Friscos food but the management at this specific location are rude. I live in Philadelphia and I've come here numerous times and its always a problem at the front when checking in! Its a restaurant not a secret club they need to be mindful we are paying customers. I feel like im targeted because I am young which people assume young people have no money. Which believe me is not the case! 5 star food 3 star attitude!

Price: 2 (very pricey here)
Ambience: 4
Food: 2
Service: 2

Joined a group in the vault for EDUCAUSE. The vault was cool and we were comfortable. It was a novelty. The server came to take our ordered and I ordered a Caesar salad with extra blue cheese. I also ordered the rib eye steak medium rare. The salad arrived and it had no dressing. No big deal, I asked for a side. 20 minutes later ranch arrived. I asked for blue cheese. Another 10 minutes and it arrived. The server was visually annoyed. A younger girl didn't seem to want to be at work today.

Just started on my completed salad and my steak came medium well. No biggie. I asked them to fix it. At least 8 can eat salad. The group started to eat. After 20 minutes more another a new steak came the same way. I asked a new server (as ours hadn't been seen for 20 minutes) for a replacement at the proper temperature. After another 30 minutes the manager came up to ask how my meal was. I told him I didn't know as I have still not received it. He was flabbergasted. Thankfully I had a new steak at the correct temperature in 10 minutes. Unfortunately, by this time the entire group was finishing dessert, while I stared to eat my steak. It really made me lose my appetite. I spoke to a few other folks at four other tables and they experienced similar mix ups. 

All in all the flavor was good once I received it. Yet after waiting over an hour for the food to arrive properly, I have to say I was disappointed. If you can't handle a large group in your banquet facilities, just don't accept the reservation. I wouldn't go back.

This was a business client dinner that was exceptionally poor.  As a caveat, I do work in the Hospitality/Restaurant business and have for over 25 years as a senior manager.  I recognize things are tough with Covid but the Del Frisco's experience was pretty bad.  After looking at my $1700.00 receipt for 7 people last night, I was just ridiculously disappointed.  Multiple send-backs due to steak temperatures.  One of my guests literally had to wait until the rest of us were half through our meals to get their meal.  Note--they REALLY undercook their steaks.  Even another client mentioned this from THEIR previous mediocre experience.  I cannot really say much good.  A seafood "tower" for 7 people for $427.00 with rubbery shrimp, a few shooters and some misc other items for $61.00 a person was a joke--even at Philadelphia prices.  

The server was perfunctory at best.  Manager stop by didn't even acknowledge the issues to the dinner host (me) with an apology.  For a Tuesday night,  this was a wholly underwhelming experience.  Oh..at end of meal offered the Landry Membership card at departure.  Nice, right?  Yea....they charged me $25.00 for it without mentioning the "fee".    With the price point, the service and execution flaws and the last "shady" pitch for $25.00, would YOU return?

This is only for you fellow Yelpers as this restaurant usually doesn't even bother responding to bad reviews (see below) unless you apparently have been drugged (also see below).
We had a group dinner in a room downstairs -- food was delicious! The butter cake was amazing!  Atmosphere through restaurant was nice!

My cousin reserved a table for ten in the private dining room "the vault" located in the lower level of Del Frisco; in celebration of her 43rd bday 10/1/2021. Reservation was for 8pm.  
Upon my arrival greeters were extremely pleasant, helpful and welcoming.  I wish I could say the same for our waitress.  
I can't recall her name however, this woman was extremely rude, slow and condescending.  While She failed miserably to remember one order to the next or serve our drinks in a timely manner; she did remember to remind us twice about the 1000 dollar minimum spend; since 3 of the guest at our table were no shows. I get it though, maybe she assumed we'd forgotten.
Needless to say, I ordered the prime steak & iceberg salad wedge without bacon. This woman managed to bring me the wrong salad 3xs.  The third time I accepted what was served to me. The steak was flavorful, tender & very well seasoned. However, I'm issuing a self proclaimed sodium warning!
My sister ordered two lobster tails which were served charred, cold, with no garnishings.  It's typically drizzled with butter. The Waitress had the audacity to note on the bill (didn't like) Lobster was never touched. 
While in the restroom our table was cleared of all of our food remaining. Waitress argued with us over the fact she would never remove anything from a table & it was just a spoonful of mashed potatoes left. LIES!!!! I was extremely appalled.
Some of these establishments that pride themselves on minimums; need to retrain staff on proper etiquette. This woman was rude, impatient, obnoxious and I will not ever spend another nickel at this establishment.
This place still BLOWS!!!!!!!!!! Food is overpriced and just Sucks they should turn that place into a WAWA

The five stars is for the food and the service only! The ambiance is "zero stars"!! Why you ask well because your site and the lobby say numerous reasons why you will not be able to come in to the restaurant yet there were numerous people who were not in the least bit presentable for such a       "High class" restaurant. 
Also the music was not appropriate for the mode that such a restaurant should play and having tv's on for football games makes the restaurant look and sound more like a bar/pub than an High end restaurant!!
My wife took me for my birthday and she was very upset. She get she disappointed me because the site does not tell the truth of what you are truly trying to give a customer.  
A memorable experience, for the right reasons. 
Mike M.
ALSO. You claim to have valet parking!!
We arrived at 6:15 and guess what 
"No Valet Parking"!!
I am handicapped and had to walk two blocks from where I parked which cost more than what I would have paid if the Valet parking was available!!
You are NOT a Five, Four, or any stars!!
When it comes to all the above. 
Unbelievable!!

This was my first experience with del Frisco's. It has taken me over a month to write this review.  I did not want to review while I was emotional or angry.  I don't go into the city often for dinner but it was my daughters birthday and she wanted a special night.  I made reservations for 6 people on 8/15/21.  We arrived and had to wait for the car in front of us to discharge its passengers.  Three scantily-clad women climbed out of the car and immediately had to straighten  their outfits as the process of getting out of the car rearranged some vital body parts in congruence with public decency.  We followed these women into the restaurant and immediately questioned if this was the most appropriate restaurant for family dining.  Four of us went to the bar to wait for my daughter and her friend.   I received a call from my daughter who was outside the restaurant, in tears that she wasn't being allowed in because she didn't meet the dress code.  This was unimaginable to me as we just walked in after 3 provocative, indecently dressed women.  Not to mention that my daughter is an extremely conservative dresser.  Her friend had a collared shirt and pants. She had loose pants, sandals and a shirt.  I spoke with the manager who said her belly is showing and that's not allowed.  The bottom of her shirt met there top of her pants.  It was straight neck, sleeveless, not low cut...very tasteful.  I was completely confused as to how 3 women with plunging necklines, one so low you can see her belly were allowed in but a young teenager with no neckline was stopped at the door.  We were told bare midriffs we're not allowed. Yet, there was a man in the bar with gym shorts, tshirt and baseball hat---which is also not allowed per the website.  Clearly these guidelines are enforced subjectively by the management. How and why my teenage daughter was targeted as not being allowed into the restaurant is a reflection on the management and culture of the company.  We made these reservations in celebration of a special night,  Obviously, the manager preferred having provocatively dressed, scantily clad clientele patron the restaurant as opposed to more modestly dressed young women celebrating with their family.  This is not a family restaurant!  I should have read previous reviews about "strip club" atmosphere.  By the way, we went down the street and were welcomed with open arms at McCormick and Schmidt's and has a great celebratory dinner.

business.name: Ocean Prime

business.categories: Cocktail Bars, American (New), Bars, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Seafood, Nightlife

reviews.text: The dining experiences here were excellent. The food was great, service at table was great! I had steak that was cooked to the perfection. I had lobster that was seasoned well to where you didn't even need butter. The only issue I had was with the valet parking! they left us sitting in our car for 15 minutes and charged me seven dollars extra when my Kia Sorento is a normal size vehicle and is charged as a car anywhere else.
Went with my wife and we absolutely loved it there the atmosphere to the food were perfect and our waitress was great! Would definitely go back there!

If I Could Give Half To No Stars I Would...


To Begin The Shenanigans Me And My Party That I Arrived With Made It On Time, But Our Table Wasn't Ready Until 45 Minutes AFTER The Time We Had Scheduled. Mind You This Is For A Birthday Party That Was Suppose To Host 23 Guests. We Made Reservations For A Private Dining Hall But They Put Us In A Public Section Anyways. Strike One . We Finally Make It To Our Seats And We Receive Bread For The Party That's Gone In A Few Seconds And We Order Our Drinks. We Didn't Get Our Drinks Until 30 To 45 Minutes After We Order Them. The Bread That Was Suppose To Come Around Didn't Come Around After The Second Time Of Receiving Bread Which That Was Also Very Late. At This Point Everyone Is Just Waiting On The Food We Order. The Food We Order Was On A Pre-Fixed Menu So There Weren't A Crazy Selection Of Food That We Ordered But Yet The Food Took 2 To 2 And A Half Hours. We Arrived At 7 Didn't Get Seated Til 730-745 Ish And Didn't Receive Our Entrees Until Approximately 10 pm. At This Point Everyone Was Tired And Ready To Go. The Food Was Horrible Too And Came Out Cold. Strike Two . The Last Thing I Will Add Is That Nothing Was Taking Off The Bill After Numerous Complaints And Times Talked To The Manager. That Was My First Time Going Definitely Will Be My Last Time Going To Such An Establishment. I Would Like To Reiterate That I Would Give 0 STARS If Possible.

I haven't been here in a while and I liked it from my last visit (years ago). However, the wait time was long for everything. I made reservations for 7:45 on a Saturday and we were seated 20 min later (even though we arrived on time. Our waiter did not arrive for about 15 min after we were seated. The food was good but the wait times were not. I guess I have to get used to the fact that covid may be the cause (wasn't the first restaurant that had this issue). I would go again, but on a weekday.
Absolute best entree I have had in years.  The blackened cod special was superb.  The sauce was flavorful without overwhelming the fish.  The butter cake was a ending to an incredible meal

Yum! Such an excellent meal. I came here for my birthday and couldn't have been more satisfied. Since it's both a steak and seafood house, there are a lot of good options if you're not a big steak person. I made my own surf n turf by ordering a prime rib and a lobster off of the menu. If you do the same, come with an empty stomach and go light on the bread because the steak and lobster are filling! The prime rib was perfectly salted with the ideal amount of fat. The lobster was also absolutely perfect. 

Drinks wise, I would recommend the berries and bubbles just for the novelty of seeing vapor come out of your drink.

Great food, great service, and great ambiance!

Ocean Prime is absolutely fabulous!  The food is delicious and the ambiance is wonderful.  I had the pleasure of meeting Amer, who took care of my family and me on Sunday.  He misses NOTHING!  He provided the most amazing dining experience and was so friendly and helpful.  His menu recommendations were spot on!  We also we met Julie, the manager of the restaurant when we dined.  She was so affable and cordial.  All of the staff were truly top-notch.

If you are ever in Philadelphia, this is a fantastic place to dine!

This place is worth ALL the hype. To start the interior design is beautiful. At the bar they serve free popcorn with drinks that is so good it must be infused with crack. (Just kidding, it's truffle oil, salt, and parsley). They also serve free bread baskets WITH PRETZELS!!! Amazing. The pretzels had a crisp bite to them but a soft interior. I could easily cut it open with a butter knife. My friend got the fish special but I ordered the 8 oz filet rare (cooked PERFECTLY) with truffle butter and a lobster tail. I ate every single bite. We also got the creamed spinach with bacon as a side which was really good and more than enough for two people. I also ordered Prosecco during dinner which was great and a chocolatini for dessert. I did order one glass of Sauvignon blanc which I didn't like but the waiter was happy to exchange it for me. The service was amazing! Big props to all the employees! Thank you so much for this awesome experience!

Husband and I were on first date night in 2 years. Was very excited to try this place. He ordered the Chilean sea bass, I ordered the scallops. His sea bass was raw in the middle, like still 1/3 translucent pinkish. My scallops were so disgusting tasting. Im not sure if they were rotten or cooked in a strange oil but they were completely inedible. We are not complaining types but was so shocking that we BOTH had issues with our orders. Reported to manager who remove them from the bill. The point is, we left hungry and sceptical that a $$$$ establishment will serve this to any customers at all.
 I would LOVE to hear what the chef was thinking while preparing our meals...

Met all my expectations!
Celebrated passing the bar exam with a delicious dinner at Ocean Prime.  Per the recommendations below, we went with the spicy tuna roll over the ocean prime roll and it did not disappoint. The tuna was so fresh and the tempura was lightly battered. Then, we tried the east coast special oysters from Virginia. For our entrees, I got the Chilean sea bass which is a best seller and now I know why. My boyfriend got the filet mignon with truffle butter and he said it literally cut like butter and was juicy and tender. Last, we spared some room for the 10 layer carrot cake which was so decadent and rich. 

Overall, it was a great experience for a special occasion! The menu is pricey which is why I will categorize this as a "special occasion" spot. Highly recommend!

One of my favorite places to dine. 

Parking: street, lot or valet

Atmosphere: comfy with low lighting

Service: Every server I have encountered is so nice and helpful with assisting with food and beverage selections. 

Food: Every meal I have had was delicious and cooked just right.  From their crab cakes, lamb chops, teriyaki salmon, Point Judith calamari, asparagus and roasted Brussels sprouts your tastebuds will be satisfied with great flavor. 

I like to go here for their happy hour. My favorite drink is the berries & bubbles! Delightful!

They also offer private dinning. 

Enjoy!

Some of the best calamari I've ever had! As for th steak, it was bland and needed more seasoning. I also tried the teriyaki salmon which was very delicious. I probably won't visit again, considering it's a fine dining restaurant  with fine dining prices, but the food was not to that expectation.

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile & finally had the chance. The only negative about my experience was how slow the service was and there were missing items in my order. Maybe b/c of short staff or Covid but the place was only opened for 4 hours this night. All the food ordered was great and when it did arrive the presentation was perfect. My favorite was the potatoes & the dynamite sushi. A good spot but because of service I will choose another restaurant next time.

Price: 2
Flavor: 5
Variety: 5
Ambience: 5
Service: 5

Amazing, simply done to perfection. I joined a group and we ordered appetizers (sushi and oysters), steaks and sides. Everything was delicious. 10oz filet was tender, well seasoned and flavorful. The 34oz ribeye was bananas. You could share between 3 people,but it was a little less than they wanted for the 3 male carnivores who ordered it. All steaks need to have accompaniments, or side dishes. We ordered truffled Mac and cheese (5*), mushrooms (5*), asparagus (4*), Brussels sprouts (5*), and garlic mashed potatoes (5*). The wine selection was ample and great.

The ambience of the restaurant was very nice the staff was very welcoming and our service was great. The only thing that I have an issue with the price of the food. The salmon was very very distasteful the chilled crab meat had no flavor and my steak was a little tough and small for $60. The drinks was wonderful and the dessert was very delicious. If you're coming for drinks and dessert a perfect atmosphere. The restaurant/chef needs to work more on the food for the price. I should have gone to Outback Steakhouse house if I wanted a good meal.

Second time here.  First time was right before Covid shut down.  Another excellent experience.  Adamor our server was excellent and allowed for a relaxing celebration.  The food was outstanding.  The twin lobster tails were delicious as was the 10oz filet cooked a perfect medium.  The other entree was the king salmon.  Started with calamari which was excellent and highly recommend.  It had a sweet Thai chili sauce.  The the spice was very tolerable.  Finished with the signature carrot cake and a chocolate cake which were both excellent and would get again.  Overall great experience.  This is a great special occasion place
Very good but very pricey and everybody was very nice Our waitress was amazing to the bartender service waiting for a table would  go again

Celebrated my big bday here 2 weeks ago and boy, did I pick the right place. Not sure if the reason we have a separate, more intimate room bc I put "bday celebration" on my reservation or it was my lucky day, i absolutely loved it and we also had a spectacular and attentive waiter so that adds on to my first time experience.

We started off with east coast oysters; they were fresh & tasty. Lobster bisque was good but I personally didn't like the chalk-like after taste- not that I have tasted chalk before but let's just say it wasn't too pleasing for my palate. We had the surf n turf and baybeeeee when I  say that short rib was moist, it was melts in your mouth.  And oh the scallops were delicious as well. We had some sushi, it was good but nothing out of the ordinary.

Onto the main dishes. The bday girl (me) had the Twin Lobster and pheww juicy, tender, and sweet. Ribeye was on point on the temperature-redish pink inside and good seasoning. The chilean bass was good and salmon had good flavor but a little dry imo. We ended the night with Creme Brulee- my fav dessert and it was a good finisher, nothing out of the ordinary, but i likes.

Overall, this was the perfect restaurant to celebrate my big day as long as I didnt have to look at the bill ‍
Happy eating!

On the "Good-Meh-Suck" scale, this was a "Solid Good". It was a business dinner during the week but it was fairly busy. Service was fine regardless.

The Caesar salad was very good as was the seafood special. The steaks were excellent also. It is a chain but they do it well. No complaints.  I will come there again!

Food was really good! We were celebrating our one year anniversary! We felt super special and enjoyed our experience. Love the location in Miami. Philly is just as great!!!! Definitely coming back! Such a great atmosphere

Even though this is a chain, for the price you pay I was expecting way better of an experience. The inside of the restaurant and the bar area are beautiful so my expectations were for a super dinner. We were seated and server came over quickly and offered us drinks and they came out quick.  The bubbles drink is Deff interesting to watch and tastes yummy but after having two of them can't say I felt much off a buzz.. Moving onto the food- we got some oysters and the sautéed shrimp. They were good but nothing out of the ordinary. I also got an ocean sushi roll. The fish was fresh but the avacado inside the roll was still hard. For entrees we got the crab cakes and filet cooked medium  with shrimp scampi added on and the tater tot sides and a side of garlic mashed. The crab cakes tasted like a frozen crab cake cooked at home with no taste. I took two bites and sent it back. The filet was burnt on the outside... not something I'm used to for a steak cooked medium. Shrimp scampi was super lacking in garlic flavor and was rubbery. The server did take off the crab cakes, but we will not be returning.

Great evening for our anniversary. Sara gets major kudos from the reservations to accepting the flower delivery the day of. Arrived a little early and waited less than five minutes to be seated. The table was set with the flowers I had delivered. Waiter Adhemar was a superstar. The drinks Black Orchid and the Old Fashion were superb. We had the Port Judith Calamari and the Ahi Tuna Sushi Roll was delish. The Riesling was fruity and delicious. We decide to go with the Halibut special with fingerling potatoes, corn relish, asparagus and cherry tomatoes. This is we're the meal went left. The entire dish was extremely under seasoned. The Halibut was over cooked and dry. The corn relish broth was tasteless and in my dish I had one cherry tomato (cut in half). We did not complain as we were in our own world celebrating our anniversary. But unfortunately we will not return. Nice atmosphere, decor and a very attentive and friendly waitstaff but the main course being a special lacked attention and Love. The three stars are awarded to the Sara, Adhemar and the waitstaff.

This is not a revenge review: I was treated fine as a walk-in to the bar. Nothing "happened". I was admittedly in a bad mood. But that meant I was willing to spend a lot of money to feel better. Nothing was off the table. But I had had mediocre experiences before (see earlier reviews). So I ordered cautiously. When I was presented with a happy hour menu (though the server was careful to tell me, I had missed the happy hour) and it was sticky, the music was "Muzak inner city edition", and the restaurant was practically deserted, I should have taken the hint. I had cocktails (fine) and I ordered calamari. What could go wrong? Seriously that was the worst fried calamari I have ever had. Gloppy sauce. Unfresh tough calamari. Truly awful. And that is a $21 dish!
 
Ok but I was still hoping for something to save the day. I ordered the chicken how can THAT go wrong? Oops. Chicken in a fancy restaurant is supposed to check off certain boxes unfortunately this one checked off the wrong boxes. Appearance ugly, flavor barely above grocery store chicken. It was something my mother packed for lunch not a glamorous take on roasted chicken like it was supposed to be. $34.

Years ago I tried this resto and was stunned by its mediocrity. It's gotten worse. I would urge anyone eager for a special night out to skip this place. I am VERY suspicious that the five star reviews for this place might be all shills. And I have never felt that way before.

Let me preface my 2 star review by saying, our waiters and the managers were PHENOMENAL and why I gave the 2 stars. Now, I don't understand the hype. The food was horrible, my date ordered a steak and I ordered the lamb chops, ordered both medium well and both came out super rare. They put his steak back on the grill instead of preparing a new one (yuck) and the chops came back burned. I hate sending food back or complaining but this meal was unacceptable, especially for the price. Both proteins lacked flavor and salt. The truffle Mac was bland, with some watery cheese sauce pooled at the bottom of the dish. The asparagus was ok at best.  My date enjoyed his drinks from the bar but we won't be returning.
The ambiance in itself is worth it.  Food was decent.  One of the better seafood spots in Philly.

business.name: Chubbys Steaks

business.categories: Cheesesteaks, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Steakhouses

reviews.text:
Good cheesesteak and bomb onion rings, would go back! 

So far my favorite cheesesteak yet. Liked that the steaks were chopped too fine and they gave a decent amount of whiz (yes whiz wit is the only way!). Only complaints is that they don't have banana peppers (I love my banana peppers), would like to see that being added to the menu. 

Onion rings are literally the best onion rings there are (ok - I don't know if it's the best out there, but can confirm it's up there). Nice crunch and good batter, what more do you need? 

Would go back!

Went here because the line at the more famous joint across the street looked too long, and that was a mistake. My boyfriend ordered the classic cheesesteak with cheese whiz, and I ordered a mushroom sandwich (I'm vegetarian) to go. Waited 30 min for our order, although there was no line. When we drove back across town and opened our food, we saw that both of our orders where wrong - my sandwich had meat in it and my boyfriends had American cheese in it and not cheese whiz. He said it was pretty bad, tasteless, and couldn't finish it. We were short on time because we had to head out to catch a flight or we would have returned to try to get our correct order. Tldr: check your order before leaving this place, or better yet, don't go at all.

I know some have said this is even better than the one across the street. It is not as good as the famous one... That's why the other one is packed and busy all the time. However, Chubbys is less of a pain in the ass to get in and out of. They also accept credit cards and you can order online. Better than others in the area, but if you're heading to that neighborhood anyhow...

Weirdly enough I was feeling healthy so I decided to get a Greek salad. This was literally 40 mins before they closed so i was expecting something thrown together real quick. I'm telling you, this was hands down the best salad I've ever had. They were not skimpy on the feta cheese and the veggies and lettuce were so crunchy and fresh I couldn't even believe it. Especially since I was ordering a salad from a cheesesteak place. I will def be ordering another in the future!

Chubby's is a decent cheesesteak spot. The flavor is nothing special but at least it is noticeable. My main issue is that they are consistently dry. If you are debating where to go for a quality cheesesteak and don't mind a little wait then you should go across the street to Dalessandro's.

Very good taste!  Better then dalessandros that is across the street.  The flavor and everything is good.  The wait time isn't long compared to across the street (which idk even why as there's isn't good).

The blandest chicken cheesesteak I've ever had. 

I hadn't been to Chubby's in years so I was extremely excited to revisit. To my disappointment, the chicken cheesesteak I had was tasteless and a complete waste of money. I should've just stuck with my usual spots in the city. Spare yourself.

These people are mask Nazi's. Way too overboard with the mask and social distancing requirements. Way too political or a restaurant. Besides that the wait time is way too long. And the food is not even that good. The place across the street has better cheesesteaks anyway

Decent  cheese steak.

The wait time was a bit long. Nearly 25min for a sandwich is a bit too long. 

I ordered the cheesesteak with onions and cheese whiz. I would request more cheese whiz the next time. 

$12 per sandwich. Good portion size. I'd def go again.

Absolutely terribly customer service. I went in there to use the bathroom - I offered to buy something since it said it was for customers only. The lady at the front was so miserable and rude and had no compassion to an obviously desperate person willing to buy something. Not only was she unwilling to let me buy something and then use the bathroom, but she was an absolute b**** about it. "Not my problem" she said rudely. No wonder Dalessandro's across the street is booming with business - who in their right mind would eat here with a nasty lady like that? Such a Philly attytude. Definitely never going to be a customer.

Because they were short-staffed, it took 20 minutes to order a cheesesteak sandwich with provolone cheese.  However, the cashier did inform us of the 30 minute wait.  The infamous Dallesandro's is located across the street and it was closed for the week.  I Suspect this place got more business as a result.  The sandwich was average and lacked seasoning.

Was in Philadelphia for a few days and ordered cheesesteaks from a few different places. Went to a cheesesteak spot near the liberty bell then Pat's. This was the third cheesesteak spot and the service was horrendous. This is all based off service, their food was ok and would rate 3 stars for the cheesesteaks. After ordering I asked to use the restroom for my 5 year old daughter who was with me and a male employee was about to open up the restroom but a lady yelled at him and said for dine in customers only. He apologized and walked away and I asked the lady if my 5 year old can use the restroom, we just finished ordering and she responded no it's policy.. I then said, ok please change my order to dine in and she got really upset and said I ordered for take out. I told her I know but now I want to change to dine in and she caught such a nasty attitude and just opened the restroom for us. I don't understand why she was so upset we are customers and when she informed me of "policy" I tried to abide by policy and was ok with dining in and requested to change my order to dine in. I don't understand why they would be so frustrated. Complete lack of customer service. I read some other reviews about the staffs attitude and possibly due to racial profiling and I really hope that is not the case. I'm Asian and it would be a shame if they specifically treat people that aren't white a certain way. I really hope that's not the case.

I went here as the mask policy was starting up & I had to have an off the grill cheesesteak. Fed up with crappy cheesesteaks. I go to either of these joints but because of how hot it was outside chubbys won easily. Got to say, owner/manager was a delight, how I've missed talking eagles etc with staff.... He also opened my eyes to YumYum doughnuts which by the way was delicious. Cheesesteak & curly fries was as good as ever though I do prefer their neighbors sauce but that's my preference. Should have come when they 1st open back up as there is nothing like a steak right off the grill I have to say

I'm going to give Chubby's 4* for the reasons I give any restaurant a 4*: either the restaurant specializes in one particular kind of food in which the different varieties of that particular item has a very low probability of straying from the good quality the food item in question (e.g. if a cheesesteak is good, chances are the chicken cheesesteak will be good as well considering the preparation is similar) or I've patronized the establishment enough times and the food and customer service remains consistently good. For Chubby's, since this is a cheesesteak/sandwhich shop, the main goal here and attraction are their cheesesteaks. I ordered the cheesesteak. I'm all about simplicity with my cheesesteaks; onions (extra if they look really delicious), hot cherry peppers and American cheese with a ketchup cup on the side which I either drizzle inside the cheesesteak or dip the cheesesteak in the ketchup cup. How I eat the cheesesteak with ketchup depends on how messy the sandwich is. 

One thing to note, there is a competing cheesesteak shop across the street called Dalessandro's and while they are indeed pretty good, have the long lines and rightfully so the recognition on social media, if you ask me I think Chubby's wins in the flavor category. Dalessandro's is going to wow you with the sheer large size of their cheesesteaks however I think Chubby's has a unique savory flavor element. Chubby's uses ribeye steak (most Philly cheesesteak shops do) and their steak is very tender and flavorful. I guess it also depends on the kind of cheese you order with your cheesesteak. I love the flavor combination of seasoned steak, onions and American cheese. I'm from the DMV and I recognize hometown Philadelphians opt for whiz cheese and in some cases provolone cheese however American cheese in my opinion is a more sophisticated move for those who are looking for a greater, deeper flavor experience and not just your normal steak experience. Chubby's fits the bill. Parking can be a drag however considering Chubby's is located in a residential neighborhood. But overall a very good cheesesteak experience. I'll return for sure. This place sustains the Philly cheesesteak reputation.

I was very much looking forward to trying this, and I will say it didn't disappoint. My boyfriend and I split a cheesesteak with wiz and American. Let me just say I'm a huge fan of places that mix the meat and American cheese together. It gives it an added depth of flavor. The wiz was drizzled on top and gave the bite the perfect amount of saltiness. However, the wiz was cold. I would have liked it to been warm upon serving. The bread was soft, I will say however the bread was a little too big but it was good bread. The meat to cheese ratio was almost spot on. If you're sensitive to onions I would suggest not to sit up front near the grills, because our eyes were BURNING and tearing so badly from them cooking onions. Also, still not used to Philly not requiring health cards for workers. The waitress was standing at the counter just eating fries in front of us and then taking orders. All in all, a very very good sandwich. Next time I just won't sit so close to the grills ;)

Ahhh, what can I say? I had to come to Philly, for some unpleasant family business, but Chubby's was one of my highlights, and the reason I miss Philly so much. I got a regular steak sandwich, and it was anything, but regular. They loaded me up with enough meat to make a whole other sandwich. Delicious!!
My personal fav cheesesteak to get when I lived in Philly for a few years. I would switch between steak and chicken, always with provolone and onions. THE BEST

I've been going to Chubbys for years and even today, living in a whole other state, i still go out of my way when I'm in Philly for a steak from Chubby's (it even tastes good after sitting in its foil wrapper for 3 hours so that should say something).  For me, it's the quintessential Philly cheesesteak. The meat is seasoned well and chopped fine, the wiz is good and complements the meat perfectly, the bread is always soft and the onions always grilled til they are soft and greasy. For me, this is everything a good steak should be- no fluff, no extra stuff. I've only ever experienced good food and  good service here (I'm thinking some of the complaints about service aren't from Philly natives). 

Chubbys is an established neighborhood steak place. It's a regular old hole in the wall who doesn't aim to impress. You can go to Dalessandro's if you want, I mean it's good enough, but for me the steaks at Chubbys are better with less hassle. One thing you gotta know about Philly and the steaks- if it's a "popular" steak place, most of the time it's not worth it, you're gonna get the best steaks from the places that seem regular degular. I'll take a steak from Chubby's over any of the top names any day!

Ordered a cheesesteak through doordash.  They sent me the wrong order, a veggie wrap.  When I called I got no apology for the mix up or an offer to replace the sandwich and have it delivered to me.  Instead she cut me off would not allow me to speak and said that she already contacted doordash and I would get my money back.  Not the best service.

I actually liked the cheesesteak, there were moments while eating the sandwich where there was just the right combination of steak, cheese and onions where it was just great. My 2 star review was for the customer service. This was my first time at Chubby's and I was not familiar with the setup and procedures.  Even though I have been vaccinated the vaccine is not working on me because of some drugs that I am on so I have to be very careful and still will not eat inside a restaurant. Before stepping into Chubby's we noticed that there was a large tented area outside with plenty of picnic tables so we though that we could get our food and sit down outside like most considerate restaurants. After we got our food we stepped over to the area and we noticed signs up that said waitress service only. Ok, there is NOBODY here and no waitress present and had I known this I would have ordered here but it was too late. I thought that because there was nobody here and like most decent places that care about their customers they wouldn't mind us sitting here because we did just spend $30. We sat down and after 2 minutes a waitress came out and asked us to leave. Sorry, this is just bad management and I would NEVER return. We are still dealing with covid and some people still want to eat outside and everyone does NOT know the rules when first visiting. You need to be more flexible. I see that there is another review that has the same complaint. I guess there is a reason why there is a line 20 deep at Delassando's and none at Chubby's.

The worst customer service ever! Went in bought a six pack of beer asked the use bathroom the sales person said I had to sit down. I said ok I will sit down and get a drink then she said I had to order food damn I just spent $16 dollars and would of spent more to use the bathroom. Don't know how the food tastes and I don't care. Thanks management! My first and last time visiting Chubby's go across the street to Delassandro's to get a steak.
While visiting Philly we want to try some place different. Found Chubby's and we were not disappointed! Chicken cheese steaks were on point  and we had an ample amount for later in the evening.

After having delassandros many times my boyfriend went to get one but decided not to wait in the crazy line so he went across the street to chubbys. We will definitely be back. The roll was fresh and the perfect texture. There was plenty of meat and lots of cheese. We also got some delicious curly fries!
Chubby's is a good steak spot that's always competing with dalesandros but just as good. They have good steak sandwiches with soft hoagie rolls and good flavor.

Please don't waste your time going here and wait for the place across the street that has a long line. The chicken was as dry as cardboard and there is no cheese and one piece of mushroom and pepper on it. I was looking for a great chicken cheese steak coming out of town and this was way overpriced and a waste of money.

business.name: Barclay Prime

business.categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Good atmosphere, Good Service and Delicious Steak. 

Lived in Philadelphia all my life and this was the first time I tried this restaurant. To a certain extend, I do believe this restaurant lived up to the expectation
I had but the reason I cannot give this restaurant 5 stars is that ALL OUR FOOD CAME OUT LUKEWARM. 

I mean oyster, of course it should be cold but we didn't expect our soup, scallop, steak and side dish to come out cold. The only thing was somewhat warm was the Brussels sprouts and that did not taste that great. 

I am giving this place 4 star based on the phenomenal service I received from everyone in the restaurant and the quality of the steak. But I hope the can improve on the logistics for the food delivery so the guests can enjoy the food hot not lukewarm.

This Starr restaurant does not disappoint. Cozy and romantic aesthetic. Still dreaming about the salmon appetizer and that wagyu!
Just remind ya rents to bring their reading glasses and pocket light, because the lighting is pretty dim.

*HIGHLY RECOMMEND*
4.5/5 STARS

Barclay Prime is part of Starr restaurant group so you know it'll be good. This upscale fine-dining restaurant is great for special occasions when you are prepared to splurge because it is definitely not cheap. I love the low light setting with low table couch seating because it enhances the intimate atmosphere. Dress code is also more semi formal than casual. Steak wise, they have a good variety of options from standard to American Wagyu to Japanese Wagyu. They know how to prepare the steak to medium rare perfection. They also have a good selection of seafood platters as well. They served the quality of the ingredients and it is definitely worth the experience.

*DINNER*

Hamachi Crudo - 4 slices of fresh hamachi with citrus ponzu and avocado jalapeño topping. The hamachi was very fresh and decadent. The citrus ponzu, not as sour as I thought, perfectly pairs well with the light hamachi flavor.

Seared Diver Scallops - the scallops was cooked to PERFECTION. The texture was so soft and tender, not chewy at all, like you're eating raw scallops but it was fully cooked. The citrus sauce was the highlight. It was sour, which I love. The broiled mushroom was also very juicy but crispy, 

Glatt Kosher Ribeye - perfectly medium rare. A bit too salty for my liking. Think it would go very well with some sauce but we didn't get any. Good but not my favorite.

American Wagyu Filet Mignon - when you think about how tender and buttery Wagyu can be, this did its jobs. Easy to cut, easy to chew with just enough saltiness. Perfectly cooked to medium rare.

Truffled mashed potatoes - great mashed potatoes, pretty heavy with the truffle flavor

Creamed Spinach - not as heavy as I thought, very good pairing with the saltiness of the steak. 

Banana pudding creme brûlée - let's just say, this is the best creme brûlée I've ever had. 

*VERDICT*
Would definitely come back again for another special occasion

Barclay prime is the best restaurant that you can visit within the city. My fiance proposed in rittenhouse square (yes 100% romantic), and we made our way to barclay prime to celebrate after. The service was phenomenal, the food was to die for, an the atmosphere was pleasant. If you are celebrating a big event/milestone within the city, consider visiting barclay prime!!

Overall experience was spectacular. The service we received from getting seated, to getting our orders taken and food being serve was very professional. With the increase cases of covid they do check vaccination card and ID at the door so be sure to get those ready before coming. The restaurant is lightly dimmed and gives off a romantic dinner vibe, which I love. Food was a bit pricey, but definitely worth going to. We ordered the famous cheesesteak and honestly it was amazing. I love the extra hint of truffles they add to it. The dish is also served with a small bottle of champagne. The ribeye was medium rare, so soft and juicy. The only thing I wish had been different was if we got to choose the knife we wanted. However, that probably changed due to covid which is totally understandable, but would have made the experience unique.

Nice romantic restaurant !!! Low lights and music playing in the background gives it a nice feel to date night. The service is exceptional. The waiter was very attentive and provided excellent service. We tried the $100 cheesesteak and it was worth it ! We also ordered lamb chops, Mac and cheese, tater tots, potato's. I did not really care for the bass. I also appreciate the fact that the restaurant has great social distance practices. We were not sitting next to any others and we were all spread out.

The service was omg just incredible, our server came back every 5 minutes to check on us and to make sure we were good. I was happy eating and the food was served hot and crispy m. Literally everything was good

So we made reservations 4 weeks in advance for 10. They refused to put us at the same table and intentionally put us at 2 tables of 5 across the room from each other. Why? For the insane prices you would think they could accommodate us. Numerous requests and this table of 10 next to us sat empty the whole time. Our one chance to have a Christmas dinner with the whole family. We won't be back. So disappointing.
Amazing steak; waiter was extremely helpful with recommendations. The Oaxacan coffee and chocolate tart for dessert created a perfect ending to our delicious evening.

I can't believe that i have not done a review of this place yet... its one of my go to steakhouses and have not stopped going here. 
Atmosphere and space is one of the top place in the city (perfect for date night!)

The food is solid, i feel like covid, the experience (food wise and they no longer offer you the knife selection) has taken a hit but the service remains top notch.  

I highly recommend the sliders, ceasar salad to start and then the bone in filet or lamb as your main course.  The desert menu is also very good

Have had the pleasure of coming to Barclay Prime twice in the past couple months and it is always exceptional. Great cocktails, wines, food, and service. Pricey but very worth it for a special occasion or if you are looking to splurge!

We ordered the truffle mac, popovers, potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach as sides. All of these were excellent and rich versions of these dishes. 

My 60-day aged Ribeye was spectacular. The fat around the edges was a highlight, as that was so deeply savory and complex. The exterior had a heavy char that added a pleasant crisp and grill flavor without being overpowering. The tradeoff with ordering medium is that the center of my cut wasn't that flavorful and could have been more juicy. But, that's a tradeoff I'm willing to make to get the perfectly rendered fatty outer parts of the cut. The whole piece was evenly tender. 

This place is super expensive, by the way. So set that expectation before you go.

In my opinion Barclay Prime is not just the best steakhouse in Philadelphia but among the very top restaurants in Philly period. 

Front of house is exceptionally professional.  Arriving for a dinner in a private dining room has the host walking the diners outside and into the room accessible by its own entrance. No pointing, no loose directions, just handles the customer. 

Servers are professional. Understand and can review every menu selection thoroughly. Most importantly, once you place your order, from drinks to appetizers to dinner......you receive your plate/glass at the same time as others in your party without a hint of questions about "who had the Manhattan ". They know. They always get it right. 

The food is great. Not sure I can articulate any descriptions that haven't been used. The waygu sliders, just try them. Even the chopped salad gets the works. Crispy, vinegar flavors, feta adds creaminess and salt. Rest assured if I made this knowing the ingredients it would just not balance the same way. 

Heading to a 4 $$$$ restaurant should be an experience and Barclay Prime delivers.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB
I managed to get a 5:00 pm reservation on Friday for Barklay Prime, at 237 S. 18th Street. Barklay Prime is the fourteenth Steven Starr Restaurant in my series so far... I arrived with my friend Robin. We were seated at a quaint table for two where we met our server, Glenn. I ordered a flute of, champagne, ployez-jacquemart, 'extra quality brut', ludes, france, as  I often like to start a meal with Champagne.  Robin was feeling a bit adventurous, and ordered a cocktail she never had before, The Metropolis, belvedere ginger zest, limoncello, thyme, white cranberry. For me, this was the beginning of an exciting evening. I enjoy sharing a meal with someone who is willing try new things ! We ordered our appetizers. Robin ordered Seared Diver Scallops, carrot, citrus, with broiled maitake mushroom, While I ordered, Oysters on the Half Shell*, half dozen, red wine mignonette. I also ordered a soup... Lobster Cappuccino.  While viewing the menu, Robin expressed an interest in, Wagyu Beef Carpaccio, aged parmesan, arugula, lemon, porcini, scallop mousseline, but never having tried it, she ordered the Scallops, "just to be safe"... She didn't want to order it and find out she didn't like it. I have had Carpaccio and I like it. Since we started out trying new things I wanted to continue that theme, and suggested we order The Carpaccio and split it...Much to my excitement Robin agreed... Glenn brought us a Puff Pastry like bread that was made with Guyer Cheese and called a Popover... It came with a small bowl of soft butter that was sprinkled with sea salt... It was SOOO good ! The Oysters came out first. In my excitement, I regret that I didn't take a picture of them. They were served with a red wine mignonette and horse radish and were very good !  Robin never had Oysters before and was willing to give one a try. The excitement escalated ! Although she didn't like them very much, we both agreed, it was so much fun ! Next came The Carpaccio, Robins Scallops and my soup, Lobster Cappuccino. I had another flute of Champagne and Robin had another Metropolis as she found it to be "Very refreshing!" The two large Scallops were served with  a sauce of, carrot, and citrus,  and with broiled maitake mushroom. They were presented beautifully. The Lobster Cappuccino was assembled tableside. Four small Scallops Porcini Mushrooms and mousseline were presented in the center of the bowl. Glenn had a small pitcher of a "Lobster Bisque" like soup that he poured around  the bowl circling the contents highlighting them well. It was as beautiful as It was delicious ! I tried a bit of Robins Scallops and she tried a spoon full of my soup. Once again... DELICIOUS  !  Then we shared The Carpaccio ! Robin was pleasantly surprised at how much we both enjoyed it... ANOTHER FIRST for my adventurous  friend ! For our main course. Robin decided on, Ribeye prime 40 day dry-aged, with Kennett Square Mushrooms,  House Steak Sauce  and  Whipped Potatoes. I ordered, American Wagyu, Ribeye Cap, snake river farms, Idaho. with Creamed Spinach and Small Potatoes. Both Steaks were cooked to a perfect medium rare temperature ! And both were AMAZING !!! Glenn so aptly recommended a Ripasso by Valpolicella, Italy...It was a medium bodied red wine with a complex flavor profile that was excellent with my steak. After sampling my wine, Robin decided to stick with her Metropolis which by this point was quickly becoming her "favorite drink." Naturally We tried each others' steak and while they were both EXCELLENT we both agreed that The Wagyu was the better tasting of the two... Now was time for desert !  We shared a slice of Lemon Cheese Cake that was sprinkled with small chunks of Dark Chocolate and crowned with a crispy vanilla wafer. We each enjoyed a cup of Cappuccino with our desert. I had a Sambuca with mine... I even managed to talk Robin into trying  Sambuca with her Coffee... One taste was enough for her and she enjoyed the rest of her cappuccino by itself... lol ! Again I regret that I did not take pictures... We had a BLAST ! It was SO MUCH FUN ! Everything was PERFECT ! In fact Robin said it may have been the "best meal she ever had !" It was made so with the expert help of Glenn, who was the perfect gentleman and most proficient server ! I had a wonderful time with wonderful people and wonderful food, and will not soon forget the evening or the meal...  https://barclayprime.com/.

Opulence is a word that comes to mind. The thought of spending $600 for 2 people kind of opulence. Facial recognition temperature checks kind of opulence. Leather chairs kind of opulence. It's very much a vibe. Right off Rittenhouse square which is incredible in October. Walking in you can tell it's going to be an experience. The famous cheesesteak was really good. Less of a traditional Philly steak, imagine cheesesteak on a seeded hoagie primos hoagie roll with some peppers. It was really good but it's more of a novelty than worth the price. The Waygu was life changing. It was crispy on the outside but pure buttery, melt in your mouth perfect. The portion is way small tho so again novelty not a try again thing. It was a great experience, they take it very seriously, I left a bit hungry and had all courses so portions aren't huge but besides that, if you want the song and dance fancy, this is the place.
Honestly one of the best steakhouses in the county.      Everything is absolutely fantastic food, service, and atmosphere.

wow. last time I came I had terrible service, cold food, the waitress offered to heat our food up in a microwave which is ridiculous! But tonight, my fiancé and I had an incredible time. Our server Glenn was so kind and attentive. The food came out spectacular and i'm so glad we gave this place a second shot. Amazing food, and amazing service thanks to Glenn!

Barclay Prime is one place I've wanted to visit since I moved to Philly seven years ago. It's a pricey place, much more expensive than the restaurants I normally frequent, so I held off for a very special occasion. Well, that time came this year and I'm happy to say that it was a wonderful dinner. 

Ambiance: Relaxing and tastefully decorated. Like a modern, somewhat minimalist, library. The lighting was dim and perfect, the chairs were comfy armchairs. It was a comfortable setup for the hefty meal we were about to have. 

Food: Honestly, I eat steaks infrequently, so I kept my order basic. I got a bone-in New York strip cooked medium-rare. It was cooked perfectly and super delicious. My wife got a ribeye cooked medium, same results for her. We loved our steaks. We got three sides: creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and tater tots. All were delicious, but the tater tots, being so random on the menu, were such a standout... like deep fried cylinders of mashed potatoes. We also got the skillet cookie dessert, which was fantastic. Highly recommended if you want something sweet, the cookie is sectioned into chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, and sugar, all were excellent. 

Drinks: The drinks were great, but they're extremely pricey. As delicious as they were, $17 for a cocktail is wild. I knew what I was getting into, so I don't think it's be fair to take off a star for this, but the price is ridiculous. And that's not even touching their $30 signature cocktails...

Service: Great. Our server was kind and accommodating. He answered all of our questions nicely and his suggestions were great. My only note is that he could have come by our table a little more, but I know restaurants are having staffing issues these days and the place was pretty busy for a Tuesday night, so it's all good. 

Overall: We loved our dinner at Barclay Prime and would absolutely go again. It's a pricey meal, 2 steaks, 3 sides, 2 drinks, a dessert and tip came out to a bit under $300 for two people, but it was worth it for delicious food on a special night.

Amazing meal - the best I've ever had. I would not do justice if I described it, but I'll try. The filet melted in my mouth like butter. The asparagus, creamed spinach, sautéed mushrooms and whipped potatoes were delicious. And the rolls! Devine! Drew was our server and he was the most professional and charming individual.. The experience was top-notch. Thank you!

My sister and I are visiting Philadelphia and chose Barclay Prime from among other highly rated steakhouses on Yelp. We are glad we did, as it is an excellent dining establishment. Service is attentive, and the food ranged from  very good to amazing. We ordered a cesar salad, ribeye steak, halibut, truffle mac 'n' cheese, and potatoes au gratin. For dessert, we ordered their sorbet. Everything was delicious, but the standouts were surprisingly their complimentary popovers which were hot and buttery and the sorbet. For the latter, we ordered a couple of scoops of watermelon and one scoop of strawberry habiscus, and it was the best sorbet that we'd ever eaten. The flavors were so concentrated and fresh. Overall, it was an excellent meal, and we'll be sure to dine at Barclay Prime again the next time that we're in town.

OK hear me out I was staying at a hotel nearby this restaurant came highly recommended made a reservation party of one service was spectacular I had William as my server start it off with the Alaskan King crab which was two small pieces for $30 Which would've been fine if it wasn't preserved in a salt brine couldn't eat it asked them to pack it for my wife she will eat it he asked if there was anything wrong I said it was way too salty for me and took it off the bill so I ordered a crabcake which was as salty as the king crab I didn't want to complain again so I took it and stuffed it in my pop over(bread) Ordered the 32 ounce porterhouse it was also oversalted on the outside had to scrape off the $100+ steak.  Ordered the corn and truffle mac & cheese the latter was guess??? Oversalted couldn't eat it the corn was incredible, I talk to some of the people at the hotel I'm staying at and they thought I was crazy said its  a great steakhouse I believe it wholeheartedly but tonight they were way off. I got all my food to go and gave it to a homeless guy. $500.00's later and I just ordered Uber eats!  Call me a glutton for punishment but I will try it again in six months Due to the fact that I think it was just tonight that they were way off.~

I took my brother here for a belated birthday dinner on a Friday night. I'm a Stephen Starr fangirl, and I was determined to take him to the best of the Philadelphia restaurants in his empire, and I really couldn't have chosen better than this. 

At the time that I made the reservation, only bar seating was available. I was initially disappointed because I didn't want to sit at the bar to eat dinner, but where we were actually seated was in a pretty lounge area in the front room, with plush seating and lovely lighting provided by candles and shaded wall lamps. Our server was extremely friendly and informative, going above and beyond in service quality (more on that in a bit)! We started with glasses of water, the Clover Days cocktail for my brother, and a delectable basket of popovers, which were flaky, light, rich and delicious all at once, and came with a whipped salted butter, though the popovers were so good on their own they didn't even need the butter.

I'm a vegetarian, so I decided to go with the Caesar salad (I make an occasional pescatarian allowance), and an order of tater tots. My brother loves a good steak, but he never treats himself out to a steakhouse. So like the bossy older sister that I am, I told him, get whatever you want! And so he got the American Wagyu NY strip steak, and an order of truffle whipped potatoes. He's not as effusive as me, but he finished every bite of his meal with enthusiasm, and declared it one of the best steaks he'd ever had. He insisted that I try his whipped potatoes, and while they were very flavorful, the super-smooth creamy texture isn't for me. The tater tots, on the other hand, were incredible. The waiter thought I was nuts when I told him I've never actually had tater tots before. Pretty sure if I ever have them again, nowhere else will they have such a shatteringly crisp and deliciously salty exterior, with a perfectly cloud-like mashed potato interior. I confess I had to take most of the tasty little bites home because the Caesar salad was huge, and the dressing and grated cheese so good that I shamelessly mopped up the dish with the last of my popover. 

Now, getting back to the above and beyond service by our waiter - the steak and salad were brought out by a another member of the serving staff, (sooner than I expected), but no whipped potatoes or tots in sight. When our main server returned to check on us moments later, he exclaimed over the absence of our side orders, (turns out they were sent to another table) and remedied the oversight within minutes, all the while apologizing for the mixup. It was barely a delay at all, so my brother and I hardly minded, but he insisted on removing both items from our bill, effectively making them on the house. Maybe it's because I'm not used to restaurants with such stellar service, or maybe because I'm more used to having to point out missing food to the server myself, and getting an annoyed reaction, with the missing items eventually being brought out later. 

Yes, Barclay Prime is quite expensive, but it's worth every penny, from the amazing service, to the beautiful decor, to the insanely delicious food. For a special occasion or if you want to super-treat someone (or yourself), this is definitely one of the top options in Philadelphia.

Simply put, Barclay Prime is the gold standard for steak houses in Philadelphia. The food, service, and ambiance are of the highest quality. No expense has been spared; accordingly, prices are extremely high. That said, every dish Barclay Prime serves is delicious and worth the price. Bottom line - a truly transcendent dining experience. Above and beyond five stars.

Just came in for a cocktail, and maybe some appetisers. Barclay Prime is a classic Philadelphia steak house. Dimly lit and very rustic inside. There are also tables outside. 
I love the small bar area here. There are also small tables in the vicinity of the bar you can reserve for an intimate drink and dining experience.
I'm not sure if they have happy anymore, but I do remember it being a pretty good deal. Great food options and reduced drink prices. 
I totally recommend coming to Barclay Prime for the great food, wine list and experienced mixologists at the bar. 
The only surprise I ran into was the price of the cocktails.  There must have been a recent price increase? For example their Old Fashioned was priced at $30!  I ordered a $17 cocktail, The Metropolis, it consisted of Belvedere ginger zest, limoncello, thyme and white cranberry juice.  It was very good.  The bartenders are highly skilled and very friendly. I will come back again for sure, just not happy with the drink prices.

From start to finish our experience here was amazing! The ambiance inside is beautiful and the seats were so comfortable! Our server whose name I don't remember was amazing and went over the menu with a lot of knowledge. We got the cheesesteak to share as an app and it was DELICIOUS! For entrees we got the lobster, wagyu steak, and truffle Mac and mashed potatoes. Our food took longer than expected so the server brought out a small dish for us to try that was compliments of the chef( we didn't even complain about the wait time) and didn't realize that it was taking a while as we we're still full from the chew steak. Anyways the wait for the food was well worth it as the wagyu steak was a perfect cooked medium and the most tender thing ever. The lobster was in a delicious butter sauce and the sides were both amazing! Will Deff return again!

business.name: Tai Lake Restaurant

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
