business.categories: Restaurants, Chinese, Vegetarian

reviews.text: Whether you're a vegetarian, vegan, or meat lover..... this place will knock your socks off. All of their food is incredibly fresh and delicious, I could get take out here once a week and not get bored. I ordered the Pickled Cucumbers, Pan-Fried Vegetable Buns, Shanghai Dumplings, & Steamed Vegetable Dumplings. Their hot and sour soup is also excellent. The takeout is always packaged perfectly and very hot & fresh. You must try this place regardless of your dietary preferences!

I went there the other day.  I order the Vege Kung Pao chicken buns and hot and sour soup.  My friend order a hot pot.  The hot and sour soup was very good, but the buns weren't very filled and they were dry.  The hot pot was okay, but somewhat blah in taste.  The dinner didn't blow me away, but I will order from them again and try some other things.
Really tasty. First time having vegetarian Chinese and it wasn't the last time. Recommend trying the shrimp dumplings.

We had my daughter's bridal shower the a few weeks ago. Jen was so accommodating in the planning and during the party. 
Everyone raved about the food and how nice the restaurant was. We brought some party table clothes and they opened up an hour early for us to decorate and set up. 
I would definitely recommend this restaurant  
My only suggestion would be to have an extra server to cover the party
L.
Vegan dim sum! What an interesting concept. It was really good to be honest. It tasted just like meat. The Roasted Vegetable Duck Peking Style tasted just like the duck I get in Chinatown

We came here as a group to order a lot of dishes so that we could sample a lot of the dishes on the menu and I have to say that the food just wasn't that good. I honestly think that if you want dim sum you should actually go to a dim sum place in Chinatown the soup dumplings skin was way too thick. If you're used to eating dim sum and you come here and try their dim sum you will notice the difference in the texture and just the overall taste and I just don't think it's really worth eating. If I could give this place 2 1/2 stars for taste I would it's really not that great.
I love this place! The dumplings are great. It's a perfect place for lunch or dinner and the food is consistently good.

An absolute GEM (at least for the vegetarian, dumpling-obsessed, hungover ones amongst us)! Stumbled upon this place by accident. Ignore the strip-mall setting; inside you'll find cozy, lovely decor, prompt friendly service, and a dizzying array of delicious vegetarian options. Loved the watercress dumplings, super fresh spring rolls, giant portion of soup, and the other 10 menu items we tried. Can't wait to go back.
I used to go out to lunch w my coworkers Chinese joints in KoP pretty often, but have been eating vegetarian recently. This place is a godsend!  Highly recommend the Peking duck and bbq pork.

I had been eyeing the very unique menu of this restaurant for several months before visiting. Unit Su Vege had remained take-out for quite some time after restaurants were allowed to reopen. I was going out for a friend's birthday, and she was very interested in the restaurant. As soon as we found out that dine-in was open, we headed in that weakened to celebrate. 

We came in on a weekend, and the restaurant was busy without being ridiculously crowded. We had called beforehand to check in seat availability, and the owner was very welcoming and eager to have us come in. As soon as we came in, we were seated promptly. The menu is a combo of a Dim Sum menu where you check off quantities of small orders as well as a standard entree/dessert menu on the other side. 

Our server gave my friends and I plenty of time to look over what we wanted and check off our orders. We ended up ordering many smaller dishes from the Dim Sum menu. I went for the Cold Sesame Noodles, Vegetarian Roast "Pork" Buns, and Taro Croquettes. The rest of the table got other various Dim Sum items. 

The food came out as a few items at a time due to the nature of how Dim Sum is prepared. As someone who eats A LOT of meat, this 100% vegetarian restaurant with mock meats was DELICIOUS. All of the food was extremely flavorful and high quality. I could tell while eating that the ingredients were fresh and that they were brought out as soon as they were cooked. All of my meat-eating carnivorous friends also enjoyed all of our food items thoroughly. We only had one Vegetarian Kung Pao Chicken Bun that we disliked. 

Overall, Unit Su Vege is a SUPER cool and unique place. They provide all the texture/flavor qualities of standard Asian dishes using mock meat, but ALSO use plenty of plant-based items like taro, tofu, seitan, and fresh vegetables. That gives the restaurant major appeal to meat eaters and plant-based eaters alike. I highly recommend this place and can't wait till I can come back next.
I'm an enthusiastic meat lover, but this place convinced me that if I were to ever go vegetarian it wouldn't be all so bad. Absolutely delicious and filling!

Hmm... #1 tip is to order the mock peking duck dish. It's delicious and is as close as you can get to the real deal. It's hard to find decent vegetarian and or vegan places. Some things you can't replace or replicate. Sometimes I just want straight up stir fry vegetables with garlic.

For a vegetarian restaurant is it not bad but as a restaurant overall, it could use some improvement. Like the hot and sour soup could be more sour and spicier. And please don't chop up the Chinese broccoli into bite sizes. Leave it whole. It's not baby food. Overall, the restaurant is okay. Food is a hit or a miss. Service is okay. I've been here more than a few times with friends and family who don't eat meat. And also had taken out their #1 dish. I'm not impressed.
Open an ATL location!  I love the enormous menu and the excellent service. Everything we tried was delicious and different than anything we can get back home.

What a hidden gem!! I love this place so much. I accidentally ordered from this place due to a UberEats promotion. However, Uber had messed up my order and I never received my food. I called the restaurant and the lady offered a discount for me to order directly from them for a pickup. What a sweet lady! 

This place is all vegetarian and also has some vegan options. The cooking reminds me of some Taiwanese food my mom used to eat when she used to be vegetarian. 

I love this place because they have brown rice options! The food also taste very healthy and authentic. The eggplant tofu garlic sauce is my favorite dish so far - sauce is so good it'll make you want to preserve every last drop of it to use in your cooking. The three mushroom soup pairs well with any rice dishes you get, not to mention the health benefits of all the different types of mushrooms in that soup! You're doing your body a favor by ordering that soup. 

Second time I got the As You Wish lunch special: mushroom variety wrapped with crispy tofu skin. Delicious - highly recommend. You also get to pick a soup and the special comes with one spring roll for approximately $10. What a deal!! 

The imitations beef chunk in clay pot was good but I wasn't a big fan of the sauce. (Tomato-based) All the ingredients in there were good and I love the uniqueness of these vegetarian dish ingredient. 

Next thing I need to try is their vegetarian dim sum :) 

Overall: great lunch special deals, amazing vegetarian/vegan dishes

Really tasty, pretty fancy vegan asian restaurant in the East Village. They have cool mock meats and also plenty of traditional asian choices as well as dumplings and dim sum.
I was especially intrigued by and enjoyed eating the "pork belly". Unlike most mock meats that have only one predominant texture this one has a seitan-y portion and a chewy "fatty" portion. 

Vegan scallops were delicious, it's evident they know their way around "seafood".

Fresh. Delightful. And tasty from start to finish. Thank you Unit Se Vege. We tried and enjoyed the seitan bbq skewers, pineapple fried rice, soup dumplings and "pork" buns. Perfect lunch for 2 after the art museum. End with the pineapple fried rice it's sweet and full of flavor.

It's a travesty I don't live in Philly because this place is a gem!! We love dim sum, we love vegan food. But we've rarely come across the combo that the two cross so beautifully. Everything we got here was 10/10 but our absolute favorites were the vegetable shumai & the shrimp dumplings. Pair these with their magical chili sauce (pictured) and you have the perfect weekend dimsum brunch.
I ordered smaller dishes to share and they were all great. Also ordered tea for a $1 per person. Very affordable, tasty, vegan food! Great service as well. Will definitely be back.
Amazing vegan Chinese restaurant!! Everything we got tasted so good and every dish tasted different!! Def in the top three best Chinese restaurants ever!! A must go to in Philly!

Flavors are solid, not over seasoned/salty - which is appreciated as it keeps it health conscious. The Sesame Seitan and bok choy were our favorite. The menu is so extensive, we are excited to try other things. It definitely seems like the seitan/tufu dishes are a strong point.

I ordered shrimp rolls last week from this place and it was great so I reordered them again today and received something different. I took my order back as soon as I walked out the door after I checked it and explained that I had ordered shrimp rolls and that's not what I received. The girl at the front was so rude and did not refund me my money but instead made me throw out the food. So they took my money and I'm still hungry. What horrible customer service. She didn't even ask if I wanted something different for the same price instead. Do not order from there ...

The garlic eggplant is so so good, and huge. With tofu, was enough for at least 2. Scallion pancake left a little to be desired, but for takeout was not bad. Staff are friendly, pick-up is COVID safe, and the food is good and hefty portion sizes.

Took me a while to find a true Vegetarian Chinese restaurant after my favorite one closed down 2 yrs ago.

They have decent prices and portion sizes. Their noodles honestly can serve 2 and all of their appetizers are, well, quite appetizing.

I recommend picking 3 appetizers instead of just 1 entree. Be prepared to wait upto an hour for your food to be ready, but it's worth it. The workers are also very nice and accommodating.

This is one of the only vegan/vegetarian dim sum restaurants that I know about. The food was exceptionally good. Our favorite was the BQQ pork. It was perfectly seasoned. The seitan was perfectly cooked and so mind blowing that it's vegan! The steamed taro dumplings had an odd grittiness to them. The buns were soft and filling was flavorful.

We are late to discover this spot. Since it's still COVID times we are only able to get take out. That said, the food is amaze balls. So many vegan options. It's brilliant, tasty and the price is right. Highly recommended. Have gotten take out several times since discovering this gem.

business.name: New Harmony Vegetarian Restaurant

reviews.text: I wish the owners will bring this place back one day  Literally the best vegetarian restaurant I've ever been to!!!

We decided to stop in for a meal after reading the reviews but were absolutely disappointed. 
We were welcomed by someone who appeared extremely tired almost catatonic and totally disinterested in her job. 
The soup was cold , wontons were hard and tasteless. 
Fried rice was salty and extremely oily. We are familiar with hole in the wall gems but this place was atrocious. Dirty plates and table. Dirty bathroom.
Please don't waste your time or your money!
This place needs a good cleaning and a complete renovation.

Great food and easy, fast delivery! I had already heard good reviews of this restaurant. My expectations were exceeded! The food was really good and was gently spiced, so didn't make me feel sick in any way. Delicious dumplings!
Really good tofu, vegetable plates. I go several times a week. The lunch specials are so affordable. Very nice people working there. I love it there
Pretty rare to have a completely vegetarian/vegan menu at a Chinese place. Everything we had was awesome. Highly recommended!

A true vegan restaurant. Lots of good choices. Great variety. The vegan pancakes are very tasty. Should have ordered a appetizer size.
I appreciated that the waitress was able to help me with gluten free choices. There were several and I chose the shrimp. It looked like shirmp and taste similar different and very good.

I stumbled upon this place while in Philadelphia (thanks again Google Maps!) Not really a big place and with poor lighting but that's okay! They have an assortment of different vegetarian dishes available to choose from. And on Sunday, from 5:30pm-7:30pm, they have an all you can eat buffet for $13. I opted for the $13 buffet, and I got fried rice, lo mein, broccoli, string beans. Helped myself to three plates. Servers are friendly and attentive and the restaurant was pretty full when I arrived. Anyone looking for a vegetarian place in Philadelphia, check this place out!

We will definitely not be returning here. Seems unclean, with holes in the table cloths, though we didn't find any of the eating materials unclean thankfully. Portions were reasonably sized, but each dish seemed very cheaply made...heavy on the salt, light in the spicy even though we requested extra spice. The dishes we ate in were ok (see pix), but those we took home were scanty in their portion size and lacking in content. The noodle dish had nothing in it but some noodles, a couple pieces of bok choy, literally a couple shreds of carrot, and no protein whatsoever. The hot and sour soup was salty water with some sourness to it, two tiny pieces of tofu, a few threads of celery and carrot. Lacked any substance for the price. To add insult to injury, the take out containers were only about 3/4 full. C'mon! I'm no cheapskate, but that's just ridiculous. 
We will spend our money elsewhere.

When you are dining with vegan friends and you crave Chinese food, look no further than New Harmony in Chinatown.  This long running restaurant uses the word vegetarian in its name (a leftover from its past) but it is def 100% vegan.  And it's a very good vegan restaurant at that!
 
We began our meal with an order of their fried veggie pancakes.  These are simply addictive.  These were easily gobbled up down to the last bite.  The main courses were varied.  I had the sesame beef with broccoli in peanut sauce while my friends had the shrimp with cashew nuts and the chicken with cashews.  Of course the beef, chicken, and shrimp used in each of these creations are all mock - still good in their own way.  A table order of brown rice to be the base for the dishes completed the feast.  Everyone enjoyed what they ordered as well as sharing some tastes from each other's plates.
 
Service was efficient despite the waiter having several tables to attend to.  The décor here is very plain but it really doesn't matter.  You're here to enjoy the vegan Chinese dishes!
 
Tip - This is a BYOB.  Don't forget!

Been going there for past fifteen years when I visit Philly.
Great, great inexpensive Vegan food. Atmosphere is not that great but you go there for the food.
Lunch specials for $8.95, seven days a week, $13 all you can eat buffet served on Sundays only. Used to be every day but costs go up.
Great selection of food. You will not be disappointed. I never have been.
FYI, no alcohol served, but house tea is free.

Coming here, was a little nervous I'd miss the beef lo mein and pork fried rice that I've come to love in my chinese food, but I had a very fun time trying everything! The lo mein was tasty, and I asked for some hot sauce to spice it up a bit so that was yummy. The egg rolls were huge and packed with cabbage and fried up well, and the dessert (fried bananas) with brown sugar maple syrup sauce were a fun touch! The imitation meat (pork, shrimp, chicken) were all flavored differently, with slightly different textures and overall, almost believable! With this place being BYOB, I'll definitely be coming back to try more things with a bigger group! 

The location is extremely outdated and very small, so talking upstairs had everyone staring at our table at some points, but if you're just trying something new while having fun, I wouldn't back down just because of aesthetics. Since I came on a night with many options to try, I think I was satisfied!

I ordered delivery yesterday through Grubhub, and I was absolutely delighted. The food came well packed and still hot. I ordered the General Tsao's "chicken" with wonton soup and brown rice (there was an option of the wonton soup or hot and sour soup, and brown or white rice), and veggie buns. It was my first time trying all of these foods, and I was not disappointed. The soy meat was crispy and cooked well, it stayed crispy since they didn't mix the gravy and soy pieces. The wonton soup was flavorful, but more broth like than soupy. The veggie buns were soft and and doughy with a small amount of veggie filling. The rice was crispy and went well with the entree. I would reorder the General Tsao's "chicken" and brown rice. The total
Order with delivery came out to be $20. The portion size was generous and I had a lot of leftovers.

Delish vegetarian and vegan food at a great price.  I would recommend this place to anyone coming into Philadelphia looking for somewhere to grab a bite to eat. The service is very fast which can be a good and bad thing when going out to dinner. The place is BYOB and has a great lunch special. Overall, a must go spot for vegan and vegetarians.

Awesome spot! Took my non-veg fiancé here and it was so tasty he didn't complain that there was no real meat!  We got lychee-pineapple juices- delicious! The 'beef' buns were also amazing and my man was shocked it wasn't actual meat.   He also got orange 'chicken' which was (you guessed it), delicious! I got a steamed chicken with broccoli and mushrooms which was tasty but the mushrooms weren't cut small enough so it was too chewy.  
Overall, we wish we had spots like this back where we are

When we visit Philadelphia we always make it a point to stop at New Harmony. Even if it's just to get an insane amount of food to take home. If time allows we will sit in and dine and still take home tons of food. The service is always fast and friendly. The seating is a little tight and parking can be difficult. We always park at a near by parking garage to make it easier. We've never had anything that we didn't like here. Everything is amazing. Even non vegan and non vegetarian family and friends love this place. It's so nice to enjoy things like pork buns, beef buns, sticky rice with beans and pork in the middle and know that it's all vegan!

If you are afraid of hole in the wall places whose carpet needs replaced and are too dimly lit, turn back from this review now. If you are, like me, however, and know these places often have the best food keep on reading.

Checked out New Harmony on Saturday for lunch. It was fairly busy even for later in the day and there were many tables occupied. Service, however, was prompt. The menu is all vegan and huge. They have recreated any meat dish you could ever have wanted. 

Partner and I both ordered the dumpling soup which is soooo good. The broth is rich and the dumplings are great. He had the orange 'beef' and I had the 'shrimp'. Both dishes were large and tasted great. 

Will definitely be returning again, because I almost liked this place better than Su Xing House and that's saying a lot.
I absolutely love this place and its my must go to when in Philly. Great vegan spot with lots of mock meats. The flavours and textures are great. Wish i was closer to this gem

Fun place for karaoke! I didn't realize karaoke was through a computer and we had to look up songs on YouTube, but I was able to create a playlist quickly once we got seated. I think I prefer the karaoke set up at other places around Chinatown, but that's okay. It was only $15/person, including food, and they gave us the room for a few hours, so it was super worth it.

I'm vegetarian/vegan, so I was really looking forward to trying the food, and I was pretty satisfied with what they served us. They served us a bunch of food, just the right amount for the number of people that we had. To be honest, sometimes I wasn't really sure what I was eating, but it still tasted really good! Will definitely be coming back again!

Love this place! We have been coming here for like 15 years. All vegetarian and mock meat ingredients. Ming is a great chef and the food is awesome. We love the Sunday all you can eat buffet- even the regular menu never disappoints. Try the General Tso chicken- it rules.

Wtf happened to this place, or did I just maybe grow up and now I have standards when it comes to what I eat...? I used to go here like 6+ years ago and it was always good. I moved out of Philly for a few years and since I've been back (like 6 months) I've had food from here 3 times and all 3 have been regrettable. Nothing is seasoned with anything, or maybe a bunch of salty oil if you're lucky (unlucky...?). My old favorite dishes here are now my least favorite dishes in the world. I guess if you're a vegan nazi with zero food experience and zero cooking skills of your own this place will suffice, or if you really love salted oil as a meal...but otherwise, you'll really wish you didn't eat this garbage. #neveragain

Two collegiate vegetarians' dreams! Really amazing food, fast service, plentiful options, great (not too big!) portions, and INCREDIBLE prices! $21.50 for two lunch specials and dessert: broccoli and mock chicken, mock sesame chicken, and fried chocolate "cheese"-cake (vegan)!!! We will definitely be back.

Sorry to say I will not be returning. After years of wanting to like this place, I've found only a select dish (Chicken Curry) and the Wonton Soup are worth the venture. The older woman who works in the restaurant is always quite impolite - barely tolerating it seems - us patrons. The young man who works there has always been very personable and has always answered any questions I've had about a dish. But still...the food is pretty mediocre and with all of the places in Chinatown, I can surely find a dish or two somewhere else that will fit the bill. I will enjoy the search for vegan-friendly in Chinatown, but no more New Harmony for me.
best vegetarian restaurant! have been here a handful of times and they never disappoint. kosher vegan buffet is a MUST GO!!! getting hungry just typing this :))

If I was on death row and had the option for my last meal, it would be New Harmony's Jumbo Walnut Shrimp. 

I could eat here every single day. 

And honestly for some reason have recently. 

Go here

Please

I was pretty excited to try vegetarian Chinese food in Philly, especially the vegetarian dim sum! Unfortunately, it fell short of my expectations.
I got a few things from their appetizer section, which were traditional dim sum dishes like steamed pork dumplings (shumai), stuffed eggplant, and turnip cake. The turnip cake was a lot mushier than it should be and the mock pork in the steamed pork dumplings was a bit bland and kept falling apart. I also tried a friend's steamed spinach dumplings, but that was my least favorite dish. The eggplant was good though!
My friend got the sesame mock chicken and her dish was really good. She's been here before and enjoyed some of their other entrees, so we concluded that their entrees are much better than the dim sum.
Also, I do like that they offer a Sunday dinner buffet for only $13!

business.name: LaTao HotPot

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': None, 'latenight': None, 'lunch': None, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': None}
attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': None, u'trendy': True, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': True, u'upscale': None}

business.categories: Szechuan, Chinese, Restaurants, Hot Pot

reviews.text: This place is amazing and my go to place for hotpot. I would rate it higher than most places in Philly Chinatown. Not just hotpot, their other stuff like the ones on the menu are very good too. I tried their spicy pork intestine, beef tendon, cucumber salad and needless to say I ordered them many more times! Not just food, when it comes to food portions, cleanliness, courtesy and service they don't fail to exceed expectation either. Overall I'd give them a solid 100/100!

Above average price for far far below average quality hot pot. Would greatly recommend going literally ANYWHERE else. 
Our server on Monday night clearly did not care about our satisfaction or presence at all for that matter. In fact, we practically expected to be automatically charged for gratuity after this terrible to nonexistent level service. Our server deliberately avoided our table and chose to hide from us over clearing anything or taking care or any of our needs or requests. The food quality is very mediocre and bland compared to any other hotpot place and the dining area is minimal to tight. The only upside to coming here is that they offer a free seat for birthdays however you must pay in cash in full. ( there is no fine print or notification of this policy except when you pay ).

I love LaTao Hot Pot! For an all you can eat place, I think this has the best meat quality. It's definitely less in quality than Little Sheep or Chubby Cattle, but those places are not all you can eat and you can easily rack up a bill 2x at those places. I loved coming here as a student and came back even when I graduated. The dinner now costs $27.95/person for all you can eat, but they offer a 10% cash discount which is well worth it in my opinion. I love to get the fatty beef, but if you want some variety go for the fatty lamb or angus beef as well. Overall it's a very clean restaurant but the service is a bit slow - they're super busy so you might have to actively flag someone down.

Solid AYCE hot pot.. idk if it's because of the pandemic, the portion for each order has become smaller and they're out of a few items on the menu.. the good thing is that it's AYCE and you can keep ordering... we ended up ordering the same food multiple times. I like the soup bases here and I'd recommend if you're just looking to get some quality AYCE hot pot

Hot pot is super delicious. I believe the quality has been slightly going down since Covid but still pretty good. Usually really pack during dinner time and the weekend. It would be best to rsvp. My go to soups are the tomyum and the special beef broth. Not to mention even though it js street parking but there are always plenty nearby. There is a milktea nearby where u can order and drink while enjoying ur hotpot!!!!

For all you can eat hot pot, this place has an amazing lunch deal ($19) with plenty of options (enough that not getting the premium dinner meat options is not at all an issue). Obviously quality is not top notch since it's all you can eat, but it's pretty decent and totally worth what you pay. You can get a free weekday lunch if it's your birthday but they do check that it is exactly that day, so just be aware. 

I'll definitely be coming back!!

There isn't a bad thing that I can say about LaTao. When I was a student in the area, LaTao was a mainstay for me and my partner and it soon became their favorite spot to go to for hot pot. I've been waiting to review LaTao, because I've been here so many times, but this time made me realize that the consistency is there. Plus it's AYCE!

LaTao is place that holds a very special place in my heart (and my stomach) that, time and time again, continues to serve quality ingredients and broths. On top of that their sauce bar is diverse and allows for endless combinations at your fingertips.

While this hot pot spot is right in the heart of University City and directly on Penn's campus, once you enter, you'll feel like you're in the heart of Chinatown. No other restaurant in the area creates a vibe like similar to LaTao with similar calibre of service and selections.

Can't wait to some back again soon!

Ugh my mouth is just watering thinking of having enoki mushroom dipped in my peanut butter chili oil sauce : P

This place is amazing, about 31 dollars per person. There was a great selection from meats to veggies and side dishes. Additionally, the service is great, the interior is beautiful, and they offered both shared and separate hotpot. Wonderful for groups but will require some waiting during busier times like dinner and weekends. Will definitely be coming back.

Food is good. One star is for the service and the disrespectful waiter. When we pay the bill, he said that paying with cash can have a 10% discount, so we paid with cash. But the change he gave to me is still calculated based on the original price. Moreover, when I left nearly 15% tip, the waiter came again and said "Is there something wrong with our service? The tip is not even 10%." (He said this in Chinese because I'm Chinese, but this is the translation of exactly what he said)
That is so mean and dumb. Go back to your elementary school to learn maths and how to talk with people!!

I've been here 3 times, and that's 3 times too many. Service was non existent EVERY time. 
 
Each time we'd sit and wait between 15-20 minutes just to have someone come bring us water and see if we'd want to order. 

We were about to walk out from our most recent visit but the server -- not the waiter -- came over to check on us and took our order after a complaint.

When asked for utensils and napkins, they bring out one napkin. ONE.

Also, DO NOT come in within an hour of closing because they will act like you don't exist, to any capacity. It's ridiculous. 
WORST customer service I've ever experienced in years.

Feeling guilty for coming back two nights in a row but this time was with close friends!


We got a larger table in the back and had the usual delicious broth and ingredients! I'm surprised but they've been out of things in my last couple times coming here (even with a year in between one visit and the most recent ones!) it usually is meat or lotus root!

The only thing that surprised me this time was condensation coming from up above dripping down? It has never happened to me before but what with such a steamy room I suppose I should expect it! Water dripped on me not once nor twice but at least four times. Small each time but enough that I noticed and my partner had to brush it off my shoulder or arm. I'm a bit alarmed only because I don't want that in my food or drink but perhaps the location of the table at the back is why I only noticed now? Very odd. Doesn't affect me coming back but being wary not to sit there.

It's been months since I've been here due to the pandemic but this is still one of the best hot pot places I've ever had the pleasure of going to! It's great for both pairs, individuals and groups!


The broth chosen was the delicious and simple rib broth. It's so light but flavorful and increases in depth and richness when you add the other ingredients! 

The meat is still tasty and quick to cook, and the vegetables are fresh and filling. The homemade crispy meat is essentially fried pork and tossed in spices should you want a break from the main part of the meal!


The sauce making station is still clean and stocked, and I recommend my personal favorite combination: super spicy oil, a splash of soy sauce, sesame sauce and seeds, garlic, green onions, and a dot of sriracha. It is so delicious when you dip just a bit of the meat into it with a mouthful of mushrooms and instant noodles.


The service isn't the fastest but I don't mind that since it gives me time to decide between rounds what I want to eat next.  

I recommend paying with cash since there's a discount when you do. So far still the best hotpot place I love to frequent!

They have wide range of food selection and their service was fast, but the food quality was okay (was not outstandingly fresh). 

One thing I didn't like about was their food portion every time they bring out, it was too small so that I had to place several orders.  

In overall, I will suggest this place if you are looking for an "All-you-can-eat" hotpot place with an affordable price or a place you can hangout with a big group of people.

First time here and it was a good experience. We were the first people to arrive and we were seated immediately. You can pick 2 different broths (shown in the menu and the picture) and select all different kinds of meats, noodles and vegetables from the all you can eat menu. There is also a sauce bar (no picture) that allows you to get all kinds of sauces. My favorite was to mix in garlic, cilantro and green onions. My favorite meat that we got was the fatty lamb. It may look like a lot of meat, but the slices are very thin and cook very quickly. Worth coming here for lunch since it is only $18.95 per person, and if you pay with cash you get a 10% discount. Overall, the food and service was good and I would come back here.

Delicious place for all-you-can-eat hotpot. Their service is fast and friendly. I've been here at least 4 times and have never been disappointed! I think the prices are quite fair because you literally can order as much food as you want! I tend to come here when I'm feeling down and looking for something nice and warm to eat. 

The soup bases taste great and I've tried a variety of them but my favorite is the Szechuan Hot Spicy broth. I've actually had hotpot in Szechuan and I say the flavor is very similar! I always at least get beef slices, fish balls, frozen tofu, quail eggs and enoki mushrooms. For the DIY sauce, I keep it simple with peanut sauce and some spicy oil. Definitely experiment around when you come here though! The options are endless
It is ok. Considering it is in between two colleges I guess most would rate it better but it was not memorable.  If I wanted hot pot in Philly I'd go to K'Pot or chubby cattle.  Skip it
ordered Shrimp fried rice it tasted so good and somehow it tasted lighter like not greasy at all compared to other places rice, but it was packed with so much flavor omgsh ! i'm deff ordering again !
The food was good. Service was pretty slow. Some dishes didn't taste fresh. Been there couple times before the pandemic, they were amazing before then.

I LOVE HOT POT. And this was perfect on a rainy day. They have so many options for toppings and the lunch special was great ($18 between 12-3 PM or something). Low key one turn off was the fact that staff started arriving at the time they were open (like turned on the lights as we walked in, etc) but honestly I was satisfied by the selection and promptness once we got seated. Would go again.

LaTao is a great AYCE hotpot spot! They have fair prices and have so many great food options. Service is friendly and food is fresh. The only downside is that when we were there, there were so many food options they were out of, that I was looking forward to, but I'm definitely I looking forward to going back to try them!

There's plenty of street parking across the street, free after 7pm and there's a discount if you pay your bill in cash.

The hot pot is great, no doubt about that. The spicy broth was my favorite broth and the spicy beef was really good as well. However, the service is kind of slow considering we are asking for uncooked items. It felt like we were doing more waiting than eating. We would also ask for multiples of one item at one time but would only receive one order. Not sure if there's a rule where we can't order multiple of one thing at a time but it wasn't mentioned at all. Overall, great food but the speed of service could be improved.

Food was good, but very poor service. Most things were not available, our waitress ignored us when we tried to get her attention, and it took over 30 minutes to deliver raw ingredients. I gave 2 stars because the food was fine. I was excited to try this place but was super disappointed in my experience and will not be returning.

I absolutely loved this place. The menu items have pictures making ordering super easy, and you know what you are getting. They offer a good variety for the hot pot, and good soup. If hot pot isn't what you are into they also have regular menu options.  I will definitely return.  Plenty of parking across the street the night I went.
The worst fried seafood I've had in my life. Was very overcooked and not as picture through Uber Eats

Been here 10+ times now, hands down best hotpot for the price in the city. 10% off with cash. Service after you order the food is crazy fast. Broth is very standard. Sauce bar has pretty much everything that's needed.

Only things to improve on are:
-Bathroom cleanliness
-Keeping sauce station stocked
-Should offer unlimited soda instead of by the can
-Needs to offer some kind of dessert

business.name: Chili Szechuan

business.categories: Chinese, Restaurants, Szechuan

reviews.text:
I'm sorry to say this place is closing by the end of the month so get your last fix in now (as take out)! Sad to see it go...such tasty food! 
Haven't eaten here as often since going WFPB. Past favorites: Pickled chili flavor fish and salt backed shrimp.

If you're looking for some legit Chinese food near University City, Chili's is always my recommendation. I haven't found a place comparable that serves authentic Szechuan food. I'd usually come here in large groups pre-COVID and the waiters are really friendly and accommodating. They're only open for takeout and delivery right now.

You should eat family-style when it comes to Chili's and these are dishes I'd recommend: Dry Pepper Fish ($15.95), Salt Baked Squid ($15.95), Szechuan Chili Sauce with Pork ($14.95), Dan Dan Noodles ($8.50), Mapo Tofu ($12.95) and Double Cooked Pork ($15.95). For veggies I'd recommend Eggplant with Garlic Sauce ($12.95) and the Sautéed String Beans ($12.95). If you can't tell, I'm a huge fan of their food and you can't go wrong with picking any of these dishes. Warning: their food's spice level can vary on the day so if your spice tolerance is limited, be explicit when ordering. The drawback is that because many of these dishes are fried, it doesn't taste as good when you takeout. But support local businesses right?

TLDR: Come to Chili's if you're looking for authentic Szechuan food near University City and enjoy their food family-style!

ordered this for delivery and it was a huge hit! I was recommended this place and everything was so tasty!!

we got the dry pot chicken and dry pot fish and those dishes you cant miss out on! as a person who can't handle spicy foods, I pushed through because it was so flavorful! we also had the chicken satay and house fried rice which were both good, but definitely recommend the dry pot dishes

it was a bit pricey, but so tasty, so i think its definitely worth it!! will be coming back here for sure and hopefully will get to dine in the future.
Delicious! Had dry pot tofu, cold sesame noodles, veg dumplings, and spicy cucumber. New favorite place for takeout I'm W Philly :)

After two visits to Chili Szechuan, the most recent being last night, wowee am I ever ready to give this restaurant a STELLAR review. The first time I went a few months ago I got the tofu double mushroom, which was pretty, pretty good, but I guess I had expected something spicier, so I decided to hold off on a review until I had one of the spicy dishes (which is, after all, what they're most notable for). My partner DID have a spicy dish that first time, the chili szechuan tofu, and he really enjoyed it. 
Well, this time I decided to try their mapo tofu. Mapo tofu used to be one of my favorite Chinese entrees when I was living in New York, but I hadn't bothered to try it in the nearly 3 years I've been in Philadelphia, until yesterday. I am so glad I waited, because this mapo tofu was a REVELATION. It was definitely spicy, though not tear-inducingly so (fortunately). It tasted exactly the way I imagined a really great recipe I'd found (but never made) years ago would have - the oil in which the buttery soft cubes of tofu nestled fairly sang with the flavors of spicy broad bean, garlic, sesame oil and of course, the essential szechuan pepper. Seriously, this is the best mapo tofu I've ever had. 
My partner went with his standby favorite, vegetable lo mein, and he described it as (one of) the best he'd ever had too. It included pieces of sauteed tofu, which one doesn't usually get in this particular dish.
Great prices for ample portions, and very quick and accommodating service (takeout during a pandemic, and both times I forgot to ask them not to pack utensils on the phone, but they quickly removed them from the bags each time I requested it when I went for pickup). I might not ever bother ordering anything different with mapo tofu this good.
One of the best Chinese food places! Delivery comes fast. The dry pepper tofu is excellent if you're looking for something hot and also vegan.

Hard to remember how many times I've eaten here. Chili's is the OG Szechuan place on campus, and for good reason. They offer an excessively extensive menu that caters to both the Western and the Asian-American tongue, and an accommodating indoor seating area (for post-Covid life, fingers crossed).

Recently ordered the Eggplant in Garlic Sauce + Salt Baked Squid, two classic dishes I have eaten and loved countless times. Szechuan-style eggplant is mad delicious, and Chili's does a great job with it. The Salt Baked Squid is equally as mouthwatering, although you'll want a large glass of water by your side, because it is, as the name suggests, salty. Other great picks are: Dry Pepper Chicken, Twice Cooked Pork, String Beans.
Because of the special situation, most of restaurant in University City only offer delivery service. However, this restaurant is really good. It matches my taste. I love the spicy food.

First time ordering. Wanted shrimp chow mein, received shrimp chow fun. Never had it, but will order it again. Keep in mind rice is not included. I also ordered shrimp noodle soup. It's good but not $10.95 good. No napkins or soy sauce provided

We really enjoyed Chili Szechuan. The Dan Dan noodles were about the best we've ever had. The Mapo tofu and dry pepper chicken were also delicious. A great neighborhood find for us. We will be adding this to our pandemic take-out rotation.

I arrived pretty quick and my order was ready when I got there. I ordered takeout from the Yelp app so I didn't speak to anyone there, I guess that's my fault. I ordered the lamb skewers, scallion pancakes white rice and Mama's dumplings which the menu says were shrimp. The menu failed to mention that the dumplings are also made with pork which my family and I do NOT eat. I asked the person that handed me my order at the door if they had shrimp or pork and she said "yes", then she yelled something to a table filled with men in the back of the restaurant and she added "shrimp AND pork. I'm mad because I expected the menu to include vital information such as that. The scallion pancakes were very crispy and tasted ok, the lamb skewers were here chewy and spicy, the General Tso's chicken was brighter in color than I'm used to and harder then I'm used to and the rice was well white rice. I don't have anything special to report about that. I don't think anyone can ruin whites rice except my sister. The dumplings hit the trash before I closed the door to my home so I cannot give you a review on those.

Bomb, on time, priced and prepared. What else u want dood cmon now big boiiiiiii. 
Yes 
Yes 
I enjoyed 
My noodles with chicken 
And my 
Steamed dumplings, 
They weren't the sauciest, 
But they were 
Dank and 
Yummy and 
They were 
Totally 
Worth the 
Wild baby
Chicks on here reviewing them for soy sauce, she sleep, they r sleep. Just ask for soy sauce. I tel u about the food, cuz it's good. Anyways you should have soy sauce in ya fackn fridge b why are u all tight about it. Fr tho look at that person in the comments, like why are u really raggin on dank food, small business, and then tryna fuc then up over a couple packets of soy sauce. She needs to chill. If I was giving her review starts. It be a half if I could go lower I would because like are u that bored, u feel that elite that you gunna get on about the packet a soy sauce someone forgot. The food is fire, eat that shit

Chili Szechuan has some of the best authentic Szechuan food in the city, Chinatown included. I highly recommend their Ma Po Tofu and Dry Pepper Style Tofu (or dry pepper style anything for that matter.) On top of their truly excellent food, Chili Szechuan is elevating the game of takeout cuisine. If you order a crispy dish, the modern day Prometheus preparing your food will cut a small hole in the lid of the container, allowing the steam to escape and keeping your food delightfully crunchy. Be advised they don't accept Discover cards.

This review is for delivery only. We ordered the ribs (highly recommend, the tips were especially delicious), chicken fried rice, beef chow fun and chicken lo mein. The food was packaged well, arrived hot, and was absolutely delicious. We intentionally over ordered to have left-overs, and the portions were generous, so we will luckily get to eat these tasty meals for quite a few meals! Looking forward to visiting in person one day (and ordering delivery in the meantime)
Has amazing service and tremendous value for the price. My favorite place for authentic Chinese in West Philly!

MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR SOY SAUCE 
Ordered lunch for the office for my bday from here.
Spent close to $100, and not one packet of soy sauce!! We ordered multiple cartons of fried rice which were also cooked with no soy sauce so it was very dry. I called back to inform them that they didn't include any and she said it was because I didn't ask... really lady.. if your abnormal policy is that I have to ask it would have been nice if you asked if we would like any condiments for our HUGE order. She said someone would bring them over (our office is about 6 blocks from the restaurant) but no one ever came. Super disappointing. Food was good, just super disappointed that I had to go back and forth over the phone over soy sauce that never came after placing such a big order.

Still open for takeout and delivery. 
Haven't had Chinese in a while and really missed Szechuan. 

For appetizers, we ordered:
Mom's Style Dumplings - outstanding. Bits of shrimp and veggies. Not sure about chicken or pork, but delicious. 

Shrimp Dumplings - these are the har gow style crystal dim sum type. Pretty good. 

Dan Dan Noodles - spicier than Han Dynasty's and less of a peanut taste. 

They also threw in some complimentary spring rolls. 

Entrees:
Three Cups of Chicken - nice sauce with Thai basil and garlic. The chicken was OK in parts, gristly in others. 

General Tso Tofu- crispy and very good

Shredded Pork with Dried Bean Curd - Light and flavorful sauce with garlic. Yum. 

Crispy Shrimp with sweet and sour flavor - think of it as walnut shrimp minus the walnut and broccoli. But with sauce on the side. And tasty by itself too. 

Tofu Pudding Flavor with Pork - This will get your mouth numb. Soft tofu pudding with hot chili oil and pork plus dried beans. Mixed well with rice. 

Yeah, we still have plenty of leftovers for lunch and dinner. For a few days. 

Parking is still hit or miss out front due to the bike lane, but I was able to park in the nearby loading zone to pay. They brought my order out to the car when ready which was great.

I used the leftover chili oil for some frozen dumplings.

Add some extra time into your estimate if you have a big order.

I was disappointed with the food I ordered.  Was at the hospital nearby and thought I would support local  business during  pandemic.  Also didn't want the hospital food - yuk. Well I must say this was just a step above hospital food. Nothing to rave about.  They gave us no condiments,  no napkins and barely  taste. Portions are small.  Don't order the fried chicken it's not what you think. The shrimp lo mein had 4 tiny shrimp. Spring rolls had no spring if you know what I mean.   I traveled over 100 miles to be with my  loved one and was hoping for more.  Hopefully I won't have to come back but if I  do they won't get any of my money.

One of THE best Chinese restaurant in Philadelphia. Every time, we order food, we get nothing but a well crafted dish made with lot care. It has an long menu, so ordering in the first place might look laborious, but what else is yelp for? We ordered DongPo braised pork belly which is among the most loved dishes. Pork is tender and well season, the addition of bokchoy cuts the fattiness of the dish beautifully. The fish is mouthwatering and tasted equally good next day when we were having the leftover. 
This time we did a takeaway because of COVID-19, the service was right on time and very clean. However, we have dined in before and their service is equally good. 
Worth every dollar. Parking is not a problem as their are few free street parking options around.
Amazing Food and the service is even better! Can't wait for them to reopen in a few weeks!

New to west philly and didn't trust a lot of these Chinese restaurants BUT THIS ONE IS LEGIT. The food is super flavorful, every bite was delightful. They also have an Americanized portion of the menu for beginners. Definitely step out the box when ordering from here being everything is good I ordered a bunch of stuff being I like to pick at things and everything was so good, yummy. The spicy cold noodles was my favorite dish

Went with a party of 16, but because we were the only customers on a Saturday at 5pm, we were served quickly!

We ordered family style and got: pickled fish soup (an acquired taste), double cooked pork belly (SOOOOO GOOD!), bok choy (basic, nothing special), dry pepper chicken, cumin lamb and dan dan noodles.

Everything was tasty and flavorful!! If I had to pick, my least favorite was the dan dan noodles. Could have gone without it.

This is probably my third-ish time at this restaurant and each visit has never been disappointing! I was so excited for the food that I completely forgot to take photos this time! Sorry!

If you have a very weak spice tolerance, I wouldn't recommend it though.

Excellent restaurant with traditional and well seasoned Szechuan food.  Service is phenomenal and personable.  Best dishes include: dry fried pepper fish, spicy lamb chops, duck blood in chili oil, spicy beef soup with veg, lotus root with pickled veg, and woodear mushrooms with pork.  This place is BYOB and provides wine cork and glasses without charge.  I have been here several times and the quality never changes.  It's also incredibly reasonably priced.  I would highly recommend for traditional Szechuan food.  I'll be back....again.
The best, most authentic Chinese restaurant in University city. The food here is absolutely amazing if you like Sichuan spice. All the dishes are beautifully flavored and generous portions as well.

Ordered takeout - the food was great! I got the dry pepper fish and was pleased with the amount of spice in the dish (warning: it was spicy, but I prefer that). It was also a decent portion for a reasonable price, which makes it a great option for Szechuan food in West Philly for university students on a budget.

business.name: South Garden

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': None, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}

business.categories: Restaurants, Chinese

reviews.text: We really enjoyed the food, the fast service and reasonable prices. Shall order again that's for sure.
There was a hair in my white rice! Gross! I wouldn't recommend this place unless you want pubes in your food. I ordered it on door dash and it came with in 40 minutes. The egg roll was pretty good.

Got take out from door dash. Surprisingly good food for what it is and you get a lot of it. 

The egg rolls were actually very nice. Crispy and delicious with a good amount of meat in them. The won tons in the soup were a bit doughy but still good and we got a good number in the bowl of soup. Vegetable lo mein and black bean sauce chicken were both solid and a large amount of food. Actually the worst thing in the meal was the white rice somehow. A bit mushy at the bottom of each box. 

Overall the food isn't as good as what you can get in China town but for what it is, its better than most of the other Chinese restaurants of this style. 

I presume this has nothing to do with the restaurant, but DoorDash was terrible. When ordering it said 25min, then after we ordered it said it would take 45min to get there. Then the food was picked up about 20min later so all told it took 55min for us to get our food. Still warm and everything, but the time estimates on doordash were so off.

Enjoy the food in this place very tasty always quick or on time food delivery & hot! my regular as to list for Chinese but Only thing is i use to just love their egg rolls crunchy tasty full but last few months something off with the egg rolls smaller soggy and whats inside is stingy and not full with various ingredients more mush inside not pure cabbage & other stuff use to make them my fav egg roll .. so whats up with that change?????
South garden is consistently solid. The entire family agrees - good food. Great place to order takeout. I particularly like their steamed options such as chicken and vegetable with sauce on the side.
Very nice &great customer service food is delicious I got the vegetable lo mien fire I honestly wanted to try more but was in a hurry

On a cold night in Philly, I ordered in not wanting to leave my hotel room. Ordered this due to the reviews.The sweet and sour chicken was a bit under cooked. The egg roll was also undercooked. The beef and broccoli was mainly broccoli. 

The plus side? It came on time and the food was warm.

Very quick as far as delivery. A tad overpriced compared to other Chinese Spots. As far as the food, it was pretty much gross. I ordered chow fun which was very very dry and little to no veggies or shrimp ( I paid for extra shrimp). The ragoons were subpar at best. And the egg rolls, the egg rolls! They were soggy and filled with more lettuce than anything. Never coming back here again
The food was really good. No tricks, it's your regular Chinese food you'd find in any Philadelphia neighborhood. Very tasty! I had the chicken and broccoli and the broccoli wasn't over cooked.

I use to eat here all of the time and lately it hasn't been the same. I don't know if they fired their cook or are trying new ways to prepare their food, but it's not very good anymore. I ordered tonight for me and my boyfriend and neither of us could stomach anymore. Get your old cook back please!
I cannot believe I gave this place a 2nd try. Absolutely horrible, as the chicken takes like fake chicken. Do not eat here!
This is the only place where me and my roommates order from. The egg roles and sesame chicken are out of this world. Highly recommend!

Via UberEats. Ordered the following items: Beef Chow Mein, House Special Lo Mein, Chicken with Snow Peas, and General Tso's. Two of the entrees should have included 1 egg roll and 1 spring roll. It was not included in the delivery. The Beef Chow Mein was not a noodle dish rather a Beef Vegetable dish. Lastly, the General Tso's tasted and looked like leftovers from sometime. It was not fresh. Disappointed. We will never order from here again. BUYER BEWARE!

South Garden is definitely the best place to order Chinese takeout in the city. The order came 20 minutes earlier than it said, and everything was PIPING hot. So hot that even the soy sauce packets were warm. The WonTon soup is TO DIE FOR!!! Did they just take this right off the PAN?!? Wow! Def coming back to South Garden.

Chicken and Broccoli was not good. The chicken wasn't well cooked at all and that's the one hung I can't stand.

Don't ever go here. 

Plus as usual the service is very rough. It's almost like you are bothering them or they expect you to be disrespectful.

DO NOT VISIT

Ordered pan fried pork dumplings, scallion/Chinese pancake, and wonton chips with duck sauce.

The food was delivered very quickly. The delivery guy was rude when I didn't answer the first call (I have a baby and wasn't right next to my phone at the moment, but heard it ring again directly after. He yelled at me on the phone to tell me my food was here. 

The dumplings were barely pan fried, they were soft and the pork inside them was tasteless. My cats enjoyed it. Dumpling sauce was okay but had an overpowering ginger flavor. 

The scallion pancake was the worst I've ever had. I worked in an Asian restaurant for years, and have eaten many a scallion pancake, it's supposed to be crispy on the outside and flaky and soft on the inside, with fresh and abundant pieces of scallions. This was not the case with this scallion pancake from South Garden. I could tell it was not fried in a pan, as it's supposed to, but actually deep fried. It was fried to a crisp, inside and out. It was completely tasteless and probably had like 10 pieces of scallion in it. Again the dumpling sauce that came with it was mediocre.

Lastly I ordered wonton chips because they're my favorite little snack, and they forgot the duck sauce that I specifically called and asked for. Like no sauce at all, just 10 packets of soy sauce.

All this disappointment for $14 including tip and delivery. 

TLDR: I would NOT recommend this place. If your local to South St, try Golden Empress Garden instead, a lot better.

Very rude. First accused me of not paying then after calling for proof he demanded a tip. I inadvertently forgot to leave one and was going to call to have it added. After how rude he was I decided against it. Some of the chicken tasted and felt as if it was refried. Not the South Garden I remember from years ago. I will not be ordering again.

Found this place because it was close to the place we we're staying at. Ordered many dishes including noodles, fried rice, Mongolian beef, general tso chicken , mu shu pork , dumplings, wonton soup and hot and sour soup. Only thing that was good was hot and sour soup, the rest was meh.... Wouldn't go back with all the other Chinese restaurant nearby.

Easily the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. The cold sesame noodles were in a sauce that was gray in color. Vegetable won tons were all dough, no veggies. We threw almost all the food away. Luckily, we did not get food poisoning. We then ordered dinner from another place, and it was wonderful.

Ordered Sweet and Sour Chicken.  Took over and hour to arrive and everything was cold.  The chicken had no taste and the breading tasted stale.  Will not order from here again and i wouldn't recommend to anyone.

We've ordered several times from here from UberEATS and have been happy each time.  Their general tso's chicken is crispy and you're able to get a lomein and fried rice combo that you can't normally do at other restaurants.  It's a little pricier than other neighborhood Chinese places, but is worth the few extra dollars.
Terrific take-out spot. Generous portions. Pretty typical Chinese take-out food, just a little more special than your average South St spot.

I was sick and needed a quick delivery option without a hefty delivery fee. Thanks to some super sleuthing on yelp, I found this gem. Even though it was on the other side of town from me, my order got to me quickly and it was still hot! I ordered the egg drop soup and the general tsos chicken (smaller size). I was worried that the small size would be too small or not come with enough rice or something because it was significantly cheaper but I honestly had enough food between the soup and the entree for two meals! Both tasted delicious and were just what I needed at that moment. I would definitely order delivery from this place again and maybe try some other options. I think I finally found my Philly restaurant that doesn't try to over price or go too crazy with the recipes after three years! *insert happy dance here*

Got take out with a bunch of friends. We placed our order at 8:15 and at 8:50 it arrived and very nice and hot! They told us it wouldn't arrive until 9:10-9:20 so we were pleasantly surprised!! 

We ordered the following:

Sesame chicken
Buddhist delight
Chicken lo mein
Egg drop soup
Pork dumplings
Chicken dumplings
Crab Rangoon
Vegetable fried rice
Chinese pizza 

The crab Rangoon was very odd and was shaped like small little purses. Still tastes good though. The Chinese pizza was great. The dumplings were the kinda with the very thing dough. Those aren't my favorite but they still tasted good although they fell apart very easily. The sesame chicken was delicious. The rice remained hot forever. The lo mein was good as well. Overall it was very great quality food and I recommend this restaurant for delivery for sure!

I ordered a take out from South Garden for the first time. I ordered the fried Vegetable Dumplings, Eggplant with Garlic Sauce (Hot and Spicy), Bean Curd Hunan Style (Hot and Spicy). The eggplant is the best Chinese eggplant dish I've ever had! The vegetable dumplings were delicious. The bean curd was ok. I wish it was fried. The delivery guy was super nice. I received my order within an hour which was awesome. I would definitely recommend ordering delivery from here. I used Grubhub.

business.name: Chu Shang Spicy 厨尚麻辣

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': None, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': None, u'upscale': False}

business.categories: Restaurants, Chinese

reviews.text: Nothing impressive yet nothing offensive. Dry pot was more wet than dry with a thick layer of oil on the bottom. Great portions though, we had 4 ppl total and were very full at the end.

Came here for a quick dinner. During pandemic, this place still attracted lots of young people.

We ordered two entrees. One Marla soup with 7-8 items selected. It was very good, but I must admit I selected too much food... I guess 5-6 is more than enough. The other one we ordered is the spicy dry pot, also selected 7-8 items, and once again too much. The flavor was great. We got the mild spicy but it was hot enough for us. 

The waiters were very nice and helpful!

Not sure why the reviews aren't higher, but I quite enjoyed my experience here. I got the dry pot in the soup (I feel weird calling it hot pot? because it's really like dry pot in some creamy soup?) which was great. It reminded me of Mala Project in NYC, where you order your own ingredients and it comes out with the classic mala dry pot flavor. The soup was something new to me though, and I quite enjoyed it (although it was really hot, it was also quite a lot of food which was good). I may come back for the dry pot without the soup sometime. I feel that the price is just correlated with how much you order - I got a substantial amount of food for a bit under $20, but my friend ordered much more and it came out to be more expensive.

My go-to spot to warm me up when it's cold. Try the pen-and-paper Ma La Soup (or Dry Spicy Pot) menu instead of the a la carte one. I always add potato, corn, and glass noodles in mine. Food comes out fast, and it's consistently delicious each time. So filling, too, and it usually  comes put to only $11. This place deserves at least 4 stars!

The once large portions seem to be a thing of the past, my most recent experience was disappointing. The dry pot was very small and contained about 5 measly pieces of each protein choice. What was once a shareable meal is now a personal sized pot.

We left hungry and had to go down the street and eat again.

It's okay. 

I don't mind Chu Shang but I think it's kind of overpriced, even though the soup is pretty large. They have add some kind of cream in their soup that gives the broth a comforting feel and it is quite delicious, but nothing crazy special. I also don't love that they don't put the itemized prices next to each ingredient, since you have to pick enough items so that you hit at least a certain price point or something. The concept of choosing each ingredient can be fun and cool, but I prefer transparency in the process. 

Maybe next time I'll try their dry pot and have more opinions!

Dry pot. You're welcome. 'Nough said. 

Ignore the restaurant rating on Yelp. Hands down one of the best restaurants in Chinatown.
I love spicy food.   The volumes of food are big like me.  I feel a bit awkward not understanding Chinese.  Ice cream can soothe your palate afterwards.  Will be back!

The broth here is so flavorful. It's not overwhelming, but perfectly creamy and spicy. I came here twice, tried medium spice the first time then the spicy for my most recent visit. I'm not high tolerant but can handle my spice. The spicy level was honestly not even that spicy. It was just the right amount for me. It was a rainy and chilly autumn night and it hit the spot. Bowl is pretty large so you can definitely share it with a friend. Just get double noodles & double meat. Not a lot of tourists come here so it feels like a hidden gem. I'm surprised myself that I've never been here growing up near philadelphia. Will definitely be coming back with more people.

Honestly me and my friend came in on a whim because we wanted to try something new in Chinatown, we did not expect the food to be so good. The spicy dry pot at first sounded interesting on the menu because I have never heard of dry hot pot loool. But it was delicious! I kept wanting to go back after that night just for that dish. I loved that it was customizable to my own liking and there was a lot of selections to choose from. It was also a large portion which is always great!

Like what other Yelp reviewers have said, do not be detered by Chu Shang Spicy's low rating; the food is actually quite good. Even though they make other dishes, you mainly want to order the 麻辣香锅 (dry spicy pot) or 麻辣烫 (ma la soup). They are both make-your-own so once you decide if you want it dry or with broth, you can choose which items you want because you will pay per item. If I had to choose between the two, I would choose the ma la soup because I like how their broth is milky like a ramen bone broth compared to the more traditional clearer spicy broth. Because these dishes are traditionally spicy, I would recommend opting to add a bit of spice. I can usually handle a 3/10 so I was pretty comfortable with mild. 

Food and Drink Ordered:
* worth trying

- [Dry Spicy Pot*]: Some may say that this tastes greasy but it's really those good Sichuan oils. I will say though that a drier, "more fried" spicy pot (like the one at Magic Pot but sadly they're closed ) tastes comparatively better. 

- [Ma La Soup*]: I HIGHLY recommend choosing instant noodles to add to the soup with whatever else you decide to add. 
 
Would I go back? : Yes, I've already gone back a few times. The only reason why I didn't give a 5 star is because I've had better dry spicy pot but I do like how their ma la soup is different from what I've had before.

Whoa. When reading the reviews and there seems to be many not so good to many very good, I figured, I'll try it. Awful.

The portions were small. Did I read reviews on here touting the portions? What restaurant was that?? Wasn't this one.
The main ingredient, for example, shrimp, and in multiple other meat entrees were almost non-existent, there was so little of the protein. It was ridiculous.
Now the quality of ingredients. For example shrimp. The shrimp were one step above the size of salad shrimp. Tiny morsels. This went for ALL entrees and the respected proteins. Beef? Hardly any. Pork? Hardly any. All Veg.
The amount of unrendered FAT on the pork and the beef were off-putting.
The flavor of the Shrimp in garlic sauce was just so unappetizing, we tossed it.
the Pork in Hot sauce was terrible. we tossed it.
The beef in Sichuan was just so bad.
Pork in garlic ...uuggh
I don't think I have ever had such consistently bad oily Chinese food, soup to nuts as I did. I was looking forward to the meal.
Maybe I hit it on a very bad day? But, this was bad. Extremely dissapointing.

The dry hot pot was good. Nice level of heat and delicious flavors. The squid stood out and the seafood ribbons were wide and delicious. The scallion pancakes were good if not a little bit on the over-cooked side. One of the additions we ordered for our dish was crab but we found these were empty shells and had absolutely no meat in them. (Believe me, we tried). I would understand if the crab shells were thrown in for flavor but they were actually one of the shell fish options on the menu so for them to be completely meat-less was a bit disappointing. I enjoyed our meal, but I felt that given the lack of crab and overcooked scallion pancakes, it was an A-ok experience .

We came in for just a few appetizers in the middle of the afternoon, with the intent that if we liked the food we'd come back for dinner.  Ordered dumplings and two duck snacks.  We were told the duck snack is a small portion of Peking duck in a pancake with sauce and scallions.  Yes it was duck, just not duck meat; it was almost entirely thin strips of duck fat doused in way too much hoisin sauce!  I showed it to the waitress and stated I wanted a refund.  She didn't deny that it was full of fat and said they purchase it from another place and don't actually prepare it themselves, so it isn't anything that is their fault.  What?  So you don't know what you're serving and take no responsibility for it!?  I was shocked.  We were in a hurry, so I didn't ask for the manager.  I still gave them 3 stars only because the dumplings and dipping sauce were so delicious and tasted fresh and homemade.  But stay away from the duck "fat" snack.  Is it likely they know what they're serving and put on extra hoisin sauce to disguise the look & taste of the fat, absolutely!  Buyer beware.

I have a really bad expensive order take out from this restaurant. I choice medium spicy soup but after I eat it I feel my stomach is burning, very uncomfortable. Order ingredients of crawfish, got like 4-5 of them, but ALL is not fresh and dark inside!!! Taste really bad and salty too. Throw out immediately because they can't be eaten! I hope this restaurant can check the quality of ingredients.

Let me tell you, chu shang spicy is my absolute GO-TO when it comes to food in chinatown. the portion sizes for their mala tang are insane for the price point and easily shareable with a party of two or even three (small appetite trios) 

I think I visit chu shang biweekly and I always come back for more. It does take a little while for them to prep the food in the back, but once it comes out, there are absolutely no complaints on my end!

*4.5/5

So, here's the story: our church pastor recommended this spot back in April, saying it was one of his Chinatown faves, and I was like huh? Homegirl's got 3 stars on Yelp -- you sure this is your fave?? Not gonna lie, I was doubtin him a lil there. But then I went with some friends, ate a few dishes, and was consequently enlightened. I love Yelp and Yelp has given me a lot of great insights (and free food haha) but y'all got this place wrong. Chu Shang Spicy is a freaking gem, and I've been back FOUR times since then. I don't even live close to Chinatown, and somehow Chu Shang has been my #1 visited spot this entire year!! That says something ok!! She a lil greasy, but she is delicious!!

This was my first time trying out the MaLa dry pot, and it was a fun time! Basically, the dry pot is a phat platter whose components (veg, noodles, meat, etc), size, and spice level you determine with a check-box menu. I can't recall the specific dry pots we've ordered, but I remember really enjoying the glass noodles, lotus root, cabbage, and fried tofu. No joke on the cabbage; it soaks up all the chili oil and complements any heavier components. It's a fun, communal way to enjoy a dish, and you really can't come here without giving the dry pot a go.

As for the plentiful other dishes available, I have liked everything I've tried, from the eggplant to the salt baked squid (all the salt baked meats are A-1 appetizers) and even the boring-sounding Szechuan Beef ended up being a culinary banger. You will probably leave the restaurant with a bit of a food coma and a few blocked arteries, but that's what the post-meal Chinatown stroll + bubble tea is for. You can quote me on that.

Love the food here, I ate here over the Memorial Day weekend with some friends and we got the private room. Good food, great service, and actually the food there tasted much better then the food in NYC.
You guys rock, keep up the good work.

Henri
One of the best drinks in philly !!! I always get the grapefruit green tea here and it's perfect for the summer or any time, it's about a big quart size for $5.

So surprised at the low reviews for this place! I have ordered takeout twice from here, so can't speak much about the service, but their dry pot is so worth it! $35 minimum and mix in various meat and veggies of your choice. We ordered mild, which was still a bit salty, but the spice level was totally doable. Portion sizing is obscure so we didn't know how much to order. For reference, we ordered about $50 worth for 5 people and had some left over. 

If you're looking for some personalized legit food, don't let the low rating here deter you.

I'm so happy that I found this place! I've been looking for places where they have Mala Xiang guo(Dry hot pot) and finally found one! My husband and I tried Dry hot pot with veggies and meat on our choice with little spicy. The amount of food was very massive and it comes with one bowl of white rice. It wasn't too spicy and salty, just right. We enjoyed it so much that we want to bring our friends next time. Can't wait to going back again!

Deliciously spicy dry pot is what brought me to check out Chu Shang. If you can handle authentically hot szechuan food, you will enjoy this establishment. Given the times, all patrons wore masks and we were seated apart at different booths.

My friend and I ordered the dry hot pot 麻辣香锅 and we got the "hot and spicy". It is definitely spicy but also delicious yet not the faint of heart. I wouldn't say it's as hot as it is in China (because that version is borderline terrifying) but it's to give you enough pain and enjoyment. We chose a various favorites like mushroom, black fungi, lotus root, taro, fish tofu, sliced beef and napa cabbage just to name a few. We also got the Indonesian fried rice as our carb which was tasty. I'm already thinking about the flavors, now if only my GI felt the same!
First time trying mala soup! Liked the diy option, you do your picks and they cook it in the kitchen and bring the soup to you.

Let me tell you something. i first got introduced to dry pot (mala xiang guo) at this NYC spot called Mala project. and i've been hooked ever since! but being back in philly, i needed a place just as good or even better, and chushang is the SPOT. 

food: i've never gotten the soup, but i always get the dry pot with my favorite things: potato glass noodle (a MUST), few meats, fish cakes, sweet potato (also a must)and a bunch of veggies + cilantro. i'll always be an avid fan of Mala Project, but chu shang's portion seriously outshines!!! it may seem like the cost is racking up with each ingredient, but they do not give sparingly! super large portions, and super strong flavor. 
it can be salty, so please don't forget to eat your rice!

the space: it's a fairly large space, just a normal chinatown area in my opinion. nothing is special about the inside, you're really just here for the food!

Slow service. Bad diarrhea after eating. Tasty food. Although the experience is horrible, at least the food has decent taste. Big portions, medium quality, poor service. Wouldn't mind going back, but that means I'd have to hit the toilet again. Choices need to be made

business.name: Inchin’s Bamboo Garden
